title: Ramada.
text:
Hotel molto curato, che non dispone di cena o pranzo, ma solo di colazione.
Camere pulite, lasciate bene, molto spazio.
Personale carino, gentile, e soprattuto molto disponibile in ogni caso.
Cibo in molte varietà, di tipo americano, soprattuto per lo scambio dolce-salato a colazione, tipico americano.
Locale vicino alla stazione, che alleggerisce anche la mobilità.
Trovatosi nella ChinaTown.
Ci siamo trovati molto bene.

title: Above and Beyond
text:
Actually styed here Sept 2022 and I can not thank the staff here enough.
I was in a negative situation and was shaken up by a series of events, the staff made me feel safe from the second I arrived. They let me park right out front and put me in a room by the front desk, so the minute I opened my door I could see the desk. When I was checking out in the morning they checked on me to be sure I was ok.
Room was clean, bed was comfy. 
Huge thank you to the staff

title: Stay away from this hotel!
text:
Arrived to be Informed the one elevator out.
No sign of repair crew as they claimed was there. When I checked out, elevator still not working Probably in violation of ADA.  It’s like an 8 story hotel. Place was packed with guests. Had to use one narrow stairwell to get to room on 6 fl. I complained and demanded discount. Front desk guy agreed to 20 %. Put it in writing. But that discount has never been received . Great location. But horrible management

title: Bad Hotel.
text: Lift was not working for 3 days. I had to take all my luggage to 2nd floor and I hurt my back. nobody helped me. Shame.  I will never ever stay there, even if it is free. I suggest all, if you can afford to pay more money, stay somewhere else. I will surely pay 50% more to stay in some descent hotel next time. The only positive is that it is near to time square, so are at least 50 other hotels. Find those & book.

title: Noisy as hell
text:
Positive: Early check-in, close to Times Square, decent breakfast included, people is nice.

Negative: Noise. There were desmantling works, it seems hotel was closing down, so they had a crew moving forniture, taking out carpets, etc. The first night they woked until midnight. I phoned front desk twice but there was no positive answer. 
Room was mustiness. I think it was de AC as it had some mold.
Mirror frame broken. It was fixed with black ducktape. Elevator was out of order. I was told it was going to be fixed during the day, but by the time we checked-out the elevator was still out.

title: Great location
text: Great location, only blocks from time Square and tons of great restaurants in a very safe neighborhood.  Rooms were big by NYC standards. Very clean but lobby a bit cluttered.  Quiet street and parking garage across the street.

title: Time for Time square
text: Excelllent location. Subway just at the top of the street. Excellent breakfast included. All day free coffee and water fountain. Rooms are basic and clean. Good size bathrooms.  Had a really comfortable stay. Only small complaint would be slight lack of wardrobe space but other than that a really good experience.

title: Horrid
text: This was possibly the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. We were. Is it in your daughter and the freaked out about her being in our room even thou we repeatedly said she was not staying. The television did not work and no one could fix it. This was absolutely terrible in every way. Never stay here

title: A Good, Clean Small NYC Hotel
text: Other than the room being a small, everything about this small mid-town hotel made my New York stay comfortable and reliable.  Including the very comfortable bed. Thank you to the very calm and helpful young gentleman on the front desk who provided excellent assistance in all matters, including calling me an alternative taxi company when I urgently needed one after check out for my journey to distant JFK airport.  This isn't a fancy hotel by any means, but everything they provide, including breakfast and all day access to water and ice in the lobby made my stay a very good one. I will most likely stay here again when I return to New York.  (I can also highly recommend the excellent French restaurant, Marseille, just around the corner on 9th Avenue.)

title: Moyen
text: L’hôtel aurait du préciser sur le site que les plus de 18 ans mais moins de 21 ans n’avaient pas le droit d’accéder à la chambre ! On m’a refusé l’accès à la chambre toute la journée (alors que la réservation était sous mon nom) jusqu’à ce qu’un parent arrive sur place

title: Labour Day weekend
text:
Review
Pros
1.) Location is very good
Cons

2.) Room was very small
3.) on 1 day the cleaning was partially done and the reception staff was not so polite when we asked why the room was not cleaned.
…….

title: CUMPLE SU MISION
text: Hotel que cumple su misión. En cuanto a cosas buenas, es que está muy bien situado para visitar lo principal de N.York; y los desayunos que están bastante bien, Habitación sencilla y correcta, para descansar y darte una buena ducha. En cuanto a lo malo es que debería reformarse un poco y también que cerca de la entrada en la calle suele haber algún vagabundo.

title: Posizione tattica
text: Vicino a tutto, struttura pulita e personale cortese, prezzo ottimo, colazione un po' monotona ma abbondante. Connessione Wi-Fi ottima, unica pecca la doccia con la tendina ma però tutto pulito. Per il nostro viaggio di piacere, abbiamo sfruttato la colazione e il letto comodo in quanto sempre a giro e ci siamo trovati molto bene.

title: Great value - super clean
text: I'd actually give this 4.5 stars but it's not enough to dock it a full star.  This hotel is as clean as any I've ever stayed in.  Our room was just fine - not luxurious but very nice.  The bathroom was large.  We were lucky enough to get a room in the back of the hotel which was very quiet; something unusual for NYC.  A very nice breakfast was also included which made it a great value.  My only very slight negative is that, all around the property, the walls need painting.  But, that didn't diminish our satisfaction.  This is a clean hotel in a great location and is a great value.

title: Try to avoid this place
text: Much better value elsewhere for $300, not up to the hotels usual standard in terms of decor and cleanliness, room smelled damp, hairs from previous guests all over the room, stains on the bedding, room was very cramped and the bathroom was only superficially cleaned, staff though were very pleasant and the location is excellent

title: Horroroso, se pudesse dava 0 estrelas
text:
- Atendimento rude, ambiente velho e sujo na recepção, pedimos dois quartos próximos (estávamos com criança, e mesmo assim colocaram um quarto no subsolo e outro no 4o. Andar). Nenhuma vontade de ajudar e respostas ríspidas e lacônicas
- Sujeira por todos os lados, desde o elevador, passando pelos corredores e chegando ao quarto (havia pelos espalhados pela área de banho).
- Quarto pequeno, ar condicionado barulhento e antigo.
- A gota d'água foi acordar de manhã com a briga entre o pessoal da limpeza, com direito a gritaria e policia na porta do quarto. Inacreditável!!
- O café da manhã era outro terror, poucas mesas, e nenhuma limpeza, seja na área de servir, seja nas mesas, o lixo se acumulava e as mesas estavam grudentas.
- Os funcionários todos rudes (não priorizavam os hóspedes no uso do elevador subdimensionado)
- Fizemos o check-out 2 dias antes do vencimento da nossa estadia pois encontramos um hotel na mesma rua, mais barato e muito melhor. A acomodação nos prometeu reembolsar a estadia dos dias restantes, coisa que até o momento não aconteceu. Abrimos um chamado no Booking a respeito mas eles sequer respondem!!

title: Good for a night
text: Beds comfortable. Tv not working. Elevator slow. Parking close to hotel discount. Free Breakfast great waffles bagels muffins danishes oatmeal bread bacon eggs juice orange apple passion fruit tea coffee. Ice machines on lobby floor. Have utensils and silverware cups lids.

title: Great Stay
text:
Excellent location if you want to check in and head straight back out as Times Square is only 3 minutes walk away.
 Breakfast buffet is worth mentioning and will keep you fuelled up. Harry and his team made our stay comfortable. Hotel is clean.

title: Okay...but will not return.
text:
Overall the staff were responsive and friendly. Breakfast was fine with the usual options one would expect for free.  
The biggest disappointment was the fact the rooms are tiny. You really cannot enjoy yourself as just enough room to walk for one person, and absolutely no place to put things down. Cleanliness is not good  I cannot imagine how they would get a vacuum cleaner in the room.  Bathrooms need overhaul. 
So in a pinch, if you are not picky and a single person who just needs a place to sleep....you should be fine. I would not recommend this place for a family or couple looking for a nice place.

title: Soweit ok
text: Wenn man keine hohen Ansprüche stellt ist das Hotel ok. Sehr gute Lage, für USA gutes Frühstück. Hygiene ging so. Zimmer recht klein. Service ist in Ordnung. Kleiner Frühstücksraum,=früh dasein ist empfehlenswert. Preis-Leistung passt schon

title: Da evitare
text: Albergo decadente a prezzi folli anche per new York. Sala colazione squallida . Camere pure. In 4 non c'era posto neanche per aprire le valigie. La camera era massima x 2 . in 4 invivibile . Assurdo pagare dei prezzi alzi per una bettola . Non lo consiglio . Unica cosa positiva in terra non c'è moquette

title: Bien situé à Time Square, personnel très agréable
text:
établissement proche de Time Square et du métro, possibilité de rayonner sur tout Manhattan.
Bon petit déjeuner.
Le personnel a été très agréable et serviable.
Les chambres sont tout à fait correcte, bonne literie.

title: Localização
text:
Excelente localização, café da manhã muito bom, quarto bom tamanho, limpeza deixou um pouco a desejar, poderia ser melhor.
Atendimento muito bom.
Gostei muito, essa é a segunda vez que ficamos nesse hotel. Recomendo.

title: Not impressed
text: Not impressed with the staff or this hotel in general. There was a mixup at checkin and staff blamed us when it was their error. Only good qualities is breakfast and proximity to Times Square. We would not recommend this hotel.

title: Great!
text: The hotel was clean, great location, amazing staff, and tasty breakfast.  We will stay there again for our next trip and will recommend it to our family and friends.  I recommend you take your personal water bottle as the hotel has a water dispenser.

title: Room was falling apart
text: I understand that i booked a lower type of hotel but this felt like a motel. The closet door handle got unscrewed the first time we opened it and bed sheets had stains. Never did breakfast because the lobby was way too busy and small. I usually don't complain but i felt embarrassed

title: Excelente hoten el relacion calidad/precio
text: La ubicación del hotel es excelente, al igual que su desayuno. tal vez parece un poco viejo pero es muy bueno, me toco quedarme pocas noches pero siempre la calidad de sus empleados fue muy buena, en relacion precio calidad y por su ubicación creo yo que es un 10.

title: Great location. Not great for comfort.
text:
So this is how I would break this hotel down
If you really care about being central above everything else - this is the hotel for you.

However, if you care about comfort, cleanliness and appearances of the room and hotel - stay away.

We were stuck in the basement - right across the staff bathroom. The room is old and falling apart. It smells terrible and so does the basement. I don’t know which genius thought it wise to stick guests in the Basement with the cleaning staff. Room is also by the elevator so you hear everything going on.

I have stayed at close to 100 hotels in my lifetime. This is hands down top 3 worst experiences in my life.

title: I’m done with Wyndham properties.
text:
I arrived exhausted at 3am after a delayed flight from NOLA. I booked a “Deluxe Queen” room and was given a tiny room with a double bed that barely fit in the the room. (A Queen bed probably would not have fit)
Also the room was adjacent to the lobby/kitchen area so the people & conversations were heard both overnight and in the early morning at breakfast.  I was too tired to complain so shame on me that I paid $265 for a room smaller than my walk-in closet at home. This is not the first bad experience at a Wyndham property. Never again !!!

title: It doesnt worth it for the money
text: Dirty properly without maintenance, rude staff and very noisy. I´d rather book somewhere else as the hotel is not cheap either. The breakfast was very poor too. The only good about the hotel is the location.

title: New York 28 maggio 4 Giugno
text: Ottima posizione,buona colazione e letto comodo. Ascensore un po’ troppo affollata al mattino e spazio per la colazione un po’ ridotto. Apprezzato il cambio quotidiano delle biancheria da bagno. Possibilità di lasciare le valigie gratuitamente dopo il check out. Forse le camere un po’ piccole ma tutto sommato esperienza positiva al RAMADA

title: Très Bon rapport qualité / prix
text: Hôtel très bien placé (Times square, resto, souvenirs, supermarché), chambre très confortable lit king size top, baignoire, vue sympathique. Attention d'importants travaux en face mais personnellement la journée je n'étais pas à lhotel. Petit déjeuner inclus et boissons à disposition dans le hall toute la journée. Je recommande

title: Don't be the last to check in
text: I checked into the hotel at 8:30 PM and was given a room in the BASEMENT.  The basement smelled bad, had sticky floors, was gunmetal grey and located next to housekeeping.  In case you are wondering, housekeeping is busy all night, clanging around trash, wheeling squeaky carts, doing laundry, playing music and chatting with each other.  It was the singularly most expensive and worst room I have ever had in my life.  I had a TERRIBLE stay.

title: Not worth it, better accommodations available nearby
text: The room we were provided with was located in the basement of the building. It was near the service and utilities area and the walls were damaged and in general dis-repair. The lobby was quite small and crowded. We were able find a better hotel only a block away that was a similar room rate with much better accommodations.

title: Good location
text:
It was a working area outside the hotel across the street that sounded extremely much started 7.00 could have been told 
The breakfast was overcrowded and could be more to choose 
The door into the room was turned that we could se out into the hall and hear every word in the hall

title: Try Somewhere Else Even if You Spend a Lil More
text:
As mentioned to the GM, Mr Kuppuswamy I did in fact write a review regarding my experience at this hotel and overall price was reasonable. Walkable distance to plenty of food and entertainment. Staff overworked and underpaid. Breakfast is chaotic and supervision is subpar at best. Good luck to anyone who considers staying here and I’ve stayed in shared BnBs with one bathroom. 
I checked into the Ramada by Wyndham around 8pm EST. As soon as I entered my room, the second guest I was with walked in to use the restroom and closed the door behind her then preceded to be locked in there for 45min due to a faulty mechanism. 
I immediately called Rut the manager on duty at the front desk who came up within minutes to assist but clearly was out of his depth as he assumed the lock was jammed but in actuality the entire door handle had been broken prior to our arrival. As a guest I had to Google how to dismantle a door handle because the panel where you can get under the lock was located INSIDE the restroom. Instead of calling the fire department, Rut called his elders who in turn blamed the issue on us; the guests! Thankfully for the night manager as he was apologetic and changed our room immediately. The next morning when I went to speak to the manager on duty I was met with disdain and told I have to call back after 1 to speak with the supervisor, Sam Kuppuswamy. I was unable to call because I was in a conference so sent an email to inquire about a discount or rebate regarding the issue. When able I returned to the hotel and spoke with Sam who was offended by the email I wrote asking for a discount and thought it rude that I said I would review his establishment based on my experience with the company’s resolution. After feeling berated and realizing I was being talked down to, probably because I’m a woman of color; the guest I was with stepped in and finally Sam relented and gave a 20% discount and only then offered an apology. At no time did I blame anyone for this issue knowing it was out of most of our controls but to be met like this for a one night stay was beyond me.

title: Un acierto
text:
Hotel muy cuidado, habitaciones medianas-
grandes. Muy céntrico, al lado de Times Square, muy bien situado. en la misma manzana cuenta con boca de metro. Cuenta con desayuno incluido, variedad de zumos, café, dulce y salado. Un acierto. Personal amable y colaborador.
 Un poco antiguo pero cuidado. En el desayuno, si no bajas a primera hora tendrás que esperar un poco porque no hay suficientes mesas para todos.

title: Too expensive, worn out, smelly hotel.
text: Hotel location is great, but the place is worn out, smells and breakfast room is total chaos. Not enough tables (just10) for all guest. Fighting for a spot. Bagels are ok, waffle iron is a nice thing...

title: 6 giorni a New York
text:
Ottimo albergo per chi vuole visitare New York in pochi giorni perchè posizionato vicino a  molti dei principali punti turistici d'interesse.
Le camere, un pochino datate, sono semplici ma pulite.
Fantastico il servizio colazione che seppur non troppo vario per una colazione all'italiana ci ha comunque soddisfatto rendendo possibile anche la preparazione di qualche panino da portarci in giro. Acqua, thè e caffè disponibili h24. Consigliato se non si hanno troppe pretese.

title: Might want to look elsewhere
text: This is a budget/no-frills hotel that I have stayed in previously without issue.  However, it has really slipped in the last few years.  The elevator is slow, the room locks are temperamental (requiring room keys to be re-issued repeatedly), and there were no janitors available off-hours to deal with our broken toilet.  While the breakfast is decent, the rooms are reasonably clean, and the location is okay, I will be looking elsewhere for our next visit to NYC.

title: Nice stay
text: Had some great days days here. Lovely hotel with great staff and nice breakfast. The room was nice and clean. Perfect Wi-Fi. The location is perfect close to the train and with walking distance to man nice sights.

title: They charged me one extra night without any reason and didnt get my money back
text: I stayed 2 nights and after checking my card balance I realized they charged 3 nights instead of 2. They don’t reply my emails and didn't give my money back. Do not stay here ever. I would never stay here again.

title: Great stay close to Time Square and Broadway
text: Very nice stay, clean and peaceful.  Front desk man was friendly and efficient.  Close to shopping and restaurants with reasonable parking across the street.  Breakfast area is small and crowded with people.  Will certainly stay here again, Thanks!

title: Buena ubicación Mala instalación
text: Habitaciones pequeñas e instalaciones viejas y descuidadas, la atención de los latinos Buena, el precio muy alto que solo lo podría hísticas la ubicación, no lo recomiendo para una buena experiencia en una gran ciudad, se queda corta la visita con un hotel que no me da la comodidad que uno busca.

title: The Ramada at 343 West 44th Street, NYC
text:
My friend and I are two women senior citizens. We went to see two Broadway shows. We were happy to find a room with two separate beds. The location is perfect for attending Broadway shows. The "free" breakfast is excellent. Housekeeping is excellent with sheets and towels that are impeccably clean.  
However, the bathtub/shower was very slippery and there were no grab bars. Also, the tub would not fill because the lever to fill it was broken off.  It was hard to communicate this problem to the non-English-speaking elderly man at the desk. He said they'd fix the bathtub while we were away, but when we returned it had not been fixed. 
The mini-fridge froze our water instead of cooling. 
I have stayed at this hotel when it was a Comfort Inn. Breakfast seemed better now (Ramada) with  delicious fresh pastry and other offerings. The location is convenient and safe. 

Plastic waste is killing our planet. This hotel is not alone in generating tons and tons of plastic waste in disposable single-use things. It was appalling to see the food service utensils/plates and food being thrown away by fellow guests. Please, someone or some company, come up with a better way!  We need to leave a livable planet for future generations.

title: Great Stay!!
text: I stayed here for 2 weeks and never had one issue. This will always be my hotel when I come to NYC now. Breakfast had a large variety and the beds were super comfortable. Less than 10 minute walk to ANY Broadway Theater and a close to major subway hub!

title: We highly recommend this hotel.
text: After many hours spent researching hotels, I came across this gem. The price was excellent for Times Square. There were many breakfast options. The room was clean and up to date. I especially enjoyed the 24 hour coffee, tea and water. We will stay here again.

title: DO NOT BOOK
text:
DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL!!! When booking through Priceline, it said a “lower level” was less expensive. Usually in my past experience this means something under the 10th floor without a view. So I was fine with it.  THEY PUT US IN THE BASEMENT! But if we wanted to upgrade there’s a fee!!! Classic bait and switch.  It was so creepy, to go down there. The walls were terrible looking with marks and scuffs, pretty beaten up. The floor was tile- so we could hear EVERYTHING. And the people who work there are in and out the basement because storage and laundry etc is located at that level… so 6am some staff members are blaring music down there when working. 
The room itself was clean but when we went to take a shower the next morning there was only conditioner and lotion… no shampoo!!! And it was the one time we wanted to travel light. Ugh! Miserable experience.  At least the breakfast was decent…

title: correcto y algo sencillo para el glamour de brodway
text:
deberian mejorar el aspecto general de fachada y zona de acceso del hotel  y tambien zona desayuno.
la habitacion podria mejorar el baño que quedo muy viejo. Las camas en tamaño correctas, y un TV excesivo grande para esa habitacion.  Internet andaba muy bien pero habia que conectarse cada vex que uno regresaba al hotel.

title: Ottima soluzione vicino Times Square
text: Buona soluzione vicino Times Square ed alle altre attrazioni della zona. Personale disponibile (ho avuto un problema nello scaricare i biglietti per una partita dei Knicks ed il ragazzo alla reception mi ha autato a risolverlo). Ottima ed abbondante la colazione. Ottimo rapporto qualità/prezzo (periodo viaggi gennaio 2023). Consigliato!

title: Best breakfast ever!
text: I loved my stay from the check in. It was amazing and the breakfast was awesome. If I go back to New York City I’ll definitely use the Ramada Hotel. Amazing location, close to the Times and to the subway station.

title: Excellent Location
text: I went to NYC just for a night to see Moulin Rouge on Broadway at Hirschfeld Theatre on 302 West 45th Street, which was just around the corner. This hotel was my first choice and it was excellent. I highly recommend it.

title: Decepcionante
text: O hotel fica muito bem localizado. A maioria dos funcionários é bastante educada e paciente. A limpeza deixa muito a desejar. Frigobar no quarto é um ponto a favor já que a maioria dos hotéis em Manhattan não oferece este benefício a tds os hóspedes.

title: Fantastic Service
text: Great service, great employees, clean rooms. The team are friendly and helpful. Coffee and ea is available round the clock and the breakfast options are also good. I highly recommended if you are in the area

title: Vacaciones 2023
text: Todo espectacular desde que llegas la atención muy profesional el desayuno muy bueno, los cuartos no son muy grandes pero cómodo para dormir muy limpio, todo queda cerca a Times Square, tienen Park fast para Que puedan dejar los carros, estación de tren cerca al hotel

title: mala experiencia en Ano Nuevo
text: El Personal de recepción no sabe y no le importa resolver bien y atender bien a sus pasajeros frente a problemas que tuvimos. Queríamos tener una experiencia inolvidable en Ramada TS para las fiestas y la falta de aseo total de la habitación arruinó nuestra estadía, no solo ese hecho, sino el comportamiento de la persona en recepción, fue indolente y nada de empatico. Desde antes de Navidad estábamos recorriendo la costa este y nos alojamos en Holiday Inn y no tuvimos ningún problema, lamentablemente Ramada no está a la altura del nombre ni la ciudad, solo desayuno es muy bueno.

title: Good Value for money
text: Place is clean. Staff friendly, supportive. They make you feel home.  Complementary breakfast was good. Location is another major attraction for a traveler on budget like me. Bus station/hub or under ground train hub hardly four hundred meters. Time Square two blocks away. major attractions withing walkable reach from hotel.

title: hotel needs massive updating
text: rooms are old, felt like I was staying at a hotel in a third world country. Service was adequate. Paid for a deluxe room and got a room on the first floor facing a dark alley. Can't believe this is a Ramada hotel

title: Ramada Times Square
text: Friendly staff, good breakfast. But the room was a tiny dump. Would not go back there. Other places we've stayed in Manhattan were also very small rooms, but much nicer for approximately the same price.

title: Low End Experience
text: The bottom line was this hotel was quite low end. When you first walk in it seems a little more like a bodega than a hotel and there was an unpleasant smell in the lobby. Not the best first impression! The whole place seem to have been retrofitted, as opposed to potentially renovated at any point in time. location was OK, but the majority of the experience made me feel like I was staying in a much lower end hotel than I would expect from Ramada/Wyndham.

title: I would not stay here again
text:
I booked via the Ramada website for a lower level room. This meant that the room was in the basement. The hallway to the room was painted battleship gray. There were housekeeping and maintenance items in the hall. Our room overlooked a courtyard which boasted a broken air conditioner.
The room itself appeared fine until we realized the heater was running too much. It's above the exterior sliding door to the courtyard. This may be why there was a ladder stored in the hallway.
We paid $560 including tax for one night. We should have booked a better room elsewhere. I am certain we will never see this Ramada again.

title: Cerca de todo
text: El lugar está cerca de todo, estaba limpio. El desayuno es variado, el área del desayuno es muy pequeño nos fuimos a comer al cuarto. En hombre del área de recepción le pidió a una de las personas que se fuera porque tenía que limpiar la mesa. La persona somo estaba sentada hablando por teléfono lo que me parece una total falta de respeto. Por lo demás me parece un buen lugar si quieres estar cerca de todo.

title: No. Don’t book here unless you can’t afford something better
text: I really do my research when I’m deciding where to stay. I look at locations, price, amenities. In fact, this place was one of my top 5 while deciding a few weeks prior to coming. When the price dropped considerably the week before my trip, I jumped on it and booked it. If you’re reading this review, you’re probably trying to decide where to stay too, and your decision is probably based more about the price than anything else. You’ll get  a very basic breakfast-no French toast, omelettes, warm cinnamon rolls, yogurt, etc. The beds are fine. You ‘ll have a tv, small refrigerator & small bathroom. It’s clean, not spotless. The location isn’t bad, although the street noise is unbearable at times, so you’ll need earplugs if that bothers you. The walls are very thin, so hopefully you don’t get noisy neighbors like we did. This is pretty much bare bones when it comes to a hotel experience. Yes, i saved money. But it’s not always just about the money. Truth be known, i just really wasn’t thrilled at the end of the day with just having a place to sleep. And that is all this was. Although the staff were pleasant, it just didn’t feel welcoming. I didn’t feel happy coming back here at the end of the day. In fact, I felt disappointed that I came to New York for vacation and everyday dreaded coming back to this drab place. I learned my lesson, and unless I’m really pinching pennies to go on a vacation, I won’t pick a place like this next time. This just wasn’t the experience I was looking for.

title: Not that clean
text: Thought it wasn’t that clean - particularly in communal areas. Breakfast was overcrowded. It was in a great location and only a 10 minute walk to time square. The staff were really nice and friendly and helpful

title: Déçus
text:
Bonjour,
Nous avons séjourné du 6 au 12 novembre 2022 au sein de l'hôtel Ramada by Windham à New York.
Nous avons été extrêmement déçus. Malgré un accueil satisfaisant, nous avons été dérangés par l'odeur de détergent ainsi que par des nuisances sonores à partir de 5h du matin car notre chambre était au sous-sol à côté de la blanchisserie.
La chambre n'était pas sécurisée, la fenêtre tenait à l'aide d'une barre.
La sécurité incendie n'était pas aux normes.
Infiltration d'air par un trou dans le mur au-dessus de la climatisation.
Le ménage non fait mis à part le changement des serviettes tous les jours.
Nous réclamons une indemnité de dédommagement suite à ces différents incidents.

title: Preço/Qualidade - a voltar
text:
Hotel bem localizado, com bom atendimento, quartos bons e camas muito confortáveis. Pequeno almoço bom e à noite pode se beber chá, café ou chocolate quente. Se precisamos táxi chamam no.
Recomendo este hotel.

title: Better than what I was expecting
text: Based on the reviews I read, I was a little hesitant about this hotel, but it was where I needed to be, at a semi-affordable price.  I was pleasantly surprised. The room was small, and the bathroom was very small, but it had everything we needed for a short NYC trip.  The breakfast saved us money.  They had eggs and either bacon or sausage, waffles, bagels, toast, cereal and several different pastries.  The dining area is very small and it was crowded.  We had a slight problem with our toilet upon arrived, but it was fixed immediately after calling the front desk.  The people working were nice and responded to our request.  The front desk referred us to a car service for a ride back to the airport and it was cheaper than many others I saw on the internet and not much more than a taxi.  So, I would recommend this hotel.

title: Dirty old hotel with a price not worth it.
text:
Horrible place to stay, dirty bathrooms, old noisy a/c, fridge licking water !! And in 4 days only once the made the room.

Breakfast means to fight for a cheap coffee or to use the toaster. Complete chaos.

title: Buon hotel in ottima posizione
text:
L'hotel si trova sulla 44a strada, a pochi metri dalla stazione metro di Port Authority. Ottima soluzione per chi, come noi, ha utilizzato la metro per lo spostamento in autonomia dall'aeroporto JFK. È possibile raggiungere in pochi minuti a piedi la celebre Times Square e la zona è ricca di negozi e ristoranti di ogni genere. È una soluzione a un costo accessibile per chi visita New York per la prima volta.
La camera ha accolto abbastanza comodamente la nostra famiglia di 4 persone, dotata di due letti matrimoniali, un bagno con vasca e tenda doccia, frigorifero, tv, ed altri accessori di categoria. La pulizia quotidiana della camera a nostro avviso è sembrata appena sufficiente. Attenzione a non lasciare nulla sui letti altrimenti non saranno rifatti. 
La colazione internazionale è un grande punto a favore della struttura. Ottima qualità, con prodotti sia dolci che salati. 
Lo staff è cordiale e disponibile a dispensare consigli sulle attività che offre la zona.
La nostra esperienza è stata positiva e consigliamo a tutti l'hotel Ramada.

title: Emplacement idéal tarif abordable
text:
Hôtel très bien situé ou le personnel est accueillant et les chambres très propres.
Le seul bémol serait le petit déjeuner qui manquait un peu de choix bien que dans les standard de la ville.
Le personnel est discret et agréable.

title: New York Experience
text: This is a great place to stay for the price.  Its clean, and the staff is very friendly.  It is in the perfect location for walking to the theaters and restaurants.  It is surrounded by nightlife and provides ease to get too.

title: Tired, dated property, grimy and feels dirty.
text: No investment in modernising since the 80’s. Tired and dirty with lots of drug addicts hanging  around outside. Breakfast was basic and rooms were extremely old and noisey. Cheap windows meant you could hear arguing drug addicts all night long.

title: Relax
text: Albergo confortevole buona la colazione ottima la posizione, accogliente il giusto per una vacanza senza pensieri. All'uscita a pochi passi metropolitana che ti permette di iniziare la giornata da turista nei migliori dei modi. La sera la zona è sufficientemente tranquilla nonostante la vicinanza a Time Square, intorno ci sono moltissimi locali, l'imbarazzo della scelta. Qualità /prezzo equilibrato.

title: What a disfunctional place!  Beware!
text:
I booked it on booking.com. It said something about I booked a lower floors room. Turned out that meant in the basement where there are three rooms. Cost each night in September with taxes was $320. There was a courtyard outside. 
The first room 103 - the thermostat was broken. A person came in and got on a nine foot ladder and turned on the AC - it was hot - and said ok?  No ability to control it. I asked for another - room 105 - that had a working  thermostat. I moved to it and went to sleep. I woke up the next morning to a pool of water in the back third of the room. I told reception and they said there had been some water problem in room 104. I we t out for the day and evening and came back at 10 pm. The thermostat in my room did not work anymore and it was very hot. A person came to fix it and finally after 15 minutes said he could not. I asked can I open the door to the courtyard and cool down enough to go to sleep. I did that and slept and checked out the following morning at 8 am. 
I left a bag to pick up later that afternoon. I complained about all the problems and asked for 1 of my 2 nights taken off my bill. When I came back to pick up my bag I asked and the man at the counter said I would get 50% off my bill for all my troubles.  They ended up taking $109 off out of $620 and said I was getting half off my one night room rate before taxes.  That was all. To be fair some of the desk people were nice and they did make a good breakfast that people seemed to like. But be warned.  That hotel seems to have a lot of maintenance problems. And they did not deliver a quality stay for my money.

title: Great location
text: The stuffs are friendly and helpful. Excellent location, walking distance to Time square and the Broadway. Foods are nearby. Comfortable bed and spacious room. Clean with all facilities. Good breakfast included.

title: Ref de hoteles
text: Bien pero podría ser mejor con estos precios que ofrecen u bajar los precios a los hoteles, en NY cuesta mucho conseguir hoteles buenos con los precios que hay que parece que todos son de 5 estrellas, es una pena que se haya encarecido una barbaridad y cueste conseguir hoteles acorde calidad precio y accesibles

title: Localização e atendimento nota 10
text: Muito bem localizado, confortável, limpo e com um ótimo café da manhã. Gostei da estadia e ficaria novamente nesse hotel. O chocolate quente, café e chá, disponível o tempo todo mostra a cortesia do hotel com o cliente. Os funcionários da recepção são muito atenciosos e o pessoal da limpeza também.

title: Horrid.  Filthy.  Zero stars
text:
This is the worst hotel experience ever.  
I don’t know where to begin.  
Rude check in.  
Messy front desk. 
Run down- everything! 
If the hotel was 50 bucks a night, I could understand. 
I felt unsafe 
WiFi not working in room 
Room was filthy 
There was cum on the bin!!
The fridge is taped together 
I honestly whole- heartedly cannot say a single good thing.   
Oh! Elevator very uneasy.  Filthy hall way.  Is the vacuum working? 
I checked out early and hope I get my refund   
I advise you to consider other options.

title: Excelente hotel a minutos de Times Square
text:
Excelente hotel, a minutos de Times Square, la ubicacion es muy buena, en la esquina esta el metro.
Las habitaciones son amplias para el promedio de NY, e incluye un desayuno muy rico.
El personal es muy atento y predispuesto a responder todas las consultas.
Desde ya, voy a volver.

title: Ramada en NYC
text: El hotel está muy bien ubicado, cerca de muchas cosas importantes que ver en NYC y la calidad-precio es muy buena, con buenas ofertas. Silencioso, cerca de una zona con muchos sitios para comer-cenar, etc, muy recomendable. Y muy buena zona.

title: Old and crusty worst hotel I've ever stayed at!
text: The whole place was super small and smelled badly - we held our breath every time we walked in the front doors.  The elevator was wonky.  The room was over marketed as a "Deluxe".  We needed 2 beds for a family of 4 and we got 2 doubles (not queens) and there was hardly any space.  No place for luggage, no space to stand.  It was a super small room and and extremely crusty.  I paid over $1000 for 3 nights.  It should be a 0 (zero) star hotel.  The experience was so bad for my family that I will never stay at a Wyndham/Ramada for any family or business travels again.

title: Great location
text: Ramada is in a great location, a few mins walk from the subway and short walk from Time Square. I travelled here with two kids under 13. The hotel staff were super helpful (we had an issue with our safe whereby it closed but wouldn't open, so the staff immediately came up to fix it). The beds were clean and comfortable. Breakfast was good but not much day-to-day variety. Shower gave hot water and there were plenty of channels to flick through on the telly. This is not a luxurious hotel, so if thats what you're after this is not it. If you're visiting NYC, this is a good basic place to rest and sleep after a day of wandering.

title: No muy seguro
text: El área en donde se encuentra ubicado me pareció muy insegura para caminar de noche y sentí que el hotel no contaba con la seguridad adecuada, cualquier persona podía entrar o salir del hotel sin que nadie se percatara

title: Hotel bien, calle insegura
text:
La habitación es grande y cómoda. Pasan todos los días a hacer las camas y cambiar las toallas necesarias pero no la limpian. El desayuno está bien, algo de fruta, tostadas, gofres, zumo y café (te ahorras mucho dinero con los precios que tiene la ciudad).
La ubicación del hotel es excelente, a 5 minutos andando de Times Square. El problema empieza al entrar al tramo de calle donde se encuentra el hotel, hay una cantidad exagerada de homeless, incluso sentados en la puerta del hotel que se te acercan a pedir, o directamente te gritan insultos. En otros hoteles tienen seguridad en la puerta y se evitan estas situaciones.

title: Just ok for a place to stay
text: The staff was just ok. My room has a little problem far as the bathroom, no shower curtain and I had to clean the hair off the flood. I carry my own supplies on my travels just for things like the bathroom

title: Family weekend
text:
Great location near Times Square. Breakfast had good selection but not enough seats and had to que every day
Rooms was ok, toilet small (could not open door fully as it hits the toilet!).  Did not spend a great deal of time in room, so not a major issue. Lastly, exterior and internal decor looks “tired’ and needs a refurbishment

title: Perfect location and for a short stay
text: Walking distance to Times Square. Room was clean and comfortable. Perfect for a short few days stay. We were allowed to check-in early at no extra cost and were given access to our room straight away.

title: Poor cleaning
text:
You have to ask them to change the sheets and clean the bathroom properly.
It has a very good location and they offer free coffee and water at any hour. You can also use the breakfast tables to have lunch or dinner.

title: August Trip.
text: Location is great, right near times square. However, walls are very thin, and we were woken up each of the 3 nights we stayed here, around 3am each night, because people were so loud. Cleanliness could be better, I feel like they rush how they clean the rooms. I saw maids laying on the floor on their phones and not doing much. Yes, it’s good value for money, but not worth the hassle. Just pay a little more for somewhere much better.

title: Estadia comfortavel
text: O hotel é bom, o café da manha é excelente, bem localizado, preço  justo para NYC, cama muito confortável. Meu único desgosto foi com a limpeza do quarto pois o chão não parecia ter sido limpo, estava com poeira e não dava pra ficar de meia no quarto porque a meia ficava preta. O ar condicionado é bem barulhento para dormir, me incomodou um pouco, mas eu me incomodo com barulho para dormir, minhas amigas dormiram super bem apesar do barulho. Se você se incomoda muito com barulho para dormir, esse ar condicionado incomoda bem. Mas foi um hotel muito bom, atendeu bem o que queríamos.

title: No frills
text: Adequate room if you’re just there to sleep. Sketchy elevator, in-window a/c unit that never turns off. Typical free breakfast with waffles, meat, juices. Staff is nice, I hung out in the lobby for hours waiting for my ride. Coffee available throughout the day.

title: Nice
text: Really I enjoyed, all staffs are trained and helpful, especially Mr. Anil and Mr. Paresh. I faced some problem in internet connectivity and signals in my room. Breakfast was good but seating capacity was less.

title: Improvements needed
text:
I stayed at this hotel several years ago when it was Comfort Inn. My main complaint then was that the rooms had a strong stuffy odor. I learned before booking with this hotel again that Ramada had eradicated the odor issue by pulling up the old carpets and replacing them with vinyl tile. Though the odor problem was gone during my recent stay, there were a few things that will keep me from coming back a third time.

My room looked old but clean, and I was happy to have a fridge and a safe to keep a few things. I loved being within walking distance of Times Square. On the negative side, the toilet in the room didn't flush well and the AC unit was so loud that I had to turn it off so I wouldn't hear it. The free breakfast every morning was one of the worst offerings I've had from any hotel. The selection was very limited and no warming element was used to keep hot foods from getting cold and sitting at an unsafe temperature. Comfort Inn offered a better breakfast here years ago.

Another negative that has less to do with the hotel and more to do with the city: During the day, there were people who appeared to be vagrants hanging around near the property. It's not uncommon to see that in NYC, but what was new to me was the yelling, fighting and partying I heard every night after midnight on 44th street in front of the hotel. I don't know if the people involved were the same ones I saw hanging out during the day, but the yelling had gotten so bad one night that the police came out with sirens on. It was never a quiet night having a room with windows facing 44th.

title: Dirty room and curtains that don't work
text: I checked in with my friend on Saturday 6/25 and we had to wait almost an hour for the room to be "cleaned". We finally got into the room exhausted & trying to take a nap, only to find that the curtains didn't even close properly, so taking a nap was impossible. Plus, the windows were so dirty and smudged, it was disgusting. If the windows weren't cleaned, God knows what else they didn't clean, and every attempt to contact the property has been ignored

title: Boa opção pela localização
text:
Pontos positivos: Localização excelente e camas boas. Água e gelo sempre disponível no hall de enterda.
Pontos negativos: Aspectos não confere com 3 estrelas. Espaço para café da manhã pequeno. Pessoas que frequentam não conferem com 3 estrelas.

title: Buen precio y ubicación!
text:
Hotel sencillo desayuno bien,manzana,  dulces.pan,cereal, factuŕa.jugos, te, café todo el día, habitación suficiente para dormir  limpieza floja pero personal muy amable! Cerca de todo! El subte muy conveniente a 1 cuadra, a estudiar el mapa!
Gracias por todo NY.

title: One Star hotel
text: The hotel is convenient but it is bare minimum, more like a sketchy motel in middle of Times Square. Internet never worked. People hanging around in hallways when we arrived, small children. Trash in elevators. Smells weird in room. AC not cold.

title: Other than location nothing nice to say about the place
text: Old, outdated hotel, ridiculously small rooms for US standards , seemed like an European hotel room. Extremely thin walls could hear every time the adjacent rooms got in or out. AC didn’t work correctly and couldn’t fix it . Pay a little more and stay elsewhere

title: WORST hotel experience I’ve had in 50 years!!
text: I have already expressed my experience in lengthy detail in a previous box. In a nutshell, I did everything I was told to do in order to extend my stay by one day only to be told, in the end, that there were no rooms available, despite my having been told that extending was no problem, and that my 82 year old mother and I were being kicked out into the street. After much protest and being told that there was no manager on site for me to talk to, a room was eventually found…after I had packed up and been stressed out. I was never offered as much as an apology. I will never stay in another Ramada nor will I ever recommend one to friends or family.

title: Good location
text:
You are right there in the middle of everything. Few steps from Times Square, several restaurants, shops  and theaters!!! Just pick which Broadway show you want to see tonight! ;-)
Many reviews said about the paper bags breakfast but it seems those days are over now! :-p our last day had already the buffet. Simple and effective ;-)

title: Tired but good location,
text: A dated property with a good location. The rooms and public area are very tired and need refurbishment. The breakfast bag is very basic but coffee was good. I wouldn’t hurry back. Not very good value. The one positive was the location - Convenient.

title: Old, smell, grab and go breakfast
text: An experience to forget. Location is great but hotel it is in need of refurbishment, rooms smell, cleaning must improve, breakfast is a joke (grab and go). Overall it was a terrible experience and had to move to another place.

title: Quick trip to NYC
text: I made a quick trip to NYC to see a show (Mr. MJ--fabulous!) and wanted a hotel within walking distance to both the theater and Penn Station. Was not looking for anything fancy. This hotel was well located, had some good restaurants and coffee shops very close by. The room was clean and quiet. The hallway hadn't been cleaned when we arrived but the room was clean. Lobby was small and didn't have a ton to offer, but that was fine for my purposes.

title: Sehr ordentliches und zentral gelegenes Hotel
text: Wenn man ein einigermaßen bezahlbares und zentral gelegenes Hotel in NYC sucht ist man hier absolut richtig! Sauber und zweckmäßig, kontinentales Frühstück, Kühlschrank, Safe und Wifi funktionieren sehr gut. Von Zimmer zu Zimmer zwar etwas hellhörig, aber so ist nun mal oft die Bauweise der Häuser in den USA. Zur Subway sind es weniger als 5 Minuten zu Laufen.

title: I’d give this hotel a 0 if I could
text: We couldn’t believe this hotel is part of the Ramada group. It is absolutely vile, the lobby is like a cheap and dirty motel. It’s located on an incredibly rough street in New York which is unfortunately full of people off their faces on drugs. Avoid this hotel!!!

title: Esperienza molto buona
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato per 7 notti.
Posizione dell’hotel ottima, personale sempre disponibile H24. 
Unica pecca la colazione che causa covid consiste in cibo confezionato e una mela ma comunque abbondante.

title: Good location, friendly and helpful staff at desk
text:
Good location near the time square, helpful desk staff.
A single lift means waiting some time
Rooms were clean and comfortable bed. Service to rooms was provided on daily basis.
Grab and go breakfast could have been better and more variable

title: Great deal just off Times Square.
text: A great bargain just off Times Square. Theatres, dining, shopping and the essence of a NYC visit at the hotel's doorstep. A five to ten minute walk covered the theater district. Buses and subway stations nearby. Best of all were the friendly staff who just wanted to please their guests.

title: Bad experience
text:
Hotel needs improvements. Both in installations and services. Small and uncomfortable room, old furniture...
Continental breakfast is almost a joke. No buffet available. Only a paperbag with an apple and a croissant and something else. Coffee and juices avaliable on machines. No service...

title: esperienza da evitare
text:
Camere sporche e microscopiche, peli e capelli a terra, aria condizionata mal funzionante e rumorosissima, tappezzeria con schizzi di oscura natura, armadi minuscoli in cui non entrano nemmeno dei pantaloni appesi, cavi della televisione a vista, sedia più larga della scrivania alla quale è adibita e per concludere colazione al sacco! nel senso che ti mollano un sacchetto con dentro una mela, un croissant confezionato e un muffin ai limiti del commestibile. Altro che colazione all'americana.. Distributore di aranciata che funziona a metà, eroga solo mela e un altro gusto, due su quattro. Il tutto servito su tavolini sporchi e mai puliti da personale inesistente. Ascensore unico con attese interminabili (da 10 minuti a botta) tutto questo alla modica cifra di 300 dollari a notte a testa! mi stupisco che possa appartenere alla catena RAMADA. 
Una simile sistemazione dovrebbe costare 30/40 dollari a notte

title: Ramada 44th street
text: It’s like a guest house . Ok room but poor bathroom . Very shabby lobby & breakfast .Un welcoming front office staff . Not value for money in anyway , it’s like a motel . Good location . The breakfast is in the go & it’s if very poor quality .

title: Awful property avoid
text:
This property was one of the worst ramadas i have experienced. Simply awful, positives include a giant tv (too big for the room) and working AC.

The location is perfect for times square but the street is full of hobos and druggies who come in the lobby screaming and shouting. The breakfast was a bag containing a pastry in a plastic bag and a piece of fruit...very random.

All this would be acceptable at a budget price but this was seriously expensive..avoid avoid avoid

title: Okay room but real bad breakfast!
text:
When I booked this hotel I was under the assumption that Ramada had good hotels. I've come back to that quite a bit. The room was okay (maybe could have been a bit cleaner), quite a lot of noise in the hallway and an entrance where you had the feeling of having ended up in a hostal.
Worst of all: Breakfast!
What a drama. A paper bag containing an unedible croissant wrapped in plastic, another unedible sandwich, granola bar and an apple. I understand that was served every day. We didn't eat there anymore and luckily we found a good breakfast spot around the corner (recommended).
Staying in a Ramada?
Never again!

title: Do not stay here
text:
Everything in room felt outdated. The tile in bathroom shower had been replaced with mismatched
From patching, cracks in sink basin, towels were short, rough and thin and worn. No service elevator so had to constantly fight staff for it. Cleaning crew left their carts in the hallways 24/7 even when not cleaning rooms. Elevator 
Bounced when it stopped.  Paying over $350- convenient but not worth it

title: EXCELENTE ESTANCIA
text: Muy buena ubicación, muy limpio todos los dias limpiaban, habitaciones amplias y comodas, el staff genial y muy amable, solo el desayuno muy repetido y no había leche o cacao para los niños, solo cafe.

title: Disappointed Review
text: The hotel clerk at this location was very unprofessional and unaccomodating. He was very confrontational with a chip on his shoulder, very unpleasant. The staff even entered the room twice while we were leaving and my wife was getting dressed. All of this happened after a late check out was secured and then reduced.

title: Nunca me habían tratado de timar así a la cara.
text:
Mi reserva era por dos noches por 471 dólares. Cuando llegue me Dan una noche por 289 y se quedan tan panchos. 
Pregunto y me dicen que tienen que hablarlo con el manager.
No entendí porque no de respetaba mi reserva previa.
El personal de recepción es incapaz de ayudar o dar soluciones. En ocasiones yo creo que había cámaras y salíamos en la tv
No es recomendable salvo que te de igual todo y quieras estar en el medio de todo
No puedo puntuar con menos que lo merece

title: Overall good experience.
text: For the price of this hotel the location was excellent. Staff was helpful and friendly. Beds were comfortable. Rooms were small but clean. Close proximity to metro and Times Square. Parking not included but garage right across the street is convenient. Would stay again.

title: EXCELENTE Y BIEN UBICADO
text: Hotel con excelente ubicación y facilidad para llegar a sitios turísticos de la ciudad, personal con excelente atención, apenas adecuado para un viajes de un par de días. Lo mejor de todo es la ubicación del Hotel.

title: Hotel Ramada
text:
O hotel cheira muito mal, tem os lençóis usados e não são lavados, quartos pequenos visto que são quartos familiares, sanita e banheira de má qualidade e a mesma observação para todo o quarto incluindo a casa de banho.
O chão é peganhento é sujo.
Horrível não recomendo a ninguém, nem ao diabo em si.

title: Very basic hotel, but well located
text: This hotel is very very basic and the rooms are really small. The breakfast as some plastic bags with pastry in a paper bag. The beds are small, not even queen size. The bathroom was small, although there was good hot water

title: Amazing
text: The breakfast was perfect, you could also take coffee and tea at any time. The rooms where clean and confortable. Regarding to the location... just amazing, Times Square was 3 blocks away! I strongly recommend it.

title: Estadia Ramada
text:
A estadia foi ótima, aproveitamos nossas férias que foram excelente, o hotel é muito bem localizado, o custo benefício foi ideal. 
Os funcionários são muito atenciosos, simpáticos e nos ajudaram no checkin e no checkout.

title: Great stay; clean hotel
text: Ramada is a great hotel stay. Kai checked me in and he was very helpful and gave useful information about the hotel/breakfast times. Would recommend! Hotel was clean and it was a good stay. No issues.

title: Excelente localização
text: Ótima localização e tem a vontade na recepção água , café, leite e chá a vontade . Tem uma estação de metrô na esquina e perto de tudo. Na 810, 8th avenida achei o Good Emporiurm que serve uma variedade de comida no peso muito boa.

title: Buen hotel
text: El hotel está bien, tiene una excelente ubicación ya que tienes una de las paradas con mas conexiones a tan solo unos pasos y es limpio. Lo único que cambiaría sería la variedad del desayuno porque todos los días daban lo mismo: un cuernito, una manzana y un pan dulce. Entiendo que es económico pero podría haber más variedad por el mismo rango de precio. Las habitaciones están bien y la verdad es que en la noche no se escucha mucho ruido de la calle a pesar de estar cerca de Times Square

title: I would go back
text: Hotel is small, not fancy but VERY clean as well as my room.   The staff was friendly, attentive and accommodating.   great location, walking distance to time square as well as bus Terminal.  I highly recommend if you are in a budget like I was.

title: Great customer service
text: The staff there was extremely kind and welcoming. They were very accommodating with our luggage and helped us out so much during our stay. Every time I came in and out of my room, there was someone cleaning and it gave me a piece of mind that I was staying in a clean place!

title: Lugar perfecto
text:
La cercanía los lugares a visitar, al metro fue de las cosas que mas valoré. 
Tiene varios restaurantes cercanos y super seguro.
La cama y almohadas me permitió tener descanso necesario para seguir en mis días de viaje

title: Bathroom not functional
text:
First two days I wasn't able to use the shower.  First the drain was clogged and water was flooding in the shower.  It was smelly and bad.  They fix that the 2nd day of my stay.  However 2nd day the shower head was broken and was shooting water away and there was no pressure.  So taking a shower the 2nd day was also very bad although the flooding got fixed.  They fixed the shower head my 3rd day of stay.

The breakfast is given in a brown bag that is stuffed with unhealthy food....same every day,  It did have an apple in it that was good.  Having tea/coffee 24/7 was a good thing however my room was next to the breakfast area and I couldn't sleep at nigh due to noises.  

The location was idea.  The staff, specially the ladies that work there are very pleasant to talk to and they try hard to get issues fixed.

title: Excellent stay
text: Very good hotel in perfect location. Staff was friendly, room was clean, great big tv and good wifi. The breakfast was really good, and the hotel is near Times Square, close to NY metro service, what was really perfect location.

title: Agradable sorpresa.
text:
La verdad hicimos la reserva con temor por algunos comentarios, pero en general es una excelente opción. La ubicación es inmejorable; la atención del personal es excelente. El tamaño de la habitación algo pequeña, pero es lo usual en New York. Lo único para criticar es la poca variedad del desayuno, siempre fue lo mismo, pero eso no baja la calidad del hotel. 
Definitivamente lo recomiendo.

title: Service and cleanliness below par
text: I am a guest, not a prisoner. I would not recommend staying here. Front desk staff in particular one person was flat out rude, terrible. Request before checking in was not responded at, at all. Floor was dirty. Room felt dirty

title: A due passi da times square
text: Vicino al centro,.stanza davvero calda e confortevole. Colazione avrei preferito qualcosa in più (la danno in un sacchetto di carta). TV schermo grande. La doccia molto comoda e il lavello tenuto bene.

title: I FOUND A ROACH
text: The staff wasn’t very polite and they were really rude and honestly  i had a terrible experience at this hotel. To top it all off  I FOUND A ROACH IN MY ROOM AND LEFT IMMEDIATELY. They didn’t refund me.

title: My actors “crash pad” in New York
text: I am a5aspiring actor and the location of this Ramada was right we’re “Hells kitchen” borders “Times Square”! I had hundreds of convenient places to eat and very popular attractions! All of my auditions and stage locations were all in walking distance! This location is also convenient walking distance to the New York port authority!

title: Cheap, Nice and very good location in Times Square
text: If you are in a budget and want to explore time square, RAMADA is very convenient. The place is very near Time Square and the has access to Subway. I paid less than 150 for 2 day in this hotel including breakfast.   I would highly recommend this location

title: Great
text:
Super Hotel , super Lage . Günstig , kleines Zimmer aber für den Preis super.
Top Kaffee und nette Mitarbeiter, top Lage !!!! Wenige Meter bis zum Times Square ! Und 24h Kostenloser Kaffee Service . Klasse

title: Todo muy bueno, Excepto el desayuno!!
text: Deberían integrar otras opciones para el desayuno . Te entregan una bolsa con unos panes y bizcocho,  una manzana  y un pequeño jugo, TODOS LOS DÍAS LO MISMO . El servicio estuvo bien, igual la limpieza

title: BIEN SITUE PROPRE MAIS PERSONNEL PEU SYMPATHIQUE
text:
L'hotel est très bien situé a à peine 5minutes à pied de times Square. les chambres sont propres c'est très bien pour un court séjour.
Le personnel a été odieux pour un monsieur un matin, qui nous a crié dessus. les autres personnes sont très polies.
le petit déjeuner était limite alors que nous avons payé pour, un sachet avec des aliments pas très bons (croissants et gateaux secs en sachets) au vu du prix du petit déj c'était moyen.

title: Bed broke
text:
The bed broke as soon as I sat on it. The hotel was also noisy but it’s inner city with thin walls so what are you gonna do?

Shower was good. I didn’t try the breakfast. Wifi was good. Temperature was good

title: Great location!!
text: Well kept and great location , walking distance to Times Square and at the same time the hotel is quiet and peace-full inside, if you wabt to walk to times square this is a great spot to  be ! Will be here again!

title: Agradable
text: Un lugar con buena ubicación, habitaciones cómodas y espaciosas, camas muy confortables, buena opción de desayunos empacados, falta mayor amabilidad en el personal de la recepción pues son fríos y cortantes

title: Excelente hotel y Buena Ubicacion
text: A solo minutos caminando de time square, tren que te lleva a la estatua de la libertad, Rocafeller. Muchos Restaurantes cerca. Recomiendo este hotel, por el precio esta super bien!! Creo que volvere nuevamente en un futuro…

title: Excelente
text: Excelente estancia, hotel limpio, magnífica ubicación, desayuno incluido, té y café las 24 hrs. superó mis expectativas, no es un hotel lujoso pero cumple al 100, habitaciones pequeñas como todos los hoteles en New York

title: Nice place to stay, right next to Time Square
text:
Generally OK hotel with at good location, thus a little worn out.
Staff friendly and polite, so definately a nice place to stay, if you want to be in the center of Manhattan, also with easy access to the subway

title: Ms Harris
text: Room was tiny as ever, but served it purpose to have somewhere to sleep and change clothes, but the location was great, close proximity to the  theater, stores & restaurant, no need for taxi or ride share service.

title: Meh
text: Beds are horrible and breakfast was nonexistent but overall a decent price for the weekend and good location. Coffee shop across the street is good and so was Don Giovannis Restaurant across the street.

title: Brilliant stay, for a bargain price
text: I had a great stay here. Right at the heart of the city. Location is near Times Square with subway at the end of the road. There are some great restaurants and bars to go to as well. Great Jazz club as well. Broadway and Times Square about 5 minutes away

title: If I could give it 0 stars, I would.
text: I am not the kind of person who usually leaves reviews online, but the experience I had here was SO TERRIBLE that I felt it deserved the effort. First and foremost, the people at the hotel are absolutely unfriendly and loathsome. My phone got stolen on the way to the hotel. Luckily I knew the address, but when I got to the hotel they wouldn't give me the room because the reservation was under my uncle's name (perfectly understandable) but they also simply would not allow me to use their computer/phone for 5 minutes to try to call or communicate with my uncle. While paying more than $100 to stay at that place, they made me go outside to times square like a beggar to ask someone to let me use their phone to try to communicate with my family members, who were waiting for me and would probably be worried that I wasn't there. Not only is that terrible hotel service but, honestly, just being unfriendly people. They were so rude and entitled. As if that weren't all, THERE ARE COCKROACHES IN THE ROOMS. Ok, I get it, it's Times Square and it's dirty, but hire a fumigation company, it's not that hard and it's very effective. I had to go to the front desk at 12 pm bc I saw maybe 3 roaches in my room. The guy came with this stupid little spray can and sprayed that corner a bit. I asked if I could keep the can in my room and he said no. The can was half empty so I'm assuming this is not the first nor the last time they've had this issue. UGH, absolutely appalling, the worst hotel that I have ever been to, hands down, all because of the people who work there.

title: Unsafe dump
text:
I don’t have anything good to say about this place other than the location. My room was dirty, hair on the towels and dirt on the floors, even some pizza sauce on the phone. There is a hole in the wall. The down button on the elevator doesn’t appear to work on my floor. The bedside reading lamp does not work. Flushing is not something the toilet is particularly good at. 
I had the pleasure of someone knocking on my door and then quickly opening it with a key to find my standing there getting dressed. She ran away screaming after seeing me, quite professional. When I called the front desk I was told nonchalantly that someone was “checking the rooms” (what for?) and received a half hearted apology. I feel like I need to sleep with one eye open for the rest of my trip. I wouldn’t stay here again if it was my only option.

title: Do not stay here
text:
I picked this hotel because of the price and proximity to Times Square. Wrong. I would rather pick something further away and pay more than ever stay here again. The bedsheets had stains on them and there were bugs on the ceiling. The curtains and carpet were dirty and the door lock was broken. They say that they would clean the room and occasionally change the sheets during our long stay, but this was not the case. We came back to find the same dirty pillow tops, covers and sheets on the beds. They assured me that I was wrong and everything was clean, which they clearly were not. Well, the second time I made sure to mark everything. Same story, they said everything was clean and fresh until I showed them my markings. Then they actually changed everything. So why charge for a service you do not provide?
Also, guests were slamming doors late at night and early morning. So it was hard to get a good rest.

title: Location , Location
text:
We stayed here three nights before taking a cruise , I contacted the Hotel prior to our visit to request a high floor room , On arrival we had the room on the 6th floor , very quiet with no external noise , The breakfast in the morning was excellent plenty of choice and good selection ,
As in previous reviews the Hotel is in an excellent location for the subway and Times square , 

there are great Bars in the street one right opposite the Hotel , We will be returning to The Comfort Inn

title: Accueil chaleureux
text:
Bel accueil courtois et rapide, ont remis un chocolat à mes enfants à notre arrivée, qui les a ravi. 
Hôtel propre sans luxe, mais bien situé, à distance de marche de plusieurs attractions.
Déjeuner fourni de bonne qualité. 
Vraiment un bon rapport qualité-prix

title: Nice, with no surprises.
text: I've stayed here a few times, and I've always been satisfied. It's in a great location, near Times Square and the theater district. I'll probably stay here on one of my upcoming trips. All in all this is pretty good, and for New York the price isn't bad.

title: Datato ma per il resto ottimo
text:
Un hotel che ha la sua età con camere con moquette e carta da parati, bagno vecchiotto e non isolate. Per il resto pulizia ottima, letti comodi e lenzuola pulite e profumate. Bagno molo pulito. TV enorme. Accoglienza buona e receptionist molto gentile e disponibile: non stavo bene e ci ha dato la camera in anticipo senza problemi. Anche il resto del personale gentile.
Colazione varia e gustosa, posizione OTTIMA.

title: Viaggio a New York
text: Appena arrivati L accoglienza è stata esemplare reception disponibile a tutte le nostre richieste. Punto eccellente perché si trova al centro di times Square. Unica pecca la camera troppo piccola solo per questo non so eccellente. Consigliato comunque ottima colazione

title: Amazing quality walking distance from Times Square
text:
Got into New York pretty early, around 1'ish and they gave us an early check in and for the price and in that close of a proximity from basically everything ($86 for the night) I was blown away, awesome staff, really nice and comfortable room, TV has Charter Cable hooked up to it so there's always something to find.
If you're looking for a good value in NYC, this is your place.

title: Good
text: Room sizes are small but neatly maintained. It was just 5 mins walk from timessquare and from the window we can see new york times magazine office. Receptionist was friendly and supportive. I stayed for 2 days and will visit again.

title: Last minute choice
text: We had to vacate the hotel we were staying in as we had no running water and I was left to find another hotel quickly through Booking.com. This one wasn’t too far from the one we were in so decided to book it. After lugging our cases a couple of blocks we arrived very early and knew our room wouldn’t be ready but asked if we could leave our bags which was no problem. On our return much later we were given our key card to our room on the 2nd floor, the room had two double beds and a huge TV, was quite small so not a lot of room for your cases etc. The beds were very comfortable and the room on the whole was fresh and clean. The free breakfast the next morning in the reception area was really good with plenty of choice, perfect start to the day. This was our last day in New York and we left our luggage and did some last minute shopping etc. We returned about 3.00pm as we were being collected just after 4.00. We had bought a sandwich and had it with a cup of coffee when a member of staff asked for our tickets to get our Cases which were in a room just off the reception, he left them beside us and near a desk with a lap top and printer on it. The next thing  a MAD woman appeared from one of the rooms and gesticulated very rudely with her hand to move our cases which were in her way. She proceeded to “thump” the keyboard of the computer in a very aggressive manner, sighing constantly, she then rose and started using the computer at the reception desk, very odd behaviour indeed. She returned to her room, slamming the door In the process, she returned to said computer and sat down again with aggression, I had a slight cough which was done with my mouth closed when she turned on me saying “how rude, cover your mouth, rant, rant, rant” By now I’d had enough of her attention seeking behaviour and swiftly restored telling her I have an incurable lung condition and is not at all contagious, I was very angry at her rudeness and very bad attitude. Is this woman a resident at the hotel, and are the staff afraid of her? She was rude, aggressive and acted like a total lunatic, NOT something guests should have to deal with........

title: thank you
text: Me n my husband visited there for anniversary celebration. We stayed there for three nights. The staff was very friendly. Specially that girl supervisor shruti, when we ask front desk that TV is not working they send her to fix it n she did very quickly. she was very helpful n polite. She recommended some places nearby that we should visit. Next day when we meet her in lobby she wished us.We really enjoyed our trip.

title: Great Location
text: This hotel is no frills. Main concern were the SLOW drain in the shower and the alarming smell of air freshener in the lobby. The room itself smelled of must and was dated, however was clean and the beds were comfortable. The breakfast has several options and will be fine for most, but lookout if you have any food allergies- you’ll need to go elsewhere. Very accessible to both the theatre district and Time Square.

title: Best Comfort Inn Times Sq West
text: One of the best Comfort Inn. Best staff like-Sunita, Vibhuti, Ghandi, Nimra and Khan. I always like to come this place since the location, morning breakfast, cheerful smile and warm welcome feels like home. Nothing beats this place.This is our 5th stay and always want to come here. When ever we take cruiseship from Canada, we would love to stay in this place. I would like to recommend this hotel Excellent bedding, best breakfast, most friendly staff and safe place to stay.

title: Excellent Hotel With Lovely Staff
text: Where to start from, amazing location. Fabulous Staff- Sunita, Vibhuti and Gandi, Such a gem. I would like to share my personal ideas as they are the most wonderful person in this earth. Amazing Service, had some remote problem Gandhi just came in one call and fixed it. Sunita and Vibhuti is also a wonderful women as I was lost in Harlem, I called them they gave me the easiest way to reach at hotel. Beds were Comfortable and cozy. My husband and I enjoyed this location. Nimra- The breakfast lady, what a pretty and humble smile makes a better day.  A huge thank you to entire staff. Its a best Comfort Inn as Far I have visited.

title: NO CONCERN FOR IDENTITY THEFT!!! DO NOT LEAVE VALUABLES IN ROOM AND DO NOT CHECK LUGGAGE WITH THEM!!!!
text:
I am a long time Choice Hotels customer and thought we could expect the same safety and care for our belongings as I always could else where.   Boy were we wrong!!!

The price was cheap, so I was OK with the small but comfortable rooms.  And the breakfast is great each morning and front desk and breakfast server where friendly.  But it was appalling after we checked in to have to walk over dirty sheets and towels just thrown on the hallway floors (not in a cart) to get to our room.  Then at night, the maid cart was left right outside our room with a dirty sheet over it instead of being put out of site or in the hotel supply room in the basement.  This was the entire time we were there, not just a one time excuse.  We felt like we were staying in a supply closet.  

I wouldn't even mention that if it hadn't been for what happened on our last day.

At breakfast, my sister had her wallet with her.   We went up together to our room and she had it in her hand.  She set it on the bed to finish package.  Our flight wasn't until later that night, so we were checking out to leave our luggage with them while we finished doing some sightseeing.  We know she either accidentally left it in the room or packed it in her luggage because after checking out and giving them our luggage to secure, we went directly into the waiting Lyft car.   Shortly after that we noticed she left her wallet behind.   But when we got back to the hotel, it wasn't in her luggage, and the hotel cleaning folks claimed it wasn't in the room either.   Upon waiting to get our luggage out of the "secure' location, I witnessed first hand how not secure it was.   Right before I gave our claim tickets, I watched them bring another hotel guest back to the room where everyone's luggage was and watched as they let him go through luggage that wasn't his.   I confirmed with Choice Hotel Corporate they they should not be letting other guests back into the secure luggage area.  

So that pretty much confirmed for me that if a hotel worker didn't steal her wallet from the room or luggage, the hotel staff made it way too accessible for someone else to take it.    The only 2 places it could have been was in the room or in her luggage.  Both which should only have been accessible by hotel staff at this point.

We asked to speak to the hotel manager and review camera security tapes.  However, were told there was no manager on duty at 3pm in the afternoon.   So, I left my contact information as asked that the manager call me to discuss.  That was 5 days ago, and the manager of that hotel has yet to contact me.

The good news is that some wonderful women happened to be in Harlem and found her wallet the next day.   We were never in Harlem!!!   So, I would be curious to find out if any of the hotel staff is from Harlem.  

The other security issue is that that the printer with the so-called Business center is broken.   We were told by TSA to print off statements and info that would help verify my sister to get back on our flight home.   Apparently, the printer has been broken for some time, so the hotel staff told my sister she could log in and print from the front desk computer.  Originally, they wanted her to give them all her log in info so they could locate and print it for her.  Talk about violating Cybersecurity laws!   Fortunately, they let her log in herself and print.   Although my sister is trustworthy, it makes you wonder who else they let log in and if they keep an eye on them to make sure they're not accessing all the guest's information.   Again, according to Choice Hotel's Corp Headquarters, they should have had that business printer fixed, or at least set up to print to the front desk computer.   Not allow customers behind the front desk.

Choice Hotel's headquarters is currently investigating, and I appreciate at that.  I would definitely stay at other Choice Hotels still.   But learning that this is an independently owned/run location, who has yet to reach out to me, I do not recommend anyone stay here.   Too much risk for theft and exposure to identity theft at this hotel.

title: Make your room isn’t on the ground floor.....
text:
Good points first - location, location, location! The room was clean but slightly dated. Bed was comfy too. But... we had a room on the ground floor and it was so noisy! If it was chatting from other guests in the restaurant area, it was the staff chatting to each other then doing the cleaning, hoovering at 5am..... But these are nothing compared to massive argument that seemed to be going on outside our door, we think someone was in the hotel that shouldn’t have been and the language from them was terrible, the member of staff was just shouting go, go, go - not a good nights sleep at all!
Breakfast was ok, not great but ok.

title: Met my priorities: place, price and predictability
text:
I had planned to stay in a room via AirBnB but changed to this hotel because the host seemed to take an unnecessarily long time to respond. A day before my arrival, I got a deal directly through the Comfort Inn website ($94 for a total of $113, for NYC, I'm calling that a budget rate). I don't require luxury; this is a nice place that delivered on the basics.

If you're Broadway bound, the location is great--only a few blocks from Times Square but far enough away that it's quiet at night.

The room: very comfortable bed with a variety of hard and soft pillows, both the sleeping room and bathroom were clean and appeared to have been renovated fairly recently. TIP: Rooms numbered 1-5 (#405 in my case) face toward 44th, giving you a bit of a view, though nothing glamorous; 6-10 face the alley, I think.
