Breakfast was your standard Comfort Inn hot breakfast although the croissant seemed a notch above. I found the WiFi reliable and the staff very accommodating.

title: Excelent for a first visit to NY
text: The location is great, meters of Times Squares, Broadway theaters, bus station, and subway. The hotel is small and the rooms are narrow but clean and with all you need in order to have a nice rest after a long day. The breakfast has everything you'd want to start the day full of energy. It has waffles, eggs (scrambled and boiled), bacon, a selection of bread and pastries, donuts, yogurts, cereals, coffee, milk, juice. Cofee and te are available all day. The area is small (about 10 tables) so it can become crowded around 8 am. But I've never had to wait for a table. Space can also be used to dine in so you can bring food (there are some food stores close to the hotel). You can use the microwave, cutlery, water so this is a great dining option. You also have a fridge in the room so you can bring your cold beverages. They cared about my luggage before check-in, and after check out. I saw some bad comments from the previous guests, but then I realized most of them were from people that were accommodated in the basement. So they should have paid very little for that. Make sure your room is not in the basement if you have paid the regular tariff.

title: Courtyard Brand Needs Help
text:
I stayed here from Sept. 26 - 28. We are top tier Bonvoy so my expectations are high. I had to adjust them.  Early check-in was guaranteed, but I arrived before my husband. They were not going to allow me to check-in (with that ingratiating gee so sorry attitude), but just as I reached my husband via mobile the staff member asked if I had any ID with the same address as my husband. A room was then made available immediately. I was in 2206 which is a king room and has plenty of space for 2. However, there is one lonely USB port and it didn’t work. Nor did any of the outlets in the strip. Bring your wall chargers. I did report the problem and exactly nothing was done.  

The bathroom has a nice size shower with a hand held spray. This hotel does not have the large dispensers of product in the shower and 1 bar of soap, 1 little bottle of shampoo and 1 of conditioner were in the room. No body lotion, no shower cap, no shower gel were in the room. I did not ask housekeeping for more, I just went to Walgreens and bought my own.  Wi-fi was free, always worked and the speed was acceptable. 

The bed was comfortable and the pillows were full size.  We did not utilize housekeeping services. There was a refrigerator and the noise it emitted made me think we were in the middle of a windstorm. Turning it to the lowest setting kept water cold and eliminated the noise. Do you have a maintenance department at this hotel?

The foyer of this hotel is welcoming and there is a microwave. Is it cleaned after every use? I didn’t use it, I don’t know. This Courtyard has a large lounge/eating area and breakfast, light dinners and drinks are available. It is not open all day. The best Starbucks coffee is made at Courtyard Hotels. This hotel is steps from Whole Foods, Starbucks, Walgreens and numerous restaurants. You won’t go hungry. 

The elevators are key card controlled. Swipe your room card where indicated. I appreciate this security feature. 

The fitness center is in the basement which creeps me out as it is lightly traveled. All of the equipment is turned away from the door so you can’t see who might be coming in. There are towels, disinfectant wipes and water. All of the equipment is ancient, but seemed to be in working order. There are free weights and a couple of floor mats. How about a TV channel guide? And maybe turning the AC on?

I chose this Courtyard for location. I had citi pass tickets to the Friday AM concert on Rockefeller Plaza and even with tickets you need to be there before 5 AM. I walked the distance in just a few minutes. It is close to the theater district and an easy walk to Penn Station, Hudson Yards and the High Line as well as Flat Iron, Chelsea and Central Park. I much prefer to walk NYC when possible and it’s often faster than taking a cab or Uber.  I am not a fan of the subway. 

I think I am done with Courtyard in NYC except for the 37th and 7th location. The staff is usually friendly. The accommodations are looking weary.

title: Great Hotel For Theater Patrons
text: We booked this hotel to be close to the Lyric Theater. Let’s face it, the cost to see Harry Potter And the Cursed Child broke the bank! When we saw the lobby we weren’t sure we did the right thing. But once in our room (606) and after staying 2 nights we were absolutely pleased with our decision. Ours was a room facing to the rear and not the street. One can open the window and enjoy fresh air. The king bed was super comfortable, the room adequate in size, and everything was clean. As for location, it’s terrific! Good theater district dining within easy walking, with good value as well. We will definitely stay at this hotel again!

title: Thank goodness I turned down the sheets before climbing into bed
text: When we checked in the hotel staff was friendly and the hotel had a strong smell of some type of deoderizer or cleaner. Maybe we should have wondered why they needed such strong smelling scent to cover things up. But they were nice and the price was right so for saving some money we were fine and at least everything appeared clean upon arriving to our room. We dropped off our luggage and headed out for the evening to see NYC. When we came back to the hotel and were ready to go to sleep, I turned down the covers and found dead skin and black hair on the “clean” sheets. I immediately called down to the front desk and asked if they would please come change my sheets. The women at the desk asked if I could change them if they brought me a sheet. I told her no thinking it was all I could do to not throw up thinking about it.  After a short time a very kind older gentleman came and brought clean sheets. He very slowly and methodically turned down the top sheet and comforter and  proceeded to change the bottom sheet. When he did so the skin fell onto the mattress pad and he started putting the fitted sheet over it. I had to get a cup and scoop up the stuff and hand him the cup. I asked him to take that with him when he left. He then put the fitted sheet on and started to pull the old top sheet back over the new fitted sheet. Oh my gosh!  I asked him if he would please change the top sheet as well. Which he did. But why did I have to ask!?!  There was a language barrier and he was very kind. But I’m thinking that he thought this was ok!!  I will never ever stay at a comfort choice again. I’m still so disgusted!  I had a very hard time sleeping wondering what other shortcuts they take.

title: A good value
text: For NYC it’s a good value. Small room and the breakfast is crowded but you can’t beat the location for the price. Also, the staff was very attentive and helpful on several occasions and I’d gladly visit again.

title: Great Location and Friendly Staff!
text: Stayed here back in Dec 2018 so a little delayed in writing a review! We enjoyed our stay here and it was ideally located and Times Square is just a block away, staff were always helpful and friendly especially upon check in. Breakfast was plentiful, but I did notice other guests being greedy with their breakfast when to be honest there is lots of choice and plenty for everyone. The room was clean, comfortable and quiet for New York! Would stay here again and recommend as a good, friendly place to stay.

title: Lovely hotel, clean comfortable
text: We ended up stopping here last minute after our first hotel fell through. We booked on booking. Com and walked right there and as we walked through the doors the person on the desk already knew who we were and greeted us. Our rooms were ready straight away and  were comfortable and clean. They have buffet style breakfast in the mornings of waffles, toast, bagels, fruit, juices, eggs, bacon, sausage and lots of other stuff. It's really great and sets you up for the day. We loved staying here and would definitely do it again. Thanks

title: Great location in theater district!
text: This proved to be a great hotel for us. The location was close to the theater district, Penn Station, Times Square, etc.  we had no concerns about safety. The room was NYC size. It was clean and breakfast was great. What more do you need? The price was a good value for the city.

title: Rapporto qualità prezzo su Time Square ottimo
text:
Ho soggiornato in questo hotel 5 notti con mio marito, colazione inclusa. Per essere un hotel a 5 minuti a piedi da Times Square credo sia un ottimo compromesso. Pulito, personale molto gentile, certo...non è un hotel nuovo, andrebbe fatta qualche modifica ma tutto sommato si sta bene!
La colazione è sia salata che dolce, non è certo un buffet a 4 stelle ma degno di una buona colazione. Consigliato.

title: Hotel strategico, senza pretese con un buon rapporto qualità/prezzo
text: Il punto di forza dell'hotel è certamente la posizione, ubicato nelle vicinanze di Times Square e dei teatri di Broadway ha la fermata della metro 42 St. Port Authority vicinissima e ben servita da diverse linee che portano ovunque. La struttura è datata, lo si vede già dalla facciata, ma per il tempo che si trascorre in hotel la cosa passa in secondo piano. La stanza al quinto piano aveva due letti da una piazza e mezza comodi, ho dormito con mio figlio di 12 anni senza problemi. Bagno dotato di numerose salviette, prodotti da bagno e un phon degno di questo nome, acqua calda a volontà. Stanza pulita ogni giorno, purtroppo a terra c'è la moquette che personalmente non amo in quanto conferisce alla stanza un fastidioso odore di chiuso, problema risolvibile aprendo la finestra. Aria condizionata perfettamente funzionante. Colazione compresa di livello decisamente superiore a quanto ti aspetteresti da un hotel di questa categoria. Possibilità di preparare i waffles di vari gusti, molta scelta di dolci, dai donuts a brioches di vari tipi, muffins, pane da tostare, frutta, succhi, yogurt, cereali e mini porzioni di formaggio Philadelphia, uova e bacon, insomma per noi fin troppe cose! All'ingresso dell'hotel è presente un dispenser di acqua e limone ghiacciata molto apprezzata viste le temperature tropicali del periodo e un contenitore con i cookies. Personale gentile, abbiamo avuto un problema in camera prontamente risolto in pochi minuti. Possibilità di lasciare il bagaglio in deposito dopo aver fatto check-out. Nella hall sono presenti distributori automatici di bibite e snacks. Lati negativi: la stanza purtroppo non è adeguatamente insonorizzata e pur essendo al quinto piano i rumori persistenti provenienti dalla 44 St. soprattutto nei giorni lavorativi hanno disturbato non poco il sonno. I cuscini sarebbero tutti da rinnovare, li ho trovati scomodissimi e non all'altezza di un hotel. La stanza è piccola, problema ricorrente a NY, noi avevamo i trolley e tutto sommato ci siamo arrangiati, con le valigie grandi sarebbe stato un problema anche perchè non ci sono piani d'appoggio ma solo un piccolo armadio poco capiente. La struttura ha un solo ascensore e a volte bisogna aspettare. Il rapporto qualità/prezzo, trattandosi di Manhattan, è comunque molto buono visti i servizi offerti e l'attenzione al cliente.

title: Good location Hotel in New York
text:
Comfort Inn is located in a safe neighborhood near by many attractions, such as Times Square, a few Broadway shows and not far from empire state building, Rockefeller center, Central park and more. 
The hotel has a nice breakfast near by the entrance to the hotel. The hotel doesn't have a good cleaning service (a few of the dirt that was when we came, stayed when I left). In the room there is a small closet (maximum for 2 people) and their is a safe. Also air conditioner was really loud. All of the workers were nice and ready to help in any time.

title: HORRIBLE
text:
This was one of the worst hotels I’ve ever stayed in. First of all, they gave us a room in the basement. At first, I was fine because I didn’t want to make it a big deal but when we got there, the rooms were super small and the hallway barely had space so the rooms were very close to one another. This became a problem because late at night you can hear EVERYTHING. The walls are paper thin and I can hear all of our neighbors.
The worst thing about this hotel was the fact that the employees are so inconsiderate. When they come downstairs in the middle of the night, they don’t consider the fact that guests might be ASLEEP, and they make the most noice! I woke up at least 5 times because of how loud they were. 
The elevator is also out of date, it took 5 minutes to come. Unacceptable, such a poor establishment.

title: Down to Earth Rooms - Your Choice
text: Well, it's not the hotels fault for putting us in the basement since when I picked the room, I chose the lowest price, not noticing it is a basement (specifically written) room. I like the big windows comparing to the usual hotels in Manhattan. The only noticeable is when you are about to use the elevator coming from the main entrance, we are so used to pressing up button. We always ended up doing it and imagine all the time we made this mistake we just have to run to the stairs and o go to our basement room. The front

title: Quiet stay safe
text: Stayed here for a couple if days. Nice hotel, but 1 very slow elevator. 6 floors I think. Breakfast had a nice lady keeping up but right in the lobby. Maybe 30 some seats.2 blocks from times square between 8th and 9th ave. Streets are dirty, but safe.and pretty quiet and my room faced the street. Clean but small toom-NY normal. Just the slow elevator

title: Pay a bit more and stay somewhere else
text: The room we got was tiny. Tiles falling off wall in bathroom, mold in caulk and grout. Sheets paper thin. There was a construction site out our window which woke us every am at 0700.  Location was ok. 55$ /day parking across street

title: Good little spot.....
text: By no means is this place fancy, but it did the trick. It was centrally located, clean and was perfect for our stay before cruising out of NYC. The front desk staff were polite. The rooms were on the smallish side, but it's NYC and who spends a lot of time in their room anyways?? Would definitely use this hotel again!

title: Needs Restoration - Clean but Cramped!!
text: The Staff was wonderfully accommodating!!! The breakfast was adequate - typical Comfort Inn free breakfast, but the rooms and the breakfast space were really cramped! Space in the hotel has to be more efficiently used and reimagined!

title: Location location location
text: For the price you can’t beat this hotel. We could walk to almost all we have anted to see and do in New York City. It had a fine light breakfast to get your day started. The staff were very kind and helpful.

title: SCAM Alert!
text: This hotel robbed me of $212.23.  I booked through Hotels.com with free cancellation.  I ended up booking a different hotel, so I cancelled my booking well within the cancellation window.  The hotel still tagged me as a "no show" and charged me for the first night.  I called and spoke to them and told them what had happened.  They didn't care.  I got Hotels.com involved - they were very helpful - but, the hotel refused to admit fault.  I have all the proof and Hotels.com as verified that I cancelled in the free cancellation window, but the hotel will not refund my money.  Beware.  Everyone I have talked to at this hotel has been absolutely rude and miserable.  This hotel has defrauded me out of my money and I am now pursuing legal action.

title: Great location for a night in NYC
text: My husband and I stayed here for one night (weekday) because we were seeing a show. The location can’t be beat- steps away from the subway station which we took from Penn Station. Very close to theaters, shops, and restaurants. The room (6th floor) was a decent size for NYC; we were pleasantly surprised since the last hotel we stayed at, the room was the size of a shoebox. Our room was quiet and clean. The reception staff was friendly and there is free breakfast in the morning. My only complaint is that the elevator is VERY slow (one time we waited nearly 10 minutes). Under normal conditions I may have been able to walk up 6 flights of stairs but I am pregnant and the 6th floor was too much for me to take the stairs. Otherwise we had a great stay and will definitely stay here again!

title: Beware... Never Stay Here!!!!
text: The pictures look good but the only thing going for the hotel is the location. If it was possible to give zero stars I would have. I am a modest guy but can’t help but feel I’ve been ripped off. Spent 2 nights here and was charged £500 at Easter for a family room with 2 double beds, which on the face of it was fine, however the pictures on Booking.com are misleading!!! Hallways and rooms painted hideous mustard yellow, bed linen old and dated, carpet disgusting, double beds small and not very comfortable. The worst bits were that we went for breakfast on the first morning at 8:45 and although we were lucky to get a table there were so many people pushing past and around us that it was unpleasurable and we felt on edge/ in the way even though we were paying guests. At 5:45 on the morning of our departure I awoke to the toilet overflowing, upon calling reception I was advised that there was no one on duty to fix the problem and that the person started soon (any credible hotel should have someone on duty at all times).... we waited 2 hours and in this time called reception multiple times and a large amount of waste water came into the bathroom and onto the bedroom carpet despite at least a dozen towels being used to soak up the issue. When asked if there was somewhere else to wash/change we were routed to a toilet and sink in the basement that was nothing more than prison standard!  It really took the shine off our visit to NY and upon check out we weren’t even asked how our stay was, even though they must have known the horrendous problem we had. We felt so dissatisfied that we couldn’t even bear to eat the complementary breakfast and paid for breakfast in a near restaurant. I say avoid at all costs and I know all I’ll get back at the very best from the management is “sorry to hear you had a bad stay with us”. I won’t stay again if I was offered it for free.... infact we are visiting New York again in February 2020 and have paid the extra to stay in a far better hotel. Beware..... never stay here!!!!

title: Great location...the rest is...not.
text: Booked this online through Agoda.com.  It was easy and affordable.  Time Square location is great and a subway station is literally at the end of the block.  No more than a 5 minute walk.  That being said, if you want quiet, a good-sized room, clutter free, odor free halls...look elsewhere.  The room size reminded me why I usually stay in Long Island City on my visits.  Incredibly small.  Closet is basically an armoire w/a drawer below it.  Loud, window unit for A/C.  The bathroom while it was as clean as the rest of the room is seriously outdated.  No actual tub, just a stall that did nothing to keep water inside it and a shower seat for disabled and elderly.  There was construction going on outside my room and when I asked for a switch the guy at the desk basically said, "It's New York, it's loud."  And then told me they had no other rooms.  It was only one night and was pre-paid so what could I do?  The hall remained cluttered with linen and a housekeeping cart and had an odor.  Needless to say, I won't be returning.

title: Pas tape à l’œil mais efficace
text: Déjeuner au top, station de métro au bout de la rue, Time square à 3 minutes et accueil sympathique. Chambre propre, sanitaires clean. Seule la clim bruyante peut gêner. Le tarif est très correct même si la décoration semble un peu datée.

title: Pre Cruise
text:
My time here was enjoyable. The management team and staff here was excellent!
The room was very compact. We had double full size beds. The room was located outside the elevators, because I was there for less than eight hours, I didn’t complain nor change from room 4003. 
“Note to self: Extremely Loud, lots of traffic. Room faces street, all night traffic.

I made the best of it. Breakfast was Great. 
Because I spend most of my vacation time in the south, I like their breakfast better😁

title: Wonderful!
text: This was the second time that I stayed at the Comfort Inn, and I will always stay there when I have theatre tickets/plans. The staff is professional and helpful. The room was comfortable and clean. The breakfast is one of the best features of staying at the Comfort Inn. Great food and coffee! The breakfast area is also a good area to just hang out in late afternoon with a cup of coffee-and cookie!-while making your evening plans.

title: Location, Location, Location
text:
Rooms:  Clean and comfortable--what you'd expect from a well-managed Comfort Inn
Common Areas:  Probably in need of an upgrade and not as clean and comfy as the rooms, but tolerable
Location:  Superb!  You are right in the thick of things--Hell's Kitchen, Times Square, Bars and Restaurants everywhere!  There is a Chipotle literally a few doors down from the hotel, along with a bunch of other pizza, asian, burger, and health food restaurants.  Across the street from the hotel is the venerable Brazen Tavern--don't miss the happy hour (more like 5 hours--it's usually from 3-7 or even 8:00).  Beers are $5 and a whiskey is $6--great prices if you know Manhattan bar prices.  Food is good too.  The Brazen Tavern is a fairly authentic Irish bar with plenty of locals and generally nice, welcoming people.  Go there to watch the Yankees game!

I liked the hotel and the surround area so much that I extended my stay  here.  And at Manhattan prices, that's saying something!

title: Super hôtel très bien placé
text: Super hôtel très bien placé avec petit déjeuner extra ( très rare à New York) ... emplacement est idéal et le personnel est très agréable et disponible... je vous le conseille pour son très bon rapport qualité /prix

title: Great hotel, great location, good price
text: Great hotel in midtown of New York. The hotel is very clean and our room on the 6th floor was lovely! Amazing breakfast and the staff are very caring. It is in a good location and very good for your money. A nice simple hotel that does all the basics correct.

title: Una piacevole sorpresa
text: Mi aspettavo meno da un due stelle, e invece sono rimasta piacevolmente colpita dall’ottimo servizio. Le camere sono un po piccine, ma comode e ben attrezzate: non manca proprio nulla! La posizione è favolosa, ma questo si sapeva già. Il personale è incredibilmente affabile, tutti molto gentili e disponibili. La colazione ottima e molto varia: ogni giorno uova, bacon, salsicce, diverse varietà di pane, muffin, cornetti e brioches dolci di vario genere, pancakes, waffel da preparare al momento, davvero di tutto! Una menzione a parte x i succhi di frutta, che spesso negli alberghi sono un po annacquati: davvero deliziosi, di ottima qualità!

title: Amazing Hotel!
text: Booked two nights for a quick NYC visit. Perfect location a 2 min walk from 8th Ave / 42nd St. subway and about 8 min walk to Times Square. Very quiet property. Rooms were spotlessly clean and though small, very comfortable for 1-2 people. Nice hot breakfast. Very courteous staff. Great price, too!

title: Decent hotel with a great location to Broadway and Times Square
text: The location for the price is amazing! The room was clean and the staff was very friendly. We stayed here during out trip to see Hamilton and we were a 6 minute walk from the theater. There is a subway station close by and we felt safe there. I will definitely choose this hotel for the value and location in NYC again.

title: Deco desuete mais au top pour le reste !
text:
Soyons clair l'hôtel est moche. Mais a cote de ca tout y est top pour séjourner a NYC sans se ruiner. 
La localisation est idéale : bon nombre d'activités peut se faire à pieds ou alors les transports en commun sont à proximité. 
La literie est ultra confortable et les sanitaires sont propres et pratiques. Tout ça fait oublier les anciens trous de vis dans les murs et la clim qui mérite de rester éteinte afin d'en éviter le bruit...
Le petit dej : gargantuesque !!! Faut être malin pour trouver une table dans la petite salle. Par contre, vous pouvez vous rassasier pour la journée. Special award pour le gaufrier en self-service qui permet de se faire des waffles king size !!!
Plein de petit service bien sympa : garde valise, distributeur d'eau, "superette",... Top.

title: Great accommodations and value
text: This was a very Convenient location. The breakfast  was great! The staff wasfriendly and helpful.  I enjoyed the comfortable bed. We booked two rooms for fun of nights, and we’re very pleased! I would highly recommend this place for other guests!

title: Best place to stay in New York - just a great value
text: Friendly staff, clean and comfortable room (very efficient layout), and nice lobby with a really good hot breakfast. By far the best value in New York City. And just steps away from Times Square and near other major attractions. Easy access to metro. Really the ideal location, nice amenities for the price and an overall outstanding experience.

title: Super rapport qualité prix
text: Pour celles et ceux qui voyagent seuls ou entre amis, cet hôtel est minimaliste mais propre, confortable, et surtout très proche du centre, de Time Square et toutes les attractions new yorkaises. On est au coeur pour un tarif défiant toute concurrence dans le domaine.  Je recommande :)

title: Simple Comfort
text: We've stayed at this hotel for both of our visits to Manhatten. There's no pool, no bar, no restaurant, no bling. It's simple, clean, quiet and comfortable. The room was spotless and I wish I could have taken the bed home with me. There is an amazing breakfast buffet included that has everything you might want right down to make your own waffles. It's just far enough off Times Square to be quiet but only about a 4 to 6 minute (1½ blocks) walk away. The lack of amenities translated into a cheaper price. I recommend this hotel if you want to keep your costs down but don't want to sacrifice comfort, location and security.

title: Great price for the location
text: We just spent 3 nights at this hotel and it was perfect for us.  The hotel could probably use some updates, but it was clean, comfortable, centrally located and in an area that felt safe.  We were on the second floor, so there was some noise from the street, but it really didn't bother us.  It was VERY cold outside the days we were there, and we had to have the heat up pretty high to combat the cold coming in from the window, but once we figured this out, the room stayed at a comfortable temperature.  The staff was friendly and the breakfast was as expected for a Comfort Inn.  We were able to leave our suitcases after check out so we could do some more sightseeing before our flight in the early evening.  the price was great (under $100 for 2 of the 3 nights) and the room was a decent size compared to rooms at other hotels in the area.

title: Great Location - Safe, clean and reasonably priced.
text: The hotel was in a great location for our needs - taking in NY. We could walk almost everywhere we wanted go. The room was a good size for the location, and the four of us were very comfortable. It even included breakfast.

title: Nice location
text: This hotel suited our needs very well. Walked here from Penn Station.  Very good location near Times Square.  Clean, decent room.  Ours was in the basement level, which was a little strange. There was a sliding door to a concrete enclosed courtyard area, but was locked with thick curtain and felt safe. Large TV. Good wireless internet. Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Breakfast was good, included hot items such as eggs, waffle maker.  Plenty of cold items as well.

title: CLEAN ROOMS, FRIENDLY STAFF, AND GREAT LOCATION
text: I just stayed here for a week.  The location was perfect (subway station located at the end of the block) and a 5 minute walk to Times Square.  The beds were comfy.  My friend reported problems getting to sleep because of sirens.  They only bothered me one night (but I had drank alcohol later than I should have, which interfered with my sleep). I would still suggest a pair of ear plugs just in case.  Breakfast is hearty with plenty of items to choose from (sausage or bacon depending on the day, eggs, waffles, pastries, juices, coffee).  The price was also excellent for the location.  I will definitely stay here again the next time I'm in New York!

title: Extremely hostile morning shift staff, threats to a paying customer
text:
I am a frequent guest in Choice hotels (Comfort Inn is a part of the group), and this is the first time I face an extremely unpleasant situation. The morning shift guy (Ghandi) is rude and abusive towards the customers. Any question is confronted with utter animosity, a customer is not allowed to finish the sentence, interrupted in a very rude way, and when you still try to get your message acrros, as the staff clearly does not understand what you are saying, comes the threat to call the police on a paying customer. 

Sent an email to the General Manager indicating my concerns, as clearly no answers were provided by their stuff. No reply what so ever, just plain ignore.

title: Best Deal in Town
text:
For the economy minded traveler, this hotel is perfect.  It is located just a few minutes walk from all the theaters, but far enough from Times Sq to be a little quieter.  The rooms are very small, but fairly clean with pleasant decor.  The room rate includes a breakfast bar which is quite high quality.  You can make waffles, there are scrambled eggs and sausages or bacon, and then the usual bread, yogurt, cereal, hard boiled eggs, and fresh fruit are also on offer.  There are surprisingly good croissants and danishes which appear to be from a bakery.  Although the guest rooms only have a fridge, there is a microwave in the breakfast area that you can use at any time ( plus paper plates and plastic cutlery).

Cheap (for NYC) parking directly across from the hotel.  Remember to have the hotel validate your ticket.

Of course the hotel is not perfect and the following are some of the downsides.  The public areas - especially the elevators - are pretty dirty.  The front desk staff are a bit dithery- I requested a courtyard room and got a street room.  I was too tired to ask for a different room, but note that there is NO soundproofing and the street noise can be loud.  Also, the desk clerk will pretty much ignore you if you try to check in early, but there is a nice fellow who will store your bags.

The rooms are extremely hot and the heating system cycles on and off (loudly) constantly - earplugs are useful.  We turned the heat down to 60F (the lowest it would go), but the room was still quite warm.  The bed was comfortable with clean linen and an ample supply of pillows.  The bathroom fixtures were also clean.  However walls and doors were dirty and the edges of the carpet needed a good vacuum (it looks like they just use upright vacuums).  You might want to wipe down your room when you arrive.

Despite these minor problems, I highly recommend this hotel, especially if you can get a room for under $100 per night.  Excellent value!  Great location!

title: recommended this hotel
text: very clean, comfortable, good location  and very nice personal. Breakfast was very good. Highly recomend this place for New York visitors.  Subway is close, all stores and tourist places is in walking distance.

title: Perfect location!
text: First, this is not the Hilton! But the room was good for 2 adults and like someone said, expect cruise ship size! But it was clean, good bed, restaurants across the street. When we returned after each exhausting day, we were greeted by family members who were always helpful. They have a place to print your boarding passes. Coffee & hot chocolate upon arrival from a days adventures. We stayed for 5 nights and would stay again without hesitation! It’s in a safe neighborhood.

title: Small, functional hotel ideally situated
text: Excellent value! Comfortable bed, nice shower, more than adequate breakfast (even for a vegan), super convenient location and friendly, helpful staff. Of course, luxurious it is not! No gym. Definitely a find for the budget-minded!

title: Nouveau nom LORD MORIS
text:
Hôtel de bonne facture mais très bruyant la nuit à cause du chauffage qui se déclenche par intermittence 
Manque de placard dans la chambre Personnel aimable  A l'entrée café, petits gâteaux, eau fraîche

title: perfect hotel and location
text: Comfort Inn Times Square West was conveniently located. It was safe, subway on corner. Near times square and rockefeller center and tourist spots. Delicious hot, free breakfast buffet. NO bugs or critters. The room was clean and cozy. The staff was so kind, kudos to Ganndi!! Will be back!!

title: Dirty and Poorly Maintained
text: I was expecting small, tired and bare bones based on the other reviews, but I also expect even the most affordable hotels to be clean.  I walked into the lobby to an overpowering blast of air freshener.  Always a good sign.  The check in procedure was archaic, taking both a swipe and a carbon impression of my credit card, but ok.  My room was unfortunately one of the few that are right off the lobby.  Inside, one can hear every conversation, every ding of the elevator and unreasonably loud pumped in lobby music.  I wasn't bothered by the small size or dinged up furniture.  I was bothered by the pilled sheets, dirty smelling pillows and hair all over the bathroom.  The toilet seat was so gross I grabbed a washcloth and scrubbed it down before using.  Visibly dirty, with hair and some kind of sticky paste on it.  The in room heater must be broken, because it decided to always be on regardless of how low the temp was set.  I finally got up at 3am and turned it off completely.  The TV was in fact large and flat panel, but had no input... No cable or even an antenna.  The only reason I'm giving it 2 stars is because the breakfast was actually decent and the woman hosting it was nice.  Won't be back.

title: Keep Expectations Modest
text: Recently completed a weekend stay and the location is perfect if the theaters, times square etc are your primary reason to visit.  The hotel itself is OK.  We stayed in a room which advertised a courtyard view, which was true but the room was actually in the basement. The room itself was fine, good size, clean and comfortable. The basement location meant the rooms on that level are amongst the "guts" of the hotel and staff is none too quiet when it comes to retrieving supplies etc. regardless of time of day/night. The staff was pleasant and the breakfast was surprisingly good. There was what appeared to be a homeless woman camped out in the lobby upon our arrival which was odd. All in all, if you are looking primarily for a good location and you have realistic expectations, you won't be disappointed.

title: Sad
text: Worst Motel I Have Ever Been TO Rooms Are Trash ! Took Extra Money Of My Card I Didn’t Even STAY There I Had MY Empy Discount That HE Was MAD About Went IN Room is Touching Out Belongings Rude From JUMPpppp

title: Fantastic location and service, Would stay here again!
text:
We stayed here three nights for a sightseeing trip to NY.  The location is SO convenient, especially if you plan on using the subway system as we did.  So many lines converge at the Port Authority Times Square station and you can easily get to LaGuardia via subway and connector bus, or many other points.   The station is literally steps from the hotel.  Many restaurants and theaters nearby but this portion of 44th street is quiet and away from the hustle bustle of Times Square. 

Service was excellent and always cheerful and helpful.  Our room was a standard Queen, and although quite small it suited our needs.  If you want a larger room book the double room, we peeked into one and it was definitely larger.  Room and bathroom were clean and quiet.  The included breakfast and 24 hour coffee/tea service were a real plus.  The selection was good and the croissants and pastry were a step above most hotel free continental breakfasts.  

In the end I would say that we definitely would stay here again should our travels bring us to midtown NY!

title: Anniversary
text:
We have stayed at other hotels near Times Square and not had a better time than at this Comfort Inn. All the staff was outstanding and always helpful. A really, really great breakfast. The rooms where very nice and clean. The location is outstanding. Just close enough to walk to Times square and Rockefeller center. 
But not in all the noise. We will return.

title: Excellent
text:
It’s a great hotel for a comfortable stay , everything’s close by , Times Square is just a 5 min walk and could be seen from our 7th floor room . Staff is quite friendly and the amenities they provide are superb .
They have 24/7 tea, coffee ,hot chocolate n water in the lobby and free to use microwave and disposable plates, bowls, Forks, knives, spoons , tissue papers etc . They have free deal coupons kept in the lobby and an atm machine aswell .
The breakfast selection was good with boiled eggs , scrambled eggs/bacon/sausages, milk , different types of cereal, breads , yogurt , juices ,waffle machine , different types of tea ,coffee , hot chocolate along with fruits .
Rooms were a bit small and the walls were super thin, our neighbours complained of us being loud whereas we were just talking in our normal tone and second time in whispers .... lol
Overall a good hotel near the Times Square with good amenities .
Would stay there again

title: TOTALMENTE RECOMENDABLE
text:
Acabamos de llegar de nuestra estancia en NYC, y elegimos este hotel después de debatir y leer otros muchos otros. La elección fue la correcta, y sin duda, volvería a elegirlo.
Apenas 6 minutos de Times Square, 2 minutos a la boca del metro que te dirige directamente al aeropuerto JFK (línea E) y cerca de todo el centro de la ciudad (si es que se puede decir que NY tenga centro).
Nuestra habitación fue la 708 (pedirla si es posible). Vistas increíbles. 
Desayuno más que aceptable, con todo lo necesario para empezar el día sin tener que buscarte la vida nada más poner el pie en la calle. fruta, baggles, bolleria, huevos, yogur, café, té ...
Sin duda volvería

title: Bon rapport qualité prix
text: Hôtel 2 étoiles bien situé. Sanitaires très propres. Chambre propre et bonne literie. Petit dej plus que correct. Celui qui veut beaucoup manger à le choix. Accueil sympathique. Possinilite de laisser ses bagages le denier jour pour visiter la journée. Pour un 2 étoiles dans le quartier des théâtre c'est un bon plan

title: Small hotel with big heart at a peaceful place in Times Square
text:
What a pleasant surprise! I was a big apprehensive due to busy Times Square around. But the hotel, a safely placed one from the hustle bustle of Times Square, is an old-fashioned but well run facility near to everything you name.
The best thing is the Gujarati Indian administration which run the place. They know business and all staff are polite, always smiling and ready to help. 
Check in was fast and room was spacious, although slightly old. Issues were there for sound proofing and door lock. Otherwise all standard facilities were available. Toilet was small but clean and had a hair dryer too. Adequate towels and toiletries were provided.
Beds and pillows were very soft, comfy and clean. We had two double beds in our room. 
Breakfast was full and hot. It had scrambled eggs, sausages, bacon and waffles apart from juices, milk, fruits and corn flakes, yogurt. Complimentary facilities such as round-the-clock tea, coffee, hot chocolate and cookies and chocolates were  huge motivators. They also had all information needed to travel in and around NYC.
The best help came when we were looking for an Indian restaurant and they had telephonic connection with them and arranged for meals at our room at nominal cost!!
The lady and all staff were helpful. I now know which hotel to stay in when I revisit New York. I strongly recommend it to my friends. Not a hi-fi hotel with ultramodern facilities but a budget hotel with lot of heart in a peaceful locality in the heart of Times Square.

title: Great location!
text: We stayed her for a girls New York City trip. It is a great location just a few blocks to times square. They also have a good breakfast selection. The rooms are smaller than other locations but I think large fir NYC standards.

title: Nothing fancy, but definitely recommended and good value
text: We stayed at this hotel on 44th in Manhattan for several days in October.  The staff were unfailingly polite and helpful.  Things are cozy here, especially at breakfast time, when people often share tables, which is a fun social activity anyway.   Breakfast features scrambled eggs or waffles.  TV and reception, and wifi are fine.  The elevator is slow, so as we were on the second floor, we just took the stairs up and down.  For some reason, the borough of Manhattan has not set aside a loading zone in front of the hotel, but that is not a problem as taxi/uber/Lyft just stops in the lane right in front to load.  Usually, there are free USA Today newspapers available near the front desk.

title: Razoável
text: A acomodação é boa, o café da manhã é bom, mas ao passar pelos andares, assusta a desorganização, com bags de roupas espalhados para todos os cantos. Apesar disso, o pessoal de atendimento é cordial e a localização é excelente.

title: Nothing fancy, nothing great
text: A good location and a relative value to other hotels in the area, but nothing else recommends it. It was passably clean. The room we were in was quite small, as was the bath. The view was nothing spectacular. And the cleaning cart greeted us every time we stepped out of our room; it was stowed in the hallway outside our room.

title: Great location and spacious room
text: Very affordable price for a good location. Close to Times Square and major bus terminals. Surprisingly clean and spacious room. Free breakfast is a great deal. Staff were friendly and helpful. Would like to come back next time in NYC.

title: Perfect for our needs
text:
My love and I were visiting NYC 22-26 sept and we had done extensive research into where to stay ...being fully aware it wasn’t 4/5 star we were slightly apprehensive however we decided to take a chance on this little gem of a place and we were not disappointed in the slightest. Check in was seconds and hassle free ..our room 606 had a great view of 45th street and surrounding skyline and was quiet throughout our stay .great facilities -fridge coffee maker iron/board and a massive tv in the wall .. bathroom was clean and corner style shower was powerful and as warm as you wanted it ..the bed was comfy and the maids came in everyday and attended very well so I tipped them $2 as we were very satisfied with their work.the room wasn’t massive by any means but ample for two and served our needs well as we were hardly in it,but when very comfortable when we were.the wardrobe had 6 coat hangers in as well which was a bonus .
Added bonus of the free buffet breakfast which saved us so much time and money..great choice of food and drinks and tended well by the young girl who monitored what was required very attentively.the breakfast gave us a great
Platform for our days out in this fabulous city with us often not eating again till mid/late afternoon.the breakfast room does get very busy but if your smart around what time you go down it’s hassle free 
The location of this place is superb and right on everything but far enough away to not have all the lights/noise which is plentiful around the avenues.theres a subway entrance a minute walk from the front door,bars ,places to eat shops,theatres ...the lot! 
Only issue we had was when the safe in the room didn’t work when we got there .i called reception and within ten mins we had a replacement safe in our room.this type of service typifies what this hotel is all about ..the service was faultless throughout our stay from all staff we encountered..
We will definitely be returning to NYC after such a fantastic holiday and same goes for this hotel ,will book here again without doubt next time .

title: Great location
text: a little bit pricey for the non upgrade room, with no view at all, breakfast included but same exactly food for my 6 days stay, Lobby always clean, but the clean product use it the smell way to strong, front desk people pretty friendly but hard to understand

title: Not Great, But Not Awful Either.
text:
The location of this hotel is very good. Just a 10 minute walk east and you’re in the heart of Times Square. 

The lobby serves as the breakfast area. It is small and can be cramped, especially at the busy times of the morning. 

The rooms aren’t too shabby. I had a huge bed and great TV. The fridge and large AC unit was greatly appreciated, along with the iron and ironing board. As for the bathroom it’s alright and overall the facilities are very functional. 

At the end of the day, I only used the room to sleep in after a long day touring around the city. I didn’t spend any great deal of time there. After all, why would you? You’re in the heart of NYC!

title: Great location, quiet, good bed and shower
text:
Perfect place to stay if you are going to broadway or Times Square.  The room was quiet, bed comfortable, room decent size for NYC, bathroom was a little tight but shower was nice. We even had a decent view of the Manhattan skyline which was a complete surprise.

Five stars for staff: The best part of our stay was the staff from Derik the desk clerk, to the young girl managing breakfast with a smile no matter what fell on the floor, to the housekeepers Nina and Jasmine.  All did their jobs with a smile, were pleasant, welcoming and accommodating.  

I usually like to stay at 5 star places but this trip was last minute - I would stay here again in NYC.  The staff made a huge difference.  Bravo to the staff and managment team.

title: Comfort Inn, Times Square
text:
Location is very good as just adjacent to the Times Square . Standard clean room though small , wifi works with standard breakfast . 

Uncouth front office Manager, very non transparent dealing. Took 150$ as security for penalty if found smoking in the room without actually explaining & under the guise of general deposit . Never  part with credit card details as they use your card without your authorisation , they will keep credit card tap open plus the cash deposit . Extreamly uncomfortable experience to deal with them . 

Barring location, there is nothing really inspiring to come back to this property . I will NOT recommend this property to anyone, I wonder how these guys get approval from Comfort Inn !!! Don’t stay in this motel .

title: Great location and Value
text:
My husband and I are on our 4rth day of a 5 day stay. The staff are very warm and welcoming and always ready to help with directions. 
Cleaning staff do an exceptional job and are open and approachable for directions as well.
Breakfast is included in the cost of your stay and includes eggs, bacon or sausages, bread, pastries, fresh fruit, cereal, yogurt, and waffles that you make yourself.

My only complaint would be that breakfast ends at 9:30 on weekdays and after a late night in NYC you need at least an extra 30 - 60 minutes.

The rooms are the perfect size and have a fridge and coffee maker.  The beds are SUPER comfy.
We stayed on the 6th floor and did not have any noise issues at all.

The location is perfect - a few minutes from Timed Square and the subway.

We visit NYC often and this will definetely be our go-to place. The llocation, friendly and helpful staff, breakfast, and price make it a gem in Manhattan.

The only reason why I did not give it an additional star is because of the early closing time of breakfast on a weekday.

I have not been through the check-out process yet but I cannot imagine that it would be different from the professional standard already set.

title: Great Location
text: This hotel is a good value,  It has free breakfast which helps save you money in NYC. The location is close to Times Square. It is the place to stay for Threater District. Stay on the top floor it is quiet from the loud new york street noise.

title: Great Location Nice Room Good Price!
text: This is a nice hotel convenient to all things Times Square and Theater.  Staff was very friendly.  Room was clean and more spacious than other NYC hotels I have stayed in.  Rooms were nicely air-conditioned (interestingly, hallways were not and in August were pretty hot).   Breakfast included was typical budget hotel fare but not bad.

title: Okay hotel
text:
For the price, it was a decent hotel. First impression wasn't great.  The lobby and dining area floors were dirty, but by the end of the day, they were mopped. There were flies flying around in the lobby area each day that we stayed there.  The elevator is slow and if it's full, you will have to wait awhile until it comes back for you. 

From desk employees were attentive, helpful, and stored our bags before and after our stay with no problems. 

The room was clean, beds were clean and comfortable. The wallpaper was peeling off near the window. The bathroom needed some updating. 
The location was great.

title: The worst hotel on earth
text: I stay in hotels more than im home. This is the worst hotel i have ever seen in my life... by a lot. To start the staff is incredibly rude. The hotel is run down, i felt unsafe, most of the amenities didnt work... you know like the hot water, tv, and most of the lights in the room. The noise level in the middle of the night was outrageous and as it turns out its the employees making the noise. The filth was so unreal i dont even have words. I dropped something and had to get on hands and knees to get off floor and what i saw under the bed was vomit inducing. Thes place is run by Indian family and they obviously cut every corner possible. Not sure how they even get passed on any inspections. Im just praying indont have bed bugs

title: Eh...
text:
Checked in and the guy was very rude.  I think he was the manager too.

It looks as though the hotel is operated by 2 Indian families.

They were having tea in the lobby when we arrived.

There were no cookies in the container at all.  And the room was tiny.  Now I get its time square so I will let the size of the room slide.

There was rust growing on the bottom of the bathroom light fixture.  The wallpaper is not cut correctly and the AC unit is 8 feet high in the air.

The tile on the bathroom walls were not grouted correctly and they attempted to caulk over most of it. But it wasn’t even the matching color so it was very noticeable.

No microwave and the fridge was a 1.8 cubic ft that say on the floor.  I’ve got enough back problems so I couldn’t even get down there.

Overall, for the price paid the location was great,  the service not so much.

The best employee this place has to offer is the maintenance man who told us more about the hotel than the front desk employee and the maintenance guy didn’t even speak English.

P.s.  I called ahead and asked if they had parking.  They said yes.  Their idea of parking is across the street in a parking deck where you pay $32 for a day.

title: Horrible experince
text:
The comfort inn on the 39th street was a horrible  experience....would never recommend to anyone..
Didnt get our room till 11 pm ......
We were promised 2 rooms in the same floor but once we got the second close to midnight they said the one on the same floor has a broken lock...
Once we checked in by midnight and finally slept somebody from the staff opened our room at 2a.m. .. On asking for an explanation he said was just checking if someone has checked in.
Breakfast was a big lie as nothing was available even at 8.30 am on all 3 mornings...
In short it was a total disaster.

title: Convenient Hotel
text: We found this hotel for a last minute travel week to the city.  It was convenient for walking to all events in the Theatre District and Times Square.  This is an older hotel, but the room was clean and the staff were friendly.  It provides a continental breakfast, which was a great alternative to dining out for breakfast every day.

title: ÓTIMO CUSTO BENEFÍCIO
text: O hotel tem ótimo custo benefício. Excelente localização, próximo a Times e tb do metrô. Café da manhã básico, mas muitos locais não tem, então é uma vantagem. Quartos limpos e confortáveis. Fiz a maioria dos passeis a pé.

title: WOW
text: I stayed at this hotel for one night and it was utterly delightful, apart from the bullet hole in my friends window the hotel was, nice. But as I was in a rush to the airport I had left behind my apple watch(with no power) and all my chargers. I have since tried to contact them but had no joy and would really like my £500 worth of possessions back. I was staying with my school Saint Francis Xavier’s Liverpool if you need it for information.

title: Good deal!
text: Right off Times Square.  Convenient to subway, good restaurants.  Rooms tiny but clean with private bathroom. If driving, park at Edison Parkfast across the street.  With hotel stamp $30 a night.  No luggage drop-off so park first then walk to hotel.  Lobby a little sketchy but rooms fine. No concierge or amenities, very basic. Don't book a first floor room--these are joined to the lobby or in the basement (we were on seven). Had noisy neighbors on last night but quiet otherwise. Decent breakfast. Definitely recommend for budget-minded traveler to stay in Manhattan. Can't beat the price for the location.

title: Small Clean Hotel with Excellent Customer Service
text: Honestly, this hotel has it all: the beds are comfortable, the rooms are sparkling clean, and the breakfast in the lobby is tasty and nicely presented. I was particularly impressed by the staff, who really seemed to care about the hotel and about their guests. Any requests were immediately dealt with. All in all, a super New York hotel experience at a very down to earth price.

title: ottima scelta
text:
abbiamo scelto quasi per caso questo albergo con solo 2 stelle. sono stato per 6 giorni in coppia con mia moglie, il risultato
è stata una ottima idea.
posizione ideale: 200 mt da times square, 10' a piedi da Empire, le fermate di tutte le linee della Subway distanti 5' a piedi, pulizia eccellente, camera spaziosa e bagno perfetto, rumori notturni inesistenti, personale alla reception gentile e disponibile, prezzo ottimo anche perché colazione a buffet con tanta scelta compresa nel.prezzo. un saluto e un grazie particolare ad Anil per la sua cortesia e professionalità

title: Good value and location
text: Good location relative to Port Authority and Broadway area. This hotel is nothing special but was clean and has free breakfast and internet. Breakfast was standard fair for this kind of hotel. Room was small, like a lot of NYC hotels. Lobby is pretty utilitarian but I'm not the type that is willing to pay extra for a nice lobby, so it worked for me.

title: Great hotel, so central and yet not noisy - a New York gem.
text: Lovely hotel with big rooms (by NY standards) and large, comfortable beds. Really handy for Times Square and theatres, metro, Port Authority bus station and Hell's Kitchen. The breakfast was good, too, with lots of choice of hot and cold foods. For such a centrally placed hotel it was quite quiet too.

title: Horrível horrível horrível
text:
Este hotel e um horror em praticamente tudo ... começa desde da limpeza que é péssima , pois logo quando vc entra na recepção vc ja percebe a falta de cuidado , o tapete de entrada sujo demais , chão tbm , Hall do apto encardido e outras coisas mais ....Fomos surpreendidos negativamente com a quantidade de lixos espalhadas no corredor do nosso apto , pois logo quando pegamos a chave para ala B no subsolo ( péssimo péssimo e péssimo de localização de apto ) , e até tentamos mudar , mas nos informaram que não tinha pois quando encontramos na porta do nosso quarto  roupas de camas e toalhas sujas espalhadas pelo no chão , carrinho de camareira , baldes ( tem fotos no meu Stories  ) , para ter uma ideia tivemos que arrastar tudo p poder entrar, então imagina a imagem que nos deixou mas isto foi o menos pior dos dois dias de horror que tivemos ! Imagina o barulho de batidas de portas pelos funcionários inclusive na madrugada  , carrinhos de camareira , vozes altas e som de rádio de comunicação .. casal brigando no hall, trash! Por ser um hotel padrão econômico mas de rede achávamos que o basico teria , mas esquece pois falta muito treinamento p os funcionários de cordialidade e de limpeza !!! Uma situação foi que meu marido pegou um copo descartável na recepção p tomar água e quando foi abaixar p colocar no lixo , caiu no chão e neste exato momento estava passando um funcionário que pegou e chutou o copo p baixo da mesa justamente p não ter que abaixar kkkkk situação de horror em
Hotelaria . Surreal!!!! A localização é boa mas estas questões superam negativamente e olha que pagamos uma diária de 1200,00 pois fomos de última hora. Nunca mais está rede.

title: Great deal for NYC!
text: This hotel is a comfortable little gem, very convenient to restaurants and theatres. I'm not sure why I never found this on my previous trips. The room was large by NYC standards and the bathroom positively sumptuous, again by NYC standards. The staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast being included was a big help in an expensive city.

title: Great hotel
text: We stayed here for a week! Perfect location - in the heart of the theatre district and just blocks from the main Times Square area. My son loved the cookies that were always available in the lobby. The hotel was well kept and the staff was super friendly. The rooms were nice and larger than I expected, given its NYC. If I had any complaint it’s that the rooms are so close together you hear doors slamming (or maybe that was just our rude neighbors???). We were at the back of the building so we did not hear traffic and slept well. I’d totally go back!

title: Awful place, terrible smell, given a handicap room, did not stay, rude staff
text: Where do I begin? This place is disgusting. Signs held on by masking tape, awful smell. Rude staff gave us a handicap room after we reserved a regular room online. He refused to give us a regular room. Handicap rooms have terrible showers with a handheld sprayer and a wooden stool screwed in that won't move. Impossible to shower there. We were tired, it was 11:00 at night. He did not give us the room we reserved, despite there being plenty of other rooms. Three people checked in after us and were given regular rooms. We left and had to look around NYC in the middle of the night for something else. Awful experience. AVOID THIS PLACE!

title: Great little hotel in an ideal location with wonderful staff
text: First of all, my thanks to the front desk staff.  They changed a room for me held luggage, let me take things in and out during the day and they were always cheerful and helpful.  The room was a nice size for NY.  The window actually looked out at the road instead of a brick wall.  Even though we were close to the elevator we didn't hear a thing.  Breakfast was great - bacon and eggs, along with waffles and the usual continental selections.  The location is perfect, especially if you are going to see a show.  This will continue to be our place to stay in NY.

title: Muy buena ubicación!
text: Hotel muy céntrico, a avenida y media de pleno Times Square. Me quedé junto a mi familia y reservamos dos habitaciones: la primera para tres personas, contaba con dos camas queen muy cómodas, nevera, escritorio, televisión por cable, un armario donde sí cabía al menos una maleta, caja de seguridad y el baño lo suficientemente espacioso. La habitación tenía un tamaño correcto. La otra, para dos personas era una con cama extragrande, y una habitación por lo demás extra grande, y con todo lo que contaba la habitación anterior además de un baño con tina. El hotel tenía wifi en todas las habitaciones y buena conexión. Desayuno americano incluido, parte del personal hablaba español, hielo, café y microondas y pc siempre disponible en la primera planta y uno puede dejar las maletas antes del check-in o después del check-out guardadas en una habitación sin problema. Lo recomiendo totalmente!

title: Well kept, good location and pleasant staff
text: For the money, this is a pretty unbeatable site. Yes, the rooms are small with doors and corners measured to the last millimeter to maximize space but for a night's stay it's perfectly doable. The breakfast was surprisingly varied and pretty good. My only complaint is the room did not have a microwave but it had a big screen TV and was fairly quiet considering it's in midtown. Staff was very attention.

title: Due giorni a New York
text: Ho soggiornato per una notte in questo hotel. La sua posizione è eccellente, a pochi passi dalla stazione dei pullman, dalla stazione dei treni e da Times Square. Se non si ha grandi pretese lo consiglio perchè il rapporto qualità prezzo è accettabile. La camera era dotata di tutti i confort: bagno privato, aria condizionata, tv, set di cortesia, set di asciugamani, scrivania. La colazione a mio parere un po deficitaria ma comunque non ci si muore di fame. Unica cosa negativa non sono riuscito a far funzionare il wi fi della struttura sul mio cellulare nè vi è riuscito l'addetto alla reception.

title: Location, Location, Location
text: This hotel is right in the Theater District.  It is just a short walk to the Metro stop.  I picked it so we could easily get around to Times Square and the theaters, restaurants.  That was perfect.  As for the hotel, itself, it is old.  So, the rooms are really small.  I was in 309.  It had a queen bed and not much room other than the bed.  The bathroom was tiny.  The shower was a triangular shaped corner unit where you couldn't possible shave your legs.  Tiny!  The staff at the hotel could not have been nicer!  The property is clean.  The breakfast was your usual fare with scrambled eggs, sausage, muffins, waffle maker etc.  Everything was well stocked and clean.  The price was a great value.  Bedding was comfortable.

title: Do not stay at this hotel!
text: They lost my reservation, then charged me $250 no-show fee. Now the management is refusing to refund the fee. Corporate headquarters won't even help me. Save yourself the time, money and heartache and book somewhere else.

title: Great Staff, Prime Location, Low Cost
text: I stayed here during a JFK layover and was very impressed with how close it was to everything. Times Square, Subway, restaurants. The Manager Gandy was SOOOO HELPFUL AND NICE! He really made our stay efficient. He recommended a great ride share company to take us back to the Airport in the morning that was way cheaper than Yellow Cab. The room was semi small, but this is NY. It was clean and breakfast was plentiful. The Wi-Fi doesn't connect at all, but we weren't in the room or awake long enough to mind. I would stay here again.

title: Tres bien situé - correct
text:
Hôtel très correct, très bien situé à Times Square, à deux pas de toutes les attractions, spectacles de Broadway...
Chambres confortables et propres.
Petits-déjeuners continental assez simple. Wifi OK.
Hôtel idéal pour quelques nuits.

title: Good location
text: We stayed here for 3 nights over Easter weekend. The location is brilliant as you are  only a couple of minutes away from Times Square and other attractions. The hotel itself is okay, in the UK it’s the kind of budget hotel you would expect to pay around £50 a night for, obviously being in Manhattan the price is a lot more expensive but that’s because of the area rather than the quality of the hotel. The room was fine, it was a good size and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom was absolutely tiny, the door touched the toilet when you tried to close it and you had to give it a shove to get it past it! The breakfast they provide is good with a nice selection of food. The seating area is small but we never had a problem getting a seat. I would happily stay here again next time I’m in New York.

title: Lobby rooms????
text:
I stayed at this hotel last night while I visited a friend who was on vacation from overseas. The hotel is very well-located and my room was very small but very clean, as was the bathroom. The shower was great, lots of hot water and good water pressure and the water that came out of the sink was totally drinkable, no weird taste or smell. The front desk staff were nice and welcoming.

However, I was put in Room 109 which is essentially in the lobby. The noise at night from other guests talking, moving chairs around, music, was horrific. I think the noise finally died down around 2AM but by 6AM, it was at full force again. There is no way that these rooms (also 108 and 110) should be for guests. It was also creepy knowing that a large group of people were virtually 2 feet from your door while you were dressing or trying to sleep.

The included breakfast looked and smelled good but unfortunately, there was an enormous school group staying at the hotel and they took over the entire dining area and the line at the buffet was a mile long, I couldn't get anywhere near it. Not the hotel's fault, just my bad luck.

I would stay here again, but ONLY if I was guaranteed NOT to get any of the lobby rooms.

title: Great location
text: Great location near Times Square. I usually stay there in Sept but this time their prices have gone up to the point that I am looking elsewhere. The breakfast is good but when I go to NY, I would rather eat at a local place than Hotel food.

title: Great visit
text: Staff was very friendly, great location. Excellent budget hotel for manhattan. Clean rooms. Walking distance to Broadway Shows. We had a great stay and didn’t have to break the bank to be close to all the attractions. I would stay here again.

title: Perfect Location
text: This hotel really fits the bill for a short stay in the city. It is in the theater district, two blocks from Times Square, a block from a subway entrance, and VERY affordable. The staff was efficient and polite, and the rooms were clean. Bonus - Breakfast is included in the price!  The rooms are on the small side (think European hotel room), but that is a minor detail.

title: Extremely accessible to Times Square
text: While the rooms are small, the value for the location is excellent. Rooms are clean, but walls are thin. Great complimentary breakfast in the morning. Walking from this hotel is recommended. Train is a block away. Taxi, Uber, or Lyft is a challenge because it's a one-way headed toward 8th Ave. which is always crowded.

title: Hot, small and dirty rooms.
text: We stayed here, thankfully only for one night, with a large group on a New York stopover in February. On arrival the very small foyer was extremely hot. The bedrooms were small and dirty e.g. The toilet in our bathroom hadn't been cleaned properly and the room next door to us had white powder/ grains on the desk. The only positives were that the hotel was centrally located in Times Square and that the buffet breakfast was quite good.

title: Comfort inn??more like the uncomfort inn
text: This hotel is absolutely dreadful and vile I wouldn’t take my worst enemy here unless I wanted to see then through great pain. The room is the size of a cardboard box and the curtains are there for decoration, the walls are an ugly yellow it looks like something a blind man would do. The tv in the room is decent but I haven’t seen a Remote for it so if it works I shall never know, the beds are meant to be double but I can hardly fit my little toe in it and the pillow is smaller than my head. The mattress makes me feel like I’m sleeping on rocks and has caused me great back pain, the bed is also covered in boogies and the sheets haven’t been washed also bugs are crawling around left, right and centre. The bathroom is also dreadful, I can hardly fit inside of it and the toilet paper is that thin I can see through it. I had extreme discomfort sleeping in this tetorous building!! The fridge is in a dreadful place and gets in the way of accessing parts of this awful room. The view is also dreadful I tried cutting it out but like I said earlier the curtains do not shut. In addition to this the heating doesn’t work and many drafts were coming into this small but cold room. Around this “hotel” there was a strong smell of cannabis, this is appalling. The dining room is the same as the lobby which is very small and unhygienic. I shall never be staying in this obserd mess again do not stay unless you want terror in your sleep, most defiantly do not recommend!!

title: Great rest in the busy city
text: This hotel offers a great place to rest, near the hustle of Times Square.   Its with a block of subway access and two blocks from the main Times Square area.  The rooms are comfortable (small -which is the norm for nyc hotels) and quiet.

title: Hotel clean and in a great location
text:
I stayed at the Comfort Inn west this past weekend with a small group. The hotel has a great location and is clean. The breakfast is good, staff is friendly, rooms are small. 

I had a small group with 10 rooms that were prepaid. I called and emailed the hotel 3 times to make sure that everything was all set, and they had the rooming list. On check in they asked if I needed the 10 rooms as they still had two rooms with no names. I said yes and they told me I needed to speak to the manager as they did not know how many rooms were paid. I had to pull up the emails to show we had paid for 10 rooms and had sent names for 10 rooms. There is a very friendly lady working at the front desk that means well, but she does not speak understandable American English. When I asked a question, by phone or in person, I have no idea if she understood my question, as I could not understand the answer. Fortunately there was always someone else that could answer my questions.

title: Great location, great stay
text: I came here a day and a half after I started my trip to NYC and I wish I'd just stayed here the whole time. It was a fantastic price, I had paid more for a closet sized room the night before. The staff was pleasant too, not concerned with staring you down every time you went outside (my bf smokes cigarettes and doesn't like to go out alone). Clean rooms, huge flag screen t.v. and very lovely shower pressure. You have to try The burger restaurant next to It. You'll thank me later.

title: Great location!
text: I stayed with friends for 2 weekend nights in December. The hotel was close to everything, it was clean and the people working at reception were very helpful. They made some great recommendations for places to eat and directions on how to get there. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Viaggio a New York
text: Albergo situato vicino a Time Square, molto facile da raggiungere sia con la metro che a piedi. La struttura offre il WiFi gratuito, dettaglio molto importante! La prima colazione è abbondante e al self service si trova dal croissant alle uova con pancetta!  Personale discreto e disponibile ad ogni informazione. Le stanze sono pulite e confortevoli.

title: Great Location
text: Close to theaters, Times Square and subway.  Room has been updated, bathroom updated & clean.  Towels good quality,  Free breakfast, plentiful and convenient vs having to look for restaurant in the a.m.  Window can be opened. Staff friendly.   Recommend third floor or higher.  Would stay again.

title: bon hôtel
text: hôtel très bien situé proche de times square et les théâtre de broadway. chambre confortable malgré certaines critiques avec un grand lit. (typique américain).n oublions pas que nous sommes à NYC, donc chambre pourrais paraitre petit et un peu bruyant, mais le seul bruit que nous avions était les sirène surtout le lundi 11 décembre lors de l'attentat et la clim. lits fait tous les jours. le personnel est très sympa et serviable. Petit déjeuner copieux, même si pas beaucoup de choix dans le salé, mais de la quantité assuré pas une serveuse très agréable. nous recommandons cette hôtel et nous y retournerons. Que demande t'on dans un hôtel à NYC quand on passe la journée à marche, c'est un bon lit, de l'eau chaude pour un bon bain. le prix est correcte. le seul hic, est effectivement le chauffage qui est la clim qui fait un peu de bruit mais c'est l'Amérique. chambre propre (nous ne sommes pas non plus dans bienvenu chez nous à chercher la petite bête )

title: Good Value
text: Great Comfort Inn, and everything you expect from a Comfort Inn.  Clean, tidy, and price-worthy.  Also, well situated to Times Square as well as the Theatre District.  Enjoyed the breakfast too.  Wish they  had real oatmeal instead of the instant kind.  That's the ONLY downside.

title: Great Location at he right price.
text: Stayed in New York overnight during my vacation, wanted a place to stay at reasonable price and we found it at The Comfort Inn, it wasn't luxurious but served our purposes with free breakfast to go along with it.

title: Great Location and comfortable
text:
We stayed in this hotel during the Macy's parade weekend.  The location is great.  Just one block away from all the action.  It has a subway station just in the corner (42nd Port Authority); you can get anywhere from the hotel.
The breakfast was a good option to reduce the expenses in NYC.  The advise of waking up early is the best; we avoided the crowds for breakfast.
We had some issues but they worked to resolve them.  We ended staying in 2 rooms; first in 204; then 504 and last 108.  
When we got the 108 it is right at the breakfast area and I was concerned but honestly you cannot hear the noise from outside in the room.
The hotel was doing some renovation works; they are replacing all wallpaper and painting the doors.  When we first check it was disappointing for the way it looked (nobody told us they were working on it); we went out to walk and came back to find they had installed new wall paper and all started to look nicer.
They allowed us early check in which was a life saver.
The issues we had was with the ac of one room; then we went to another room and the faucet from the shower broke down :-( so we had to move.  
In general it was a good experience because of the location and the staff is friendly.  And rooms were clean.
Rooms are small which was expected for NYC but keep that in mind; we were 3 adults in a double bed room and it was tight with the luggage.  
My advise is only 2 people per room

title: Hidden Gem
text: This hotel is very clean and the the staff is very courteous. It is within walking distance to many theaters and restaurants.  Ample parking is across the street at a discount rate for hotel guests. The bathroom could use some updating, but it was clean.

title: Great bargain
text: This is a medium priced hotel in the heart of Times Square.  We walked to the theaters from the hotel.  Our room was feet from the breakfast area and front desk.  When that was assigned we were afraid it would be noisy but the hotel was full and it was our only option.  The room was super quiet.  We heard NOTHING.  The sheets were clean, crisp and looked very new.  Beds were comfortable.  The front desk staff were like friends they were quick to greet us and make us feel welcome.  The breakfast was a very busy place but they kept up with restocking of the items.  We would stay here again in a heart beat.

title: happy
text: good location,price and breakfast. parking great and a good price . near shows and subways. Can walk to many sites or cab. Recommend Juniors as a good and affordable eating establishment also. would return again

title: very good location, very low grade hotel
text: The location is very close to the heart of Times Square. The room is very small (expectable for the price) with old and cheap furniture and old and cheap carpets. Bed is queen size, pillows standard. It is not so very clean. The walls are very thin, so you can hear everything from the surrounding rooms. It has a very large TV set and a very small wardrobe with an iron and iron table. It has a large mirror. I was given a room for disabled persons (I had not asked for it) , so the bathroom was quite particular and made you feel at a nursing home. However, However, I do not believe a person in a wheel-chair can really move in a room with so few space. The basin is minimal, you do not have any space where to place your stuff, at the shower (plastic and quite weak) you do not have anywhere to place your soap or shampoo. It does not have an augmentation mirror and the amenities are few and cheap. Breakfast room is small for the amount of people and can be full when you arrive. Breakfast ends earlier than in most of the hotels (9.30), it is the typical breakfast of small American hotels, not bad but nothing fancy. The lift is old and noisy. The staff is polite, but they do not do the smallest effort to solve any problem. A couple of warnings: if you want a shuttle you have to ask for it 24 hs in advance (something they do not consider important to warn you when you ask at your arrival, so.....be ready to pay 85 USD for a taxi). They will tell you that you need 1 hour by taxi to JFK, do not believe them, you need 2 hours. And finally, if you plan to send any purchases to the hotel.....they reject all of them even if you had sent a warning mail telling some parcels will arrive....and do not consider necessary to tell you by mail that they do not receive them. They simply do not answer your mails. In summary, if you are a fan of Times Square and plan to have breakfast early, be out all the day and only get some sleep at the hotel, you could be there. If not....even with the same budget you have much better options in Times Square itself.

title: Nice place to stay
text:
Nice place to stay.  Not fancy but close to the center of it all. Great price. Definately stay here again
 Staff was AWESOME. Very friendly. Location was great. Good value for the price. No frills but great time.

title: Great Location
text: Great location near Times Square and many restaurants. Parking across the street for $30.00 per night. Subways nearby, but most attractions are within walking distance. Free breakfast included from 6:30 to 9:30 AM.

title: Reasonable central location for NYC travel
text: We needed one night accommodations on short notice and the Comfort Inn came through.  We checked in before 1500 and were able to stretch out and rest prior to our dinner meeting.  Upon return, we were able to walk easily to Times Square and see the sights!  At 2300 it was as crowded as broad daylight. Our room was comfortable and quiet and easily accessed.  We were able to grab a quick breakfast (included) and store our bags for an early evening return free of charge.  The staff was friendly and cordial and made us feel welcome.  For Midtown Times Square Broadway lodging this is a great find quiet, clean, and affordable.  Check it out!

title: Location, location, location; clean, safe and comfortable.
