text: This Comfort Inn is near 8th avenue which means it is within walking distance of the theater district.  That is the reason we picked this Comfort Inn.  Upside is its price.  We stayed for 5 days and the average room rate for Sunday through Thursday was about half what the Intercontinental (at 8th and 44th) charged.  Downside is the size of the room which, I calculate was about two-thirds the size of a room at the Hilton around the corner.  If we had been taking kids to New York we would not have stayed here.  The room is obviously sized for a business traveler on a budget.  Upside:  the room was clean, the king-size bed was comfortable and the pillows were just what we needed after a day of walking the city.  The bathroom was also about two-thirds the size of the Hilton's rooms (we checked but at over $400 a night we decided to save our money for other things) but it was clean and the shower was very good.  As with many, if not most, Comfort Inns, there is a free breakfast included which was good ... not great mind you ... but if you like waffles, this is a quite tasty extra.  The coffee is freshly made and even the eggs were OK.  Many of the people who stayed there told me the room and bathroom is what you would expect to find in a moderate priced hotel in Europe.  My wife and I will stay there again.  It is conveniently located and does what we wanted:  a safe, environment that provided comfort for weary souls who came to New York to see the city and then get a good night's sleep before doing it all over the next day.  As for dry cleaning ... the hotel doesn't offer it but there is a dry cleaners next door.  TIP:  walk to 8th avenue to get your Uber or Lyft.  Traffic on 44th street is a bear.

title: Excelent location
text: This is a great hotel if you are on a budget. Me and my friend wanted a hotel with location close to Times Square, free breakfast and free WiFi so we chose this one. We got a large room on the top floor. The bed was Great and there was a fridge. The aircon worked fine. Breakfast was Great with all we needed. Coffee and tea 24/7 is also Great. The staff is polite and helpful and the location is really good. Close to Times Square, Port Autority bus station and subway. There also more than one good restaurant nearby. We Will be booking this hotel again next time we want to go to NYC.

title: Great location
text: Great location, nice and clean rooms, awesome breakfast! We couldn't be happier with our decision to stay here. We are a short walk away from Times Square and very close to the subway system. We would definitely stay here again!

title: Great location, buget hotel
text: Stayed here for one night back in September. The rooms are small but the bathroom was larger than expected. Walls are thin so you will hear people in the hallways. The room was clean, but dimly lit. Safe was not bolted down and was a waste of time.  Coffee maker and microwave was in the room. This was fine for staying for a few hours but not if I wanted an extended stay or a good nights rest. Side Note: the staff was nice and helpful, I didn't try to complimentary breakfast but was told that it was served in the mornings. However, this is a budget motel/inn so don't expect anything more and you will be fine.

title: Buena ubicación
text: El hotel es ideal para quienes buscan estar en el corazón de Manhattan, su ubicación es excelente, a solo un par de cuadras se encuentra Times Square, la Autoridad Portuaria y decenas de tiendas y restaurantes. Además las habitaciones son cómodas, aseadas y el desayuno es tipo buffet con una buena variedad de alimentos por escoger, pero solo se cuenta con un ascensor para todos los huéspedes y es bastante ruidoso y demorado.

title: Situation parfaite
text:
Hôtel situé sur la 44 ... Proche de 2 station de métro.. Lieux à voir facilement accessible depuis l hôtel .. Proche de beaucoup de restaurants et de Times square .. Pour se balader le soir ..
Les inconvénients sont les chambres petites comme les salles de bain mais propre . Hôtel qui se situe dans le style des confort in' . Deco dépasse 
Personnel accessible.. Ét très sympa 
À recommander pour un séjour accessible financièrement mais New York reste très chère pour le reste

title: Budget Hotel, fantastic location
text:
I was very unsure of this hotel, however booked it based on the price and location, and that you had a breakfast included!

It is a tired hotel so yes, its very traditional and 'brown/biege', however the staff were lovely and very helpful, the room was kept clean and was visited everyday by housekeeping and fresh towels were provided and check in and out where seamless.

Breakfast:  This is in a small area in the reception/lobby with perhaps only 10 tables.  We took reviewer's advice and went down early everyday and so we always had a seat.  I did see it a bit busy later on when we were leaving for the day.  We made out own waffles which alternated being original and blueberry or chocolate.  There was scrambled eggs and either sausage or crispy bacon.  You could make your own toast and there was a large variety of pastries available too.  There was three types of juice and tea and coffee along with cereals and fruit.  We filled up on breakfast and took some fruit for a snack later on and it saved us a pretty penny eating out!

Room:  Kept clean and tidy.  Was small but had everything we needed including an iron and hairdryer.  Large flat screen on the wall.  Shower was hot and air con was good.

Location:  The best.  We were a few minutes walk from Times Square, Broadway Theatres, lots and lots of places to eat (including Restaurant Row which is allegedly cheaper to eat on than if you were in the Time Square district), Subway and lots of shops.  It is right in the middle or near everything.  Perfect if you are in town to see some shows.

title: Affordable Broadway Show Hotel
text: Located conveniently on 44th St in the midst of all of the Broadway Show theatres, the Comfort Inn Times Square West is in a great location.  We were looking for location and low price and we found it here.  You do get what you pay for, but I was pleasantly surprised with a nice King bed and plenty of room.  It is dated and the bathroom is basic at best, but we knew that when booking here.  Breakfast is free and is a serve yourself continental style in the hotel lobby.  It is basic, but free coffee is free coffee.  You can make a waffle, toast, etc and if low cost is what you're going for, this is the place for you.

title: Great Room for the price
text: I picked this hotel because of the location;  2 blocks from the Port Authority,  (42nd street station)C & E train at 8th Ave corner,  can take  train to  Village ,  Little Italy or uptown to Lincoln Center/ABC studios  or Central Park.  Hotel is located  in Hell's Kitchen so great  restaurants are very close by. The /bath/bed was clean   but room was  small, it smelled mildew/musty but for one nite was doable . Breakfast was good. Front desk was accommodating. Would stay here again.

title: Great Location
text: I will start by saying that my husband and I were a little nervous about booking Comfort Inn West after reading the reviews from other trip advisor travelers. When we arrived at the hotel and entered the lobby we were even more fearful we had made a terrible choice. The lobby is very tired, and the breakfast area is not very welcoming. We went to our room and we were pleasantly surprised. It was small but very well appointed for a budget hotel. The king room's (#301) comforter, sheets and towels were all quite nice. The bathroom had been a complaint of several other reviewers, but we thought it was very clean. It is a little tired, but very acceptable. The next morning we arrived at the hot free breakfast that was wonderful. The attendant was very attentive to our needs, helping guests with the waffle maker and making sure everything was filled. You could choose from scrambled eggs, bacon or sausage, make your own waffles, bakery, juice . . .There is limited seating so be prepared for a crowd. The desk clerks could not have been nicer. They stored our luggage on both ends of our trip. We arrived at 11 am and they kept our bags so we could begin to explore, as well as our departure day as we were going to be in the audience at The Chew! The location is amazing. Carmin's, a wonderful Italian restaurant, is just a block away. Broadway and Times Square are 2 blocks away, and restaurant row is on 46th st. with many great restaurants to choose from. We ate at Becco, a Lydia Matticchio Bastianich restaurant. We walked to the theater to see Kinky Boots! We got the best price of any hotel near Times Square AND a free hot breakfast every morning. We would stay again!

title: Ótima localização
text: Me hospedei do dia 12 até 18 de outubro. Os atendentes super atenciosos, o recepcionista Anil sempre disposto a ajudar no que precisávamos. Excelente localização, podíamos ir para qualquer lugar a pé. Estação de metrô muito perto para ir aos lugares mais distantes de Manhattan. Hotel bem limpo e café da manhã bom, apesar de não ter nenhuma variação nas opções nenhum dia.

title: Súper céntrico!
text:
El hotel es súper céntrico, no es muy nuevo, pero para llegar a dormir está bien! La atención del front desk es muy básica, pero no está mal. 
El desayuno es súper básico. Creo q es un hotel que podría repetir!

title: Great location and amenities for the money
text: We looked at a lot of hotels on Trip Advisor before choosing Comfort Inn Times Square West. Although some of the reviews were negative, that was not our experience. The hotel is in a great location only two blocks from Time Square. The place was clean although in need of a makeover. Our room was a handicapped room (we did not ask for it) and it was HUGE!  We have been to NYC many times, and this one was the largest by far. The bathroom alone was the size of some rooms in the city! Both the room and bathroom were clean and we found it made up and cleaned every day upon our return. The hotel is managed by an Indian family and they were friendly and helpful.  They even showed us how to use Uber! A full breakfast is included as well as free coffee and tea all day.  We took the E train from JFK and exited at 42nd St/Port Authority a block away from the hotel.  Check-in and Check-out were really easy. Some reviews complained about a slow elevator.  We did not have any problems with it and we were on the 6th floor. The only complaint I would have is despite the fact that there was a big flat screen TV on the wall, the channels were not HD and there were not many to choose from.  All in all, we had a great experience and we will rebook it on our next trip.

title: Avoid
text:
I recently stayed there with friends during Comic-Con and wish I could say there were any redeeming qualities to this particular property.  Sadly there aren’t any, except for the large flat screen televisions in rooms.  

For starters the front desk clerk, a middle eastern man of middle to late age heckles people for extra money and cash bribes.  He comes off standoffish and threatening to guests, what makes it worse is he and his family live on the property.  

The next issue is the cleanliness or lack thereof for the overall property.  The rooms are dirty, and with hairs and other matter left unclean.  The elevator gives off the appearance of being safe, but gives unsafe lurks and jerks before the doors even close.  

The breakfast is okay, but nothing to write home about.  You’re given plastic utensils, plates and bowls, which is typical of similar properties.  The dining area looks old and drab, like it was taken out of the 1980’s.  

Most recent though and most striking, was they had the gall to double charge my friends account.  Mind you that is criminal, and they refuse to refund the extra charges.  

I honestly don’t know how this place stays in business.  If I could give zero stars I would.

title: Sejour new-york septembre 2017
text:
Très bon hotel avec un accueil très chaleureux. Nos bagages ayant été perdus à Paris nous sommes arrivés sans bagages. L'accueil s'engageait à nous prevenir dès leurs arrivées. Sauf que ça du etre tard dans lanuit car nous les avons eu le lendemain matin.
Très bon petit déjeuner.

title: Just Right For Us!
text:
Stay with me, I have lots of info: Since we were staying for 6 nights, I looked at lots of reviews and prices before choosing this hotel. Although there were other hotels that were just a little more in cost, they also charged a $21-$33 daily "resort fee" (none at Comfort Inn) and if you wanted a refrigerator, another $35 for your stay (refrigerator in our Comfort Inn room at no extra cost). Free wi-fi. Free USA Today newspaper in the lobby. Another very big plus for Comfort Inn: free breakfast! And it was an excellent breakfast of waffles, eggs, alternating bacon or sausage, croissants, danish, toast, bananas, oranges, apples, three types of juice, yogurt, cereal boxes (not generic bulk cereal) and more. The breakfast attendant was amazing in keeping the breakfast stocked and the breakfast room tidy. Breakfast was always busy, but we found a table every morning.

    The location was terrific. We were there to see plays and could walk to all the theatres. Just a few blocks to Times Square and the TKTS booth. Lots of good restaurants in the area (didn't get to try them all in six days). Subway entrance a half block from the hotel and the port authority two blocks away. The hotel is in the middle of a "side" street, so it was a lot less busy.

    You expect NYC hotels to be small. Our room had a king bed and was roomy enough (our last vacation was a cruise, so we can handle cozy). During my research, I saw photos of very small, tight rooms, and this was so much better, especially for six days. The room configurations are not all alike (from floor plan and peaking in while housekeeping was at work). Our bathroom was too small to easily open and close the door and to stand in front of the sink (toilet too close), but other bathrooms are configured differently. Housekeeping did a great job every day.

    There is only one elevator for 7 floors and probably 10 rooms on floors 2-7. Build in some wait time during the busy morning.

    Front desk: some were more friendly than others. We had a few favorites. They answered questions, were helpful and provided quick resolution (light out in hallway by our door).

    To be improved: The lobby area could use an interior decorator and maybe some remodeling. Since the rooms are small and there was only the desk chair to sit, it would have been nice to have a comfortable lobby area. There is an old sofa and a couple chairs, but not inviting. There is a computer and printer available. And the breakfast area tables and chairs.

title: Boa relacao custo beneficio
text:
Boa localizacao para quem vai uma primeira vez a nyc. Muito perto da times square. Bons restaurantes nas proximidades. Quartos normais, sem atrativos. Cafe razoavel. Recepcao atenciosa. Alguns quartos bem pequenos.
Em geral eh uma boa relacao custo beneficio.

title: Times Square Basic Hotel
text: Friends were visiting the big apple in September and I picked them up and dropped them off here - a small hotel on 44th Street off 9th Avenue in a seven story building. The rooms were an adequate size and the location is ideal for theater lovers as it is a quick walk home from most of the Broadway plays about a mile from Lincoln Center and Central Park. Basic hotel with a great location.

title: Good Place at a Great Location!
text: Booked this at the last minute for the labor day weekend. Room was no frills,but comfy and clean. Recommend to the price conscience traveler who would love the location, and block and a half from Times Square. We go to NYC a couple of times a year and would stay here again.

title: AVERAGE  HOTEL. GOOD LOCATION
text:
We reached the tired after a long travel from Rochester. On a rainy day of May 2017. Upon reaching Reception, no Greetings or a Customary Smile. Stiff lips all around! Strightway business - Give your Passports ! Not even a comfortable chair to sit and find passports from handbags ! Then demand for Credit Card ! The floor of reception was wet and muddy because of rains- no one to clean it up. No complimentary drink to calm the tired nerves after a long drive through traffic of Times Square. A vending machine for some lime juice was there and no glasses! Some cookies in an unkempt jar. The lift to room was smelly. Rooms, typical of a Times Square Hotel were small and packed. No room to move around or stretch your legs in a chair. Linen- Both Bed Linen and Bathroom Linen- not up to mark. Tea/Coffee machine was there. Though we had booked a room for Three, there were Towels for two people only. Bathrooms no upto standard of a branded hotel in Times Square! Buffet area is too small and can seat only 15-20 people at a time and  looks overcrowded even with 15 people around. Breakfast is basic. Nothing special to mention.
And we paid $300 per night for such a below average stay! 
Only good thing about Comfort Inn is it's location. You can walk down to all the major attaractions around in 5-10 minutes. 
Watch out  this space for more.

title: Great location
text: We were going on a 7 day cruise out of NYC and needed a hotel near the pier for the night before we left.  The Comfort Inn was within walking distance.  It is also close to the Port Authority. Many nearby restaurants.  Overall, the hotel was very clean, our room was actually large for a NYC hotel, the bed was super comfy and the free breakfast was good.  My only negative is that they insisted on making a photocopy of my credit card and keep it in their files - even after I checked out.  In this day and age of identity theft, I find this practice disturbing. My credit card company has told me there is no reason for them to make a photocopy of my credit card after swiping it.  The man at the front desk of the hotel told me he did not make a copy of the backside of the card with the three digit security number, but it would be all too easy for them to memorize that number and hand write it on the paper.  But since we needed a place to stay, I could not argue with them.

title: Avoid this place
text:
Where to start. Upon arrival after a long trip get to the reception expecting a nice welcome and was met with the words passport credit card in that order. No hello how are you. 
As we were being checked in I pointed out to my fiancé there was a complimentary cookie see through container which was swarming with flys. 
Upon entry into our bedroom it was very pokey and not really what you expect for 200 dollars. 
As we unpacked and got ready for a night out I was disgusted by the state on the bathroom floor. Hairs everywhere and broken dirty shower rail. 
Only redeeming feature of this hotel is the location.

title: Wonderful Stay Close To Everywhere!!
text:
Had a wonderful stay at this reasonably priced and well run Manhattan Comfort Inn as the staff was friendly beyond belief and responded to any and all requests in a very interested and welcoming fashion from the great people at the front desk to the room staff to the breakfast staff!! :0) 
All Accommodating, Jovial, Informative, And Friendly People Every Single Day :0)

Thank You and See You Again Soon!! :0)

title: Most humble and friendly staff, ideal location, value for money....
text: We booked online Expedia for a hotel and flight deal (will never do that again, not recommended at all) the hotel we got in was Comfort Inn South 39th Street, the place was so horrible, so we decided to move instead of ruining our vacation. Comfort Inn West 44th Street was the perfect place, the staff especially Mr. Anil was extremely helpful and genuinely sincere. We enjoyed our stay, the proximity to Times Square was added advantage. The price we paid was much lesser than booking on Expedia. Absolutely recommend Comfort Inn West 44th Street... dont make a mistake and go to Comfort Inn on 39th Street :)

title: Value for money hotel located within walking distance of Times Square
text: On family holiday celebrating my birthday.  Hotel is the most friendly place I have stayed in.  Hotel is located few minutes walking distance from Time Square.  Room accommodation is very good. I'm staying here with my wife and child.

title: Ugh
text: This was the 2nd time I have stayed here. The first time was serviceable, so we opted to try it again for a quick overnight. The location for us was great. But everything else was not. The staff was mediocre at best. The man who checked us in could barely speak enough English to tell us the elevator was down (it would not be fixed for entire stay and all they gave us was some points on our comfort inn account, not even an apology). They can't hold your luggage for the day after you check out, causing us to run back from a matinee to retrieve our luggage before they would just "throw it in the lobby". We have never had that issue at another hotel in NYC. The walls were so thin we were awoken at 6 AM by our neighbors alarm clock, after being awoken by the alarm in our room at midnight which was unexpectedly set. The whole experience left a bad taste, and I would definitely not pay their prices to stay here again. There are cheaper and friendlier hotels in the area.

title: No frills, basic but comfortable
text: All of your basics are here, including coffee in the room. The bed was extra comfortable and the staff seemed pleasant. The room was typical New York small, the decor in the common areas is very dated, the water pressure was a bit low for a great shower and there is nowhere near enough towels. However, if the price is low enough this is a sturdy low-budget option.

title: Great Location - Mixed Thoughts on Room Quality
text:
The location is great - right in the heart of the theatre district. The hotel offers free coffee and breakfast, so that's a definite plus.

Our room was actually larger than expected. There were some cleanliness issues, however, such as mold on the bathroom ceiling and yellow stains on the curtains. The beds were quite comfortable, and I really can't complain about the room in general. Several friends have stayed here and had only good things to say, so perhaps our room was an outlier. Regardless, I'd be willing to stay here again. If you don't want to pay $400+/night for a room yet want to stay near the theaters, the Comfort Inn TS West is a good option.

title: Needs some updates
text: What can I say, it was New York and reasonably priced however it was outdated and too much noise from outside and from other guest rooms. We also chose it because breakfast was complimentary, however there was limited room, the place was crowded and the food was not good.  Suffice to say we went elsewhere :)

title: Location, Location
text: The price and location is great, our room was very clean and nice but extremely small. The bathroom door could not open fully because of the double size bed. I recommend this hotel if you want to be in Time Square

title: un hôtel sans cachet et peu recommandable
text:
Nous avons pris l'hôtel suivant son prix et sa localisation.  Nous avons vite déchanté.
exigu pour les chambres,bruyant sur New York.. bref peu recommandable sauf pour la proximité du centre.
Evitez au maixu

title: Great for theatre lovers!
text: Would you rather spend your money on Broadway tickets or on a fancy hotel?  If you would rather see the shows, I recommend this hotel.  I stayed there in 2012 and 2017. The location is the best part, walking distance from many theaters.  But you don't have to give up all comfort.  This hotel is non-smoking.  The staff (Ron is one) could not be more helpful.  The two rooms I stayed in (5 years apart) were cozy and met all my needs.  The elevator was slow; the air-conditioner was comically noisy but I hope I can stay here whenever I come.  Their breakfasts were more than anyone could eat.  Scrambled eggs, alternating bacon and sausage, make-your-own waffles, yogurt, cereals and more.  If you come before check-in or are not ready to leave at check-out they will happily store your luggage.  You could stay at the Intercontinental (near-by) but then you would have no $ for Broadway shows.  Not that the Comfort Inn is cheap, but it is moderate in price.  Reasonable.

title: Buena ubicacion, comodo
text: Habitacion comoda, baño idem. Habia un poco de olor a desinfectante, pero la verdad dormí excelentemente, la cama era comoda. El desayuno variado aunq no me parecio tan rico. El personal buena atencion, pude dejar las valijas y me daban un ticket para pasar a recogerlas luego.

title: Buen Hotel, excelente ubicación súper central
text: Habitación acorde (triple), camas comodas, buen baño, desayuno buffet, fruta, muy buena experiencia, cerca esta times square,tiendas, port authority lo cual facilita el acceso a transporte en bus si lo requieren

title: Zafa, mejor d lo esperado
text: Estuve una sola noche en este Hotel ya que me cancelaron un vuelo a Washington por mal tiempo y tuve q quedarme en NYC.- El Hotel esta muy bien ubicado, las habitaciones son pequeñas pero confortables, el desayuno  es bastante completo y la atención buena.- Buena relación precio calidad.-

title: Reasonably Priced, But Tiny
text: The hotel is super close to a lot of Broadway shows and is priced great. However, it really could use renovating! I felt like the carpet in our room was filthy and I didn't want to walk barefooted. I requested a higher floor, but wound up on the main level (I didn't realize there were rooms steps away from the desk and breakfast area). It could have been worse - there was a basement level. If we had been spending any time in the room I would have been super miserable, but we were only there to change for a show and to sleep.

title: Good value, close to subway, theatres and time square
text:
Friendly, good cooked breakfast (Eggs, sausage, pastries, waffles, yoghurts, croissants, juices, boiled eggs, coffee etc etc) - 24 hour tea/coffee in foyer and in rooms.  Reception also had iced lemon water always available which was fantastic after a long day walking around NYC in 90 degree heat.

Rooms were basic but clean and beds very comfortable (I like firm beds).  Toiletries were basic (small shampoo/conditioner/bar soap).  Shower was strong and the A/C in room worked really well.  Very small shampoo bottle provided for 2 adults and 2 kids in room but reception provided more.  Bathroom didn't have towel rails which was odd.

Would highly recommend this for value and location for family visiting NYC.

Location was great - We walked down to Empire state building one morning which took about 20-25 mins but a nice easy walk, going to Hamilton at Richard Rogers Theatre was a 5 min walk, all broadway theatres very close by.  About a 5-10 min walk to time square etc.

title: Location was excellent
text: Average comfort inn. Room was small but clean. Breakfast was adequate. Elevator was slow and bouncy. The selling point was its location a few blocks from Times Square, Restaurant Row and the theatres.  Parking was across the street and they validated for a discounted price.

title: life saver
text: Arrived late p.m. after being let down by our previously booked hotel - no room at the inn! - and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. We were given their last room and although it was in the basement it was what we needed. Ample room, comfortable beds, clean and plentiful towels etc. great breakfast. All good. No complaints whatsoever. Would stay here again.

title: OK place in a high-priced area.
text:
Hotel rooms in New York are expensive and you don't get as much for your money as elsewhere, so with that in mind:
The good:
Rooms have fridge, coffee maker, ironing facilities.
Good breakfast. It's a full breakfast even though the hotel calls it "continental." (breakfast room is crammed to overflowing by 9 a.m., however. Eat early.)
Service is mostly cheerful and efficient.
Outstanding location.
Nice, firm beds. Big fluffy towels.
Air conditioning is by wall unit. Ours worked well.
WiFi is excellent. It stays on instead of kicking you off the network after a few minutes of idle time;.
Snacks and soft drinks are available in the lobby.
The bad:
Our room was tiny.
Overall, the hotel is becoming  bit shabby. We had bare hooks on the wall where a picture once hung.
The breakfast area is crammed by 9 a.m.
The ugly:
There's only one elevator (lift)  and it's not only slowwwww, but has a disconcerting habit of bouncing when passengers board. We were on the 5th floor and it seemed that the younger folks all chose to use the stairs, rather than waiting for the car to come.

title: Recomendable
text:
Destaco a este hotel por la calidad de sus habitaciones y por su gran ubicación, cerca de Times Square y de Port Authority.
El servicio es muy bueno porque cuentas con cafe, té, chocolate y galletas o cookies a toda hora. 
Y por ultimo, quiero destacar la atención de RON.  Este conserje nos ha facilitado las cosas , no solo para el alojamiento, sino para todo tipo de información de la ciudad.

title: Comfort Sums this place up.
text:
Our room was spacious and the bed was very comfortable. There was a fridge and tea and coffee making facilities which was just what we needed after a long flight from UK. The great thing about staying at the comfort in is that it was fuss free on check-in and a 5min walk from times square so great location. 

Breakfast was included in our price and we were not let down. My wife and I loved the breakfast selection and shared a waffle with maple syrup and fruit etc. 

All staff were nice and friendly. We stayed here only one night and then stayed elsewhere with friends for the remainder of the trip but my wife and I agreed that we preferred the Comfort inn and if we were to come back we would book this place for sure.

title: Ótima localização
text:
Além da ótima localização, o hotel oferece um farto café da manhã continental.
Apesar do quarto pequeno (padrão em Nova York), possui banheira, pra vc relaxar, após um dia de muita caminhada e passeios.

title: Couldn't be more pleased!
text: This hotel was the perfect choice for our family's trip to NYC. This was our 2nd trip here but the first time staying in the city. We were looking for something close to Times Square but also affordable and this was the best option! The hotels price and location cannot be beat, especially given that includes breakfast. We arrived early on the day of our check in and were given the keys to our room 3 hours before check in time which was a blessing. Breakfast was good each morning with plenty of choices. Although the room is on the smaller side, we didn't come to spend time in our room and it was adequate for our needs. Beds were comfortable and the room was very clean. We will definitely be staying here again!

title: A Pleasant Surprise
text:
I'm sorry, but Comfort Inn doesn't usually come immediately to my mind when thinking about quality accommodations.  Add to that the fact that reasonable pricing is not often synonymous with quality accommodations in NYC.  Thankfully, I was open-minded when reserving a room here.
The location was very good. West 44th is one of the quieter cross streets in Manhattan.  The hotel exterior is kind of average, but the interior was bright, clean and attractive - kind of reminding us of a hotel where we stayed in Oslo, Norway.
The desk staff was friendly, helpful and efficient.  The rest of the interior was clean, though it had an oddly haphazard layout.  When we got to our room we discovered the probably reason for the hall layout.  This appears to have been a hotel with larger rooms that have now become more utilitarian in size (e.g. Minimal space to squeeze between the bed and the wall-mounted TV).  It was exactly what we needed, with little wasted space.  The room was clean and secure, with almost everything in good repair (Their were a couple of tiles loose in the shower, but it didn't impact our stay).
The Lobby breakfast area was pleasant and clean.  My only comment/criticism there would be that the bar stools were a bad choice.  They were cheap and, as a result, upholstery was giving out and the stools scraped noisily on the floor.
The breakfast was good and a step above minimal.  I looked, and it would be hard to beat this place for location and price.  There may be better/nicer hotels in the area but, for a 1-2 night stay in the city, you would probably be paying for stuff you don't need anyway.
Generally, the worst thing I saw was the elevator, which was slow and bounced like a thrill ride.  Still, it got us up and down without a problem.

title: Muito bem localizado
text: Hotel entre a 8a e 9a avenida, a cerca de duas quadras da Times Square. Localização perfeita que permite estar no coração de NY em instantes, bem como em grande parte dos teatros da Broadway. Estação do metrô com entrada na esquina da 8a, sem sequer precisar atravessar a rua para chegar ao metrô. Inclui café da manhã, o que não é tão comum em NY, que é suficiente. Cama confortável, bom banheiro, quarto incluía frigobar e cafeteira, e em tamanho suficiente para duas pessoas. Quarto foi limpo todos os dias. No hall, há a disposição água, água saborizada, cookies, chocolate quente e café. Voltaria com certeza. O preço é alto para as instalações, mas em se tratando de NY, em que os hotéis não são baratos, e a localização, que encarece bastante a estadia, acredito estar na média.

title: Boa localização
text:
O hotel é muito bem localizado, gostei muito! Pois fica entre a 8ª e a 9ª avenida, com uma estação na mesma quadra ( quarteirão ), além da Times Square.

Ponto forte: localização e facilidades ao redor.

Ponto fraco: a limpeza dos quartos. Infelizmente um dia fiquei sem a troca das toalhas e no outro dia a limpeza da banheira...lamentável...

A recepção até se esforçam em ajudar, mas não fazem nada além...Caso pensem em localização, é um bom hotel.

title: Excellent  experience
text: Great location. Would recommend  this hotel to anyone going to  visit new york. One block from time square. Clean. Rooms are small but I was only in my room to sleep so it didn't bother me.. I know some past post said beg bugs never did I see one bug. Would stay here again if I ever return  to new york...

title: We spent 6 days and 5 nights, our first trip to New Yok City.
text: The hotel staff was very nice and helpful.  We arrived a little early and were able to go ahead and check in.  Our room was clean and nice.  Breakfast was good every morning.  The staff offered helpful guidance for getting around the city.

title: Vacation
text: The rooms are very small, but if you want a cheap clean room, this is a good place to stay. Staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast was great. It was a full breakfast with sausage eggs and waffles, etc

title: Good location
text: Really good location, very close to Times Square. Our room was on the top floor (7) and faced 44th ave and street noise could be heard. Sirens, trucks, motorcycles. But it wasn't too bad. Didn't wake us up at night. Beds were comfortable and room was adequate in size. We never tried the breakfast but it looked like typical fare for the Choice chain. The elevator was fun. Probably an old hydraulic type since it "bounced" on each level the car stopped. And the staff was very nice. Same staff every day and night. A family affair I suppose. Third hotel we have stayed in while in NYC. Probably one of the better stays.

title: Location, location, location
text: This hotel has a great location if you're going to NYC to see Broadway shows, Times Square, Hell's Kitchen restaurants, Rockefeller Center. . . .  We took the train to Penn Station and it was a 20-25 minute walk to the hotel. Rooms are clean but small--it IS New York. The beds are comfortable and the breakfast is delicious and included in the price of the room!  The staff were very polite and accommodating.  Great food, bakeries, and theater are so close!  We'll definitely be back!

title: Great location. Reasonable price
text:
Location could not be better. Walking distance to bus terminal, Times Square, Central Park. Good breakfasts. Clean.
Faults included a very slow elevator and much too large chairs for breakfast area. Could not move around when it was busy,. Dangerous with hot coffee!
I booked early and prepaid through AARP and got a good rate.

title: Regular
text: El hotel no ofrecía buenos servicios , utilizaban el pasillo de la habitación en la cual estaba , para dejar el carrito de la limpieza. El desayuno es pésimo, es un lugar con 4 o 5 mesas, cuando el hotel tiene más de 60 habitaciones, y los productos ofrecidos no eran buenos. Me quedé 3 días y nunca me hicieron el servicio de limpieza

title: Great location, reasonable price
text:
The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. They found a great local place to get a sandwich to take to the Statue of Liberty. (However, it does turn out there are places on the island that the Statue is on and Ellis Island that do have food.)
We had a small room on the 7th floor that had a nice view of the skyline.
The breakfast that was provided was adequate to keep us going until lunch.

title: This Hotel has seen better days!
text: This Hotel has seen better days!  Price OK, luxury it is not!  The rooms are small (it is NY after all).  When mentioning the smoke alarm was clearly low on battery the answer was to remove the smoke detector rather than fix the issue (not the safety you want for your family).  Breakfast was not good, so we ended up eating out having picked this place for its breakfast option. Very noisy, could do with new thicker windows.

title: Just ok!
text: Happened to be here for just one night, it was just ok. The only good thing is its location very close to Times Square. Rooms are ok, bit smaller, and yes no water bottles in the room, you have to purchase from the reception, the first of its kind in the world. Breakfast have limited options specially for veg lovers. Anil and Vibhuti at front desk and Rajesh in the restaurant were very helpful.

title: Great location, great rooms
text: Very comfortable and clean, this is a great place to stay in the city if you want to be near the theatre scene. The rooms are large for NYC and very quiet. The location is so convenient and the price was unbelievable! I will definitely stay here again.

title: How not to make your stay comfortable at the Comfort Inn Times Square West
text: I need to set the scene. We had arrived in the Big Apple. We were looking forward to the next chapter of our month long journey. A little disappointingly we were greeted by grey, wet, cool conditions as we climbed up from the Subway. Despite my wife having picked up a heavy cold in DC we consoled ourselves with the thought of a warm welcome and hot shower at the hotel. Nothing could have been further from this on our arrival. The fellow at the desk ushered us over after a short wait. All our paperwork was in order but for a slight admin glitch. He made us wait 15 minutes, cold and wet in the lobby as he spoke to various "people". He said we needed to sort problem with our agent where it was midnight on the other side of the world. Totally humiliated, my wife sick, we were made to feel defeated and frustrated. We did eventually to get our room and that hot shower. The room was basic and cramped. Comfort Inn Times Square West is really about location, location, location which is fine but a little customer service and understanding would also go along way...

title: Bad experience
text:
I never do this, but I did have a bad experience here.  We arrived and were given a key to our room with a king bed.  It was in the basement, and small, and I'm claustrophobic.  They told me there were no rooms available on upper floors with a king bed, and I would have to pay more for a room with two doubles.  I showed the reservation, where it did not say that the room was in the basement (!), and the man said to call the website.  Their website.  How do I call a website?  So the (more reasonable) woman that was also present agreed to call the manager and handle the problem.  We waited a half an hour.  A precious half an hour between shows when we could have been sleeping or showing for us to say that it is listed on the website. I was so upset that after a half an hour they just wanted to prove me wrong, that I didn't look.  But since then I have looked (please look!) and I can not find that rooms with king beds are in a basement!!  I have clicked through a full reservation and can not find it.  I paid the extra for the room.  It was not 5 p.m., and they had the rooms, and had us wait for a half an hour. I can't believe they wouldn't have said, "We'll offer you a one time upgrade because of the misunderstanding."  Especially as it was not listed on my reservation on my phone!!!!  

I looked at the room before taking the two double beds, and it was lovely and the house keeper who showed it to me was also lovely.

And lastly, and hand to god this is true, we found a live Tick on a towel this morning.  I don't know how this is possible in a city, but we did.  We would have brought it down and showed the desk staff, but I am certain they would have taken a lot of time and not done anything to help us.  

Okay, now really lastly, I can not believe the man they had helping us is customer facing.  Completely independently, my husband and I both said we wanted to punch him in the face.  I assure you, neither of us have ever punched anyone, but the fact that he elicited the SAME response in both of us, is noteworthy.  

I wont' be returning.

title: Weekend getaway
text:
This place is very well located, right on teather district. The whole staff are so friendly and helpful, the room is spotless and breakfast is a plus! They will also stamp your parking ticket for the parking garage across the street.
Great job Comfort Inn!

title: Great location
text: Great location three blocks from Times Square.  Super friendly staff, with larger than average (for Manhattan) rooms.  Near restaurants, Broadway shows, and the subway.  Decent price for Manhattan as well.  Can't go wrong with Irish pubs located on either side of the hotel.

title: Small hotel in Excellent Location
text: Functional and clean Hotel. Rooms are very small and we were not thrilled with the coil spring bed. This could be because we are accustomed to a memory foam mattress. Otherwise this is a decent hotel for the price in an excellent location near Times Square.

title: Hôtel très bien situé
text: Nous avons séjourné 6 jours dans cet hôtel et en avons été satisfaits. Je recommande de choisir une chambre à un étage élevé, côté cour, pour éviter le bruit. En plus on a une belle vue sur le Rockfeller Center. Pour le petit déjeuner un large choix est offert et c'est bon. Plusieurs restaurants très bons à proximité, le Westway dinner, au 614 de la 9ème avenue et le Yum yum too (restaurant asiatique) au coin de la 9ème avenue et de la 46th street. De cet hôtel on est à 10 mn à pied de Times Square. Ensuite dans le métro une navette très rapide (The shuttle) permet de rejoindre Grand Central Station d'où on peut circuler facilement partout dans Manhattan.

title: Average Stay
text: For a recent business trip, I stayed at this hotel due to its location. The rooms are smaller as expected, but everything functioned. I personally felt like the hotel is "dated" and could undergo some renovation. The average hot breakfast and temperamental WiFi made this stay....Average. Nothing wrong, but nothing special either.

title: Great place to stay
text:
This is our 2nd stay at this hotel. 
We (me & my wife) checked in on 24th March 2017 and checked out on 30th March 2017. Though we arrived at the hotel much earlier than the check in time of 3.00 pm, the Customer Service Assistant Ms. Sunitha helped us to check into a room in double quick time. While we waited for the check-in, she also helped us to become members in "Choice Hotels.com". This very first point of contact was pleasant, friendly and professional.
We were also assisted greatly by Mr Anil, at the counters. He guided us to routes and places of interest (also super-markets). We met him at most times of the day (and night) and we were always greeted with a broad smile. These two staff, made us at home !!!
The hotel is close to all major attractions, like tours, theaters and the 'Times Square'. 
The hotel is clean, the room service is excellent and what more, tea/coffee was available 24/7. We had walked into the hotel at late hours, after a cold evening in the city and it was always refreshing to find a hot drink.
The prices are competitive. 
We would recommend the hotel unreservedly.

title: First time in New York
text:
First off, the location of this hotel is great. Literally a couple blocks from Times Sq. You can walk to Rockefeller Center, the library, Bryant Park. Subway access is also very convenient, as are Broadway plays.

I had read the reviews about avoiding the basement rooms. I had no choice during my stay and I must say there were no issues at all. The room was bigger than I thought it would be. There was a desk, wardrobe, 2 nightstands and walking room. I never felt cramped. There was occasional noise from what I assume was housekeeping or maintenance, but nothing that kept me up. There are rooms on the lobby level, I assume those may be noisy and I would avoid them if possible. The bed was very comfy. The staff was accommodating when I had a question. There was no full length mirror in my room. That was the only issue I had with the room.

I did not use the wifi or eat the breakfast so I have no comment on that. 

Will definitely be back!

title: Buena, no tan barato pero con excelente ubicación!
text:
Estuvimos por 4 noches en este hotel..es bastante bueno, pero por su ubicación no están barato:
1.Puntos buenos:
- desayuno muy bien pero con pocas mesas y si llegas justo al momento del término ya no habrá mucha variedad .
- disponibilidad gratis de café, te y chocolate  todo el día y noches.
- Personal muy atento y preocupado en especial Ron! 

2. Puntos negativos: la limpieza de las habitaciones bien, pero un día no la habían realizado y tuvimos que pedirlo cuando llegamos en la noche. Lo mismo los espacios comunes faltaba un poco de limpieza.

Al sumar y restar...lejos lo mejor La ubicaciones se puede ir caminando o metro a casi todo Manhattan, de todas formas lo recomiendo y seguro iría si vuelvo a NY

title: Disappointed
text:
I've stayed here many times. Staff has always been friendly and helpful. After checking in today I was browsing the breakfast area. The man working at the front desk began yelling at me - from way across the room - for opening the cooler to look at what flavor yogurt there might be for breakfast. I walked over to him and politely asked him not to speak to me that way. He kept yelling. It was unreal. 

I will update at the end of this trip. I hope it improves.  Maybe the GM, Mr. Kuppuswamy, will read this and counsel this gentleman.  Not a good start for this vacation.

title: Great!!!
text: Great location. Near Train Station.  employee was so kindly. Definitely i will stay again. Room clean. Its not a 4 star hotels but for the prices it's amazing. For breakfast waffler, eggs, bacon, coffee, juices yogurts.

title: Bom custo beneficio
text: O atendimento é bom, a cama é boa, mas a limpeza deixa a desejar. O salão do café da manhã é muito pequeno e apertado. Entretanto por  bem perto da times square, vale a pena pelo custo beneficio, pois saindo do hotel a poucos passos está no centro nervoso de NY

title: Fantastic location, good value for money
text:
Rather belatedly, adding a review. The hotel is quite basic but based on location and price, this hotels gets 4 star. 
Positives - the staff were very helpful and friendly, free buffet breakfast including hot dishes offered plenty of choice. Free hot drinks available throughout the day was a nice added extra. Room facilities were good including a safe and a full size fridge in the room was an added bonus and it wasn't too noisy either. 

Negatives - the shower was a little pathetic. Room walls are a bit thin so noisy neighbours could be a potential problem. The breakfast area is small, so you may have to wait if you don't want to use the breakfast bar area but want a table. 

Given that it's NYC, room size was better than expected and the bathroom was a reasonable size too. Furniture/decor may be a bit faded/worn but given the fact that you are within minutes of Times Square but away from the hustle and bustle, this is a great choice if you want location, but don't want to pay the earth.

title: One of my favorite, great breakfast.
text:
Despite previous review Sam, the owner/general manager  is a great along with the staff here, very helpful.  Beautifully furnished rooms, with very nice BIG 55inch plasma tvs, always a plus in my eyes.
The breakfast selection is great, can't go wrong with freshly made waffles.   I do miss the sausage gravy with biscuits, wish Sam could get that back. Hint hint!
See you soon.

title: Good location
text:
We stayed as a family of 4 for 3 nights. For 4 people in a room was tight. A dresser would have been more helpful then the desk. 
Nice breakfast, which was great it was included, again just a tight space. The hotel has a couple extras like cookies in the afternoon, and fresh lemon water, and coffee tea and got chocolate free and available all day and night. Super nice after walking around in the cold all day!
Staff was friendly.
Location was good, close to theatres and time square. Remember you are in NYC to walk so bring comfy shoes.

title: Réception très coopérative
text: Un hôtel de standing moyen,au prix en rapport,mais avec une chambre spacieuse pour l'adresse en plein Broadway.Le personnel très disponible et la chambre très propre,un petit déjeuner compris dans le prix de type américain en self service.L'emplacement pour le petit déjeuner est restreint bien que suffisant.Bon choix pour le quartier pour un séjour à New York à bon prix.

title: Buena relación calidad precio
text:
Me alojé durante la pasada tormenta de nieve. Al quedar suspendido mi vuelo tuve  que buscar hotel puesto que en el mío duplicaron el precio. Aquí me encontré el mismo precio que para otros días, no abusaron de la situación. Aunque era la última habitación que quedaba, el precio de 190$, era correcto. 
El trato fue muy amable de todos los empleados. Aunque acudí a las 12 de la mañana, me dieron la habitación. 
La habitación es muy correcta. Buen Wifi, televisión enorme, buen sistema de refrigeración. Se ve todo bien cuidado. 
El desayuno normal para este nivel de hoteles. Tostadas, café, bacon. 
La ubicación es muy buena. Cerca hay montones de restaurantes de todos los precios y a 10' Times Square. 
Es un hotel que si vuelvo a NY, posiblemente repita.

title: What a dump
text: Dirty couches & broken chairs in the lobby with a staff who act like they care but don't do much. Noisy slamming doors with dirty curtains in the rooms. This is not the place you want to relax after working in New York City all day.

title: Perfect for the complete theatre experience
text: Our stay was due to an university excursion under the theme of immersive theatre and we couldn't have hoped for a hotel more central. The service was also very good and the breakfast included something for everyone.

title: Great if you just are looking for the basics!
text:
I got a great rate on this hotel so decided to give it a shot. I first stayed on the 4th floor, then extended my vacation and moved to the basement. The rooms are small, but I have stayed in smaller. It was a handicapped accessible room (which I didn't request). The floor of the shower was dirty- ground in dirt most likely from wheelchair tires. When I did complain about it, they came right up and scrubbed it out. So, the service was good. It was perfect for just me.
 There are refrigerators in the rooms which is a plus!
  The breakfast was very good! Included were: waffle maker, scrambled eggs, sausage or bacon, baked goods, toast, yogurt, bagels, hard boiled eggs, juices, bananas, and apples. Oh, one thing I have to add- I tried cereal with milk and it didn't taste right. Then I looked over at a cart that had gallons of milk on it-sitting out for a while, covered with a sheet. I saw this everyday. Do not drink the milk!
  I loved the location. It was on 44th close to 9th were there are a multitude of restaurants on 9th (restaurant row).
  I would stay here again, but not the basement room I had (104). It was next to the elevator and across from the "work area" for employees.Their phones were constantly ringing and it was loud.I wore ear plugs. I also kept the curtains closed b/c the room looked into the area where the garbage dumps are.
  I do have to say that I was given the Tripadvisor price while extending my stay plus the desk woman gave me 10% off. So all in all, I would recommend this hotel minus room 104.

title: Small Room; Great Location
text:
Me and a group of 4 friends were looking to spend some time in NYC and were only going to be there for the weekend. We didn't went to spend a ton but wanted to be in a good location and this provided just that. 

Pros:
~ Great location right by Times Square in the middle of the city
~ Friendly staff
~ Average FREE breakfast in lobby

Cons:
~ Tiny, dated room

Honestly, if you are the type of travelers who only use their hotel room to sleep and don't use it for much else then this hotel will do you just fine. The rooms, although tiny, were clean and even had a mini fridge. The breakfast provided was better than expected and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The price you pay will be loads cheaper than those of other hotels just a couple blocks away. Here, you have a great location. 

For the price I paid I was satisfied. The room was really small for four grown adults but considering that all we used it for was a place to lay down our heads it passed our expectations.

title: Not bad, not great
text: We had planned a full Saturday in the City and decided a few days in advance to spend the night.  We got the room for $175 through Hotels.com.  The room was right off the lobby. The other side of the shower wall was the reception area. Despite being so close to the lobby, we only heard lobby noise once during the night. The room was clean, but small. We had two double beds. There was a small fridge under the desk beside the first bed. The fridge is good for drinks and small things, but the take-out containers I had from dinner had to be wedged in on an angle. You get what you pay for. A room right off Times Square for less than $200. I would have given four stars, but the beds were very hard. I woke four or five times during the night because I was uncomfortable. (I like firm support, but there has to be some comfort. This was just plain hard.)

title: Close to Times square on quiet street
text:
First off I booked this hotel with my first impression of the staff Ron I (believe  that might been his name) when I called  inquiring about this hotel as well as the reviews I read. Also the close proximity to Times Square and * it had free breakfast and *wifi where other hotels charge for it and they don't charge extra resort or hidden fees .Reservations Was for 2 nights I had a warm check in greeting, we arrived just before 2pm our room was ready. Upon opening our room door there was an never ending flushing sound coming from the bathroom (toilet) . I called the front desk and right away they appologized and sent new keys to room next door. The 2nd room toilet had no issues , but did notice blacks spots in shower/tub tile 
in both bathrooms although clean they could use a renovation .
 The beds were clean and comfy . They do need to dust  and vacuum behind the front door in the corners and give a good wiped down inside and outside of the welcome book on desk it was sticky... We did find a balled up receipt on floor left from previous (how ironic the receipt was from the same city we were from) guest. The Tv is fuzzy with a couple chanels that don't even come in..(a waste of a big flat screen tv ).
We did have a good nights sleep!
Next morning went to get breakfast !
Only thing I like  was the waffles.
We Sitting in dining room eating minding our own business and my son says there goes a roach !!! I was like huh , what and where!  Then I seen it ..omgee ! I told the breakfast attendant ,she was standing by the front desk talking , she came and killed it (stepped on it) and got it up and apologized!!  I was scared & turned off! (never experience roaches in hotel before).Oh Hec Naw!!
Then it was another smaller one crawling on the counter near the food!!! This explains why the breakfast attendants stands  by the counter to assist you and to clean up any every spill or crumb right away!!
This will be the only reason , if I decide not to stay here again!!! Thank God they wasn't in the rooms because I would have loss it..

title: great location
text: The hotel is located conveniently near Time square. Nice and modern rooms with friendly staff. Will definitely return to the hotel for the Location. Breakfast was included and saved me from eating outside which would have been expensive. Parking is opposite the road so if you are driving the hotel has a special rate for parking.

title: MARAVILHOSO CUSTO BENEFÍCIO
text: Ótimo custo benefício. Fiquei perto da Times Square e ainda com café da manhã incluso na diária. Além disso, havia outras comodidades gratuitas no hotel que ajudaram bastante como água, água saborizada com limão, cookies, café e chocolate quente, gelo, tudo disponível no hall de entrada do hotel. Maravilhoso!Equipe muito solícita!!!Pude deixar minhas bagagens na recepção antes do check in e depois do check out gratuitamente. Quarto limpo, cama maravilhosa, ótima ducha quente!!Havia frigobar e cafeteira no quarto. Trocaram nossas toalhas tb. Recomendo muito !!Estava num grupo de 4 pessoas e não achei o quarto pequeno como muitos dizem!!Mas cada um do grupo tinha uma mala média. Comportou perfeitamente a gente. Ficamos no 7º andar. Na rua do hotel, há uma estação de metrô, a 42 st port authority terminal. Recomendo muitíssimo!

title: Hotel ótimo custo benefício
text: Fui com minha família para Nova York e nos hospedamos no Comfort inn, ele é do lado da times square, tem um bom café da manhã, internet boa, os quartos são bons e a limpeza também . Ficaria novamente e recomendo.

title: ¡Excelente!
text: Estuve con mi pareja desde el 4 al 10 de enero de 2017. La ubicación es excelente, a 5 minutos a pie del Time Square, en la esquina del hotel hay una estación de subte (que nos dejó bárbaro tanto para ir del aeropuerto al hotel, y viceversa). Cuenta con un muy buen desayuno, y con café de máquina las 24hs a disposición (en invierno el café es un gran aliado, se los aseguro). Con respecto a la habitación, es chica pero cómoda, muy cómoda. En general las instalaciones siempre limpias. El trato de los trabajadores del hotel siempre muy cordial y respetuoso, ante cualquier duda que tuvimos estuvieron a disposición para ayudarnos de la mejor manera. La relación precio calidad es excelente. Dato no menor, el WIFI es buenísimo, estabamos en el segundo piso y tanto en la habitación como en el sector de desayuno el internet volaba. Altamente recomendable.

title: Great Place!
text:
We stayed here for a weekend so we could catch a show at the Broadhurst Theater.   The location of this hotel is fantastic.   Just a block away from many theaters an tons of great places to eat.  We've stayed before in New York in places right on Time Square where it is CRAZY.  But just being a few blocks away can make a huge difference.  

The room was great an clean.  You have to remember small rooms are the norm in this city but we had a king size bed an still room to walk around.  The bathroom is on the small side as well but it was fine for just two of us.   Also, quiet!  Except for a little noise of sirens which is normal in the city, there was no street noise that many reviewers of hotels in New York complain about.

There was included a great breakfast each morning that we would bring back up to the room.

For the location an price we were very happy!  The staff was also fantastic an ready to help.

title: A diamond in the rough
text: Great experience and great stay! I am a GM of a hotel in Delaware and I was VERY impressed. They know their stuff and are very willing to help you in any way needed. The room we had was in the basement. It was totally fine. We didn't have a view but we did have a sliding glass door that opened onto a roof. The room was small but one of the largest rooms in NYC we've been in. It was clean. Simple and clean. The breakfast was GREAT! The coffee was good and everything was fresh! The location of this hotel is AMAZING! You won't be disappointed! Oh, one more thing! Parking is EASY! Parking garage is across the street and $30 a night with hotels validation. Just show ticket at the front desk and they will stamp it.

title: Excellent in all regards
text: Look no further for the perfect hotel in the perfect area.  This Comfort Inn (we are Choice Hotel platinum members) is spotless, efficient, staff-friendly and is located in the very heart of what makes New York tick- Times Square! Our King-Bed room (OMG-$80/night!---awesome price) was well-appointed, extremely clean and polished, relatively spacious, fully-equipped (many USB data ports!-WiFi was good), enormous wall-mounted TV, desk and wardrobe, windows that actually open to get fresh air and hear the sounds of the street, and a lovely "step-saver" bath fully fitted with commode, toilet and tub (plenty of towels, soaps, shampoos etc). The elevator was clean and fully-functional. The breakfast each morning was hot, delicious, many choices... and best of all...24 hour coffee/tea/hot chocolate!!!! We loved it and will be returning in March!  We have stayed many times in NYC and this was a most pleasant experience.

title: Ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo
text: Io e mia sorella ci siamo trovate benissimo. Abbiamo soggiornato per circa 5 giorni. L'hotel è abbastanza centrico, 10 minuti a piedi da Times Square. Il personale gentile è qualificato, in particolare modo ringraziamo Guendaline che con noi è stata gentilissima e premurosa.

title: Yes, FIVE Stars!
text:
I give the Comfort Inn Times Square West five stars, not because its as nice as the Intercontinental down the street for three times the money, but because it fully exceeded this family's expectations in every way.

Just to set where I am coming from,  we're a blessed "middle class" professional family of five.  We're extensively traveled.  We enjoy the fancy hotels, but we're realistic and know what a simple good value is.  Luxury isnt always about bling, sometimes its about convenience and what works well.

If we had been just visiting NYC with no particular purpose we probably wouldn't have looked twice at this Comfort Inn, especially with the mixed reviews.  But this time we were in the city to move our daughter into an appointment in the neighborhood nearby.  So this was convenient base camp for a week to get that done.

The surprise was how perfectly nice the hotel and service was for our whole stay.  

We got the "dreaded" first floor room,  #108.  It turned out to be perfect for us as I was walking back and forth between my daughter's appartment.  What a hassle it would have been to wait for the elevator each time. Yes we could hear commotion in the lobby at times, but no big deal.  BTW, first floor always has the best water pressure.  It was also very convenient to getting breakfast and bringing it back to the room.  I joked with my wife to dare me to walk out into the breakfast area in my pajamas and slippers to get coffee like it was our kitchen at home!  That would have got some wierd looks!

The room was on the smaller side, but definitely not unworkable.   Everything was clean.  The linens smelled fresh.  The room had a surprisingly big TV although the number of channels and picture quality was a little let down.

I see people remarking that breakfast was awful or something.   Id say it was actually rather above par for this level hotel.  Good selection of both hot and cold items.  The coffee was way better than I would expect and available 24 hours.

Coming into the city I was fretting over where I was going to park my van to unload all my daughter's stuff for her appartment.   My daughter is a model and fashion student so she doesn't travel light.  To my surprise there is a huge loading zone that extends down the street and in front of the hotel.  It was empty and perfect.   Then there is a freshly remodeled Edison parking lot right across the street.   Im crazy about my cars, like obsessive compulsive, so I freak out about NYC parking.  Edison is always great and never a mark.

So will we stay at Comfort Inn Times Square West again.  You bet. I will specifically ask for room 108 right off the lobby.  And we'll stay for a week at less than half the cost of any other reputable hotel in mid-town.  I'll spend what I save on all the great restaurants in the Hell's Kithchen neighborhood and buy lots of trendy cloths for my wife and kids!

I completely reject most of the negative reviews I read.  I dont know who those people are, where they come from, or what they were expecting.  But if you can deal well with anything between the Intercontinental and a Fairfield Inn then you will be pleased with your stay at this Comfort Inn.

title: EXELENTE HOTEL
text: Exelente hotel tanto en los servicios que ofrece, la calidez del personal sobre todo de las personas que estaban en la mañana Karina  Lopez y Ron Retamales, la ubicacion , las comodidades todo! lo super recomiendo!

title: Convenience + affordabilty = great value
text:
Yes, the rooms at Comfort Inn TSW are small.  E.g., to store your clothes you will have relatively little closet or drawer space -- just a modestly sized wardrobe.  But the rooms are clean and the furnishings are up to date; wifi and coffee-maker also good.  And yes, there is but one elevator and the lobby is tiny -- but the included breakfast is good, and if all the tables are taken you are free to take some nourishment up to your room.
And just down the block is an entry to a subway station, from which you can reach all of NYC; a few steps further is the theatre district in all its glory.  In the other direction is an avenue with more dining options than you can sample in a week.
Bottom line is that our week-long stay was a pleasure.  We got an excellent rate, the service was good, and we were so close to such wonderful attractions that the size of our room and the lack of lobby space and common areas was not a problem at all.

title: Buena ubicacion
text: El Comfort Inn TImes Square West es una buena alternativa para quienes quieran visitar NYC por su ubicacion a dos cuadras de TImes Square y a una cuadra del ingreso del Subway y a media cuadra de Hell's Kitchen donde esta la zona de restaurantes pero el hotel deja bastante que desear en cuanto a su limpieza y organizacion. Como es un hotel chico, hay solo un ascensor asi que puedes encontrar cuando subes del desayuno el carro de las toallas y limpieza. El lugar para desayunar es bastante chico para la cantidad de gente que hay en el hotel, aunque ofrecen una buena variedad. La limpieza de las habitaciones deja bastante que desear, no siempre reponen amenities y no siempre queda bien limpio el baño. No es caro pero tampoco es economico. El personal de habla hispana es muy simpatico y eficiente

title: Great location, free breakfast
text:
Spent one night here in Room 401 with spouse and enjoyed our stay. Great location to subway, sights and restaurants. 

Small room, but nice furnishings. Some rooms are in the basement, o make sure when you book.

Breakfast is standard Comfort Inn fare. Breakfast room is pretty small so you may not find a place to sit.

Computer/printer in lobby.

I'd go back again.

title: vacanze a New york
text: ottimo sotto tutti i punti di vista!!! camere pulite e spaziose è una colazione strepitosa come se fossi in Italia!!! è soprattutto in qualsiasi orario la ragazza del servizio ristorazione rimpiazzava ogni cosa che finiva. ottima la posizione centrale ! consiglio al 100%

title: Breakfast sucks
text: I stayed at this hotel for a whole week room was very small but manageable, location of the hotel is great but the hotel itself was disappointing, breakfast area was clean but small for the size of the hotel and couldn't even sit down to eat breakfast in the morning due to lack of space and seating

title: Great Value next to Times Square
text: The rooms are very clean and updated but they are small.  We found the location to be ideal for going to Times Square and for the Subway.  The warm breakfast, which is included with the room, had many options.  The staff was friendly and the room was quiet.  Large Flat screen TV.  The outside of the Hotel could use a minor facelift.

title: Ok I suppose but Wouldn't go again
text:
This wasn't a cheap hotel but felt like it.  (Know its the holiday period so rooms were more but a couple of weeks later could get a 5star hotel cheaper!)

The room was small but functionable. My complaints would be:
Cleanliness - hairs in the bathroom and dusty areas of bedroom (e.g. Lamps). 
Noise - inside the hotel sound seemed to carry. I was woken by what sounded like a family argument in another room and as for the street noise, ridiculously loud! Don't expect to get much sleep.

Seemed to be big piles of duvets or sheets on the landing at all times. 
The lift was small, slow and not too pleasant. Staircase was dingy too - service staircases but all the guests were using.

Breakfast was ok, fine, nothing special but edible. Pastries, cereal, a hot plate of egg or bacon and what was good - a waffle maker. The problem was the room size, a small area with too many people in and too many tables that you couldn't walk between.

However the location was good, close to Times Square.

title: Better options out there for the Money!!
text: Yeah it's a New York hotel. ... That being said. Rooms are clean beds are comfortable however Room was EXTREMELY SMALL even by New York standards!! Breakfast served but good luck finding somewhere to sit!!  WAAAY better options in area!! Thought we'd give it a try!!!   Not worth the money!! Oh and room prices change every day!!!

title: You Get What You Pay For
text:
We stayed here for six night for free using Choice Points so I think they gave us the worst room in the hotel - the smallest room on the top floor. I know NYC hotel rooms are small but this was tiny. Barely room for the bed. There is only one elevator for 7 floors and it was very slow. My recommendation is to ask for a room on the 2nd or 3rd floor and use the stairs. You don't want the first floor because the rooms are right outside the elevator and breakfast area.

The breakfast was typical for a Comfort Inn but the eating area was very small and crowded. We only ate there once due to the crowding.

It is in a good location close to the great restaurants in Hell's Kitchen. The 42nd Street Subway stop is at the end of the block with quick access to the A, C and E lines. We walked to the three musicals we saw.

title: Excelente ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
text:
Este hotel cuenta con una excelente ubicación a pocos pasos de Times Square es muy bonito, cómodo y seguro. En el lobby tiene café, limonada y galletitas deliciosas todo el tiempo *gratis*. Las habitaciones son amplias y confortables la limpieza es impecable, cuenta con desayuno buffet de 7-10 AM delicioso y muy surtido. 
El personal es genial todos muy amables.
El precio económico para la alta calidad de este hotel. Su nombre lo dice todo es confortable en todo sentido. Altamente recomendado para cualquiera que quiera disfrutar de la gran manzana.

title: Taking your money
text: Fair warning - the hotel takes your money off your credit card BEFORE you check in.  If you want to pay cash, it takes 7-10 days to refund your credit card - still waiting a week later!!!  They said no charge on credit card taken otherwise I would not have paid cash in full at check in - now a week before Christmas I'm without the money - VERY unhappy with this hotel and chain.  When I pointed it out at checkout asking for my cash bask, I was told they could not refund my cash and would have to wait - they did not seem concerned that it was very inconvenient to be without the money period, let alone at Christmas time.  Called the main Comfort Inn corporation and all they could do was open a file and suggest that it the refund was not processed by Dec 23rd to call back.  Not impressed and we travel ALL the time as my husband works for an airline and have never had such bad customer service.

title: Economy Hotel
text: We stayed at this hotel and found it to be a good value considering it's location.  Very clean and a friendly front desk staff.  It is close to Times Square.  There are plenty of places close by to ear.m

title: a beautiful surprise!
text:
We chose this hotel for its great location: a few minutes walk from Times Square, a subway stop even close and not far from Macy's Lord and Taylor and Rockefeller Centre. We were a bit daunted when we checked in and saw the lobby as it is quite crowded and feels a bit cramped. And the halls, often had piles of clean laundry. The elevator can be a tad slow too.
But the room was clean, the bed so comfortable, the sheets felt amazing and each side of our king-sized bed had not just one, but two reading lights, one focused for when you want to read later than your partner and the other just normal. We had a room on the sixth floor which is a bit more expensive but probably well worth it, even though we did not check out any other rooms. 
The breakfast too was impressive: even a waffle maker and scrambled eggs, bacon one day and sausages the next, fresh fruit, orange juice and everything else one would expect. This hotel was several hundred dollars cheaper than a more high priced hotel we usually stay at. In addition, they offer points if you become part of the hotel chain program. The staff, especially Anil, as well as Sunita and Karina, were beyond helpful calm and welcoming. They also gave us good advice on landmarks and airport transportation and were quick to attend to any unusual needs, such as wanting our room made up right away. Not only was this done, but they gave us a change of sheets too--all so quickly and professionallyl. Best, I guess, I liked the value for the price.  This is not a luxurious lobby but the rooms, location and hospitality more than made up for any deficits. The fresh cookies which are sometimes at the reception desk are delicious too.

title: Muy bien ubicado
text: Ubicado a solo cuadras del Time Square, una de las recepcionistas hablaba español y en general muy amables, habitaciones pequeñas por el costo, pero en fin alguien me dijo "Welcome to New York" donde todo es caro..

title: Clean, convenient and comfortable
text: This hotel doesn't look like much from the outside, but inside it's not too bad. Flooring in the lobby looks new. The kitchen area where they serve breakfast is slightly crowded but always looked clean during the time I was there. Only one elevator which caused back-ups from time-to-time. Front desk staff was friendly enough. Ice and coffee is available anytime. The room, #710, while small, was just fine: comfortable queen-sized bed, closet (with hangers, small ironing board and iron, and small safe), desk and a large bath. Large TV screen that displayed an average quality picture but a very limited number of channels available. While the 7th floor was not noisy, it should be noted that when walking through the halls or to the elevator, one can easily hear private conversations in other rooms. Overall, I found the room to be clean and comfortable and the location was extremely convenient. A couple of blocks to the 42nd street transit station, buses run on both 8th and 9th. Easy walk to Times Square and the Theatre District. Breakfast consisted of waffles, bacon or sausage, scrambled eggs, mini pastries, yogurt, hardboiled eggs, fruit, juices, coffee, instant oatmeal, and cereal. I would stay here again.

title: Read:
text:
This hotel was not just a complete disaster but I do want to point out a couple of things that happened to my family while we were there: 
1. When we checked in they acted like they didn't have our reservation sending me into panic mode for a second. It was actually just the front desk having new employees that obviously aren't trained yet.( we made our reservation several months ahead of time and from many states away)
2. After they figured out we did have a reservation they handed us 3 separate keys all on different floors(3 couples) one on the 1st floor which is IN the lobby only steps away from the front desk and breakfast area... SUPER noisy. We went to go in and the room was obviously not cleaned at all from where someone stayed in it. Gross. They gave us another key for the same floor. 
3. The elevator did not work when we were trying to get our luggage to our rooms. I'm 6 months pregnant and they didn't offer any help. 
4. The rooms are OK. The only thing that really grossed me out was the black long hairs on our towels/in shower. Idk what that was about. 
5. Super noisy family on our hall that kept screaming and yelling in a different language at all hours of the night.
6. The blind don't close so it is BRIGHT in the room starting at about 630.

title: Very unpleasant experience
text: I had previously given this Comfort Inn a positive review, but I am now forced to retract it, due to the unprofessional behavior of the front desk staff. I was denied entry into the Comfort Inn Times Square West, due to a mistake on the part of Priceline. The Comfort Inn front desk staff was rude, deliberately unhelpful, and ultimately failed to resolve the situation. They went so far as to mock me for not booking directly through the hotel. Then when I informed them I would be giving them a negative review, they panicked and threatened to call the police! I ended up staying at the nearby Row NYC hotel instead (which had far superior service). Hopefully, they will keep this in mind for future customers.

title: Convenient to Theatre District.
text:
We were traveling with older family and children so we were looking for a hotel convenient to theatre district. This was very close to Times Square and the theaters. Can with a decent breakfast compared to some other NY hotels I have stayed at. Also had coffee, tea and hot chocolate available all day, and cookies until they run out of the daily allotment. Comparatively priced with other New York hotels. 
They were sticklers about having the person present who made the reservation at check in. My friend who was staying with me went back to check in with her older mother who tired out and they wouldn't let her check in until I came back even though we had been there together to check luggage earlier in the day. She showed them her baggage check but they insisted I be present. I guess that is not a bad thing in NY, just be aware when traveling with a group.

title: recommended
text:
It's all a question of price / quality ratio, right? So, this hotel is not about high luxury, but it's a good deal: ideally located near Times Square, good service, large enough room with a desk, all clean and a good service. Wifi and a nice breakfast are included. I staid there 2 nights earlier this month, and I enjoyed a very friendly service.
I recommend it.
