title: DECENT BUDGET HOTEL
text:
First you have to understand this is a budget hotel. No frills here. The real appeal is the price and the location.  Close to theaters and Time Square    Me and the wife stayed here for one night so it was fine.Didn't spend much time here other then to sleep. The outside and lobby area are in need of some attention. Kinda run down. The room was small even by NYC standards but was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was a good size and was clean as well. The room had a large TV (to big for room) that did not work well at all and only got very limited channels. Our room was right off the lobby on the first floor so it was a bit noisy. Hotel offered free breakfast that was good and free coffee all day. The staff was pleasant. 
If you are looking to save money and are only here for a night or two its a good choice.

title: Great little find
text:
We were booked somewhere else but ended up here.  It was in a great location less than 5 mins from Times Square. Room was clean and comfortable and had the bonus of the free breakfast.

Would I stay here again easy answer yes

title: Buena ubicacion, hotel aceptable
text: Visite este hotel en viaje familiar, la ubicación es muy buena, tiene un buen servicio de desayuno. Las habitaciones son muy pequeñas como la mayoría de los hoteles en nueva york. La limpieza es muy mala y mas que nada en el baño. La atención en el front desk es aceptable, solamente que no te dan ni un servicio ni siquiera ayudarte a parar in taxi cuando estas cargado con las valijas. El precio es aceptable pero deberían mejorar!!!

title: Great hotel
text: Room very clean, included breakfast excellent. Location was perfect! Five min walk to Times Square. Lovely water cooler with ice/fruit in lobby at all times was much appreciated with the heat outside.

title: Bra frukost!
text: Blev en natt här innan vi skulle till en lgh som vi hade hyrt över nyår. Bra pris och tyst utanför. Hotellet ligger på en ganska så mörk gata, fast går man 100m så kommer man ut på 9th ave så det är inte så farligt.. Mycket bra frukost med mycket sött=) Goda våfflor som man får göra själv.

title: What a dump
text:
For the price im shocked. Rooms are small and antiquated, towels are old, and elevator is risky. From the front door one could tell cleaning is not high priority and I doubt the carpet in the entrance has ever been vacuumed. The tv in our room was larger than the double bed. Classified as an ADA room I doubt a wheel chair would get any farther than the front door. There was less than zero moving space in the room. Bathroom was larger than the room itself.
Won't stay here again thats for sure...

title: Ideal location
text: Rooms were small but very clean and breakfast was good.  We were close to the theater district and felt very safe in walking around.  The only thing to complain about was the parking across the street as we didn't get to park our own car and I forgot something and had to chase someone down to find my car.  We would stay there again if we go back to NYC.

title: Good value, would stay again.
text:
We were very happy with our stay here. We arrived in the city at 4am after about 24hrs of travel, so we were quite exhausted. Check in time wasn't until 3, and they didn't have any empty rooms from the night before to give us, but they did let us nap on the lobby couch like a couple of weirdos. Around noon, they had a room ready for us and let us check in, which was very nice of them. 
I liked the location, mostly because there was a bubble tea shop right around the corner and we were a reasonable walking distance from most attractions. We mostly used Lyft to get around, but since we were centrally located, we rarely paid more than $10 for a ride.
The staff was very friendly and always greeted us when we came back in from our various outings. The rooms were clean, which is always a plus. My only complaint is that the television didn't get all of the channels that were advertised in the information packet. We were pretty much stuck watching two channels all week. We were hoping we could hook up our devices to the tv and watch Netflix, but no such luck. Overall, this hotel was a great value for the price we paid, and we will strongly consider staying here for future trips to the city.

title: Clean, small rooms, friendly service
text: The rooms are small and bathrooms are tiny, but they are clean. Staff was very friendly. Free breakfast.  We would stay there again. Great Irish pub and Italian restaurant across the street from hotel.

title: Saved the holiday
text:
So we arrived in New York late one night to be told our hotel had cancelled the booking we'd made, eventually we found the comfort inn.  What can I say the staff were brilliant, very supportive, very understanding, very polite.

Okay its not the best style wise, its not the smartest one in the block, it definitely needs updating.  But in our situation we couldn't have asked for more.  

Breakfast was lush, Freshly made waffles while you waited, fresh cookies free all day to go with free hot drinks all day everyday.

The bed was remade every day, the bathroom was cleaned every day, the floor was hoovered every day. 

At the end of the day, we didn't have a fortune to spend on a hotel and we went to visit New York not to stay in the room all day and admire the walls, floors etc....

title: Mediocre and Overpriced
text:
I do not care that the location is "prime" or "in NYC", if I spend $200/night on a room, there are expectations to be met. I didn't even want to see Times Square. This stated, below is my review: 
CONS: extremely cramped bathroom; bathroom had strange stains on floor tile, bathtub was mediocre, not white enough, and needs an upgrade; the smallest bed I've ever been in since being an adult (my boyfriend's feet hung off the bed)

PROS: Shower water was HOT(good yet bad because I almost burned myself,my fault for not testing it; just a heads up); breakfast was better than I expected; not many interactions but personnel seemed helpful and attentive; the snacks downstairs were fairly priced

title: Un excelente hotel para una estadía rápida!
text:
Si deseas disfrutar New york al máximo y necesitas un lugar donde descansar y desayunar tranquilamente, esta es la opción.
Un lugar muy limpio, tranquilo, pequeño pero acogedor, con muy buena atención en front desk y el desayuno muy variado.

Tiene una excelente ubicación! Nos movimos a los lugares más importantes de manhattan caminando y está muy cerca del times square, estación de buses y también de los buses hop on and hop off y otras importantes atracciones.

Definitivamente me volvería a quedar pero compraría mi estadía con más anticipación para que no salga tan caro, sin embargo está más cómodo que el resto.

title: The trouble with people who don't travel working in the hotel industry-
text:
I arrived in NY early in the AM and my inquiry about an early check-in was denied. That was understandable as it was a Friday and the hotel was very busy. At 2 PM when I was finally allowed to check in I explained to the clerk how tired I was from traveling all night. He assigned me a room not more than 15 steps from the front desk and 4 from the main elevator. When I asked if it would be possible to change to a quieter room maybe on a higher floor I was informed they had no more rooms left, at 2 PM in the afternoon… 

Room had the same furnishings as all the other Comfort Inns do and the rest of the hotel may have been ok but my particular room was about the size of a large closet.

title: Ripoff
text:
I made a reservation at this hotel, but cancelled it more than 24 hours in advance when my plans changed. However, they still charged my credit card and refused to remove the charge. Although it was their system which failed to capture the information correctly, they are refusing to acknowledge their mistake and trying to stick me with a bill they should not charge me with.  Beware of trusting them with your credit card details!

I have stayed several times at Comfort Inns across the country, and my positive experience with those properties led me to make this reservation at Comfort Inn Times Square West.  However, this brand trust was misplaced. Do not reserve your hotel stay here.

title: Filthy with small rooms
text: I stayed here for two miserable nights.  When I checked in, the front desk was very nice and I was processed immediately.  I went to my room via elevator.  You feel as though the elevator could stop working at any moment.  I go into the room and pull the covers back like usual, checking to make sure the sheets and blankets appear clean.  The mattress pad was filthy.  It appeared as though someone put their filthy feet up against the side of the mattress and pad and their feet were filthy.  I asked to be moved right away.  The second room was a slight improvement but I still had a really uncomfortable feeling about the cleanliness.  If you are interested in a room close to the theater district but aren't concerned about the cleanliness or size of room, this is the hotel for you.

title: 위치 좋은 호텔
text: 타임스퀘어와 극장가가 가까운 호텔. 주변에 쉑쉑버거와 기념품 상점들이 많으며 늘 사람들로 붐비는 곳. 위치는 좋지만 방은 좁고 약간 냄새도 났음.

title: Horrible customer service
text: I called at 5:06PM to cancel a reservation for the following day. Was told that I would need to speak with a manager and that I would need to call back the next day. I called this morning and spoke with Sunita, manager. Explained that this is business travel and that the plans had changed. She was completely rude with me on the phone and told me that I would not be able to cancel since I did not call 24 hours in advance. I explained that I tried to do this yesterday and she still refused to cancel the room and told me they were completely booked and still holding this room for me. I explained that they should have cancelled it yesterday when I called and they would have still been able to resell it. I sincerely doubt that room will sit vacant tonight if rooms are in such high demand and now they will get double the revenue for that room. HORRIBLE customer service...I will NEVER book a room at this location again! Buyer beware!!!

title: Location, location, location
text: Have stayed in Comfort Inns elsewhere.  This one was the smallest per room but then, it's one block away from many theaters and restaurants and 2 blocks away from time square so the location is perfect!   Room was very clean but tiny, bed was very comfortable.  Breakfast is included and the staff is very friendly.   This Comfort Inn is about $50-$100 cheaper than the cheapest in the area and again, location, location, location!  Would stay here again if in wanted to be in the theater district!

title: Good experience
text:
All comfort inn are the same style but this one was smaller. Good service, reasonable price, near Times square, polite staff and ...
These are good points I experienced there last April.
The breakfast is quite good

title: Location/Value/Service
text:
Making a quick trip to NYC to see my oldest son, my daughter and I stayed at the Comfort Inn Times Square West for one night.  The location of the hotel was perfect - close enough to Times Square, but yet far enough away from the crowds.

The rooms were clean and size sufficient for our needs.  Great value for the price in comparison to many others.

By far, the service was the best that I have received in a long time.  We arrived at the Comfort Inn at 7:00 am.  Knowing that we would be unable to check in at that time, the front desk employees, led by a gentleman named Anil, greeted us at the hotel by agreeing to store our luggage, providing us a place to freshen up after a long ride to the city, as well as offering us coffee, all making us feel welcome and very special upon our arrival.

Later in the day, Anil checked us in - was very professional, courteous, and one again, willing to go above and beyond by offering to store our luggage the next day past the normal requested pick-up time, as he was working the later shift the following day. He was willing to take personal responsibility to assure that we would be able to enjoy a full day by not being burdened by having to carry our luggage well into the evening.  Again, he went above and beyond to make sure our stay at the Comfort Inn was an enjoyable one.

Therefore, because of location, value, and most of all service exemplified by employees like Anil, made our stay memorable.  Thanks to all the hard-working employees at the Comfort Inn Times Square West.  The pride you take in your job shines through.

We will be back - Thank you, Anil!

title: loved New York
text: Wonderful trip for my bestie and I. Stayed here for a couple of days prior to boarding a cruise.  Experience was a wonderful one.  Staff was sooooooooo very helpful with everything. Breakfast was great, and time square was just around the corner. Felt very safe in the neighborhood

title: Great location, friendly staff, rooms are small
text: Great value for being just two blocks from Times square.  Easy location to walk around midtown Manhattan.  Breakfast is included, with scrambled eggs and bacon or sausage, make your own waffles, cereal, pastries, bagels, juice, coffee, etc.  Nice big-screen TV on wall.  Really good 24-hour coffee machine in lobby brews on demand.  Convenient parking across the street, hotel discount rate was $30/day (garage will park it for you, not park & lock).  Just one elevator, though, for 7 stories, gets slow at congested times.  Also, location just 6 blocks from Lincoln Tunnel avoids too much driving in congested NYC streets.  We really enjoyed our 4-day stay.

title: Good location. Good price. Highly recommended.
text: We went to NYC in Columbus Day break. Most hotels in Manhattan are quite expensive and we didn't want to spend that much on Manhattan hotel so we chose Comfort Inn. The room was big and clean and the location was great --- convenient to go to theaters and Times Square. It was a great experience!

title: Reasonable price for a clean place
text: Manhattan hotels are expensive, but if you can get a place that is clean, well maintained and cheery, at least you are getting something for your dollar. This place does that, and I do not think you can accomplish it for less $$. The room was small, but well maintained. Decent bath. Bed was comfortable, AC worked well. Front desk staff, especially Anil and Karina, were very helpful. Breakfast was very good, expansive choices, although located in a small area right in the lobby that got quite crowded as the 10 am breakfast deadline approached (eat at 7:30 and you dine alone!). There is no parking.

title: Never Again
text: If I could give this hotel a zero rating, I would. We reserved two adjoining rooms, one of which was supposed to have two beds. Upon checkin, we were told these rooms weren't available. We were given two rooms on different floors, one bed each, and charged more than the booking was supposed to cost. One of the rooms was extended for an additional night, under a second reservation. At checkin, the front desk printed two forms, one for each reservation, and charged our credit card. When it came to the day that we had switched to the one room for a single night, the front desk told us there was no reservation for that night. They lost the paperwork from when we checked in. They forced my friend to put her credit card down again, otherwise our things would be thrown on to the street. The night manager raised her voice, told us it was our fault, and refused to acknowledge that she lost the records of us being charged. Now we have to wait until the credit card gets charged twice and dispute the charges. On top of this whole debacle, there was absolutely no room service. We asked for towels and never got them. Room service never came to tidy up, and the handicap accessible room just barely fits code. A wheel chair only fits halfway into the room. This stay was a complete nightmare and I will never be using a Comfort Inn again.

title: Was OKay
text: Arriving into our room we found possible public hair on the toilet and drain with mould and cracks near the shower. We wanted to change room as this was quite disgusting. They said there wasn't any other available rooms at the type we had and would charge us extra for a new room. We denied to pay extra as the issue wasn't our fault. However, the decided to waive the cost and allowed us to stay in another room. We had lost a couple of hours over this and we were tired and stressed enough as it is. But from that point on our stay was good. Location was perfect and the breakfast was good. Service despite the issues we had they very friendly and calm. I would stay here again.

title: Excelente relación precio calidad
text: Lo recomiendo, excelente servicio de desayuno. Hablan español. Lo único para criticar es que tienen un solo ascensor para todo. Lo demás... Café, chocolate todo el día, las 24 hs a pasos de Times Square

title: Buena relación precio calidad
text:
Lo bueno: ubicación, muy cerca del timé square. Desayuno, no es gran cosa pero suma mucho. Limpio. No es caro.
Lo malo: resulta un poco chicas las habitaciones. El hotel tiene sus años, consecuentemente hay cosas propias de los años. Le pongo 7 puntos. De volver seguramente estaría entre mis opciones.

title: Not happy
text: Not happy with my stay had to get my let activated six times! Saw a roach in my room on the last night of my stay, typical New York! Staff very friendly, hot water issues in bathroom but conveniently located close to Times Square. I probably will not stay at this location again.

title: Semester i New York
text:
Mitt i Manhattan , två kvarter från Time Square , lugn område . Trevlig personal . Frukost inkluderat , är en bra start på dagen , toast , kaffe , te , juice , ägg , bakom , frukt , kakor , yoghurt , mjukost , sylt . Bra Wi-fi . Bodde på 5 vån hörde inte ett ljud utifrån . Time Square ligger mellan 42/7 Hotel ligger mellan 44/8&9 
Åker gärna tillbaka till den här Hotelet!

title: OK stay
text:
Room was typical New York size. Small but enough room to sleep.
The a/c was noisy. The unit did not make a uniform sound so it kept me up. I was able to fall asleep with ear plugs.
Not sure I will be back given the amount of options in New York.

title: Bon emplacement!
text: Très bien comme hôtel pour passer 2-3 jours à new york. À côté de Times square donc proche de tous, permet de marcher et rentrer tard sans problème! Stationnement payant juste en face si on arrive en voiture.

title: Location Location Location!!
text: This hotel is located not too far from Times Square. It is in a really nice location of what I believe is the Theatre District. It was the perfect stay for a birthday weekend in New York. The customer service from the hotel employees was great. They also have cookies and ice water for hotel guest in the front lobby. The room was relatively small but the perfect size for a couple. It included a small closet, desk an chair as well as a refrigerator. I will admit it was nice and quiet and I do not remember hearing anything outside of our room door. The place was decorated nicely and the linen was nice and fresh. They offered a nice breakfast which included waffles, yogurt, boiled eggs, sausage, muffins, cereals and pastries. The location of this place is great and convenient if you are looking to see a show, concert or play.

title: Nice place to stay
text: Great location and is within walking distance to several attractions. The staff friendly and helpful.  The room was comfortable, breakfast good, and wifi works great.  Hotel was clean and well maintained.

title: Hôtel qui "fait le boulot"
text: Cet hôtel "fait le boulot": les chambres sont correctes, tout comme le petit déjeuner compris dans le prix (correct lui aussi). L'accueil est sympathique, et la localisation parfaite, car proche de 2 stations de métro aux lignes complémentaires. Bref, une bonne adresse sur NYC mais qui ne fait pas rêver.

title: Hotel Super Practico
text: Es un hotel sumamente recomendable por tres motivos: no es caro, la ubicación es excelente (a cuadra y media del subte que te lleva a todas partes y a dos de Time Square) y el desayuno es completísimo, Las habitaciones no son muy grandes pero estan correctas, ya que uno solo las usa para dormir, despues de andar todo el dia paseando. Sin duda volvería a ir.

title: Perfect place to visit Manhattan!
text: Rooms comfortable and clean. We stayed on the 7th floor and we could see Times Squares signs... Good breakfast with several types of food: bagels, bread, waffles, fruit, etc. Staff very helpful and always ready to give instructions. Good value for money

title: Great location, great price!
text: We stayed for 3 nights and were nicely surprised with this hotel. On arrival our documents were all ready and we went straight to our room. Complimentary cookies were a nice touch especially for the children. The room was very narrow but we didn't spend much time in it anyway. Clean, tidy and in good condition. Complimentary breakfast was a bonus and although very crammed in the morning was nice to be able to grab a quick bit before venturing out. Location was great and only a few blocks from the heart of Times Square!

title: Good price, perfect location, decent hotel.
text:
Stayed here for the first time recently and it was a good hotel for the price in a great location.  First my normal disclaimer for those who aren’t used to staying in Manhattan.  Hotel rooms everywhere in NYC are small. If you've not stayed in a big city before, this is something you're going to have to accept. Space is at a premium everywhere and that includes hotel rooms, so don't expect tons of space to sprawl out, a huge bathroom, or much closet space – unless you’re willing to break the bank, they don’t exist!

Location was great for doing a lot in Midtown/theatre district.  It’s on 44th between 8th and 9th – really close to a lot of things (and a subway stop at the end of the block) while being on a block that’s normally slightly less crowded than others.  I say normally because when we were there, we found out that Biden was staying down the block from us and the street was full of various cop cars, ambulance, and official vehicles.  It was interesting to see all this, but I digress, let’s just say it’s generally a really good location. 
The room was fine – we had a room with two double beds.  We had a small fridge, coffee maker, and a desk.  There was a tiny armoire to put a few clothes in, it also had a safe and iron.  The bathroom was nice, looked recently updated.  We had a couple problems with the bathroom – the showerhead really didn’t work well and the hairdryer was dead.  Thankfully, when we reported these, each were replaced very quickly and without question. Our room faced 44th which was normally fine, except one night when I was awoken with horns and sirens (assuming it was something to do with the VP’s visit – see above). We were a few floors up from street level, but I will point out that there are some rooms right off the lobby next to the elevator as well as some that seemed like they were garden-level.  I’m glad we didn’t stay in one of those rooms, as I imagine they could get noisy.  The elevator was a bit slow and wobbly, we ended up just taking the stairs most of the time. 

The lobby was compact, but tidy.  My main issue with it was the smell.  It was a very strong smell of what seemed like some kind of industrial cleaner.  I’m glad they kept it clean, but the smell was a bit too much for me.  When we were there it was very hot outside, so I wonder when it’s nicer if the door can be opened and let the smell out.  Breakfast was included daily and served in the lobby.  It was mediocre, but it was ‘free’ so I’m not complaining much.  Two types of make your own waffles, some breakfast meat that changed daily (microwave bacon, sausages, etc.), eggs, breads, sweets, yogurt, and more… In the afternoon, the lobby also had fruit-infused water and cookies which were a nice touch.  

Everyone we interacted with that worked there was very nice.  They were friendly and willing to help.  One remembered that mentioned we were going to a show and when we returned she asked us how it was.  If you drove in, you can self-park across the street.  The hotel will give you a sticker so you only pay $30 per day.  Note that there are no in and out privileges and if you’re a few hours over you may be charged an extra day’s rate (both of which are common at most garages in town). Overall, it was a good hotel in a perfect location if you’re seeing shows or doing other touristy things midtown/Times Square.  Given the location, it’s a good hotel for the price point and I’d consider staying here again.

title: Great price for the location
text:
Just a few minutes walk to Times Square, easy walk to Central Park, lots and lots of places to eat and drink nearby. 

Standard comfort inn rooms, they were clean if a little on the small side. Not that it matters as you are out enjoying NYC most of the time anyway. 

Had one minor issue when we came back from a very busy morning/early afternoon walking the city and found the cleaners still in our room. We asked them nicely if they could just leave everything as it was so we could collapse in our room but they refused to leave. One of them was also using our phone charger, which was fine but a little odd. We had to call the front desk so they could ask the cleaners to leave. 

However that was one small blip in an otherwise perfect stay. The breakfast was good - very American, waffles, eggs, doughnuts etc. The staff were very helpful and they let you leave your bags there if you have time between arriving and checking in. 

There is a car park across the road too. We booked a space online, but were told afterwards that if we had said we were hotel guests we could have got a discount. 

Would stay here again.

title: Great value. Great location.
text: If you are looking for a conveniently located hotel near Times Square without breaking the bank, this is a great choice!  You will not get a lot of frills but you will get excellent customer service, free breakfast, short walk to Times Square and all the necessities to have a great stay in NYC!  My family spent 6 nights here and would definitely visit again for the value!

title: Hotel bom
text: Fiquei hospedada uma noite noite nesse hotel, ele fica super bem localizado, o café da manhã é excelente, com sucrilhos, waffles e tudo que tem direito! Apenas o quarto deixa a desejar, muito pequeno, cabe praticamente só as camas e duas malas grandes. O banheiro também e bem pequeno. Não sei se me hospedaria novamente apenas pelo tamanho do quarto, achei meio sufocante.. Atendimento muito bom, servem cookies na recepção.

title: Bonne adresse pour un court séjour
text: Un hôtel bien situé avec possibilité d'arrivée tardive si l'on prévient avant (utile quand  le vol arrive tard). Literie confortable petit déjeuner copieux en buffet avec du choix. Parfait pour un court séjour.

title: Small but adequate
text:
Trying to fit into a 'family room' was difficult as the rooms are cramped and there is very little space to move with two double beds filling most of the floor space. The staff managed to move us to a slightly larger room (even numbered rooms are larger than odd numbered ones) but the size of room could cause difficulties for some guests.
However, the room and bathroom was clean, the beds were very comfortable and the air conditioning effective. Noise from the streets was not too noticeable (we were on the 11th floor).
Staff were helpful and friendly and the free breakfasts were a welcome bonus though, again, the breakfast room is very small and was always crowded.
If you can accept these negatives, then the hotel's positive aspect is its location, being very close to many major attractions; Empire State Building, 5th Avenue, Grand Central Station and, a bit further away, Central Park and the Metropolitan Museum.

title: Good Clean hotel at a great location
text: Stayed for the second time at this New York hotel. Great location. Waking distance form the 44th street exit of Port authority Metro station. The A route from here takes u to JFK. Close to Times square. Good hot breakfast. Helpful front desk and Staff. Room carpet needs a change. Pressure in the shower could have been better.

title: Adequate for a Plan B
text: When our usual hotel in the Times Square area was full, we booked here based on the combination of location, price and our familiarity with the Comfort Inn brand.  The price was indeed very good for the great location, and there were some other good points as well.  We found the room clean and tidy, and all the equipment (including Wi Fi) worked well.  Plenty of towels.  But there were significant drawbacks too.  Prime among them was the truncated, stingy lineup of channels on the cable.  No HGTV (no House Hunters), no MSNBC (no Morning Joe), no Food Network (no Chopped), no Comedy Central (no Daily Show).  Very frustrating.  Also, there was no dresser in the room because the dimension of the room did not provide enough space between the foot of the bed and the wall.  Consequently, there were no drawers to put dirty clothes in, forcing us to put the dirty clothes back in the suitcase.  There was a small desk but it was not usable because the mini-fridge was located under the desk where your legs should go.  Breakfast selection was quite good but the scrambled eggs were overly salted and many of the pastries were seriously stale.  Still, hotels with this good a location generally cost $100 more, so whether you'll be happy depends on whether the defects are worth saving $100/night.  For me, because of the cable offering, it will never be more that a reluctant Plan B.

title: fabuloso hotal
text: el hotel esta en el corazon de la gran mazanzana a una cuadra de los teatros y a dos de times square,el hotel esta bien ubicado cerca de todo pues recorres a pie todo lo emblematico de nueva york.no dudaria en regresar al hotel lo recomiendo mucho

title: A mixed bag
text:
I'll start with the positives - really great location, decent breakfast (although the area where you get the food is very crowded so people kept bumping into each other), good price for a NYC hotel.

However, the cleanliness of the bathroom leaves a lot to be desired.  The toilet and sink area were fine, but the shower did not look clean at all.  There was noticeable mildew in the cracks and the floor of the shower looked dirty and dingy, so much so that my daughter refused to take a shower when we were there. 

You can hear very clearly what is happening in the hallway from your room, so that was annoying as we were situated near the elevator and I was woken up several times each evening and morning by people talking in the hall as they were waiting for the elevator.  Obviously the hotel can't control people's behavior in the hall, but just be aware that it can be noisy.

Also be aware that while the hotel is nice enough to hold your bags for you after you check out so you can continue to explore the city, they will only do this until 6 PM.  This was very inconvenient for us as our flight was not until 11 PM.

I don't think I would stay here again.

title: Ótima localização, serviço básico
text: O hotel tem o essencial. Bom café da manhã, quartos limpos diariamente, banheiro limpo. Atendimento na média. A localização é, sem dúvida, o melhor. A duas quadras da Times Square e na rua da Broadway. Definitivamente a melhor escolha.

title: Weekend in NYC
text:
Hotel was nice, the front desk people was very nice, breakfast was good, bed was comfortable. Walking distance to Time
Square which we loved. A lot of nice restaurants to choose from. We used an über for transportation this was my first time,and it was a great experience. 
The hotel is like twelve minutes to Grand Central Station. We would stay at this hotel again. 😉 oh and my boys love shopping lol

title: Overnight getaway
text: This was a very nice hotel. Breakfast was great and friendly staff. However, they don't need to have rooms in the basement of the hotel. That was a bit uncomfortable and I didn't really feel safe but otherwise everything was ok.

title: Ideal location and cost
text: The hotel has been my choice for my last 3 visit's due to its cost and location which is so close to Times Square yet not too busy. As I only sleep in the hotel for a short time I don't need to be in a fancy hotel paying more than twice as much as I'm around this amazing city trying to see as much as I can while I'm here. Don't expect too much but the hotel is very clean and if your not happy with anything let the staff know as they always sort it out as I've found. Good typical American food for breakfast which is included in the cost £175  a night (approx) can't go wrong for here.

title: Perto do fervo!
text: Bem perto da times square! Foi prático para chegar da estação de trem e também para pegar o onibus para o aeroporto. Café da manhã delicioso para os padrões americanos. Fiz meu primeiro waffle lá! Adorei!

title: Great home base
text: Great location to explore downtown New york, with a soild free breakfast. The breakfast has the make your own waffle setup which is always must. Your only a few blocks from time square, and a block from the metro. Broadway is right there, it's off a quiet street so no loud at all. Everything you want to do is woth in walking distance,or a quick metro trip away. Clean rooms, friendly staff. Will be back again next year.

title: Great deal, impeccably clean
text:
I wanted to take my two kids overnight to NYC but almost had to change my plans because I could not find a reasonably priced hotel with good ratings--until I discovered this hotel.  I booked a room with two double beds for $197 (thanks to my AAA discount)--while every other Times Square hotel I looked at was in the $300-450/night range.  Apparently it is men's fashion week and prices elsewhere were very high.

We arrived early and even though our room wasn't ready, were able to check our bags while we headed out.  Once we returned, check-in was fast and easy with very friendly staff.

Our room was spotless and the beds were comfortable.  It was on the small side but was actually bigger than other some other NYC hotel rooms I've stayed in.  We were in the front on the second floor and had the air conditioner running all night but had no issues at all with noise from the street.

Having breakfast included is a huge bonus in an expensive city.  The breakfast area was small and crowded but the food and coffee were certainly more than adequate.

Overall, the hotel was a really pleasant surprise.  It is in a good location--close to the subway and to some great sites and restaurants.  This just may be my go-to hotel in NYC from now on!

title: Excellent value, great location!
text:
This is the second time I've stayed at this particular Comfort Inn. The location is great -- on 44th street, near Times Square, but a little to the west, and therefore quieter. Very courteous staff, clean rooms, excellent breakfast buffet (included in the room price). 
I never stay at the fancier hotels because they're much more expensive and don't include breakfast.
The hotel is right across the street from a large parking facility, and, with Comfort Inn's validation, 24 hours is only about $30.

title: Buen hotel, personal muy amable, bien ubicado.
text: Termine en este hotel porque en el Comfort Inn Central Park habian sobrevendido las habitaciones. Nos atendieron muy bien. Lindas habitaciones aunque pequeñas.El personal es casi todo indu pero hablan bien ingles. El desayuno es muy bueno y variado

title: High value hotel with very good service
text:
The hotel is small, and the rooms are understandably small given NYC and the location.  They were comfortable though; my two kids and I were fine in a room with two double beds.  

The staff was helpful when we arrived, and when we checked out, offered to keep our bags in a safe location until 6:00PM that night, so we could spend the rest of the day seeing the city.

The hotel offers free breakfast; I appreciated the free coffee / hot chocolate throughout the day, and being able to fill our water bottles with ice and cold water there as well.  I'll definitely consider this hotel on future visits to NYC.  If traveling alone, it seems like a no-brainer! :)

The location is within walking distance to Times Square, Empire State Building, Rockefeller Center, and many subway stops.  There is also a parking garage directly across the street.  Hotel guests can park there for $32 for a 24 hr period, which I thought was a great value as well.

title: Great location and clean!!
text: Just one block off Times Square.  Can't beat the price and free breakfast that consists of waffles, eggs, a meat, cereal, bagels muffins, etc  All the people that work there are so nice from the people at the ck in desk, the ones that cleaned our room and the young lady that kept the eating area stocked and clean.  We always got to breakfast around 8:45 and they never ran out of anything.  This is the second time I have stayed at this Hotel and just love it.  Highly recommend.

title: Muy buena ubicaciòn y desayuno
text: el hotel es muy recomendable. tiene una muy buena ubicacion, buena atencion y un abundante servicio de desayuno dìassrio. las habitaciones son muy amplias, acondicionadas, poco ruido.  Volveria y recomendaria sin dudarlo

title: Very close to Time Square
text: Breakfast has a nice variety.  Breakfast area is small.  Close to lots of restaurants, bars and Pubs.  Close to other attractions to visit.  Metro Subway is close to get around.  The elevator is very slow.  House keeping is slow too.  Our room was cleaned after 3:30 pm everyday.  rooms are small.  Had a microwave and Small refrigerator in the room.

title: Sleep shower and shave, but don't sleep late!
text: Convenient location but, If you want to sleep late be prepared to clean your own room..only one housekeeping service early morning! Frustrating and unhealthy..with so many tourist whom come through...then when service was done the next day..still needed toilet paper..not Cool when you gotta go! Great location needs a lot of attention and a quicker elevator..we won't be back😒✌️BTW coffee was faulty too!

title: Clean and close
text: We were a bit worried since this hotel was cheaper than others in the area but other reviews said it was clean so we booked it. It was very clean and the staff was very friendly. It had a good breakfast. The quarters were tight but we didn't spend much time in the room anyway. My only complaint was that it was a bit noisy. We were awakened one morning with two women arguing very loudly in the street out front. Next time I will ask for a room in the back.

title: Nice and Quaint!
text: We were in town on business and this was a pleasant stay for us. It's small, but welcome to NY!  We were only there to sleep, so it worked out nicely for us. It is located close to Times Square, the Theater District, and Shake Shack!  Would definitely stay here again!

title: Clean room and nice staff.
text: When I arrived the staff was helpful and nice.  I arrived 4 hours before check in. I was presented with the option to check my bags in and return at check in time to access my room. I left my bags and came back during check in time . I was very satisfied with the service i received. The hallways, elevator, rooms and bath rooms were very clean. The bed felt excellent, and the pillows were very comfortable.  The bedding was prepared neatly and the refrigerator was cleaned. i give this place 5 stars and will return on my next visit to NYC.

title: Vacanze a New York
text: Ottima posizione per spostarsi a New York, colazione a buffet molto completa e ottima qualità, camere molto pulite! Ottimo hotel vicino anche alla metropolitana , silenzioso ma ben curato, lo consiglio anche a famiglie con bambini ottimo per avere tutto a portata di mano x gira New york

title: Excellent Hotel -- Stay HERE!!
text: We were a little worried about this hotel, because it was less expensive than most others in the Times Square area. We had no need to be worried! It was GREAT!! Our room was small, but we didn't spend much time there, so it fit our needs very well. It was CLEAN and smelled good, and the free breakfast had a huge variety including eggs and sausage and make-your-own Belgian waffles. The staff was very helpful and extremely friendly. The only reason I didn't put five stars is because it is a bit noisy. We were on the side of the hotel facing 44th street, and on the 5th floor. We were awakened one morning very early by a disturbance in the street. If we stay there again, we might ask for a room on the back with less street noise.

title: Vale pela localização
text:
Como hotel deixou um pouco a desejar, não tem freegobar no quarto.
O café da manha que é incluso, não é la essas coisas, o espaço é minusculo, nao tendo lugar para sentar ( tem uma mesa grande comunitaria) e é uma bagunça!
Tive muitos problemas no pagamento do hotel, debitaram um valor a mais do combinado e quando tentaram reverter a situação, acabaram debitando 2 vezes! Tive meu cartao bloqueado na viagem por conta disso

Unico ponto positivo que achei foi a localização! A pé a poucos minutos da times square!

title: Opiniões sempre são muito pessoais... Eu não recomendo
text: Escolheria ficar apenas em caso de necessidade. Pelo preço, realmente não vale o quanto pesa, acredito que existam melhores opções em Manhattan. Instalações mal cuidadas, precisam atenção com a manutenção. Ar condicionado sem limpeza e com um baita cheiro de mofo. Concordo com outros avaliadores apenas no item localização, que realmente é muito boa. Sobre o café da manhã incluso: ajudou a amenizar a experiência.

title: NYC visit
text: Very clean, but tight quarters. We had a basement room; but it had a view of the outdoors, just not scenic. Two double beds with a flat screen TV. The staff members were quite pleasant. The breakfast was standard fare for hotel breakfasts, but plentiful and good. The location provides easy access to subway system, restaurants and theaters. Times Square is only a few blocks away. Be prepared to walk.

title: Great Location and Helpful Staff
text: I selected this hotel for the location and price. I was not disappointed. The room was not large but not as small as some reviewers indicated. The bed slept good and the tap water tastes good. I traveled to NYC with my daughter to watch some shows and ended up seeing so much more. The hotel has a subway station on the same block and Times Square is literally 2 blocks away. We walked to the shows and rode the subway to Downtown and Tom's Restaurant (Seinfeld fame.) I will come back to this hotel.

title: Good Value
text: Good location two blocks from Times Square. The rooms were very small but clean and comfortable. The price included breakfast. The dining area was very clean the breakfast was plentiful, fresh and diverse. The attendant even made waffles for us. The whole staff of the hotel was friendly. I would go back to this hotel.

title: Excellent Value Hotel
text:
The hotel is very close to times square & subway station ( 2 blocks away). Hotel is neat and clean, staff is friendly, offers free wi-fi and breakfast. Breakfast is high quality - waffles, scrambled & hard boiled eggs, bacon, cereal, fruits, juice, coffee & tea etc.

Check in 3PM, check out is 11AM but you can store luggage.

Rooms are smaller than the average size hotel rooms but were neat & clean, bedding done and smelled fresh. 

Parking is across the street and I paid $30/day for a sedan. Bigger vehicles pay more.

title: Ideal location, clean, cramped, inexpensive, good value, includes full breakfast, front of street noisy
text:
This hotel is located ideally within easy walking distance to the restaurants in the Hells Kitchen area of west New York City, and Times Square/Broadway Theater district.   

We used our Comfort Inn credit card points accumulated on stays at Comfort Inns to get two 'free' nights here April 30 and May 1, using  comfortinn.com.    

Arrived here at 730pm on a Friday, taking a taxi from JFK airport, after a long cross country flight from SFO.  

44th street is a one way, one lane street, with all parking spaces on both sides of the street completely filled, making it difficult for the taxi to find a spot to stop and drop off passengers.

If you are arriving with a car, you will have to pay up to $38 per 12 hours to park it in the garage up the street, with the 12 hours expiring at 12pm and 12am.  The 44th street Edison parking lot has deals for longer periods of time -check parkfast.com.

The hotel is right on 44th street, seven stories tall with about 9 rooms per story, except for the ground floor which only has about 5 rooms.  So it is a small hotel, run by some very courteous and helpful Asian Indians.  

The wife and I staggered in at 730pm with our luggage, having awaken at 4am to catch the shuttle to SFO.  The hostess smiled behind the counter and  offered us freshly baked complimentary chocolate chip cookies for us starving guests -we flew American Airlines which doesn't offer a real in flight meal, just snacks and sandwiches on the 6 hour flight.

Didn't remember her name, but the hostess was extremely helpful in all aspects of our stay, even directing us to the nearest decent restaurant -right across the street -the entire area for blocks around is full of restaurants, with Times Square/Broadway theater district only a 7 minute walk.

We got room 605, and got on the single rickety, slow elevator with torn up tiles on the elevator floor, for the ride to the 6th floor.  This was the only item which was subpar -everything was clean, modern and tidy looking.

When we opened up our room, we got a king size bed with a large sliding window with a view directly in front of the hotel on 44th street -the window opens about 5".  

Clean and relatively new carpet, and comfortable to walk on.  

You want to get a room as high as you can, if you are facing the front of the hotel, due to traffic noise -NYC drivers lean on the horn a lot, noise from night clubs nearby, and the neon lights in front of the hotel.     

The bedroom area was approximately 8' x 14', with a 2' area around the sides and end of the bed to walk around.  Small external wooden closet, desk, desk chair but no dresser, except for a single drawer at the bottom of the closet.   Dorm size Refrigerator, Electronic safe and 40" flat screen cable TV on the wall in front of the bed.  Free Wifi, good enough to read e-mail, but too slow for videos.  Comfortable bed/pillows, with black out curtains.  No noise from the neighbors.

Room is cozy, with no sitting chair, and little room to put one's luggage.  But by New York City standards, the room was adequate in size, especially for a budget hotel.  Quiet but powerful AC/heater next to the window, although outside temperatures never reached 65 while we were there. 

 Across the street is a series of single story businesses, with skyscrapers on the other side of the block, so there is some degree of privacy with the curtains open on the single sliding window.   

Bathroom is approximately 6' x 8', and includes a bathtub -didn't expect this!  Bathroom is so small that the open door barely misses the toilet.  Long bathroom granite sink, very clean, with vanity mirror the length of the bathroom.  Forget something -downstairs will give you a free toothbrush, toothpaste, floss, comb, etc.   

Rooms in the back of the hotel, including the first floor open up on a courtyard, and would be quieter, but without the view of the front facing rooms.   Avoid getting a room on the first floor due to noise from the lobby and breakfast area. 

Full complimentary buffet breakfast with scrambled eggs and sausage or bacon, along with oatmeal, waffles, pastries, yogurt, apples and oranges, along with fruit juices.  Very unusual for a New York hotel.  Microwave available at the breakfast area next to the lobby.

Asian Indians stock the breakfast buffet, man the front desk, and do daily housekeeping -all in the family.

Subway is a block away on 9th street, a very busy 4 lane, two way avenue, where we caught a taxi on our third day to stay at West 57th Street by Hilton Grand Vacations for 5 nights, double the cost of the comfort inn hotel  -the real reason we came to New York City.

7am Saturday and 8am Sunday awakened by jack hammers working on water line across the street.   Welcome to New York City!

title: Toplage - freundliches Personal - kleines, unpraktisch eingerichtetes Zimmer
text:
Ich muss zugeben, wir haben vorher sehr großzügig in einem großen App. in Jersey City gewohnt und ich war echt schockiert über das kleine Zimmer. Ich kenne kleine Hotelzimmer, die wesentlich praktischer eingerichtet sind. Positiv: oberster Stock und hinten raus war es sehr ruhig. Auch konnten wir schon früher einchecken als üblich.
Die Lage ist super, wer es am Times Square mag und wenig Zeit hat für Sightseeing.
Das Frühstück ist ok, aber nichts besonderes. Ziemliches Gedränge und nur Plastikgeschirr. Auch der Aufzug ließ oft lange auf sich warten, da dieser auch zu Lastenzwecken vom Personal benutzt wird.
Fazit: War für 3 Tage ok. Würde mir das nächste Mal ein anderes Hotel suchen.

title: Sweet staff, depressing room
text: This is a budget hotel, so one can't complain too much.  But the bed took up so much of the room that I had to turn sideways to fit between it at the closet.  The breakfast is a nice option to have and the location is good.  But, I personally would pay $50 more to be able to enjoy the room.

title: buenisimo hotel
text: es una buen hotel nos hospedamos 4 personas en una habitacion cuadruple, Excelente precio.. y muy bien ubicado !!.. El precio esta bueno solo si van de 4 personas .. si son solo 1 no conviene mucho .. Las Habitaciones y el hotel es lindo.. los cuartos son pequeños!! pero lo vale por el precio

title: Great location!
text: We chose to have a small, modest room in exchange for a good price and great location. Every staff member we saw was pleasant and very helpful, and the facility was quite clean. Having the subway entrance just down the block was a plus. I would happily stay here again.

title: Love It
text: Staff is very friendly and accommodating, very friendly and fantastic! the breakfast wasnt all that great but it was complimentary so how can i complain haha! the location was perfect for what we needed

title: Excellent, friendly, well situated hotel, with helpfull friendly staff.
text:
I have stayed at the Comfort Inn Demonbreun St Nashville 5 times,in the past,and have all ways been satisfied,so that is one of the reasons that I ,along with my wife,and 18 yr old niece,decided to stay in the Times square Comfort Inn,along with the fact that the other 3 hotels that I contacted were more expensive,...The Staff were very helpfull and friendly,the staff that I had most dealings with were...Vibhuti..Anil...Niti..and Sunita..They were all very helpful and pleasant,as were all the others who I occasionally spoke to,When i booked in(an hour early), Vibhuti saw that i was not a Choice Hotels Member,so in fairness to her,she did the paper work and signed me up,which was really good of her..The room was on 7th floor with street view and 2 Queen beds,ample room for 3 of us.The breakfast was good,a choice of Serial..Scrambled Eggs... Boiled eggs..sausage...bacon...toast...cheese...waffles...fresh fruit...in other words,something for everyone.and the location was very central.This hotel is within walking distance to Times Square, the Port Authority, subway and many, many attractions, and most importantly, the Broadway theaters,.The Building is only 7 story's high,so I couldn't get lost in the hotel,which was a bonus.. If I ever come back to New York,i will definitely stay again,as long as the price remains competitive...Thank you for a good stay,and hopefully I will be back....

PS  I had a few evenings  eating and drinking in a bar(The American Beer Co.) which is 40yds from the hotel,and the barman,one evening asked if the hotel i was staying in was a swish, swanky, posh place, with water fountains ETC..and I replied...No,its a Nice Friendly place with nice friendly staff, that provides a good breakfast and free tea and coffee all day,along with afternoon, free cookies.....Its as simple as that..

title: Très bon hôtel vu les prix dans cette mégapole.....
text:
Accueil excellent, sympathique, personnel très ouvert et à l'écoute
Emplacement excellent proche de la station de bus central pour partir vers Washington
et proche de Times Square sans être incommodé par les bruits
Chambres sans doute assez petites mais tant pis car tout y est bien organisé
Wifi très bonne
Petit déjeuner complet
Mais surtout si vous voulez une ambiance décontractée: choisissez cet hôtel
Je l'ai vraiment préféré à un autre hôtel très luxueux certes, mais mal situé et à l'ambiance laissant quand même à désirer: "Hampton Inn Carlstadt at the Meadowlands"

title: Location is Perfect!
text: This hotel is within walking distance to Times Square, the Port Authority, subway and many, many attractions, most importantly the Broadway shows we attended (Hamilton and Aladdin).  Friendly staff, clean rooms, although they are small.

title: Great Location
text: My 2 sisters and I stayed at the Comfort Inn for 4 nights. Location was great! Close to the Subway, Times Square and Broadway. We walked everywhere from this hotel. Breakfast was excellent. Good variety of hot and cold items. Hotel room was clean and beds were comfortable. Only downside was the small room size and the rooms could use updating. Would stay there again if I went to New York.

title: Fantastic location and great breakfast. Lovely staff at Reception too. Would recommend.
text: Was delighted with this choice as its a 5 min walk from Times Square so really handy. Clean room, free wifi, safety deposit box and beautiful breakfast. We flew from Ireland and booked it through Booking.com and to our horror Booking.com did not pass on the booking so hotel staff had no record of us coming when we arrived BUT they not only booked us in for 4 nights but they gave us a room upgrade for a cheaper price. We got a larger room with a street view and 2 large kingsize beds and saved money. Thankyou so much to the 2 lovely staff on reception when we arrived on Sat 30th April. Very much appreciated. Would recommend this hotel to all. The decor is basic etc but it is clean and central and well run.

title: lovely stay, but some people lacking in customer service
text: Starting off with, I had a wonderful time in the hotel, it was clean and the breakfast was the best. The staff is mostly every helpful with directions and greetings but I did notice this lady at the front desk, I believe her name was "Niti" or "Nidi" I made sure to write her name in my diary. She seemed like lovely lady, but while passing on Saturday afternoon near front desk, I saw she was on her phone texting or doing something the whole time in a corner, while the other young boy and a couple on side were trying to work. It wasn't the only time that happened. I saw her many times, when the guests would come, she would slide on the side so she won't have to deal with them; she would just pass the guest to the co-worker working with her. She seemed very lazy and ignorant, like a low-key mean girl working there, I wanted to talk about her to the manager but I could never see the manager in the office. So I'm writing this review hopping the manager sees it and tells her about some working manner at the front desk.

title: Safe, clean, convenient
text: Great location, right near Times Square and the Port Authority subway station which makes it convenient to other areas of the city as well. Nice, clean, quiet, safe hotel for a good price. All of the staff was very friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast was very good with a large selection. Would recommend to family/friends.

title: Great choice and affordable price.
text: Great breakfasts, close to Broadway, Times Sq. many restaurants, shopping and subway. Walk to everything. Very clean and well-managed. Lots of information available for sight-seeing. Small by Colorado standards (and the great open spaces) but probably standard by NY standards.

title: 魅力が増していました
text: 2年ぶりに滞在しました。立地の良さは変わりませんが、8th Aveと44th Stの交差点にあるRow NYCホテル2階にお洒落なフードコート"City Kitchen"ができ、さらに便利になっていました。City Kitchenには一風堂のファーストフード店である「黒帯」があり、待ちなしで一風堂のラーメンを食べることができたのが良かったです。24時間提供されるコーヒー、紅茶、ホットチョコレートと、夕方フロントで提供されるクッキーがあれば、Shake ShackやCity Kitchenからのテイクアウトによる部屋での食事もさらに充実するというもの。洗面所の排水の悪さとテレビリモコンの無反応を指摘したら、翌朝には対応していただけたのも良かったです。

title: Birthday trip to New York
text: Central to many new york attractions .2 blocks from Times Square.Subway 1 block .Walk to Central Park,Koreatown,Empire state building ,5th Ave,Broadway.Smaller hotel but very clean, rooms smaller but  nice .Fridge in room .Nice king size bed . No complaints .Also very fairly priced for the value .Not many hotels in New York offer free breakfast .Really exceeded my expectations. You wont be disapointed in your choice of this hotel .

title: Très bien situé, mais attention au bruit
text:
Nous avons passé 4 nuits au Comfort times square West.
La chambre comporte 2 lits doubles petits (130 cm chaque). Pour 2 adultes et 2 grands ados (17 et 19 ans) un peu limite. La chambre est petite, il a fallu jongler avec l'armoire disponible et au dessus. avec un peu d'organisation, on s'en sort et à part les nuits, on ne reste pas dans l'hôtel. SDB propre et produits de toilette remis chaque jour. Le wifi très simple et très bon débit
A  200m du métro et surtout 400m de Times square, départ de toutes nos journées.
2 points négatifs : 
1/ le bruit : nous avions une chambre sur rue, avec une climatisation individuelle éteinte mais qui laisse passer tous les bruits de l'extérieur, bref bouchons obligatoires (bien que sans, cela n'a pas eu l'air de gêner nos ados...).
2/ le monde au petit déjeuner : 10 tables à tout casser pour 70 chambres (250 personnes environ...). Sur 2 matins, nous avons trouvé de la place mais pour les 2 autres.... et à 09h30 pile, ils commencent à débarrasser même si ils ont vu que vous attendiez depuis 30 minutes. Ceci dit, le pdj est bon en quantité et qualité.
 Du thé et du café + cookies sont à disposition dans la salle du PDJ qui jouxte l'accueil 24h/24, sympa après une grosse journée.
Par contre ils vous gardent gratuitement vos bagages (pour nous jusque 20h) et ont appelé un taxi : en fait un véhicule type "uber" grosse berline qui nous a amené à JFK pour 70 dollars tout compris, très propre et très "classe".
Bref très bien pour son emplacement pour environ 230 euros par nuit (taxes locales incluses) pour 4 avec pdj (durant les vacances de pâques). il y a moins cher mais pas si bien situé à cette période.

title: Ottima posizione
text: Ho soggiornato in questa struttura in ottobre. Posizione ottima, a due passi da Times Square. Personale cordiale, sempre disposto a dare informazioni. Colazione continentale abbondante con la possibilitá di godere di caffè e acqua durante tutto l'arco della giornata. Consigliatissimo.

title: Excellent location
text:
We stayed here in 2013 a family of 2 adults 2 teenagers 
One family room lower floor it's a bit dated but has lots of old original features very clean air conditioned rooms it can be a bit noisy but you get used to that after one night reception staff very helpful and lots of vouchers at the reception for discounts 
It's easy to get to all the main attractions
Breakfast was included and was very good we are here one night and the food was of good standard 
You have s safe in the room and free wifi

title: Great location, average hotel
text:
Hotel itself is clean and the rooms have all you need, as long as that's not space. 

Rooms are really small could barely fit a suitcase in the floor space and the door swung into the bathroom door, the bathroom door swung into the bath etc.

Staff were rude and breakfast was overcrowded.

title: Great location
text: We stayed one night and it had a perfect location.  Very close to the theaters and many eateries.  Although the hotel is not glamorous, the beds and bedding were great.  Slept very well after long day. The hotel was very quiet...a plus in a city. Rooms were an adequate  size, after all, in NYC, WHO SPENDS MUCH TIME IN ROOM. Breakfast was standard for a hotel but had something for everyone.  I would say for the price it is a good choice.

title: Good deal
text: I spend a night in there, I know it's NY and it's close to times square, but maybe the prices are a little high anyway I had. Really good attention and free breakfast and wifi wich is the best deal if your traveling.

title: Good hotel for a night at the right price
text: I've seen reviews of this hotel that mention the size of the room. The room (we had the queen) is the tiniest I've been in to date. That being said, it was very clean, had a refrigerator, free WIFI and more than enough plugs to recharge the electronics. The included breakfast in the morning was more than enough to start the day - waffles, eggs/bacon, fruit, etc. They also offer coffee and tea 24 hrs a day. it's in a good location for seeing the sites and going to the theater. The staff was very helpful and nice. We would stay there again if the price was right.

title: Excelente ubicación
text:
El hotel se encuentra en una excelente ubicación, a unas cuadras de Times Square y Broadway. Al llegar nos dieron una habitación que se encontraba a la par de el elevador y el sonido era bastante molesto por lo que solicitamos cambio y nos lo dieron sin dudar. Las habitaciones muy limpias y cómodas y el buffet de desayuno (incluido en la tarifa) muy bueno y variado.

Al ir en un grupo de 3 mujeres, la ubicación de este hotel fue lo mejor ya que no nos sentimos inseguras en ningún momento.

title: Great location
text: Close to Times Square,this is a great smaller hotel. The room was quiet and the bed was really good. Included was the usual chain hotel breakfast.For sure we will stay there again.It was close to the theatres and the restaurants. Shopping was closeby too as was the subway.

title: Accommodated large group
text:
This hotel is very conveniently located within walking distance to Times Square and the Theatre District. The street is a bit run down but felt safe never the less. 
The rooms were clean although a bit small, so if you have a large family it is something to consider. Great for 2 adults and 2 kids.
We ate the free breakfast once, it was ok. We loved to local coffee shops!

title: Good Location... Clean but small room
text: On arrival I was hesitant due to the poor condition of the front area. The lobby seriously needs a facelift and the it would not require much to improve on what is currently there...They have small plastic christmass trees in the planters !!!!!!  Check in was good and in fairness very friendly. The lifts looked like they had not been hoovered for weeks...Upon arrival in my room I was pleasantly surprised based on what I was expecting. Room was small however clean and the bed was seriously comfortable. The AC unit was very noisy and can imagine how hot it get during the summer. You can also hear allot from other bedrooms. I did not go for breakfast so cant rate it. Overall it was fine .. clean bed to lay down for the night and the rate didnt break the bank. however would not have paid any more that 140$

title: Great location, staff and breakfast
text:
STayed here for a couple of nights in March. The place is located just a short walk from Times Square and is a good base for explorers. It was not cheap overall, but was good value for NYC, if that makes sense. 

The staff were good, polite and courteous and although basic, the breakfast was pretty good to be honest. The hotel felt a little tired, but our room was clean and in good condition and for a base, that's all you need.

I can honestly say we'd have no problem booking here again.

title: Spring break 2016 NYC
text:
My husband and I took our 16 year old daughter to NYC for spring break to see the show Chicago at the Ambassador Theatre. (The show was great!) We chose the Comfort Inn Times Square for is proximity to all things near Times Square, a room with 2 beds, the free breakfast, and most of all - the price!  The hotel was an excellent choice for all of those reasons. 

The rooms are on the small side with 2 beds, but had everything you could ask for in this location for the price.  The hot and cold breakfast was great every morning, the bacon was even crisp! (which is hard to do in a warmer), they had many choices of cereals, danishes, coffee, teas, yogurt, toast, bagels, waffles, and more.  Yes, the eating area is small, but as with any hotel that serves a hot breakfast - you need to go early. However, I did see the staff working very hard up to 30 minutes past stop time to accommodate people that arrived late.  Other hotels I've stayed at would stop stocking the food 30 minutes early so they could close it down on time.  The staff was very attentive to the breakfast area and its customers. Food in this area is very expensive so this free breakfast easily saves you $15 per person each day! 

They had coffee and tea in the lobby 24/7.  The beds and pillows in our room were very comfortable, we slept great every night. Our room was on the 5th floor and faced 44th street and we were not disturbed by any noise.  I mean, it is downtown NYC, if you expect no street noise,  you are looking in the wrong city :).

Most visitors to NYC aren't staying their rooms all day, so for a place to sleep and eat breakfast, the Comfort Inn is perfect.   For the price and convenience, this hotel is just fine.

title: Good location, friendly staff.
text: I feel this hotel is grossly overpriced for what it has to offer. I booked a double room for two nights, and was told they did not have that room available on my arrival, then was placed in a 'suite" that appeared smaller than the room with two beds. Anyway, lots of confusion, the staff were friendly, the location was good. Do not accept a room on the first floor. Very noisy due to being close to the breakfast room, and guests coming down all night for whatever. I have had good luck with tripadvisor so far, was disappointed that my travel karma has run out.

title: Hotel Comfort Inn
text:
Eu adorei a experiencia nesse hotel.
Recepção excelente, quarto grande, limpo com travesseiros macios ou rígidos. s
Sim você tem essa opção!! 
 A limpeza e realizada todos os dias.
Foi encaminhada uma correspondencia para mim depois que tinha saído do Hotel,1 mês depois fui buscar e me atenderam super bem, minha correspondência estava a minha espera, foi incrível, nota 10.

title: Great location, basic hotel
text:
Stayed one night in April 2016.  Lots of positives and negatives.

Reception staff were very friendly and welcoming.  Just a few minutes walk from Times Square and Pier cor Central Line tours.  

Breakfast area by reception is small, chairs too big for dining area, chairs difficult to move to gain extra room. Only one lift, you're can wait for 10 mins or more for the left during busy times, recommend you take the stairs.   

Breakfast was good however, a great selection.  Fit for purpose if you just want somewhere to lay your head, whilst sight seeing during the day.

 If you have room overlooking 44th street, it is noisy if you open your window.  

Would stay again.

title: Good value
text: Comfortable, small room, even had fridge. Ideally located, and not too noisy considering location. Nice staff, friendly, welcoming. It's a smaller hotel for NYC and that may help. Very generous breakfast.

title: 便利なホテル
text:
タイムズスクエアに近いので選びました。ブロードウエイや地下鉄の駅も徒歩圏内で周りにレストランもたくさんあるので、場所は最高です。朝食もついているし、値段も他のホテルに比べるとお手ごろです。
唯一の欠点は部屋とベッドが狭いこと。Double bedのツインルームに泊まりましたが、Double bedの割にはベッドが狭い。部屋もスーツケースを広げる場所が十分にないぐらいでした。

title: Overpriced but this IS NYC
text: Maybe the best thing about this hotel is the complementary breakfast. Or the politeness of the staff, which impressed me. The rooms are not special by any means and, as I've found in more expensive NYC hotels, both the cable TV and WiFi are lacking. Still, the place is clean and the location is very fine; near wonderful 9th Ave. but also close to Times Square. Not cheap but nothing in New York is, and I'd stay here again (if I made my arrangements through Priceline).

title: Nice stay
text:
Reception- friendly staff. Quick service. Small area, looks like going through a refurb. Breakfast area just off reception. Free cookies. Free coffee and hot chocolate in breakfast area all day. 

Receptionist wished us a good time every time we left the hotel. 

There was only one lift. Not particularly fast and looks like it has seen better days (wood effect on floor peeling or rubbed away). 

Room - King room which roomier than I thought it would be based in reviews. Large king bed, tv, desk, cupboard with safe. Bathroom nice but small (door only just made it past the loo when opening and closing). Toiletries provided in bathroom. There were only a few rooms on each floor and walls a little thin but so much that we were disturbed. 

Area - on 44th between 8th and 9th ave. perfect for Times Square. Walkable in less than 5 mins. Major Subway interchange also on Times Square so can get around the city very easily. 

Breakfast - a decent selection of hot and cold items and juice, tea, coffee etc. Can get very busy and there is limited seating. 

Overall - a solid 3 star. Nice room in a nice location with friendly staff.

title: I will not go there again...
text:
I really have mixed feeling about our stay, but mainly NEGATIVE...
We were given room 106, which is RIGHT NEXT to the reception, this meant:
-very noisy, you could literally hear people coming back to the hotel
-you can actually smell the bacon from the breakfast inside the room! I am not kidding, this was surreal!
The room is really old fashion, carpet seems to be from last century also. Also there was a weird smell when we checked in.
The heating system is for some reason almost stuck to the bed, which was super annoying.

What we liked was: the location
What we did not really like is that when we asked for a cab, we were told it is IMPOSSIBLE to book a yellow cab, and they tried to sell us an expensive limousine service instead. Now I may be a tourist, but I know for a fact you can order a yellow cab, we had one booked by the reception of our previous hotel. I do not appreciate too much when I am not told the truth.

To sum up, good location, poor service. Even if this one is a bit cheaper than other hotel in the area, you will be disappointed by your stay, so you might as well look for alternative!

https://www.tripadvisor.fr/ShowUserReviews-g40024-d93331-r360883818-Comfort_Inn_Baton_Rouge-Baton_Rouge_Louisiana.html#

title: Ok hotel, good location??
text: The is a smaller hotel on the outer edges of what I would call the tourist area. Some great restaurants in the area. Its a budget hotel and a not so budget price. The hotel needs a serious facelift and cleaning. The only elevator was constantly in use but the cleaning staff. We found the cliental loud and rude. The area seemed to not so friendly after dark with lots of "interesting" people walking the streets. The breakfast area was kept well stocked but the staff could not keep up with the mess that the customers were making. We would not select this hotel to stay at, there are much better hotels available in nicer areas within this price range. Free Wi-Fi but low speed and a TV that seemed to work when it wanted. I am not sure about where others that rated this hotel high stayed before or compared this hotel to but this is a low quality hotel in all aspects.

title: Hotel muy bien ubicado, personal amable, mala limpieza
text: el hotel esta ubicado cerca de time square, a pocos metros de la estacion de buses, con un rental car al frente, estaciones de metro cerca y rodeado de cualquier cantidad de restaurantes y pequeños supermercados, puedes recibir paqueteria de compras por internet, en mi caso 2 paquetes llegaron 2 dias antes de mi llegada, sin problema alguno, tienen un libro de registro de paqueteria, en ese aspecto dan mucha confianza. su personal es muy amable, hay una dama en el area del desayuno, que esta extremadamente atenta a que todo este en orden y limpio, el area de desayuno es pequeña pero nunca tuve problema para conseguir puesto, desayuno es el suficiente para empezar el dia con energia, nos ofrecieron cafe y chocolate caliente todo el dia, el internet es bueno y gratis, mi habitacion era deluxe 2 camas dobles, extremadamente pequeña, se nos dificultaba transitar en ella con las maletas y cosas de compras, el baño bien, hay caja de seguridad y un micro refrigerador, mi unica queja fue la limpieza de la habitacion, 4 noches y fue decepcionante, la habitacion daba hacia la calle y habia bastante ruido, la isonorizacion era deficiente, pero estabamos tan cansados que ni nos enterabamos de nada.

title: Bad Experience
text: I booked the hotel by phone. When I arrived, I've been told that my room was not ready because of painting! then they gave me the keys of room 101, on the ground floor, right beside the elevators, and right in front of the main entrance. I had a conference the very next day. I couldn't sleep that night because of noises coming from elevators and people in lobby. the room had no fridge, no microwave, and even no closets. The next morning, I complained about my room, the manager told me to pack my stuffs, and leave the hotel at 11:00 AM so that they could find another room for me and they could move my stuffs to the new room. It was not done until 14:00 and for 3 hours I was kicking around the streets near the hotel and coming back to hotel to ask the receptionist about the room! the answer was that the manager is not in and they could not do anything till he come back. Finally they gave me the new room's keys at 14:00 and when I asked them to partially refund me the manager told me he could not do it and instead he gave me their best room. When I entered the new room it had the same condition (room 401) with the exception of a closet in the new room! Not only they did not refund me for such a bad night, but also they did not even apologize me,, albeit they did not insult me and always faced me with a big & kindly smile which made me feel more stupid internally! Strange story, No?

title: Ótimo hotel.
text:
O hotel é absolutamente bem localizado, fica na 44, entre a 8ª e a 9ª , é uma região extremamente movimentada, mas muito segura de caminhar e voltar tarde por exemplo. Há duas quadras da Times Square, e na rua dos principais teatros, como o que exibe O Fantasma da Ópera, O Rei Leão e Matilda.Tem muitos bares e restaurantes ao redor. Comer por ali é bem tranquilo, bem de esquina fica o Shake Shack, que é uma lanchonete bem famosa e lotada, é barato, bom , mas difícil é arrumar um local pra sentar, por isso, um monte de gente comprava lanche lá e comia no hotel.Tem pizzarias, Mc Donald´s, Chipotle e ainda alguns bares mais arrumadinhos e de comida natural. Os quartos diferem pelo tipo das camas, fiquei em um com King Size, cama enorme, mas quarto pequeno, porém satisfatório.Banheiro grande, com banheira e chuveiro muito bons, e sempre muito limpo! Café da manhã tem waffles, baggels, pães de forma, bolinhos doces, ovos, sausage, bacon (varia de acordo com o dia), sucos,frutas,iogurtes e cereais em caixinhas individuais, achei ótimo, visto que em NY quase nenhum hotel tem café da manhã incluso. Eles tem na recepção durante todo o dia cafés e chás como cortesia, e máquinas de gelo e bebedouros de água, tudo cortesia! Não há restaurante dentro do hotel, mas no lobby há uma área em que se pode fazer suas refeições, muita gente compra comida na rua e come ali, os frigobares não são abastecidos, então você também pode comprar a suas bebidas e deixá-las ali. O staff é em sua maioria indiano e são muito simpáticos e dispostos a ajudar. Fica próximo a muitas linhas de metrô (Amarela, vermelha, azul e roxa) e há duas quadras da rodoviária Port Authority.
Voltaria e super recomendo!

title: Increible hotel en el centro de Manhattan!
text:
Fui 2 veces a este hotel, una vez en febrero y otra en octubre, y debo decir que el servicio es excelente!! Desde la recepcion hasta un gran desayuno y wifi gratuito, el hotel lo tiene todo! La habitacion es amplia y luminosa. El baño igual, amplio y comodo.  Dan todo lo que necesitas. Hay servicio de cafe 24hs.
El desayunador no es muy grande. Conviene ir temprano.
 el personal mas que agradable.. es mi primera opcion en NY!

title: Great hotel
text:
Just returned to NYC for the second time this year, decided to try this hotel with the wife and two teenaged daughters.  Enough room in the double, was on the third floor but only one flight of stairs so did not use the lift much.  Nice hotel for a budget stop over, has everything you need, the breakfast was a useful extra and the cookies and coffee/tea was also a nice touch.

Very central location so was very happy with the stay here.

title: Excellent location, room, and staff
text:
We visited NYC to celebrate a birthday and this hotel provided the perfect location and comforts. Our theaters were a few blocks away and parking across the street was very convenient.  Carmine's was a very short walk as was Times Square and all the action there. 

We slept well in a comfortable and clean  room.  Lovely view from the window! Breakfast food and hostess were great.  Nice teas, pastry, oatmeal, eggs, etc.  

The staff was cooperative and friendly.  This hotel is fairly priced and just what is needed in the heart of the theater district!  We are thinking of a return visit soon!

title: Great small hotel free breakfast
text: Comfort inn served our 4 day vacation well. Free breakfast - hot and cold items. Free tea hot choc. Coffee and cookies. Room is small and that includes the washrooms.  Small fridge and coffee maker in room with cable tv. Front desk staff were helpful and friendly.  Centrally located close to time square and subway lines. Only negatives were very slow elevator and bathroom towels were rough. Overall would recommend Comfort Inn for travellers looking for a clean cheap accommodations!

title: Back again.  Another great time.  Such good value in a fantastic location.
text:
I have stayed at his hotel twice, both times with a college party of 40+ teenagers.  The location is just so brilliant I would stay here if I was on holiday on my own.  You are literally 2 mins from Times Square without the accompanying price tag.
The rooms are well furnished – huge king size or two double beds and the bathrooms are fitted with everything you need.  There is also a desk, wardrobe, chair, safe and mini fridge. The standard toiletries are all there but if you forget something like toothpaste, just ask at Reception and they will give you a free one.
The staff work very hard over long hours and the place is always spotless because of it. They are all really friendly and welcoming, especially those on Reception.
The real bonus is the free hot breakfast and 24hour coffee.  Just what you need after a long day out in the cold.

title: Atendeu bem as expectativas
text: O quarto é pequeno, mas possui wi-fi de boa qualidade e  café da manhã gratuitos. Café, chocolate quente e cookies ficam disponíveis o dia todo. Hotel sem grandes luxos, mas muito prático pois fica a poucos metros da Times Square e do metro.
