Quem quiser economizar com o táxi na chegada do aeroporto, pode pegar um ônibus que para na Port Authority e andar um quarteirão até o hotel. Voltaria a me hospedar nele!

title: Excellent Deal
text:
The location is perfect- a two minute walk to Times Square and right in the heart of the theatre district!  
It is clean, the beds are very comfortable (lots of pillow choices) and there is breakfast included in the price (a phenomenal value). There is 24 hr coffee and hot chocolate available in the lobby (nice to have after out walking on a chilly evening) The front desk staff are polite and helpful. There is a main (Port Authority) subway stop 2 blocks away. 
Yes, the elevator is small and so are the rooms (10 x 16 feet), but this didn't bother us as we were spending our time out viewing the city. There is also a considerable amount of street noise if your room faces 44th street, but it's a city and we soon got used to it. 
During the day and even into the evening, there are bags of laundry left by housekeeping in the hallways, but again, with the rooms being so  clean, this didn't bother us. 
   Each room has its own heater/a/c that you can control (or shut off ...or leave on fan) and the wifi is good (and free). 
   For what we paid ($120/ night - taxes included) this was a raging deal for a clean, safe perfectly located place and I will be staying here again.

title: Great Location but thats it...
text:
I always think that making an hotel review is something very subjective and kind of personal, because we all are different persons, we always came from different places, have different costumbres and see things different algo. So, i rather prefer to make a  simple list of things which i like or dislike. Hope it work for u..

*Great Location for New York first timers, just 2 Blocks from Times Square.
*The whole lobby is a complete mess now at days, they are making some arrangements and its a little chaos all around.
*The whole hotel has a very bad oddor, i think is the normal smell in NY 2 stars hotels...
*Kind of little and tight rooms.
*Nice and comfy beds.
*Short and tight space in the bathroom.
*Very well presented Hot Breakfast for a 2 stars hotel, although the room is tight too. 
*They also gave tea, Coffee and cookies for Free in the afternoon.
*Very nice and helpful staff.

First timers definetely give it a try, hotels in manhattan are expensive and not that valuables. This ones is cheap, well located and is saving u some money with the breakfast and food thing.

Hope it works for you! Enjoy NY.

title: 반지하층은 비추입니다.
text: 반지하층에 객실이 있었습니다. 복도도 좁고 불편했습니다. 창문을 열어도 도로가 위에 위치하고 있어 환경이 좋지 않았습니다.

title: Muito bem localizado
text: A localização é ótima e a recepção é bem calorosa, preço justo, você vai se sentir em casa! Nada tão luxuoso mas é aconchegante. Com certeza eu iria novamente. O café da manhã é bem servido! Tente não chegar muito tarde para o café pois os lugares são limitado, chegue cedo para não ficar esperando lugar em pé.

title: Nice staff, nice experience!
text: To spare you with what you will read a million times, let me add that this is small, compact hotel 7 stories up with small and compact rooms. They are comfortable, and provide a nice clean, modern room. The 2 DB's give you a bit more space but again measure that against your needs and price concerns. Plentiful breakfast with all the standard carbs plus eggs and either bacon or sausage. All juices, oatmeal, and muffins, croissants, and pastries. The staff is friendly and if anyone comes to fix anything, they don't speak much English but they are competent and respectable to you. If you talk to them and they don't engage a whole lot, don't take that as a negative. I will stay here again if the price is right. Parking lot right across the street gives you a $30 per night rate (as of 2/24/16) with parking receipt stamped by hotel.

title: Comfort at the Comfort Inn
text: We stayed one night at the Comfort Inn after moving out of an apartment rental gone bad.  The staff was welcoming and the rooms were clean, warm and safe.  We even got some cookies upon our arrival.  Beds and pillows felt great, the bathroom was very clean.  Breakfast was good and plentiful, included in the stay.  Price was very reasonable as well, with free wifi.  It's a small hotel, cramped space in the breakfast room and the sleeping rooms, but hey, it's New York!  Older hotel with a little wear and tear, but not bad.  In a great location, close to the subway and Times Square, plus lots of great restaurants.  Thank you, would stay again!!

title: Good price and location
text: Stayed here with my family. Comfortable bed,small room but clean  wi-fi fine , good breakfast very friendly staff they leaves us to check in early, very close to Times Square and Broadway. Great value.

title: No frills, simple- clean- good price for great location!
text: Came to town for Discovery display of Star Wars costumes. We were a family of four. Stayed one night - 2 double beds. Nothing fancy, small room -but very clean. Coffee maker, hair dryer, iron and ironing boards, nice reading lighting and TV. Coffee, tea and hot chocolate in lobby 24/7. Included breakfast which was awesome. Eggs, Belgium waffles, bacon, oat meals, tons of fresh fruit, yogurts, fresh pastries, juice, tea coffee. 7 min walk to Bryant park for ice skating. 3 min walk to Times Square. 20 min walk from Grand Central Station. Felt very comfortable and safe in the area. Front desk staff were quiet, quick-  but polite. Front lobby could use updating. We would go back.

title: Great Value and Location
text: Stayed here with my daughter. Comfortable bed, wi-fi fine for searching but not watching videos, very friendly staff, very close to Times Square and Broadway. Great value. Only negative--rooms are small and all are close to the elevator so if you're planning to sleep in past 7:30am bring ear plugs. Highly recommend.

title: Excelente y buen precio
text: Definitivamente regresaria, la ubicacion es inmejorable, a 2 cuadras de Times Square y en la misma esquina entrada para el subway,  es un hotel muy economico, el personal es amable y servicial! Estuve 5 dias hospedada y el desayuno es fenomenal, desde las 6:30 am hasta las 9:30, la cama es verdaderamente comoda, estuve en el 405 lejos del elevador y sin ruido! Estoy satisfecha por completo con este hotel

title: Blizzard 2016
text: We were here for Blizzard 2016 - ended up having to extend our stay 2 nights because of flight cancellations.  Hotel staff were all very polite and helpful, breakfast was plentiful, and the location was good.  We had a double/double room, which was pretty cramped and it was impossible to unpack b/c there is just a small armoire w/one small drawer.  Might have been easier to move around if not for the rolling chair that really wasn't needed since you couldn't sit at the desk thanks to the mini-fridge under the desk (mini fridge was great thing to have though, so no complaints there).  4 adults in a room would be really claustrophobic (we had 3), but for just needing a place to sleep, it was fine. Room was quite clean, beds were quite comfortable (to us) & linens very soft. Only complaint was the other guests who utterly lacked common courtesy, coming in super late & yelling/slamming doors at all hours.  Walls are thin and doors don't block hallway noise (not uncommon in any hotel). Bring a white noise machine or use an app on your phone to help mask it somewhat.  Also, appreciated that the sidewalk was kept shoveled during the storm, but would have liked it if at least a small path could have been cleared from sidewalk to street so getting into cabs wasn't such an ordeal. Wifi was hit or miss and the TV had very limited channels that didn't match up to what was on the card in the room, but we found a news station so that was good enough for us.  Don't go to NYC to hang out in your room, and little of these criticisms will matter.

title: OVER NIGHT STAY
text: The place was the best place for me to stay in midtown Manhattan right around the corner from the theater  From The Color Purple.  The  Hotel Staff was very accommodate , I appreciate them call me about the object that I left in the hotel . Thank So very more much  .This place is very  clean .I will  be back  soon to get my object so thank you for your excellent service

title: Perfect location
text: me & my girlfriends were there for a long weekend and these people were great! The breakfast was a perfect way to start our morning each day. Rooms were clean and staff were helpful and nice. I would recommend this hotel for families and or friends to stay in. Close to Times square and subway and plenty of restaurants and theatres.

title: Friendly and cozy
text:
We were on a budget but needed a place in that area for an event my daughter was participating in. This fit the bill! The room was small but comfortable and clean. It's in a great location close to Times Square, theaters, and a major subway station, which has bus service to the airport (LaGuardia). The entire staff was so friendly and polite, from the front desk, to the housekeeping staff, to the breakfast staff. Full hot breakfast and they kept it well-supplied with items. 
Cons: Not much space for our suitcases in the room. The fridge was located under the desk and we did not see it the first day! The heater was rather noisy but we got used to it, or maybe we were just so tired from all our sightseeing it didn't matter.

title: Retour d'un séjour de 6 nuits
text:
Pas facile de choisir un hôtel depuis chez soi avec la multitude de choix dans le confort, la situation, et/ou le prix ?
J'ai sélectionné celui-ci pour un premier séjour en couple à New York du 2 au 8 janvier ! et oui je rentre tout juste :( pour sa situation à proximité de times square et finalement nous n'avons pas été déçu c'est un excellent rapport qualité/prix/situation.
Le personnel est discret, disponible dès que besoin et s'assure que votre séjour se passe bien (j'ai pu leur envoyer un mail pour que me soit imprimée ma réservation de transport vers JFK pour notre départ et nos valises ont été gardées gracieusement toute la dernière journée : check out à 11 AM et départ à 5 PM). Dans la chambre une cafetière avec café et thé est disponible mais à savoir que du café et tout le nécessaire pour du thé est disponible 24/24 dans la salle de déjeuner à l'entrée qui  est certes petite mais nous avons toujours eu de la place (bon ok nous ne sommes pas en pleine haute saison !) mais si vous n'avez pas assez de place rien n'interdit de prendre ce dont vous avez besoin pour déjeuner dans votre chambre !
La salle du petit-déjeuner est maintenue propre et le nécessaire est fait pour que rien ne manque (tous les produits sont bon et au niveau du salé cela change tous les jours, pour le sucré on vous prépare même vos gaufres si besoin ! 
Notre chambre a été faite chaque jour avec soins (ok je n'ai pas plongé sous le lit pour chercher des moutons) ainsi que la salle de bains où il ne manque rien (serviettes, savons, sèche cheveux). Certes la chambre n'était pas très grande mais nous avions 2 grandes valises + 2 petites et avec un peu d'organisation on s'en sort très bien ;)
Le bruit : alors du silence dans New York, à moins que de planter une tente au coeur de Central Park (et je ne pense pas que ce soit autorisé ;) ) je ne pense pas que cela soit possible ! On est à New York quoi !! Les climatisations/chauffage sont bruyants (et pas qu'à New York, les installations sont les mêmes ailleurs aux USA), nous nous avons pris le parti de l'éteindre la nuit (même avec des températures inférieures à -5° C dehors nous n'avons jamais eu froid sous la couette, un peu frais le matin au réveil mais la chambre vue sa taille se réchauffe vite : juste le temps de préparer un café !) Et puis nous avions apporté nos bouchons d'oreilles et cela suffit à nous isoler de l'extérieur. Pour ce qui est du bruit dans l'hôtel lui même rien à dire, il est super calme. Au fait nous étions au 5° étage sur rue (les chambres sur l'arrière sont peut être moins bruyantes mais on n'a pas vu sur les lumières de la ville).
La situation de l'hôtel est plus qu'excellente car il est situé à 5 minutes de Times Square mais plus pratiquement à 2 minutes (même trottoir) qu'une entrée au métro qui court sous time square et avec accès à toutes les lignes de métro ! que demander de mieux !

En résumé : nous y retournerions sans hésitation sauf à vouloir quelque chose de plus luxueux et forcément plus cher !

title: Close to Attractions
text: Great place to stay close to Times Square and other attractions.  Room was clean,quiet, and breakfast was a plus. Maybe 5 minute walk to Times Square. Room was bit small  and lobby was cramped during breakfast ...but who comes to New York to sit in a room.

title: A Decent stay for Times Square
text: I asked my dad to book the Marriott, but he booked this place. I wasn't paying for it, so I couldn't complain. It has all the qualities for a hotel in a big city: small rooms, street sounds outside, and situated near a subway station. It is quite a plain hotel. The breakfast was decent. We were able to walk to Times Square from here and obviously the nearest subway station, so it was quite close to everything. The only negative was when we were trying to sleep one night and the heater was making this horrific noise. It sounded like a generator or a lawn mower was running. It must have been midnight or later. I could not stop laughing because this contraption was situated above my brother who was trying to sleep on the mattress on the floor. I imagine that it was like trying to sleep with this loud motor looming over your head. Eventually, my brother complained and they put us in a different room. If anything, it was a laugh. It is the Comfort Inn after all. In the end, my dad compensated himself for this flaw by stealing a couple muffins from the breakfast bar on our last morning. I only knew about this because when we were waiting in the seating area at our gate at the airport, he pulled these Comfort Inn muffins out of his hoodie pocket and spilled crumbs all over the place as he stuffed them in his mouth.

title: great location near times square and theatre district
text: Check your ego at this oddly pencil shaped hotel. The first thing you notice when you enter this hotel is that it has almost no lobby, you start questioning yourself about booking this place. When you get to your room you start to feel a lot better. The room is small but clean and nicely furnished; it looks like it was recently refurbished. The staff is very friendly and helpful; and you can't beat the location.

title: Good value in a great location.
text: This small hotel is in a very convenient location just a couple of blocks from Times Square and the 42nd St/Port Authority Metro station. Our top (7th) floor room was clean, quiet and comfortable and had good Wi-Fi service and a view. The complimentary breakfast was good, with a number of hot and cold choices. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Overall a great place to stay at a very reasonable price.

title: Great stay, great value
text:
Stayed here Dec. 20 with wife/daughter to watch shows and do some shopping.  As the other reviewers indicated, rooms are sorta small but plenty big enough and appropriate for midtown Manhattan (think London, Tokyo, Berlin).  I had requested upper floor due to noise and was granted top floor (7th).  Yes, elevator is sorta slow, so even at age 60 I usually took the stairs.  It's half a block down from the swanky Inter-Continental, so a very good area.
Street noise not bad at all for this light sleeper due to very good windows.  Breakfast staff kept the food selection well stocked even at peak times (8-9am), and front desk staff were quite friendly and helpful, in particular Vibhuti.  Many nearby options for parking, but take mass transit if possible to avoid driving altogether.  Lots of restaurants a short walk away, as well as many theaters, shopping, sights.

I would absolutely recommend this property to friends and family, and would certainly stay here again.  Every expectation was met or exceeded for our family's stay at this midtown hotel.

title: Not bad/great location
text: We enjoyed our stay but the room was so tiny. There were 4 of us (2 adults and 2 children). Not enough room for our luggage. However breakfast was included and that's always a plus. Excellent location. Clean room. Pretty noisy at night but that's to be expected.

title: 100% ubicación
text: El hotel no tiene nada que destacar, no pasaría de correcto y hasta ahí si no fuera que está cerca de todo lo que tenes ganas de visitar cuando pensas en midtown. Los teatros a pasos, el tramo mas popular de Broadway y todos los metros que quieras a metros de su puerta. La habitación correcta. El desayuno es muy abundante y siempre hay huevos y otra proteína caliente que cambian a diario además de yogur, frutas, cereales, panificados, wafles, jugo y café. La terminal de buses está a una cuadra para los que quieren ir de compras a Jersey Gardens. Y podes aprovechar hasta la hora que quieras la esquina más iluminada del mundo. Wifi gratis. Fue el hotel más caro de todo el viaje a usd 200 la noche y no lo valdría sino no sería tan cómoda su ubicación

title: My Theatre District Launch Pad
text:
This is my affordable and convenient launch pad for taking in theatre and the energy of Times Square. The hotel is in an older, low-rise building which means quick elevator waits and short rides to the lobby. Smaller rooms mean less square footage and lower prices. Typical with this chain, breakfast is complimentary.

Lots of nearby great places to eat whether you head toward 8th Avenue or 9th Avenue. Across the street is Todd English's Ca Va, which offers a pre-theatre early dinner seating. A few doors down is the iconic Birdland Jazz Club.

title: Great location for a weekend in NYC
text: We came to NY to see a show and play tourist, and this hotel is a fabulous location for both of those activities.  It is true that the rooms are small, but they have everything you need (iron, ironing board, safe, toiletries).  The rooms  are updated and very clean.  All the staff we encountered were very friendly. Because our room was ready, we were able to check in well before the 3 pm check in time, which was very helpful.  Breakfast is free, and it is substantial. A great value for the money.

title: Value for money
text: We stayed in the comfort inn on 10th to the 15th of December for sight seeing and shopping.  The hotel decor is very basic but very clean and staff very helpful our stay was very comfortable and the complimentary  breakfast was a great start to the day. The hotel is very central to everything and with in walking distance to most attractions and very close to times square and hells kitchen with lovely restaurants. The two restaurants we would recommend  is a French restaurant Marseille  come out off the hotel turn right just a few hundred yards and sits on the corner ,the other one was Italian restaurant go past the Marseille and its in 46th street called Lattanzi excellent,  our advise is to stay away from the The New York beer company a bar restaurant  and i use that term restaurant very loosely on restaurant,  the service  and food was atrocious , please dont go there , its out of the hotel turn left and a couple of yards up towards times square . I would defenitly go back to this hotel , great value for money.

title: Affordable, Clean and Conveniently Located
text: We stayed here for 3 nights.  I was skeptical at first, but had very little choice due to most hotels being booked or highly priced.  I was pleasantly suprised.  Although the room was the smallest I had ever stayed in with two double beds.  The room was clean, comfortable and tastefully decorated (modernized).  There was free breakfast in the lobby which was also a plus, and we were close to shopping and the subway.

title: Last second visit; right choice for us
text:
My family and I had reservations elsewhere in Times Square but the hotel called at the very last minute (minutes before we would have checked in) to cancel on us due to a water leak. That hotel gave us a few options and we chose the Comfort Inn. 

We were hesitant since it wasn't our initial choice. The staff very warmly welcomed us, took us at the same rate and were extremely helpful in getting us squared away and finding the other stops we had planned to see on the short trip.

They provided a good, but average free breakfast the next morning. The rooms weren't large, but we didn't expect that. The room was clean, well kept and wifi worked consistently.

All in all it was a good choice and the hotel worked very well for us. I would choose the Comfort Inn again if I wanted a safe, warm and affordable option in NYC.

title: Great Location
text: Great location, great rooms and the staff were very friendly and attentive.  This is my second stay at Comfort Inn on west 44th street and I would have no hesitation in booking again or recommending to others.

title: Excelente Hotel
text: La ubicación es fenomenal, cerca de estación de metro y time square. Las camas son muy cómodas, la habitación es pequeña pero cumple. Agua caliente con buena presión y aire acondicionado correcto. El desayuno si bien es siempre igual, es variado y abundante. Durante todo el día hay agua caliente, té y café a disposición. La pieza además tiene mini refrigerador y cafetera. En el baño colocan toallas y artículos de limpieza que reponen a diario; hay secador de pelo. El único pero es la existencia de sólo 1 ascensor, a ratos muy lleno, pero nosotros estábamos en 2do piso así que usamos sin problemas las escaleras. Además existe maquina de bebidas y comida dentro del hotel. Volvería sin dudarlo. Importante destacar que no es unhotel lujoso pero cumple con creces lo que promete. Lo elegí por precio, fue lo más barato que encontré dentro de mis requerimientos y quede muy contenta con la elección.

title: Soggiorno a Manhattan
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato al Comfort Inn 4 giorni. L'accoglienza cordiale, camera all'ultimo piano ben tenuta e silenziosa. Pulizia giornaliera con cambio asciugamani. Colazione continentale abbondante. 
Posizione comodissima a due passi dalla metropolitana e da Time Square. Consigliatissimo

title: Comfort, secure and Hot Chocolate
text: The staff here is top notch and keep the place very clean. All New York City hotel rooms are on the small size, but the Comfort Inn rooms are very comfortable and clean. The price includes a hot breakfast, hot beverages (even hot chocolate) 24/7, and wifi. It is a short walk to places to eat in Hell's Kitchen and just 2 blocks to Times Square. Heaven for theatre goers. A subway stop is just 1 block away giving total access to the city. But the staff is the greatest. They greet you at every entrance and exit. I will return to this hotel again for another comfortable stay in those amazing beds and fluffy pillows.

title: Very nice
text: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and it was great! We ended up staying here because we could not afford all of the other hotels that were $400/nite. This hotel was very clean and updated. Rooms are very small, but we weren't there to stay in the room. Majority of our day was in the city seeing the sites. Staff were friendly and accommodating. Very nice breakfast. Location was  convenient to the theaters and restaurants. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Genial!
text: Muyy recomendable. Muy bien ubicado, Wifi gratis y va muy bien. Desayuno super completo, Personal muy amable y atento, limpieza ok. La habitacion un poco pequeña pero suficiente para una visita a Nueva york. Todo Genial.

title: Great Location
text: We were very happy with our stay here. The location is just a few blocks off of the hustle and bustle of Broadway and 5th, so it was close enough but not too close. The rooms were small, as to be expected, but updated and very clean. The staff was all extremely friendly. It was nice to have coffee and breakfast snack in the lobby every morning before we headed out. There is a great sports themed restaurant/bar next door, a fun bar across the street, an AMAZING organic burger place next door (our favorite meal by far)... just 1 block away is a convenience store for water and snacks and very close to Hells Kitchen for great restaurants. The subway is also just a few blocks up. We were pleasantly surprised by how much we liked this hotel.

title: Great location
text:
This hotel was ideal for our stay. The location was ideal-a 5 min walk to times square. Apart from statue of liberty (which we braved the subway) everything else was in walking distance.
The breakfast was rare for a NY hotel, but was a good selection to start your day.
Our room had 2 double beds, so wasn't really small. The only slight downside was lack of storage space. Only 1 small wadrbobe (which has iron safe and iron board) and a couple of drawers- not really enough for two adults.
Was a really good stay, but if you are using your hotel for anythibg more than sleeping in, you are not making the most of this fantastic city.

title: Small but great
text: The hotel room was small but clean, and the staff were very friendly. It was very close to Times Square, theaters and other attractions. I would definitely stay here again. For the price it was a great hotel.

title: It's not the Ritz, but...
text: Across from the Port Authority, on 44th  between 8th and 9th. An easy walk to everything, Times Sq, MSG, Central Park, Grand Central, Broadway Shows, Rockerfella Sq, even the ESB. So if location is important as well as your budget, this is a great choice. Busy breakfast area, ample selections, only as it is small, the lift is slow, so goes against the pace of NYC. Cozy room, King bed, not much room at the foot of the bed, good enough bathroom, and everything was clean, so no complaints.For the price and location, we would stay again!

title: Super hôtel
text: Un hotel super qui est proche du centre et à côté d'une sortie du métro. Des réceptionnistes très gentil. Les gaufres du petit dej me manquent!!! Si je devais y retourner je reprendrai cet hôtel car je n'ai rien a redire!

title: Charming budget hotel
text: This hotel was centrally placed, small, but clean and thoroughy charming. A modest buffet breakfast every day was a good start. Friendly helpful staff and tea and coffee available all day in reception.

title: Excelente
text:
Hotel a duas quadras da time square, mas super silencioso. Café da manhã ótimo, com vários tipos de pães,  iogurte,waffle, café, leite, chá.  
Banheiros reformulados, quartos confortáveis, limpos e com roupa de cama aconchegante. 
Ponto positivo: cookies, chá e café e água disponível durante todo o tempo. 
Excelente custo benefício. Ficaria novamente.

title: Affordable and comfortable hotel in a great location
text:
Before booking a hotel in Manhattan, I researched the reviews on this site for several of them. The Comfort Inn Times Square offered decent rates during our recent stay and I read a lot of good reviews.

Upon our arrival the front desk staff was very warm and welcoming and check-in was quick. We had two rooms on the fifth floor with a limited view of some of the Manhattan skyline. 

The room was quiet and clean. The TV worked well. I think the best part was the beds. The mattress was very comfortable and I liked that the hotel offered both firm and soft pillows on the bed. While the room is somewhat small, this is the norm for Manhattan hotels.

The rate included a full breakfast in the lobby area each morning which was good. Although it was crowded, we found a place to sit and eat during each of the 3 days we were at the hotel.

The location is only 2 blocks from the Port Authority Bus/Subway station located at 42nd Street and 8th Avenue which makes it very easy to access all areas of the city.
The hotel is within walking distance of both Times Square and Hells Kitchen.

We did have an issue with a slow draining tub and a key card not working in one of our rooms but the staff addressed those issues promptly.

This is my first stay at a Comfort Inn and I was not disappointed.  We would definitely stay here again.

title: Ma première nuit aux US...
text: C'est du n'importe quoi cet hôtel. Les chambre sont restées dans leur jus ou alors les décorateur est resté bloqué dans les années 70/80. Pour préserver votre sommeil je vous invite à couper des que possible la climatisation et le frigo car ils sont très très bruyants. Vérifiez également le fonctionnement du coffre fort ! A ce prix là c'est abusé, dans d'autres villes cela ne devrait pas devait pas dépasser la moitié du prix indiqué et encore je reste gentil.

title: Front desk lady problem, but a good stay
text: The lady at the front desk named "Vibhuti" checked me in and out, however she was every ignorant & rude. It just seemed as she was trying to deal with very fast, she wasn't very polite and was always in a hurry so she can have a free time for herself. She can improve her conversations with other people and try to be polite. Besides that, it was a wonderful stay, all the other staff was great, the rooms were very clean and the breakfast was just amazing.

title: A bargain in a central location
text: Although the hotel wasn't cheap, compared to those in a similar location it is 2/3 or less of the price. The hotel is on 44th, just a five minute walk from Times Square and within the Theatre District, surrounded by many of the large Broadway shows. It is also in a great location for travel as it is less than two minutes from Port Authority making it very easy to get to from the Subway itself, and easy to get to from Newark Airport as Port Authority is the first stop from there ($17 one way). The hotel isn't 5*, but it is above average and will give a great base with a comfortable bed and helpful staff. The other thing which sets it apart from other hotels that I researched before booking was that breakfast was included - many New York hotels don't include this - and a first class breakfast it was too with bacon, egg, sausage, freshly cooked bread, cakes, cereals and my first ever helping of biscuits and sausage gravy! There was lots more on offer too. We had a great view of the Empire State Building from our window which was an added bonus. I would definitely recommend this for a short stopover in the city if like me, you are just using a hotel as a base and will be out exploring the city the rest of the time.

title: Front Desk customer service lacking
text:
The positives:  comfortable beds, good price, great location, clean motel.  Young front desk staff working the afternoon shift when I checked in were very friendly.  

The negatives:  Attempted to print airline boarding pass on hotel lobby computer late in the evening but one computer was malfunctioning and the other wasn't hooked up/wouldn't turn on.  I asked the two men who were then on duty at the front desk for help with the computers but they weren't able to get the one computer turned on.  Most hotels would have offered to print the boarding pass on their front desk computer when they saw that the lobby computers weren't working, but I had to ask them if they could do it.  They initially said they weren't able to do it, but a few minutes later they said I could use their computer and print it off myself.

After successfully printing my boarding pass, I asked if I could leave a wake-up call for 7 a.m. and they said they would do that.  However, I was awakened by heavy machinery on the street outside our window at 7:45 that morning (despite requesting a quiet room) since they had failed to give us a wake-up call.  We had to hurry and get ready to leave for our flight (no time for a shower, etc.).  I asked the man at the front desk about the wake-up call and he checked his list and apologized since he said the two men who had been working when I made the request hadn't written down our wake-up call on their list.

I had difficulties with the front desk staff at this hotel on a previous stay as well when I was watching a video interview on the lobby computer late one evening.  There was sound coming out of the computer speaker but it was so soft that I had to lean in towards the speaker to hear it.  Nevertheless, a front desk staffer came over and told me I needed to turn off the computer because "the noise from the computer is going to wake up people who are staying in the rooms near the lobby."

title: Wow
text:
Pleasantly surprised when we opened the door. I was expecting a large closet for a room, but instead it was a good sized room. The hotel was very clean and well taken care of, every one I talked to was very friendly. The only problem we had was when it came to food allergies. The only response I got when asked about ingredients in the breakfast was, "we order in the food and we have no information on it". I can understand that, I will just plan accordingly next time. By the way the breakfast had a great selection of prepared food, and a few prepackaged food so at least my family could put something in our bellies. 

In a nutshell well worth the money and is where I will stay when I go back to NYC. There is no parking for the hotel, but there is parking across the street, just plan on paying $20-$50 a day.

title: Small but very clean and quiet :)
text: We had to attend an appointment on NYC and needed somewhere reasonably priced in the inner city at the last minute. Got a very good price on a standard room with a king bed. While it was the typical tiny NY sized room, the bed was big, clean and very comfortable, the bathroom was spotless and the room was quiet (6th floor away from the elevator). Well placed and walking distance to the theatre district and great bars. Would return in future, at that price. Clean, quiet, comfortable.

title: Hotel stay
text: Not disappointed, polite people, room was nice, clean, little exspensive but i guess thats New York... parking right across the street reasonable for a day. continental  Breakfast served was good i would stay there again.

title: Ótima localização
text: O hotel está praticamente do lado da Times Square e bem perto das estações do metro. Café da manhã é bom, com waffle e iogurte. O quarto é pequeno e se tem muitas malas, vai ter dificuldade em locomover. Tem um Chipotle bem em frente ao hotel.

title: OK standard, perfect location!
text:
When in NY you do not spent much time in the hotel. Nevertheless, I appreciated the wifi-speed, the clean room and the free breakfast. The bed was good, too. The best part, however, was the location! Just one and a half avenue from Times Square/Broadway and 100m from the main subway lines and the train system. From here you can go to all the three airports without any hazzle. 

Advice: if you want to eat dinner nearby, walk to 9th Avenue, and then head north towards 44.street. There are a lot of nice restaurants in this area.

title: Muy recomendable!
text: Hotel discreto, excelente ubicación en Times Square, cerca del subte. Las habitaciones no son muy grandes, tiene frigobar y cafetera. El baño es amplio, con bañera. El desayuno es muy bueno, completo y riquísimo. Ademas, durante el día, el café, te y chocolate son libres. Muy buena atención.

title: Very nice visit
text: This hotel was moderately priced for NYC . Very close to the theater district and all the shows that we want to see. The beds and pillows were very comfortable. The room was very clean. We were on the 4 th floor and it was very quite in our room. Management was very nice very courteous in every way. Breakfast was included and was quite nice. Plenty of juice coffee hot chocolate cereals yogurt bagels pastries fresh fruit eggs scrambled sausages waffles pancakes many choices not fine dining but very good to be included in room price. The double bed room was adequate not much room for suitcases and small bathroom. I would definitely not want 4 people in the room. But if you pack light it is very adequate for 2 people even 3 but pack light. The black out curtains small refrigerator and very small cabinet to hang clothes was nice. Iron and ironing board of you are in need of one. Very comfortable room very good price but the price changes daily. It does get booked solid during peak weeks so if you wait you may loose out. It's really a bargain if you go in off season if there is such a thing in NYC maybe when it is really cold or really hot weather. Easy walking to time square, lot of shows and many restaurants. You are in the heart of time square but sort of out of the hard core hustle and noise.

title: Good if You Need to Squeeze a Dollar
text:
I would normally tell people not to consider anything less than a 4 star hotel in NYC because you will usually still pay a lot of money and still be a lot disappointed. Hotels in the city get a lot of wear and tear, and they show it.
When I had to book a last minute hotel, I groaned when I saw that I got this property. My expectations were pretty low. However, It was a pretty positive experience in the end. I wouldn't necessarily want to honeymoon here, but the room was clean, and it had all of the basics including indoor plumbing and electricity. It even had a coffee maker. There is no gym, but you get free wi-fi instead. Breakfast is pretty decent, as you can put something healthy together between Oatmeal, yogurt and fruit.
Staff is very friendly, and location is great.
Overall, if you're the type who squeezes a dollar until it bleeds, then you will be very happy here. Might be one of the best budget hotels in the city.

title: Отличный вариант
text:
Для нас при поездках в Нью-Йорк при отсутствии машины была очень важна близость к центру и метро. Данный отель отлично подходит - до Таймс-сквер минут 5-7 пешком мимо основных театральных зданий - расположение просто замечательное. Номер был не слишком просторный, но вполне чистый с большими удобными кроватями, нормальной работающей сантехникой, кофеваркой и пр.  Для того, чтобы несколько раз переночевать, нас более чем устроило. К тому же в стоимость входил нормальный завтрак, подкрепиться вполне хватало. Кстати, чай-кофе и воду в зоне завтрака можно наливать круглосуточно, очень удобно. Обслуживающий персонал - в основном индусы, очень вежливые и приятные в общении. При выезде, несмотря на отсутствие помещения для багажа, оставили багаж на полдня в свободной комнате.  
В целом, отель полностью нас устроил, при таком отличном расположении обошелся в очень приемлемую цену (чуть больше 100 долларов без налогов за ночь).

title: Amazingly PERFECT STAY!!
text:
Great hotel for several reasons:
-Amazing customer service with outgoing and friendly staff
-Free Breakfast (eggs sausage bacon pastries cereal yogurt waffles)
-In Times Square 
-Walking distance from Port Authority
-Several nearby attractions, shopping, theaters and good restaraunts
-Free Wifi
-Clean hotel
-Modern room nice decor clean mid size bathroom includes small refrigerator
YOU WILL NOT BE DISAPPOINTED THIS IS AWESOME HOTEL!!

title: Good value near Times Square
text: I've stayed at this hotel several times and recommended it to friends many times, and it's always clean, comfortable, and convenient.  Yes, rooms are small and there's only one elevator, but it's within safe, easy walking distance to Times Square, so if you're going to New York for theatre, it's hard to beat.  The staff, especially the the front desk staff and the lovely young woman who keeps the waffles going in the breakfast area, are always helpful and friendly.  Check in and check out are quick and easy, and they'll hold your luggage if you have a late flight.  Nice touches include computers in the lobby for printing your boarding pass, newspapers on weekday mornings, coffee and tea in the breakfast area all day, and cookies in the afternoon.  Affordable hotels near Times Square are hard to find; when I find find a good rate at this one, I book it knowing that I'll have a pleasant, comfortable stay in this well-run hotel.

title: Midtown Manhattan Value
text:
The City hotels can get a bit pricey, but this Comfort Inn in the heart of mid-Manhattan was a great deal.  Our room looked like the hotel's pictures and came with the advertised amenities.  It was also quite comfortable.  We would come back for an hour or so from one area of the city and go to our room to get refreshed and relax, before continuing our explorations.
They don't have a fitness facility, but you can walk everyday, so there's your cardio.  Also, they do not have onsite parking, so if you're traveling by car be sure to find the lowest priced garage with in/out privilege's.
It's very nice to be able to start your day with FREE breakfast before setting out for daily activities.
Staff are friendly and obviously quite busy (in a positive sense).  You don't have to be concerned with not being taken care of.
Now, a word about location.  The hotel is only a couple of blocks from Times Square, which can be and many times is, the mass of humanity you might think.  And, those couple of blocks are important because while centrally located to major sites, the hotel is down W44 St from 8th Ave away from the hustle and bustle of 7th & Broadway.  So, we enjoyed quiet nights for sleep to wake up refreshed in the morning.
We had easy walks to sites like Rockefeller Center, The Museum of Modern Art, Port Authority Bus Terminal and Metro, Madison Square Garden, Radio City Music Hall, and more. Although, we used our Metro Card to conveniently get to Central Park, The Natural History Museum, Battery Park, Brooklyn, etc. in minutes.
There's a reason so many travelers would recommend the Comfort Inn Times Square West, it's because of the value, service, accommodations and location.  Maybe that's all I needed to say, in the first place.

title: Moderate with access to everything
text:
New York size, in other words smallish.
3/4 of a block to 8th ave,a major hub.
Subway entrance on the corner, bars and eats right out your door.
Clean, comfy room, no bed bugs, okay bath, friendly staff, breakfast included
Walk everywhere, Times Sq, Grand Central, MSG, Empire Sate, Rock Center and more
Undersized breakfast area, hot and cold choices, but all you need. Slow elevator ( could use another)
Friendly Staff, would return and recommend

title: Pleasant surprise
text: First trip to NY with my daughter for IMATs show. Didn't know what to expect, but the hotel met all of our needs. Couldn't believe how close it was to Times Square. Front desk was personable as well as hotel staff. Room was basement level, but not a problem for us. I will definitely be back.

title: Muy buena opcion
text: La ubicación es inmejorable, el hotel es lindo, la atencion muy buena pero lo mejor de todo es el desayuno! Este hotel es super completo! Hasta tiene un ATM adentro . No es de gran lujo, y las habitaciones son chicas pero las camas son muy comodas y el baño es grande y lindo. A dos cuadras de times square! Y es super económico! Recomiendo este hotel 100%

title: We Liked It
text:
We were in New York City for the 2015 ComicCom.  The hotel was well placed to get to the Javits Center (about a 1-mile walk) and very close to Times Square and the theaters on Broadway (less than six blocks away).

The room was a little small, but not so bad that we were upset (the only reason we didn't rate it as five).  Everything was clean and the hotel staff was very friendly and helpful.  Breakfast was included and the hours for it weren't bad at all (6:30 to 9:30 a.m. on weekdays/til 10:30 a.m. on weekends).

There are plenty of restaurants close to the hotel so eating was not a problem.

Overall, we liked our stay and will definitely stay there again when we revisit New York City.

title: Great stay!!
text:
Very Good Service, clean, nice breakfast, excellent Location! 

We booked With expedía The hotel at times square AND they told us Expedía continue sellling after they stop sales; so, we had to look FOR other hotel around. This was a great coincidence!! 

I wont Book With expedía ever!

title: First trip to NYC and hotel was perfect!
text: This hotel was perfectly located between Times Square and Hell's kitchen with nearby subway.  Easy to get anywhere! Recently redecorated.  2nd floor room was good size and clean.  Breakfast had variety and well stocked with more than 1 fruit - good apples, oranges and bananas!  Hotel staff superb and friendly, especially Sunita and Niti!  Helped with directions, appropriate dining and answered all questions.  Easy check-in and check-out arrangements to fit schedule.  Arranged a perfect return to the airport-no hassles. Would stay here again.

title: First time in New York City!
text: This was my first visit to the Big Apple, and I didn't know what to expect, as I am from a small town.  Our tour bus arrived late, and it was pouring down rain, but check-in went smoothly.  As mentioned previously, the rooms are small.  This didn't matter to me because I only used it for showering and sleeping.  I thought the rooms were very nice.  There are alot of eating options in the area, and there is a great Irish Pub across the street. Hotel staff was very nice and friendly.  They gave me a discount ticket to use at the Pub.

title: Muy bueno y conveniente
text: La ubicación, el precio y calidad del servicio hacen que este hotel sea muy conveniente. Las habitaciones son muy cómodas y silenciosas. El desayuno es muy completo y su staff muy atento. Volvería sin dudas en mi próxima visita a Nueva York, ubicado a 200mts del Time Square y rodeado de restaurantes , es sin duda un buen hotel a considerar.

title: Amazing Stay by Times Square
text: Excellent hotel and location close to Times Square. Included breakfast is a great value and the rooms are a bit small, but clean and are still nice. Breakfast was busy at the end of the window, but I've experienced that at other hotels as well. For the price and being within walking distance to Times Square was great. It was easy for us to walk around the area and know our hotel was only a few blocks away.

title: Convenient location, wonderful staff
text: We stayed here three nights in September, 2015 and found the hotel more than met our needs.  In addition to the very friendly and helpful staff, we found the small (king size bed pretty much filled it) but very comfortable room to provide a quiet place to sleep at the end of a long day of playing the tourist.  The hotel is convenient to TImes Square and a pleasant walk to Central Park, the High Line Park, Rockefeller Center, and the Hudson River.  The self-serve breakfast was perfectly adequate (eggs, bacon or sausage, cereal, waffles, fruit, yogurt, etc.), though the dining area was compact.  Would highly recommend for the value-minded tourist, keeping in mind that centrally located hotel rooms in NYC come with a premium cost.

title: Nice quick trip
text: It is a very nice hotel to be for a quick trip . Hotel stuff are very nice and the breakfast is ok . It is the best hotel close to Times Square and to the 5th ave . At the entrance you can get all the Broadway information shows and in some of them you can get some discounts . Enjoy NYC and all the nice people over there .

title: Great Value for Manhattan / Times Square / Theatre District!
text:
Great value for Manhattan!  Staff was very professional.  Room staff who cleaned were very attentive.  (They stopped us one morning to make sure we knew it was raining outside.  We were waiting at the elevator - and had already packed our umbrellas.  We appreciated their thoughtfulness!)  

Breakfast pastries were fresh & wonderful!  Just 2 blocks from Times Square.  7 floors to this hotel.

Rooms & bathroom are small, but beds were quite comfortable.

Breakfast seating was tight, but breakfast was more than adequate - especially for free!

Book early - this is a small hotel!

title: Absolutely Wonderful
text:
Walking distance to Times Square / Broadway area attractions. Comfortable rooms--small but conveniently arranged. Pleasantly surprised to have a fridge included. My only minor complaint would be that the drapes don't close completely, but I've stayed at other hotels with this same issue.

Management was VERY accommodating. We were on a last-minute trip to see a taping of Late Show with David Letterman and stayed just one night. We needed to leave our bags the following day while we attended the taping, etc. We were able to leave our bags at the hotel at no extra charge. When we returned to the hotel that evening, it was raining heavily and we still had a few hours until out bus left for home. The evening manager was kind enough to let us sit in the lobby for a bit until the rain let up.

The staff was very polite and the room price was very reasonable. I would definitely stay here again when I'm in NYC.

title: Best trip ever
text:
I actually stayed here in January 2014 with my sister and niece . The trip was for my 30th . 
Hotel location is fabulous . Walking distance of everything . Wifi was brilliant and the rooms while small ( 3 of us in one ) all we did was shower and sleep there , too much to see and do on our doorstep ! 
The beds and pillows were the most comfortable I have ever experienced in any hotel stay in any part of the world . The breakfast was , crowded at times but moved quickly . 
All the staff are really helpful and we got a fantastic taxi back to jfk rang by reception . 
On my next trip to New York this hotel is my first choice and myself and my sister have been recommending it to anyone travelling . 
Well done , sorry my review is late.

title: Ottima posizione
text: Abbiamo soggiornato per 5 gg niente di stratosferico ma pulito e molto cordiale il personale. Colazione a buffet abbastanza varia. Quello che ha di spettacolare ė la posizione, davvero a un tiro di schioppo da time square. E se piace camminare da li a piedi arrivi quasi ovunque ( abbiam preso la metro solo per arrivare all'imbarco della statua della libertà ). Ti danno la possibilità di lasciare in custodia i bagagli il giorno della partenza perché la camera alle 11 va lasciata ( noi avevamo aereo alle 2030). Per essere in pieno centro rispetto ad altri il prezzo ė ottimo. Wi-fi gratuito e all'ingresso computer e stampante a disposizione.

title: Comfort Inn Times square west
text: Good customer service, clean room, great complimentary breakfast.the location is walking distance to the broadway play area and times square. Subway entrance is down the street for easy transportation to anywhere in NYC.

title: Nice Comfort Inn feel right next to Times Square
text: I stayed here for work. Very nice people working here - much nicer than comparable other hotels. The room was perfect. Nothing special, but for Manhattan standards relatively spacious. Only downside: no gym.

title: Just OK
text: The hotel was just OK. I asked for the highest floor up and we got 1st and 2nd floors.I called ahead  a week and requested a early check in and didnt get one but told we can use the basment bathroom and freshing up , they would keep or luggage and we could come back at 3pm  The breakfast was just ok. I expected better. However the front desk staff was nice.

title: Tiny room, wonderful front desk
text: This location works if you are ok with walking a very short distance to the pier (great for cruisers) or a much longer distance to Times Square- the name is misleading, its a LONG walk. The front desk folks were very courteous. but the rooms are so tiny that there wasnt room for a real closet and the space between the bottom of the bed and the rack that was a sub for a "closet" was so narrow that the king size bed had been trimmed short to fit(my feet hung over the end, and that doesnt happen in other king beds including my own). the bath was so tight that the sink was cut to allow the door to open. It ran over my toes if I didnt remember to back up. NYC rooms are small, but not this small. I wont stay here again. there was a holiday inn next door that is worth looking into if you want budget near pier. also if you want food at night, you have to walk at least a couple blocks.same with breakfast or brunch. nothing in the block.

title: Clean Room in  a Perfect Location!!
text:
I really liked this hotel! Yes, the rooms/bathrooms are very small (we were in room 201 with one King bed), but the space is used so efficiently that they pack a lot of amenities into the small space. 
The lights by the bed are great...larger light for the room, and a very tiny reading lamp for not bothering the other person in the room late at night or early morning.  Each side of the bed has a table with a charging station right next to the bed.  Convenient for checking those e-mails comfortably.  There is a coffee maker, refrigerator, and safe.  The air conditioner looked relatively new and was very quiet. The bed was very, very comfortable and I slept like a baby both nights.  Plenty of pillows with varying firmness. There was no street noise, and our room faced 44th street. The bathroom is small, but has a decent size sink counter. There were cookies available at the front desk every day.
The location of Comfort Inn was terrific.  We walked all over the place from Grand Central Terminal to our theater to Madison Square Garden to Times Square.  
The breakfast was great, including waffles and either sausage or bacon and eggs. The breakfast seating is limited, but our group of 4 never waited more than a couple minutes for a table.  
The staff was all amazing.  I wish I knew the front desk clerk's name, but she checked us both in and out. She was very friendly.  We arrived at 1:30 and checked in immediately even though check in was at 3:00. 
The wifi sign on was easy and remained strong for our entire visit.  It did not need to have  a log-on each time. 
We found the elevator to be a little slow, but our room 201 was just a few steps above breakfast so we just took the stairs.  I appreciated the ability to not have to use the elevator.
There was an odd odor in our hallway.  It did not go into the room at all, and I am not sure what kind of smell it was.  The carpet looked to be fairly new, and I did not see any stains.
Overall, I would return to this hotel in a heartbeat.  No need to look any further if you are considering a stay in NYC!!

title: Very very good for a 2* hotel!
text:
This was absolutely the best hotel I had in the 4 times I visited NY. All the hotels were in the Times Square area and however we did not expect too much (because of the 2* rating), it was the best! 
Free breakfast, free WiFi, comfortable and clean rooms, very friendly staff and the best location. Many 3,4 or even 5 star hotels can learn from this hotel.

title: Nice
text:
My friends and I stayed here only for one day, and the service here is awesome. Shot out to Nirma who is in charge of the breakfast, and Anil at the front desk during the night shift who was very helpfull as well. Check-in process was fast and we didnt have any issues just that the 2 double beds room some are a little small but nice and clean. 
Thank you guys... until next time.

title: Refeitório e idiomas para comunicação
text:
A mesa do café da manhã é muito incomoda, toma todo espaço do refeitório deixando seus ocupantes mau acomodado. Os funcionários só falam em inglês. Tivemos dificuldades de comunicação por que não sabiam falar nem em  espanhol .
Porém é muito bem localizado.

title: Nice value in Theater District
text:
Nice rooms
Attentive staff
Clean
We could walk 2 blocks to see our plays.  We stayed here in busy September weekend
.
On top of this, included a nice complimentary breakfast each day.

Would definitely recommend.

title: Perfect getaway
text: In town for a once in a lifetime family get together, we chose this hotel due to its location and the brands reputation.  Located just a few blocks from Times Square everything we needed was within walking distance.  Excellent restaurants, bus service and Broadway plays to name a few.  The staff was very accomodating, friendly and definitely helped with our questions.  Should we ever have the opportunity to see NYC again this will be our choice for lodging.

title: Close to the Action!
text: For a clean, inexpensive room in a great location, this hotel fills the bill. Several theaters, countless restaurants, a couple subway entrances and Time Square are within 2 blocks. Our smallish room [#105] was on the basement level. It was very clean, pleasantly quiet and featured a 60" flat screen TV. Though small, the bath had a tub/powerful shower. The staff was cordial; the complementary breakfast was good. We'll be back.

title: Nice room at a reasonable price!
text: Great location; 3/4 block from the subway, 1 block from the theatre district, 2 blocks from the heart of Times Square.  The rooms are on the small side, but clean, and the staff was excellent!  Prices were reasonable for the city.  I would stay here again in a heartbeat!  The only reason I gave it 4 stars was the size of the room...but for 2 people (and we were) it would not be an issue at all.

title: Fantastic location , staff and facilities
text:
I stayed here last week with my daughter. I have nothing negative to say - rooms were clean, good sized ( we had 2 double beds in ours ) provision of the fridge was a welcome addition to keep our drinks cool, air conditioning was well used as were the free films that were available to watch.

Breakfast was great - got a little busy after 8.30 but always somewhere to sit and well stocked range of foods - the freshly cooked waffles were amazing 

After checkout the hotel kept our bags safe until the evening. All staff were lovely throughout the stay
And the front desk were helpful with advice on where to go and how to get there. 

Location of the hotel is fantastic close to Tines square, the theatres, subway station and bus station.

Thank you for a lovely stay we will be back and I will recommend to all my friends

title: Small room but good location and clean room
text: The hotel is very well located a few minutes away from Time's Square and close the subway. The lobby is very nice and the staff were always very friendly. There is only one elevator and it does take a lot of time to go up and down. Our room was super tiny but we expected that in NYC. We could barely fine room to put our two suitcases. The room was very clean and had everything you need. There was a mini fridge and usb ports for charging phone.  Everything was very clean but just a little small. The breakfast in the morning was good but very crowded so it takes a while to get food and find seating.

title: Amazing Value Two Blocks from Times Square, Renovated, Spotlessly Clean & Great Staff!
text:
My kids and I stayed at this hotel for three nights when we were doing Admissions visits to NYU, Columbia, Barnard and Cooper Union.  

The hotel is 2 blocks west of Times Square, on the same street as Toys R Us and a few doors down from the InterContinental New York Times Square Hotel and Birdland.

If you leave the hotel, turn right and go to the end of the block you will see plenty of good restaurants, of many types and price points: Upscale French, Hipster Burger Joint, Good Thai, Elegant Korean.

There is a parking garage directly across the street from the hotel. The hotel validates parking for this lot at the front desk, it's very convenient.

As for the hotel itself, the staff were excellent, especially Niti at the front desk.  We arrived late at night after driving 6 hours from Rochester and we were exhausted.  We asked if we could get an extra room for the kids.  She quickly gave us another room, on the same floor, no problem at all.  The next day, we needed directions to NYU and wondered if we should take a taxi or the subway.  Niti printed out very clear subway instructions, told us how to get to NYU, also gave us taxi instructions on timing and sent us on our way with a smile.  She did the same each day for each school we wanted to visit.  We had googled this information, but Niti made it clear, concise and easy to understand.  Every afternoon when we came back, she took the time to ask how we were and if we needed anything.  She always had a smile and a pleasant greeting.  Comfort Inn should be very proud that she is the face of their business.

The other staff were just as nice.  It's a very pleasant place to stay.

Physically, the hotel is an older building that has been recently renovated.  The rooms are tiny, there are about 20 inches of clearance from the foot of the bed to the wall.  The beds are doubles, not queens.  That being said, the decor is modern, very HGTV.  There are flat screen TVs and refrigerators in the rooms.  The bathrooms are tight, but have nice fixtures: marble, nice shower heads.  The water pressure is better on the lower floors, but still adequate elsewhere.  The air conditioner is loud, but it works well to cool the room.

The hotel offers a good free breakfast in the lobby: waffles, bread, pastries, bagels, eggs, sausage, coffee, juice, fruit, yogurt. There are tables, but it's a tight space, so they offer trays to take breakfast back to your room.

There's free wifi, a computer for guest use in the lobby and in the afternoons, the front desk has cookies!

The cons are few and not serious:  The elevator is slow and it bounces up and down as you ride it.  The rooms on the first floor and in the basement don't have any privacy.  Avoid them. The hotel rooms are very small, but for a room under $250 a night in Times Square, I'm not complaining.

All in all, this hotel is an excellent value for the price and location.  If you are visiting New York, especially on a budget, this is a great place to stay!

title: Vacation
text: It has been a pleasure staying at the Comfort  Inn in Times Square  it is clean the staff is knowledgeable & pleasant & the breakfast is great .10 Stars for Me.2.My grandaughter & nieces really enjoyed their stay they where having withdrawal  when we left the area for a couple of hours  to go shopping.

title: Ok Stay
text: Great location and friendly staff. Overall was a nice stay but rooms were really small. Not much space to move about. Room was clean for the most part minor wear and tear. Small bathroom, really small! Didnt get to try the free breakfast but heard some of the other guest saying they enjoyed it. Probably would stay again just for location and price only.

title: Short Visit With Our Son
text: We had a one-day visit with our song on August 12.  We stayed in this Comfort Inn. The room was very comfortable. Breakfast was surprisingly good. I had scrambled eggs and bacon the first morning. The second morning they had links sausages and scrambled egg patties. They also offered A variety of sweet rolls, cereal, and Belgain Waffles, along with orange juice.

title: Comfort, value, service
text: What a relief move from a very expensive and cramped hotel to this warm family hotel.Booked in the morning of Sunday at a rate that put the smile back on...Front desk was reassuring and authentically helpful.Room with queen bed was cosy big enough and clean.Breakfast was quite nice.Dining area a little cramped though...single lift was a slight inconvenience....but this fades into insignificance given the other nice features and off course proximity to time square.Will definitely come back.Percy and Esme, Durban, SouthAfrica

title: Three nights and were very happy
text:
After booking elsewhere I found this hotel, was amazed at how close it was to Times Square, I was very Leary as the price was very good for being this close to all the action. We arrived around 11:00am, they took our bags and stored them for us and told us we could check in around 2pm, we came back just after 2 and the check in was very easy and smooth, the two young ladies were very friendly. Parking the car was simple directly across the street, three nights was only 90.00.
 We went to our room and was pleasantly surprised, it was clean, recently renovated lots of storage and fridge microwave and coffee maker, what more do you need for a hotel.
They also provide a free breakfast every morning, the young lady working there had her work cut out for her, some guests act like animals and don't bother to clean after themselves and think she is there servant, she works extremely hard trying to please the guests at the comfort inn, she was a highlight of our visit to this hotel, always has a smile and helped up make the most amazing blueberry waffles.  During our breakfast there I noted that not one guest acknowledged her with a gratuity for her hard work, I made sure to say thanks and gave her a gratuity that was well deserved. The hotel management is lucky to have a friendly staff member like her.

title: Bueno
text:
Estuve en este hotel sólo por una noche. Cuando llegamos aún era muy temprano para realizar el check in, por ello nos permitieron dejar las valijas allí hasta que podamos ocupar la habitación. La recepción fue muy cordial.
EN general la ubicación del hotel es muy buena, ya que se encuentra en la 44 entre la 8 y la 9, muy cerca de Times Square, Port Authority y subtes, entre otros. 
Cuenta con desayuno incluido, muy completo.
Las contras: la habitación que me tocó (501) tenía olor a humedad y por otro lado el trato que recibí del gerente no fue amable ni me hizo sentir cómoda.
Por el contrario, todos los empleados del hotel me trataron muy cordialmente.

title: Everything you need
text: Welcoming staff, great location, good breakfast, quiet rooms, always available coffee and tea, strong wifi signal and fair prices are all the positives. Very tight space in our room and crazy in breakfast area- minor compared to the positives.

title: Location, Location, Location!
text: This hotel is only 2 blocks from the center Times Square and in the middle of the theater district.  Very clean with surprising spacious rooms (by NYC standards).  The staff was wonderful and very helpful with some of our planning.  Best of all, free breakfast every day at NO extra charge!!  Will return again on our next visit.

title: Great place to stay
text: I have stayed here before and was happy then and still very satisfied with this stay. We were in room 406 and there was no outside noise except maybe an ambulance a time or two.  You couldn't hear any slamming doors from other rooms. This room was also a little larger, double beds, than the last time I stayed here.  Everything was very clean and I will stay here again in the future.

title: Excellent choice. Staff outstanding. Location perfect
text:
This was our 2nd stay at this hotel and we will definitely be back. The location is perfect for theater, dining, shopping, etc. The staff is truly outstanding. They are very friendly and accommodating.  The rooms are clean and comfortable. Breakfast is very good. Special thanks to the front desk staff for their willingness to go out of their way for your needs and requests. Thank you to all.
Pat and Gerry

title: Practicality and Integrity
text:
The hotel is very decent and practical in many ways. Near Time Square, and near several Broadway theatres. Going to the Hop on/Hop off or coming back, we would look for tickets at the theatres.
They offer a nice and decent breakfast. Hot dishes with the regular breakfast. The “dining room” is a little tight. The personnel are friendly and very honest. We left a cell phone in our room; they got in touch with us to inform us. We sent someone to pick it up 2 days later. Integrity and honesty is definitely one of their traits.  Thank you

title: Better than I expected
text: Located 2 blocks from Times Square but had a subway stop very close and 9th Ave. bus went downtown quickly.. Our room was very small, 209 and 410 only meant for 1 person, but there are larger ones.  Hotel was well managed, breakfast was very good, although hard to find a table to sit at in the morning. Don't expect luxury, but it was comfortable and clean.

title: service in abundance
text:
Angelo and everyone I met at the front desk were exceptional, truly. Thank you for going the extra mile - from taking care of our luggage outside of the time of our stay, to the hearty breakfast (which was limited but at least fresh and warm).

I have already recommended your hotel to friends.

Best wishes, Jameel

title: Location, location, location!
text:
This is our 3rd visit to NYC and must say that this has been the best hotel that we've stayed in NYC. We stayed on the 2 fl right off the elevator. There was no noise and if I felt the elevator was taking too long, the breakfast area was a few steps away.
They offered great customer service every time we approached them; either for directions, extra comforters, extra towels, etc.
The location is AWESOME!!! It's about 2-3 blocks from Times Square. If you walk towards TS, you enter TS right by the Toys R Us store. The only hotel I saw from our walk towards TS was InterContinental, but that was overly priced for our family. Between the hotel & TS are many theaters and even the cast of Matilda (I think it was this show??) were there every night signing autographs. 
Breakfast was really good and filling. Had many options for all. From waffles, toast, bagels, bacon, scrambled eggs, yogurt, pastries, cereal, & coffee/juice. 
Parking was very convenient. We parked in a garage across the hotel. 24 hr rate is $30 for cars & $50 for SUVs/minivans. 

The only cons I felt were:
I didn't put up my sleep card the previous night as I expected to get up early and head out by 10 am. We over slept and were awakened by Housekeeping at 9:00 wanting to come in and clean. 
After being awaken from Housekeeping, I made it downstairs for coffee at 9:20. There was a lady already picking up the breakfast bar as they stop serving at 9:30. By 9:30, she locked up the fridge & turned off the juice machine. The next morning, we were up by 7:00 and had breakfast by 8:00 and everything was fresh & delicious.
 
Over all, I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC.

title: Location is ideal
text: My wife and I celebrated our 51st anniversary in NYC.  We stayed at the Comfort Inn in Times Square due to the location.  You can reach Times Square and all the major theaters within an easy walk.  There is an excellent parking garage directly across the street that works with the Comfort Inn for overnight parking.  The Comfort Inn was clean; the room was small but okay for NYC.  The service was outstanding.  Breakfast was provided similar to any other Comfort Inn. Price was affordable for NYC. We will stay in this Comfort Inn in the future when we go to the city.

title: Location, Location, Location
text:
Pros:  walking distance to Port Authority Bus Terminal which services all major NYC airports,TimesSquare,subway stations, Bryant Park, nearby shopping, eat in and take out restaurants,
free hot/cold breakfast, friendly employees, efficient housekeeping, in-room mini fridge
Cons:  crowded breakfast area, one elevator for 7 floors, slow-running shower drain

title: Muy recomendable
text: Hotel muy recomendable a 5 min de Times Square y a 1 min de una parada de metro. La zona es inmejorable, muy segura y animada, hay un Shake Shack en la esquina, además de un muchos bares.Desayuno gratis muy completo. Conexión Wi-fi genial, muy rápida. Te guardan las maletas el último día gratis hasta la hora que quieras. Habitación con nevera, plancha, caja fuerte, cafetera... La cama muy cómoda y con varias almohadas para elegir. A la hora de la merienda tienen cookies gratis en recepción. El personal es súper amable, siempre con una sonrisa e intentando ayudar,y la limpieza impecable: cambio de toallas y amenities diario. Por poner una pega, el agua de la ducha sale con poca fuerza, pero al parecer es algo común en la ciudad. Repetiría en este hotel!

title: Summer in New York
text: Very close to Times Square and a subway station. Room is clean, breakfast is good and staff is very helpful and courteous. Quieter neighborhood but very close to Hell's Kitchen and the theater district.

title: Good location & clean
text: My wife and son stayed at this hotel for one night. Price was cheep on PL. It`s nothing special but its clean and comfortable and very close to time square with out paying the time square prices. AC worked great on the 96 degree day and the beds were comfortable with good pillows. It`s a great place if you are looking for a short stay room with no frills and very close to "time square" , NYC subway station and "hells kitchen".

title: Good hotel in a wonderful location - wow!
text: This hotel is a very good value as it includes bfast and wifi in the price.  Wifi was slow but did work. Parking is not included but they have a reduced rate with the garage directly across from the hotel. We used their services and found them to be very accommodating and helpful.  You have to understand that you are downtown New York City. With that in mind, you should appreciate that the rooms are very small. That is certainly the case here, but it was also adequate.  The only gripe that we had was the fact the curtains will not close completely over the windows. There was a buffer layer, but you could not completely darken the room with heavier curtain layer.  As a result, the sunlight came in the room early in the morning.  Again, that is a very minor gripe.  Breakfast was the standard fair that you would expect this type of hotel to have - it certainly was adequate.The staff at the front desk was very helpful and willing to guide us around the area.  You are steps away from the subway, as well as Times Square.  Oh yea - our kids loved the free hot chocolate all day in the lobby, too.   :). They earned a five star review based on their location and the helpfulness of their staff.  Thanks again!

title: Excellent
text: Excellent location. Extremely quiet and clean. Very professional and courteous staff. Will recommend it. It's located only minutes from Times Square. There is even a parking and even a car rental facility across the street.

title: Muito bom
text: Excelente localização. Bem perto da Tomes Square (vai a pé - 3 a 5 minutos). O hotel é arrumado, aconchegante, inclui café da manhã bem completo e a equipe é simpática e atenciosa. Totalmente recomendável. Já tive a oportunidade de me hospedar por duas vezes em passeio em família e todos ficamos muito satisfeitos.

title: Clean, safe and a free breakfast is included in the price.
text: We chose this because of its proximity to a theatre where we had tickets for a show.  We were pleasantly surprised to find that it is run by very friendly people who were very helpful.  It is clean, safe and the location is very central.  We had a room with two double beds, a desk, small refrigerator and wall mounted tv.  It was small but compared to other hotels in the area, more than adequate.  The bathroom was clean and had a full sized shower.  The only thing I would change would be to add grab bars as the bathroom floor was slippery. It was very quiet at night since we were on the back of the hotel away from the main street.   In the morning there is a full breakfast with eggs, sausage, bacon, fruit, cereal, yogurt, coffee, juice, bagels, etc which is included in the price that was very reasonable.  There were many families having breakfast the morning we were there.  The day we checked out we were able to leave our bags safely in the lobby while we did more sightseeing and then picked them up before heading back to Penn Station.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: Excellent location & Staff
text: Such a great little place.  Location could not be better for what we want to do as we always see at least 3 shows on our NYC trips.  Stayed here back in February and again in July.  Staff is always super friendly and kind.  I will say this time we had the water out from 8;30 till 4:30 on July 4th which made things a little difficult, but it was no fault of the hotel's.  Rooms are pretty small, but for NYC they're not too bad.  We'll definitely be back!

title: Excellent Hospitality
text: Excellent Location! I was travelling with my wife and two daughters aged 12 and 6 and stayed with them on 15th June 2015. Though the room was small and could accomodate 2 or 3 people Max..We managed to stay Comfortably because of efforts of Mr. Manoj , Mr Suresh And Mr. Shailesh who all went out of their way to make us feel comfortable. Kudos to them..It's the people behind who make us feel at home even in a hotel. The pricing of the Rooms is just right and plus it being right next to Times Square is an added advantage.

title: Great Staff and Good Area
text: The best thing about the hotel was the staff. For a hotel located in New York, the rooms were spacious (the size you would typically expect to find in a hotel) and clean. I expected the worst when I arrived, but was pleasantly surprised that I did not hear the city noise or other guests as I expected. The walls are pretty thick! Times square is literally a 2 block walk, and the staff is friendly. I did have a few issues but they were handled professionally by the staff and management. The breakfast is more than I expected with a mixture of hot and continental choices. I would recommend this hotel to everyone who is visiting the area, but call the hotel directly for the best deals- do not book through an online vendor. I would stay here again.

title: Great hotel!
text: Stayed here for 4 nights and was very pleased. Got a basement room and it was quite spacious for a NYC hotel. Nice breakfast - but go early as it gets very crowded. Free WiFi a nice perk. Great hotel if you are going to the theater. I highly recommend this hotel!

title: Hotel stay
text: Stayed here while my friends stayed in the Millennium broadway. It was clean great location. Guest service was sweet. Made my stay in NYC amazing! Check in and check out was quick. I really had a awesome stay in NYC.

title: Un buen lugar para hospedarse con excelente ubicación
text:
Un hotel con excelente ubicación, a un par de cuadras de Times Square y cercanísimo a la zona de teatros. Las habitaciones son pequeñas, pero muy limpias y con camas y almohadas comodísimas. El desayuno está incluido, y ofrecen huevos, waffles, cereales, jugo, fruta y pan. Se puede subir el desayuno al cuarto, ya que el espacio de  comedor es muy pequeño.
Hay una estación de metro a media cuadra, en la que te puedes trasladar hacia el norte o sur de la isla.

title: Nice stay and excellent location !!
text: Booked this hotel for a weekend in New York with some friends. 2 blocks away from Times Square. We were pleasantly surprised how nice this hotel was. Arrived 3 hours before check in time and the room was clean and ready. Rooms, although a bit small, were very clean. Staff is very nice and take care of all your needs. Complimentary breakfast is always a plus !! Will not hesitate to return :)

title: Mixed feelings
text: First what I liked about this property:  The staff was very nice, the room was clean and the bathroom was spotless.  The beds were comfortable and the bedding was nice. And the location was really nice.  There were theaters down the street as well as a subway stop at the end of the block.  Really couldn't ask for a better location.  And the breakfast was nice.  Not great but given most hotels in the area offer nothing, this is awesome.  Now what I didn't like.  The room was small. Miniscule, Microscopic.  Our room had two double beds, one end table, a small desk, a small wardrobe and a small fridge.  There was so little floor space  I was constantly tripping over bags and shoes.  Because of the lamp, coffee maker and other stuff on the desk, there really wasn't room to use it as a desk.  And my biggest complaint is that the room was musty.
