As soon as I walked in the room, my sinuses started filling up.  My allergies bothered me so much that I had to take medication before bed every night so I wouldn't wake up with a headache.  That said, my son didn't notice any smell and had no issues.  Also, there were stains on the carpeting both in our room and in the halls.  I think the place would be greatly improved if they just replaced all of the carpeting.

title: Very nice for a short stay
text: Room was very clean although small.  King bed was very comfortable as were the pillows.  Front desk people very helpful and nice as was the free breakfast.  The food was good with lots of nice pastries from New York.  Although the eating area was small, people moved through quickly.  Parking deck is right across the street with hotel discount for parking.  You are in the heart of the theater district and many excellent restaurants within a block or 2 of the hotel.  2 adults, 2 nights and will definitely stay there again.

title: A good stay at a super location
text: The hotel is like the standard Comfort Inn. Functional, spacious rooms. Excellent location (just a couple of blocks from Port Authority and Times Square), good complimentary breakfast and helpful, courteous staff.

title: Clean and Comfortable
text:
Stayed here for one night before a work event, and would do so again. As others have mentioned, the rooms are a little small (about the size of an average suburban bedroom), but the property is clean and well-maintained. The free breakfast has a good selection of food and beverages, and the round-the-clock availability of coffee, tea and hot chocolate is a nice touch.

One potential downside: If you have to get work done, the small size of the rooms make this a little harder. The desk in my room was cluttered with the lamp, coffee maker and charging station, with barely enough room for a laptop. And the small refrigerator sat under the desk, taking the room where your legs should go. I found it easier to use the bed as a desk. 

If location is an important consideration, you should know the hotel is closer to 9th Ave than to 7th and Time Square. The "Times Square West" in its name perhaps suggests a closer proximity to Times Square than you get. It's still less than a 10-minute walk -- not too bad, but something you should know about going in. 

Despite that, however, it's a clean, comfortable room, and a pretty good value in the overpriced world of midtown Manhattan lodging. I might not want to spend a honeymoon there, but for a night or two, it's a good deal for a pretty good property.

title: Great for everyone
text: Stayed 6 nights very good location our room on 4th floor was very good size  one double bed but only a single wardrobe.  A large wet room / toilet. Very friendly staff very good complementry breakfast all day coffee and cookies free wifi. Only negative is lack of shelves in bathroom nowhere to put toiletries (only on sink side)and nowhere to put soap or shower gel in shower.

title: Hotel de boa qualidade
text: A localização é o ponto forte do hotel. Na área de teatros, Time Square, Macy's, estação de metrô  e restaurantes . O pessoal que atende é muito atencioso, o café da manhã é simples mas de boa qualidade. O quarto é espaçoso e limpo.

title: Great Stay
text: My family stayed in the Comfort Suites, Times Square, for a few days prior to leaving on a cruise to Bermuda. The room was clean and comfortable. Although we spent very little time in the room, the complementary breakfast, excellent location, affordable price, and friendly staff make this hotel a real gem in Manhattan!

title: I would DEFINITELY stay here again!
text: I took my daughter recently to NYC for her high school graduation present to see all of the sights. We stayed at the Comfort Inn on 44th for five wonderful nights and I canNOT say enough kind things about the staff nor enough awesome things about the comfort of the room and service. It was the most convenient location to all of our Times Square and Theater and sight-seeing action! I would DEFINITELY stay here again! (Suggestion: Get down to breakfast and take it back to your room! Fantastic breakfast...just can be crowded at times!)

title: Excelente lugar a pasos de Times Square
text: Lugar limpio y cómodo para visitar Nueva York y estar cerca de Times Square. Se destaca su localización para hacer paseos caminando en las cercanías y poder ir a cenar y tomar unos tragos por las noches a Times Square.

title: Great hotel, great location, scary elevator
text: The location of this hotel was great! Right close to the subway, Times Square and just a short walk to the Empire State Building. The rooms are very small (of course, it's NYC!) but pretty clean. The only negative about this hotel, the elevator always feels like a death trap. It feels like it's suspended by a bungee cord and it severely bounces when you step in or when it stops. Other than that, great hotel!!

title: Loved it!
text: Just loved this hotel. Location is so convenient to the Subway and Times Square and other New York attractions. Really can't say enough about the staff. I think they were wonderful -- helpful and friendly -- perhaps even the best I've ever seen at a Comfort Inn. Exceeded my expectations for the city. I was impressed they had fresh pastries and bagels with their other standard breakfast choices. I stayed in one of the "basement" rooms and it was so quiet. I'm told the room was also quite large by New York standards. Thought the bed and pillows were very comfortable.

title: Perfect Location
text:
We stayed here for 5 nights, seeing New York for the first time.  The room was small be adequate although it was a challenge working out where to put our suitcases.  We muddled through though.  The staff were very friendly, everything imaginable was provided in the room, including a safe, ironing board and iron in the tiny wardrobe, coffee making facilities on the desk, and plenty of disposable cups.  There was even a small fridge under the desk.  The bathroom was a good size and everything was provided in there.  it was a bit noisy though - the constant sirens don't help you sleep well (our room looked out on 44th Street) and when the guests in the next room open or close their door, it sounds as though they are in your room.
On the downside, we never got used to the lift - it did a lot of bouncing and adjusted itself every time one or two more people got in - not good for your appetite.  There are 10 rooms on each of the seven floors in this hotel, but only one slow lift, so sometimes you have to wait quite a long time for it to arrive. I would recommend asking for a room on a lower floor so you don't have to use the lift. and if you want a bit of quiet, ask if rooms away from 44th Ave are quieter.
The breakfast room was always crowded - again, it is probably too small for all the guests it is supposed to accommodate.  Every day we had to wait for a table to become free before we could help ourselves to breakfast.  The food selection was good though - eggs, bacon or sausages, toast, cereal, pastries, yoghurt, fruit juice, fruit,waffles - the owners have crammed as much as they possibly can into the selection.  if you have room to eat breakfast in your bedroom, it would be worth taking the tray from underneath the coffee machine, and put your breakfast on that to take up to your room.
There are plenty of places to eat and drink within a stone's throw of the hotel, and there is a laundry right next door - they will wash and fold your clothes for 90 cents per pound - drop it off in the morning and collect it after 5pm.
This hotel is so conveniently placed, and good value as well.  We will definitely stay here again, and will recommend it to others.

title: great location!
text: This hotel is situated a short walk from Times Square.  Our queen bedroom was  quite small but clean.   Staff was friendly and helpful.  Hotel is non-smoking which we appreciated.  Our room was on an upper floor facing rear of hotel which made it quiet.  Breakfast offered was complimentary and adequate.  Only complaint..base of tables in bkfst area were too large to be able to push chairs under table.  Made area very crowded.  Room was moderately priced considering the location.  Would definitely stay here again.

title: Great location and wonderful staff
text: I brought a group of high school seniors for their graduation trip to New York and had a wonderful experience with the hotel.  At check-in our rooms had already been assigned, key packets with rooming list were given along with bags of cookies for the kids!!  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  Rooms are the average size for New York.  The complimentary breakfast was a great way to get the day off to a good start.  It included proteins, yogurt, fresh fruit and pastries, waffles, and the usual cereals, juices and coffee.   The location is just a couple of blocks from Times Square and we felt very safe walking back at night after our activities.  Will definitely stay here again.

title: Great Value in a Great Location
text: My wife and I stayed at the Comfort Inn Times Square for three nights in early May of 2015 and the very best thing about this hotel is the location.  It's within walking distance of so much.  The room was on the small side, but not uncomfortably so.  It was clean and comfortable.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The breakfast was adequate and well tended to.  My only complaint about breakfast was the egg-like product that is supposed resemble scrambled eggs tasted like cardboard.  But most other Continental Breakfasts serve the same thing.  We were on the sixth floor, facing 44th St, and did not find it noisy in the least.  All in all, this place was everything we were looking for - a relatively inexpensive, clean, safe room to sleep in  while enjoying the amazing sights of NYC.  We would stay here again and would recommend this place to anyone looking for a great value in a great location.  If you're looking for a luxury room walk down the street a 1/2 block to the Intercontinental and pay twice as much.  For us, the Comfort Inn worked great.

title: Not as good as the last time
text:
WE have stayed at the Comfort Inn Time Square West several times this last time the service was not the same.
WE booked two rooms they tried to put us on different floors when I complained they up graded us to a king size bed room.
  we were shocked latter that night a young man  opened the door and came in . He had been given that room. What would have happened if we had been out?
The front desk  goofed up .
It was crowed with school kids on break and they were noisy.
One night the manager was on the phone  or sitting with one of the staff drinking coffee not at the desk. 
It is a good location but next year we will look at the other Hotels in the area and pay a little more for service.

title: location
text: hotel was in a great location for walking to time square. The staff was very friendly and helpful. My room was down in the basement which was a little different but it was very nice and clean.I would stay here again.

title: Good price for a Great Location
text: Enjoyed the freedom of safely walking right to Times Square and to the Theater District.  We wanted to be able to walk to everything on our Bucket List including Rockefeller Plaza and the Broadway show Wicked.  Done.  Great bonus of having a complimentary breakfast.  The room was small but very clean and comfortable.  The staff were friendly and accommodating.  Would stay here again.

title: Albergo un po' triste ma in posizione strategica.
text:
Abbiamo scelto questo hotel per la posizione (eccellente) e per il prezzo (caro in termini assoluti ma per NY decisamente economico).
Le camere sono piccolissime, l'ambiente è un po' triste.
Alcune stanze sono a piano terra, accanto alla reception e all'ascensore: troppo rumorose! Solo dopo due notti insonni siamo riusciti a farcela cambiare. Vi consiglio di precisare alla prenotazione che scegliete camere ai piani alti. L'hotel è vicinissimo alla fermata della metropolitana ed a times square in una zona comunque, incredibilmente, silenziosa.

title: good bang for your buck!
text:
First off location location!   If you are there to tour NYC then this is one of the best areas to stay to be central to most places.  Its in the heart of Times Square.  The service is awesome.  The wifi is free and breakfast every morning is free.   The have. a fridge, coffee maker and save in the room.  They even have free movies (select movies but nice seletion)
Like I said they give you for free what other hotels will charge you for.

title: 1 night in the Big Apple
text: Stayed for one night in early April on our way home to the UK after 5 days skiing in VT. great location, only 5 mins from Times Square but quiet enough to get a good nights sleep. Hotel was very clean, rooms looked very modern and the beds extremely comfortable. Breakfast in the morning was a bonus that you don't normally get in NYC without paying for it. Staff were very helpful considering we had 117 in our group!!!!

title: Great location, fantastic staff
text:
There's a lot of places to stay in NYC and some may not prefer Times Sq area but we love the lively atmosphere. 

This place is a 2 -3 min walk to Times Sq & Theater district area. Awesome location. BTW if you are traveling in your own car there's a parking facility opposite to the hotel. If it interests you, Port Authority Bus Terminal is 10 mins walk from the hotel. There's plenty of good eating joints nearby and you can walk up a block and stand in the crazy queue if you want to eat at Shake Shack ;)

They provide breakfast (plenty, reasonably good, decent choices), coffee/tea/hot chocolate available throughout the day, my advice, go a little early if you wanna get a place at the breakfast lounge, it gets filled up real quick. 

Rooms aren't big but spacious enough to make you feel comfortable. They have coffee machine, electronic safe, TV (not that you will ever turn it on), closet space, wifi access with pretty good speed. The bathroom was clean and decent. 

Staff is the best part of this place. Courteous, always smiling, attentive to your needs. Check in Check out was simple and efficient. Ask the front desk, sometimes they have discount vouchers and they can even arrange for some local tours. 

We really enjoyed our stay. Next time when we are back this is where we are staying for sure.

title: Could have been soo much better
text:
We stayed here May 11-15, 2015. Upon arrival, the check in was swift. We were given our room straight away, even though it was before check in time. We were checked in to a room on the 6th floor which i loved. The room was small. Very small.. We had 4 people in the room, 2 double beds that barely fit inside. The bathroom appeared somewhat clean upon inspection and the beds were clean too, no bedbugs or other infestations. They have in room fridge that works great, and a coffee pot. Also in the closet was an ironing board, safe and iron. The bathroom hair dryer sucks.. The water pressure was also horrible. 

The room was never fully cleaned for days, only swapping out the dirty towels and garbage daily. Never vacuumed or sink cleaned. The cleaners I seen were men, who did not speak much English, and I don't think they understood to come back in 20 mins. 

The free breakfast they supplied were waffles, (both original and chocolate) boiled (hot or cold) eggs, sometimes scrambled or egg patties, microwaved bacon or sausages (alternate days) and bagels, pastries and mini muffins, cereal and yogurt. Coffee/tea/hot chocolate was a 24/7 deal. 

The real problem came when the night before we checked out, we asked for a taxi to be ordered for us for 9 am the next day. We were told by several front desk staff that the taxi is $60 for one trip to LGA and that included tolls, and tip. We were fine with that since it was $45 to come from the airport and its $15 per person to get the shuttle. However, once we arrived at the airport, the driver that the hotel ordered for us, tried to scam us out of an extra $8 (not much i know) for 'tolls' he decided to take to make the trip to the airport smoother.. Funny since it took us an extra 30 min to get to the airport than coming from. My husband got very irate over this driver trying to scam us for more money and the driver backed down and gave us back $10.  

Just be aware of this, and maybe arrange your own transportation.  Would I stay here again? Probably not.

title: Excelente Hotel!
text: Fiquei em um quarto com camas Twins. As camas eram queen size, com roupa de cama e travesseiros de qualidade. Muito bom o banheiro e com isolamento acústico bom. Bem localizado (100metros do teatro do Fantasma da Ópera e da Port Authority, bem como fica próximo da Time Square) Café da manhã bom para os padrões americanos ( o que é ruim para o padrão brasileiro :). Wifi gratuito de boa qualidade. Staff da Índia, em sua maioria muito simpáticos. Recebem encomendas postais sem cobrar nada. Permitiram check-in antecipado. Ficarei lá de novo da próxima vez que for!

title: Fantastic hotel, excellent location, clean rooms & comfy beds.
text: This is only a small hotel compared to some of the others around it but great value for money. The staff were excellent, check in was swift and efficient. The room was clean and inviting and I don't think I have ever stayed in a hotel where the beds and pillows were so comfortable. Plenty of clean towels  and a hair dryer in the bathroom. Breakfast was good with free tea and coffee whenever you wanted it, not just at breakfast but all through the day. The hotel is situated only 2 blocks from Times Square so close enough to the action and subway stations but far enough from the noise. We were not being picked up from the hotel until 5pm but check out was at 11am so we decided to go and have some lunch and the hotel tagged our luggage airport style and locked them away for us to pick up later. Overall this hotel was great and I would definitely stay there again

title: Clean, comfortable, great location. Excellent value near Times Square.
text: Clean hotel, comfortable beds, good breakfast, friendly and helpful staff. About 5 minutes from Times Square and close to all the theatres. Lots of restaurants, bakeries and cafes nearby. Reasonable price. Not fancy but has everything you need. My only criticism is that the Wifi was somewhat spotty. I would stay again in a flash!

title: Hotellrum
text: Vi var tre personer i ett hotellrum och blev lovad att få ett större men alla rum var lika och det var trångt samt att det var dåligt med hängare, annars var väl standarden ok för det priset. Bra gångavstånd till centrala delarna på Manhattan men ändå lite avsides vilket är en fördel eftersom man hade lite distans till stadspulsen...bra utbud med restauranger. Frukost ingick och den var okej dock inte som de svenska hotell frukost vi är van med. Fiberrikt bröd lyste i sin frånvaro samt grönsaker. Kaffet var bedrövligt så införskaffa en burk pulverkaffe. Det var alldeles för få bord så man fick vänta till det blev ledigt...Annars så var det en toppenbra resa.

title: A good and clean hotel right in the middle of it all!
text:
I Manhattan for a trade show and needed a reasonably priced hotel to stay at. It was a reasonable walk from what seemed like everything. Penn Station, Javits Convention Center, Times Square, dining, bars, you name it. 

The hotel staff was very accommodating. We arrived hours before checking time and they held our bags so we didn't have to tote them around the city. The hotel was clean- the rooms were well kept, and the bathrooms were clean. The rooms are not spacious, but they are what one should expect to find in Manhattan. 

The continental breakfast is what I have come to expect from Comfort Inns and I was very pleased. The staff was helpful and even assisted with waffle making. 

Overall a good experience and I would definitely would recommend and stay there again.

title: Perfect location
text: We stayed 2 nights 3 days. My son, my mom and I. Everything perfect. Rooms are clean and neat. Bathroom is very nice, beds are comfortable and most important part for NY LOCATION is perfect and safe. Just breakfast room is too small if you are late you have to wait.

title: Excellent location, great service and fabulous price!
text:
2 women and 2 twelve year old girls, for a single night following Wicked.  First and foremost we felt safe both in the hotel and walking to and from.

Great price (~$200), clean rooms and common areas.  Rooms are small, typical for NYC but they had all we needed and were very clean.  It was fairly quiet for the city, likely much less so than a "prime" Time Square location.

The included breakfast had the typical continental breakfast fare and then some, you can make your own Belgium waffle, there was eggs  & sausage, plenty to fill up for the morning.

Everyone we encountered was pleasant.  

Great location!  The short walk to 8th Ave and plenty of options to eat right there.  Shake Shack, John's Pizza, Famous Famiglia Pizza, City Kitchen, and a diner.

title: Perfectly located, clean, priced right
text: I have NO idea why some travelers have criticized the quality and price of this hotel. If anyone wants a 400 square foot room and in the morning go out and spend $24 per person on breakfast, go someplace else. Anyway, our experience was fantastic. The room was of adequate size, (huge, sparkling clean bathroom), and the staff was very polite and efficient. The location, as others have said, is very convenient to Times Square and lots of restaurants. The continental breakfast offers a few hot selections and all the standard pastries, muffins, etc.. The only very small drawback is the slowness of the elevator, but if that's an issue for you, take the stairs (I did).

title: Great Location
text:
This is a nice hotel in a great midtown location.  It is clean, the front desk was pleasant and had it together.  One of the more pleasant front desks I've encountered in or out of NYC!  You can check your lugagge there if you are early or staying in NYC after checkout.  There are restaurants in the area, including a diner around the corner, pub across the street, french place that looked good a half a block doen the street.

We had a room with two double beds and it was tiny.  I couldn't stay in this room for more than one or two nights, because even with minimal luggage there's just no place to put anything, let alone dress.  Bathroom is similarly small, with really not enough room to put the tioletries of two women, even though neither of us has tons of bottles.  Everytime you move you are in danger of knocking something in the tiolet!  

It does have a coffee maker, but I'm not sure how usuable it is, because you have to either walk across the bed or move luggage to get to it.

For people who like openable windows, they do open, which is a huge thing with me.  If you like to open the window you might want to get a room higher than 2, because our 2nd floor was right above the lobby roof.  Ventilation seems to work well and is not loud.

Over all, a GREAT place for a short visit with no more than two adults.  I would NOT plan on staying here for more than a few days because of the cramped space.

Would plan on staying here again, especially with the price being as right as its going to be in midtown Manhattan.

title: A great spot for all Times Square action!
text:
My brother and I stayed here for a few days. For the price, comfort and location this place cannot be beat.  I've stayed in a number of hotels in the area over the years, trust me on this one.   

THE LOCATION: Excellent!  An easy walk to all the Times Sq. action and most mid-town attractions... And most importantly, the theaters!  We went to a number of shows and walked to them all without problems at all!  Consider how much cab fare you save!  If you need to go uptown or anywhere else, there is a subway station on the street about half a block away! 

Another thing fantastic about this location is the vast selection of great... And I mean GREAT... NY food that surrounds you at every turn!

THE HOTEL: compact but very nice, plus FREE breakfast and FREE WIFI!  The staff is supremely friendly and the double queen room we stayed in was the largest room I've ever stayed at in NYC... I'm talking including normal rooms in the Marriott marquee and other high ends hotels in Times Square (they don't have free wifi for free breakfast either)

The room was quiet, very little road noise for us, only the occasional police or ambulance siren.  I don't know how parking was because staying here you don't need one... 

OVERALL: This is my new New York hotel of choice from now on, without a doubt!

title: Serve bem quem quer praticidade!
text: Bom Hotel! Quarto pequeno mas o banheiro compensou! Limpo na entrada, mas tivemos problemas no decorrer dos dias precisando contatar a gerência para resolver! No mais tudo certo! Recomendo para quem não te. Expectativas com luxo! Bom café da manhã

title: Excellent Stay - Perfect for Times Square
text:
We stayed here with another family over the Easter holidays. We had a great time and cannot recommended the Comfort Inn highly enough. The staff were very friendly and extremely helpful, particularly at breakfast when on a couple of days it was a bit busy with school trips. The breakfast itself was of a very good standard and having free hot drinks during the day was a nice touch.
I found the room to be slightly small but in line with other Manhattan properties so not an issue. It was very clean, reasonable modern and comfortable. It was a nice touch having a fridge, and the wifi worked well. 44th St can be a bit noisy at night but it didn't give us sleepless nights.
Location wise, the Comfort Inn was pretty much perfect. 2 mins walk to a grocery store, 2 mins to enter the Subway and about 5 mins to Times Square itself. There were good bars and restaurants, including Shake Shack on the doorstep. We had a car for a couple of days and were able to park on the street for free overnight or opposite in a car park - no problem.
So overall, highly recommended for the price. Would definitely come back here again given the excellent staff, good breakfast, comfortable rooms and awesome location.

title: Excellence all the way around
text: We had a wonderful week in NYC! The Comfort Inn staff was excellent and so willing to help. Rooms were clean and the location was great. They lady in charge of breakfast was outstanding. Even with several groups of students, she kept the bar well stocked and cleaned. They held our luggage when we checked in early and were always willing to give us help or directions if needed. I would most definitely stay here again!!!

title: Excelente escolha em NY!
text: Hotel com ótima localização, se você chega no aeroporto JfK basta pegar o Airtrain e depois o metrô e descer na 42, são apenas 2 ruas do hotel que fica na 44 com a oitava avenida, mesma rua do Fantasma da Opera e também fica a duas ruas da Times square e Broadway. Quarto confortável e limpo e excelente café da manhã.

title: Lives up to expectations! !!
text: We booked this hotel based on all the good reviews it received, I have read every single review on here since December 2014 and I have to say that this hotel is great!!!! The staff is very friendly and accommodating, the rooms are a bit small as expected but me and my wife and daughter stayed in a double bed room and it was fine, the free breakfast is amazing and they even have a staff member there to make you a fresh waffle! The elevator is a bit slow but there is only one for the entire hotel so I was expecting a bit of a wait, and this hotel is literally 5 minutes from Times Square, in past reviews the great location is noted, but I was still amazed at how close the hotel is to Times Square, the only downside that we experienced is that there is a bit of street noise from 44th but not enough to wake you if you are sleeping but enough to hear if you are awake, overall this hotel is an amazing place to stay if visiting NYC!!!!

title: Excellent family hotel, great location and breakfast
text: I stayed here on a family vacation with kids. We found an excellent rate on the hotel's website. Very central and safe location, with a Shake Shack around the corner and right in the middle of theater district. Hotel staff were just excellent, friendly and helpful. The breakfast was great and the woman running it did a fantastic job even at peak times-- friendly, helpful, and keeping food freshly stocked. Two waffle stations were the highlight, offering a regular and special waffle. (I think there chocolate waffles our first morning sold my kids on nyc.) Also offered egg and either sausage or bacon; cereal; yogurt; pastries; bread and toast; boiled eggs; banana, apples, and oranges; apple and orange juice; coffee. Breakfast was crowded but we always found seats. our room on the 6th floor faced the back and we had remarkably little street noise. Room was standard Manhattan size and we did fine with four of us in a room with two double beds. Room had a mini fridge and desk. Sadly our safe wasn't working. Nice family atmosphere, close to times square and subways. Hotel was extremely clean. I would happily stay there again.

title: Fantastic location, nice rooms
text: One thing I know has been said before...you don't go to New York spending a lot of time in your hotel room. I carefully considered my options as there is a lot. My dad and I decided on the Comfort Inn mainly for the price. It was one of the only places we found that offered free wifi and breakfast without breaking the bank. We were in New York mainly to see shows and it was in the perfect location for that. A subway entrance was a the end of the road (corner of 44th and 8th ave) which was very nice to help get around the island. The rooms are fine, small yet comfortable and was exactly what we needed for three nights. If you are a light sleeper like myself I suggest bringing ear plugs, getting a room on a higher floor, or a room not facing 44th. My dad and I noticed that 44th seems to be a main thru-way for emergency services to come down...and it can get kinda loud. (Note: I wouldn't stay here if you want to sleep during the day. The cleaning people are loud in the hallway in the am.) Breakfast was great and had a variety of choices. We didn't have any problems with the wifi and the staff was very pleasant. Whenever I travel back to New York, this is definitely the first place I will look.

title: good loaction, not so good room
text: It has a very good location, but the same cant be said about the room. They are terribly small but comparing the price and the location, they are more than enough to get by if you are budget traveler. The breakfast buffet is an added bonus for the weary traveler

title: Expensive room rates, average service, boring breakfast
text:
I have just stayed a this hotel for a 2 week period (that was very expensive!). I had to book this hotel because this one is in a fantastic location, literally metres away from the times square area where my business trip brought me.

The interiors of the rooms look dated to some extent. The heating is sometimes too hot, sometimes too cold. The bathroom is decent but there were not enough toiletteries provided. The worst part of the stay was the breakfast. They only have a set menu of 2 different item combinations which they keep alternating ALL THE TIME. This can get tiring if you are staying for longer periods as you will be eating the same stuff over and over again.

However, the location as I mentioned earlier is fantastic, as the hotel is just walking distance to Time Square, Madison Square Gardens and also the 42nd St. subway.

The staff don't speak fluent English either, although most of them can manage to convey themselves.

title: amazing.
text:
From the moment we stepped into the hotel till the day we left, customer service was given at its best. The warm staff at the reception went beyond their scale to make our stay a pleasant one. We booked a regular room for 2 persons initially but at the very last minute, we had to change it to a double queen bedded room as there was a last minute addition to our trip. The staff were very helpful on the phone, making sure everything was sorted prior to our arrival. The room was clean and sufficient enough for the 3 of us. The hallways are very narrow and if there is a negative, it would be that at times we could hear our neighbours shutting the door loudly. But besides that, we had quiet nights. The beds were comfortable. Breakfast was mediocre. We had breakfast on the first morning (complimentary breakfast), and for the rest of the trip, we sourced out. The wifi was strong. There is no room service, however the reception is more than happy to provide information about take outs. The location is absolutely convenient. Its literally 10 minutes walk to Times Square and the subway station is just 7 mins or less away. 
Overall, I would definitely return back to this hotel and will be happy to stay there again. Credits to the staff who made our stay a memorable one.

title: Good Deal For Times Square Area
text: This is a nice hotel for the money. The rooms are small but they are clean. It is close to a lot of attractions.  You are within walking distance of most of the theaters.  There are a lot of restaurants.  You get a free breakfast in the morning. It is pretty good.  You have your choice of waffles, muffins, bagels, toast, fruit, yogurt and more.  Beverages are free too.  They generally  have coffee, tea, juice and water. We got all of this for under $100.  Overall, it was a pleasant stay.  I would definitely like to stay again.  It is relatively quiet for a Midtown hotel.

title: Times Square Hotel-Great Price and Value
text: The Comfort Inn Times Square West had very clean rooms, very friendly staff and a great breakfast.  The beds were very comfortable and the hotel was very quiet at night.  It was close to all the attractions of Times Square but far enough away that you didn't hear the city noises when you wanted to sleep.  The rooms were small and the lobby wasn't fancy, but we had not come to New York to stay in our hotel room!  If you are looking for a place to sleep that is clean with a free breakfast, this is the hotel for you!

title: Strange hallway and small room...good for one or one & 1/2 people (lol). Very nice staff.
text:
Strange, rooms are similar to a cruise ship, yet, clean and comfortable.
You can tell when you enter the lobby, that the hotel has a little age to it. 
However, the desk attendant was very nice, incredibly curteous, and very helpful.
He even went the extra mile, to tell me to leave my car right in the front because I arrived at 2:00 in the morning. 
Get ready for the hallways...weird...almost seems like they added rooms, and used part of the hallway for the added rooms.
Bathrooms... small, yet brand new.. 
The hotel serves it purpose. Good for one or two people.

title: Excellent for the $$
text: I seriously questioned  how this hotel could have "excellent" rating and yet so reasonably priced??  But yet it was...  The room was clean, furniture in nice condition  - and the bed was very comfortable. The location was right off Times Square - walk to theater district.  The staff  - friendly and helpful and the price was $200 cheaper than what I normally pay in NYC so I was VERY happy and will stay here again for sure.  Here's what I wish I had known ... don't get a room in the basement because the staff is up early working and you can hear them.  Don't get a room near the elevator - there's a loud whoosh noise every time it moves.   I could hear the room next to me at 1:00am and again at 7am.  Were they loud talkers or were the walls thin? No idea - but I'm a light sleeper. My daughter slept through it.  It's not ritzy - but if you are  looking for a clean, comfortable place to crash at night - pick this hotel. It's perfect for that.

title: Excellent Stay!!
text: We stayed at the hotel for a fabulous getaway.  Check in was very efficient.  Location is prime.  Just steps away from the subway, Times Square, & Broadway district.  Breakfast was excellent for continental breakfasts.  Flavored home made waffles, sausage, bacon, bagels, fresh fruit, yogurt, eggs & much more.  Fresh tea, coffee, & chocolate chip cookies available 24 hours a day.  Staff were very friendly and helpful.  I would definitely recommend this place and will most likely stay here again.

title: bon hôtel très proche du centre
text:
Accueil poli et courtois, les réceptionnistes sont à l, ecoute et très disponibles
Seul bémol, aucun ne parle le français mais bon on ne va pas aux États Unis pour parler français...
Chambre propre 
Petit déjeuner copieux

Adresse à garder pour un prochain voyage!

title: Great location, tiny room
text:
Our taxi driver described this as a "boutique hotel."   We reached it using the train from the Newark Airport to Penn Station, and then took a cab.  An alternative would be to take the bus from the airport to Port Authority, which is an easy walk from the hotel.  The location is fantastic, especially if you want to access Broadway shows and Times Square within easy walking distance.  There is lots to do in this area.  
       Our room had a queen-sized bed, and there was very little walking room around the bed, and we had to take turns accessing certain parts of the room as there wasn't room for two people to function easily in the same area at the same time.  The shower door wouldn't open and close properly, but the hotel sent up maintenance men immediately when I mentioned it. The room was minimally decorated, and I found the endless beige and brown drab and uninteresting.  Functional, but not stylish.  
        The hotel provides a breakfast buffet that is included in the price, which was a good feature.  Coffee, tea, hot chocolate, and chocolate chip cookies are available for free all day and night. The staff were friendly and obliging.  A couple might want to get a room with two beds just for extra space.  Or, see if they have rooms with king-sized beds, and find out how much free floor space there is.  There is a wardrobe to hang up clothes, although the hanger rack is low that full-length clothes drag on the floor of the cupboard.  There is a small safe in the wardrobe as well.  There are bedside tables that can hold items, but no dresser.  There is a small desk.  
         We came in early March and the price was very reasonable (less than $100 per night with our CAA/AAA discount) but I noticed that it increases drastically by the third week of March.  It was clean and we didn't notice other problems.  If people can handle a small room, this is a good choice for midtown Manhattan.  It is not a luxury hotel, but a functional, affordable choice if you are going to be out and about, and hardly in your room.

title: Great hotel, great value!
text:
This hotel is located within walking distance of everything you want to see near Times Square and right down the street from the Broadway theaters. It is close to the Port Authority Bus Station and the Subway, which is great for easy access to other attractions that are not so close (like the Statue of Liberty). There are plenty of restaurants nearby (all of which are better alternatives than the chains in the square). 
When we first arrived, I was skeptical about the room because it was small and in the basement. It seemed to be very clean, but It was also cold. We turned on the heater, went to bed and had a great nights sleep (the bed was very comfy!) 

In the morning, I noticed the sheets and comforter were a little dirty. We asked housekeeping to change them and they immediately did. Our safe did not work but they sent someone to fix it ASAP. The coffee was plentiful and actually good. The breakfast was better than average, with hot foods like eggs and bacon as well as toast, bagels, fruit, cereals, etc. Even though the hotel is small (welcome to the city!) there was plenty of room to sit and eat breakfast. The wifi worked like a charm!
The staff was very attentive to our needs and helpful. They allowed us to check out late and even held our luggage until it was time for us to catch our flight (even offered us cookies and coffee while we were waiting for them to retrieve the luggage). 
One last point, the hotel was about 1/2 the price of the hotel that was hosting the conference. It is a great value and I will be back.

title: we will be back, best value!
text:
location: perfect. it's two blocks from times square but nice and quiet for sleeping and just getting away from it all in between events. we felt very safe both times we stayed there. many great restaurants within a block or two including restaurant row on 46th. we were there for kinky boots which I could practically see from the window of our room. 
breakfast: free and amazing. real eggs, scrambled, soft boiled and hard boiled. waffles, both plain and blueberry. cereal. oatmeal. toast. bagels. fruit - including bananas. yogurt. the staff was working very very hard to maintain the quality and quantity and they did a great job. it was crowded but not overwhelming at all. 
room: small but clean with a nice shower, great tv, in room coffee and fridge. nice pillows, choice of soft or hard. 
staff: out of their way pleasant and hard working. 
other: cookies at the front desk. coffee, tea and hot chocolate 24 hours. 
special:  we arrived quite early and the room was obviously not ready but they stored our luggage. Even better, they stored our luggage after we checked out so we didn't have to take it to the show!!!

title: Excellent value, very helpful staff
text:
This hotel has modest sized, clean rooms and is very well located, being close to both the subway (half block) and Times Square to the east and most Broadway theatres. There is a good variety restaurants on the same block as well as in the "Hell's Kitchen" area to the west.

The price includes a good breakfast (with additional coffee/tea 24 hours).
This is a safe area and has with 24/7 desk staff who are very helpful.

The staff went the extra mile for us because we had booked via Expedia to a room configuration that does not actually exist in the hotel (i.e. Expedia had made an error).  The hotel staff kindly re-booked us in a better room as soon as they could accommodate us.

Definitely excellent value for money.

title: It was great! great location, amazing staff!
text:
Me and my friend  stayed in this hotel for three nights and it was beyond our expectation! 
It is not a big, luxury hotel but exactly what you need if you come to travel and explore NYC :) the location of it is awesome! 5 min walk from times square, movie theater around, good restaurateurs, 

The breakfast was great! they had breads, cakes, yogurt and even a Belgium waffle machine! the best part was that anytime we want- even in the middle of the night- there was always hot water, coffee, tea and hot chocolate! when we got back from a trip in the cold city it was a sweet and great treat. 

The room is not big, but very stasfied. we had TV with cables, coffee machine and ac/heat. the room and the shower was clean and knit- everyday someone organize the bad and took trash, put new towels etc. 

The staff was great! everything we asked for it was more then willing to help! in our last night we went to Broadway and need to print the tickets- and the representative at the front desk gave us the option to it out of charge! it is just an example for the kindness they had. 

In total we had a great experience and we will be happy to come back again!

title: Ótima localização
text: O hotel é simples, mas bem localizado.Para quem pretende ir ao Fantasma da Ópera, fica localizado na mesma rua do Teatro Majestic. Há também uma estação de metrô bem próxima. O café da manhã está incluído na diária.

title: Great hotel.
text: Great staff.Very welcoming.This hotel has everything you need, wright there - Times Square. Althought the rooms are not big, they're clean and confortable. The breakfast is very good and the service also. I really recommend!

title: Ótima localizacao
text: Hospedar-se em Nova York por um preço justo e pagando um valor razoável é muito difícil, então, na maior parte das vezes, faz-se necessário optar entre pagar pouco e ficar longe das atrações ou pagar um pouco a mais e ficar no burburinho.optamos por gastar um pouco mais para ficarmos melhor localizados. Próximo ao metrô, restaruantes, times square, o comfort inn mostrou-se uma ótima opcao. Apesar do quarto pequeno, ele estava sempre limpo. Recomendo

title: Great budget hotel
text: I read a few reviews on tripadvisor after booking this place and I was a bit concerned about what I would find.  Contrary to the negatives the place was in a great location, close to Times Square, very cheap and all round impressive.  The staff were extra pleasant and friendly.  Nice warm room in the middle of a NY Winter!

title: Paper Thin Walls, Noisy Hallways, Comfortable Beds, Kind Employees
text:
Thursday night on W. 44th street is Trash night. And if you get caught behind city trash truck, you are trapped, no way to back up, construction work eliminates space to move around. Spent 45 Minutes waiting for trash men to load thousands of bags into truck from office buildings. Parking garage across street from the Comfort Inn was convenient but overcharged $20 (noted after exited that hotel validation discount was not deducted & charged full price),
The room was comfortable. Modern bathroom & super comfortable mattresses w/ soft & hard pillows. My teen forgot her toothbrush & the front desk person quickly and kindly provided us with a complimentary one. 
Breakfast was better than expected..eggs..waffles...I would stay here again despite noise.

title: Nice Room, Great Location near Times Square Free Breakfast
text: I stayed in a double room. The room was a decent size for a Manhattan hotel as they usually tend to be small. The beds were on the small size more like a twin bed. Glad I didn't have to share that bed. One elevator can be hard to catch at times. Lots of places to eat near by. Times Square is one block away and within walking distance weather permitting. All in All I'd stay here again if the price was right.

title: Very Satisfied
text: I stayed for a couple of nights. It has an excellent location. Very close to the subway and Times Square. Got a great price for that part of NYC. Rooms not really big, but it is Manhattan. Good hot breakfast included. I would stay again.

title: Great location,  incredible value.
text:
So I had my reserves on booking this hotel and frankly I was going to book the one in Times Square South,  but by accident this hotel was selected. Yes,  pretty quite dumb from my part,  truth be told I'm happy of my mistake. Though there are mostly good reviews on this hotel there's also bad comments and that quite scared me, my family is used to travel in good hotels but this time we were in an adjusted budget for our winter vacations in NYC. 
So,  getting to the hotel.  Lobby is small,  you can't expect the Plaza size lobby for a Comfort Inn,  but it's practical. The people handling the main desk are friendly and make your stay a pleasant one. Next to the lobby is the tables for the breakfast buffet they offer each morning already included in your daily rate. This is a major plus for the value because you get a hot breakfast each day you save at least 7 dollars daily. From waffles to bagels,  with a different time of eggs,  yogurt, coffee,  juice,  tea and milk. It's a good breakfast you can have to begin your day. 
Son on that first floor there are a couple of rooms,  which I think is really practical,  no need of elevators or so. There's only one elevator and it could take a little longer in the mornings, but that's not really a big hassle. We stayed in the 4th floor and in a Double bed room,  yes,  the rooms are small but that's nyc type. Any hotel in the city will be a smaller version of it than any other hotel of the same brand in any city. So,  the room had a desk,  chair,  mini refrigerator. The bathroom is complete with essential toiletries you might need in the trip,  also a hair dryer and iron are included in the room. 
The bed,  it's so comfortable! They provide you of hard and soft pillows, which I must say is nice to consider your option to use.  
Location of the hotel is the best value of all,  GREAT!  Just one block and a half from Times Square and one block from theatres that have Mamma Mía, Rock of ages,  The Phantom of the Opera and Matilda. In the same block walking towards 8th Avenue is the metro stop which connects to almost all the metro lines in the city. 
Gotta say the location for the price it's totally worth it.

title: Great location and price
text: This hotel is an excellent place to stay, close to Times Square, the theatre district and subway lines. The price was excellent, rooms and lobby were clean. Staff was extremely helpful, professional and friendly. Breakfast was the usual fare for the Choice Hotel chain, but it does the job to help start the day. We will return to this location. I should note as well, that the rooms are not huge, but if you've stayed in Manhattan, you know rooms at hotels aren't big.

title: For the price, amazing!
text: Very nice front desk staff, decent wifi, decent breakfast, and great bedding. The room was tiny but modern and clean, and the location is perfect for Times Square. If someone else were paying, I'd want a bit more luxury, but it was absolutely not depressing at all!

title: Another excellent stay
text: Because of a good experience last year, we took another January break in NYC and took advantage of nice seasonal rates at the Comfort Inn.   It was very cold in the city, so the location, very near Broadway theaters, restaurants, subway, etc, was great.  Rooms in city hotels are generally not very large, and this is no exception, but it was nicely appointed, perfectly clean, quiet.  Bed comfortable, and we appreciated that there were 6 outlets handy to bed and desk for recharging electronics.  Free wi-fi worked fine.  Housekeeping was efficient and friendly.  The breakfast was plenteous, with eggs, sausage or bacon, waffles, cereals, fruit, yogurt, pastries and breads--all good.  And coffee, tea, hot chocolate available at all times.    Specially impressed with desk staff, who were friendly and most helpful always.  And even free cookies!  It all made for a very comfortable and happy stay in The City.

title: Best choice unless you you want to pay for luxury
text:
Stayed here for a week - If you want a 3.5 star of 4 star hotel with a nice lobby and restaurant, you likely would not get what this hotel offers: refrigerator in room (microwave available for use in lobby), decent sized rooms for NYC, free breakfast and evening cookies, free Wi-Fi, individual HVAC units, clean room.

Breakfast:  Make your own fresh regular or flavored waffles with batter, scrambled eggs (chunks or flat, depending on day), meat (bacon and hot boiled eggs; or sausage links and biscuits/gravy depending on day), bagels, toast, croissants, muffins, pastries, cereals, yogurt, cold hard-boiled eggs, oatmeal, apples, oranges, bananas, hot chocolate, coffee, tea, oatmeal - pretty good!

Room: The two-bed rooms include refrigerator in corner, and against the main wall: desk with chair, bed #1, end table, bed #2, suitcase rack, and clothes armoir.  Flat screen TV against the other wall about 3-feet from the end of the beds.  Bathroom has a shower/tub combo with curved curtain rod, marble counter.  Toiletries include shampoo, conditioner, skin lotion, shower cap, and soap.  Nice skyline views from upper floors.

Location: 1.5 "long" blocks (NYC has long blocks and short blocks (3=1)) and a 5 minute walk to Times Square. 15-20 minute walk to Rockefeller Center.  Less than 30 minutes to Central Park south, Madison Square Garden/Penn Station, Empire State Building/Macy's, Grand Central Station, etc.  Subway stations 5 to 10 minutes away or less. Lots of places to eat, small food markets, and places to see Broadway shows within a block or two.

Only downside: thin walls if you have a noisy neighbor, city noises - don't stay in NYC if you are a light sleeper.

title: Great Place for Vacations!
text: Considering that all the NYC visitors expend the time in the streets of Manhattan this hotel offers the chance to recover and recharge battery for your next journey! Rooms are not big, actually they are compact but nice! The room had a giant screen, the bed is really soft, in general great service. Location is perfect just 2 squares from Times Square and Radio Music City Hall, there is a parking lot in front of the hotel and they make a discount for the hotel visitors. I can recommend 100% this hotel as an option to have a good time at NYC!!

title: Muito bem localizado
text: Em NY priorizo localização e este hotel neste quesito é excelente. O fato do café ser incluso ajuda no custo benefício principalmente quando se viaja com crianças. 2 pontos dei considerando a localização e o custo. Contras: para mais de duas pessoas os quartos são bem apertados 1 só elevador em certos horários a espera é longa. espaço para café da manhã pequeno, acorde cedo, senão a espera pode ser longa. Como não vou a NY para ficar dentro de hotel, a se mantiverem os custos voltaria a ficar novamente.

title: Past Reviews about Bed Bugs Infestations still Valid in 2015
text: Others have written reviews about bed bugs and management's unhelpful or unprofessional responses circa 2010 and 2011.  Still true, sadly. On New Year's Eve we rented a room for $700.  An hour after arrival saw a large bed bug crawling around our pillow.  Caught the bug, which is good because the manager initially denied vehemently that there could be an issue.  He insisted that he'd gone and inspected the room and there was zero evidence of infestation.  The rooms had been remodeled so there was no way we could be correct.  Even after we showed him the bug crawling around in our plastic cup, he actually suggested that we could have "brought it ourselves" in our bags or clothing.  I understand there is a bed bug issue across the country.  I wasn't expecting to never encounter one (though this is my first ever).  But to be treated so rudely after spending over $700 for one night's stay, is unacceptable.  I often stay at this line of hotels in other cities.  But never this one.  Never again.

title: Convenient and the Price is Right
text: Great location for a fun trip to the Big Apple.  Close to theater, arts, shopping and restaurants.  We found the hotel clean, comfortable and easy to get to after all of our jaunts.  Hotel staff were helpful with suggestions and directions, very polite and kind.  We will certainly visit this spot again.

title: If you want a good nights sleep, avoid this hotel!!
text: The staff was nice, the rooms were teeny tiny! We had a view of the city on the 3rd floor, but we were kept up ALL night by the street noises. Not only that, but we were woken up by the room next to us!!! Horrible worst experience. Good hotel location right next to subway and food, but bad hotel for peace and quiet!

title: Exactly What I Expected
text: The Comfort Inn Times Square West was everything I was expecting from the excellent reviews I read here on Trip Advisor!  The staff was very friendly and helpful,  our room was very clean and the breakfast was just what we needed to start our busy days of sightseeing!  This hotel is in a very convenient location to midtown Manhattan attractions, and there is a subway stop just up the block.  Would most definitely stay here again!  I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Inmejorable ubicación
text: Es un hotel pequeño, muy bien ubicado. Las habitaciones son normales, cómodas y completas (TV, cajoneras, escritorio, espejo) Estuvimos en el piso siete y no hay problemas de ruidos de la calle, por lo que se puede descansar muy bien. El baño es pequeño pero completo y limpio. Tiene un desayunador con café, frutas, cereales, leche, pan mermeladas, jugos, yogurt. etc sin costo. Los empleados son muy amables y predispuestos para ayudar en todo momento. Es muy económico.

title: Nice rooms excellent location
text: The hotel is located literally only minutes away from Times Square and has easy access to all public transportation. The rooms are small but that is to be expected in the city and are well appointed. The hotel itself is maintained well and the front desk staff were mostly friendly and helpful. The breakfast offered in the morning was a nice touch.

title: Great location, very friendly staff
text: Just a couple of blocks from Times Square, which makes it super convenient to walk to everything and the main Subway station where you can catch a train to anywhere!  Rooms are nice and clean, albeit small (this is NYC, after all), and the staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful.  Overall, a very enjoyable stay.

title: Excelente Ubicacion
text: Este hotel era muy económico para la ubicación en que está. Nos hospedamos en el por 2 noches, y estaba tan bien ubicado que pudimos recorrer la mayor parte de lo más importante de NYC. La habitación era muy cómoda, una cama de 2 plazas, baño limpio, y la gente que atendía muy agradable.

title: Super Stay !
text: I have scored this top marks - Some will not agree but this is my reason - New York is about site seeing so we spent very little time in the room other than sleeping. We had 2 rooms on 7th floor for my wife and our 3 teenage children , rooms cleaned daily , basic but equipped well enough , there is free safe in the room which was a bonus for us. Breakfast I loved , no frills but plenty of choice to get you started for your day. Staff super and helpful , location was excellent ! Can't fault this place and will use again !

title: Superb !!!
text: Well what a great place in a super location. We had 2 rooms , one for me , my wife and son and two daughters in the other -  Clean rooms with regular maid service , super friendly helpful reception , good breakfast , great view from our room , free safe in the room. Really pleasant stay. I will certainly use this hotel again ! Thank You

title: Very helpful staff!
text: My sister and I stayed in New York for one night with our Mom  prior to an 80th birthday cruise.  We arrived very early, but the staff were very accommodating.  They made sure that Mom was comfortable during the wait and got us into a room as soon as possible.  The desk staff also went out their way to assist us with a wheelchair rental and taxi to the cruise port.  The hotel was clean and comfortavle and the location was excellent for our dinner and a show that evening.  Thanks!

title: Great experience!
text: The hotel is in a great location, the room was very clean and comfortable, and the staff could not have been any nicer!!  We love to come into the city for weekends and will DEFINITELY stay here again and again!!!

title: Custo Benefício & Localização bons
text: òtima localização, região dos teatros, poucas quadras de Times Square, próximo de estação de metrô, o que facilita trânsito diário. O hotel é simples mas fornece café da manhã. Legal conhecer o restaurante "Carmine's" que é bem famoso em filmes.

title: MUCH MUCH BETTER THAN ECONO LODGE TIMES SQUARE!
text:
So if you're planning on using some of your hard earned choice privileges points in Times Square you probably have noticed that this hotel and the Econo Lodge are the closest to Times Square. You also likely noticed that they require similar points to stay for free. I have stayed at both and there is NO comparison. The COMFORT INN TIMES SQUARE WEST IS A MUCH BETTER VALUE! Instead of reeling off justifications for why you are "ok at the Econo lodge" you could be HAPPY at the comfort inn west. The rooms at the Econo Lodge are a joke. You will be sharing embarrassing photos at the water cooler back home about how you could stretch and touch both walls (really) at the Econo Lodge. 

The Comfort Inn is not a palace but it is very functional. The bathroom is clean. My room with 2 double beds (I chose that because you couldn't fit 2 double beds into my room at the Econo Lodge) didn't require you to 'inhale and walk sideways to get by the bed'. The desk and chair were fine for getting work done too. The walls were clean. The heat/ac worked. It was about 1/3 smaller than a normal room but still big enough to be in without getting claustrophobic.  

The location is good for theater goers. Many shows will be less than a 10 minute walk and some only 3 minutes. 

There is some noise with other doors closing and from the street even if you are on a high floor but not that kept me from getting a good nights sleep. I found the bed very comfortable (unlike the V shaped bed at Econo Lodge). 

If you are a single, book a double room anyway and you'll have lots of extra space. There isn't a chair for sitting and watching TV so plan on viewing from your bed. The TV is about 32" and is wall mounted. 

There is a single slow elevator which can get frustrating as it it also the one that the cleaning crew has to use. There is a garage across the street where you can park (with hotel validation) for $30 per day. 

I have stayed in many places (Crown Plaza, Double Tree Times Square) that were a bit roomier and ON Times Square that are worth your points (but a LOT of them...50,000 per day and up). The Comfort Inn West offers great value for your points!

title: Muy buena ubicación
text:
El hotel está muy bien ubicado, en la misma cuadra hay una estación de metro.
Muy cercano a Times Square, y a diferentes medios de transporte para recorrer lugares turísticos.
Las habitaciones son pequeñas, pero con muy buen servicio.

title: A gem just off Times Square
text: The staff was very friendly.  The hotel has modern updates.  The breakfast was wonderful.  The one downer was that the elevator was not working and we were on the top (7th) floor.  It was no fault of the hotel as the parts to make the needed repairs were not available.  The staff offered to carry our belongings up to our floor.   I would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Acomodação e Café da manhã de primeira
text: Ótima localização, pois está a 1 quadra de distância do centro do Central Park West, algumas quadras de distância do American Museum of Natural History, fácil acesso à 2 estações de metrô (subway) que te levam à vários pontos da Times Square. Hotel perfeito para o que precisava.

title: Great Location & Hotel!
text: This hotel has a great location 5 minute walk to Times Square. Great Irish Pub two doors down a must try! Great prices, food & liquor. Had a wonderful stay the beds were very comfortable, rooms were very clean. They were just renovated and did an amazing job. Rooms are small but who spends much time in their room when in NYC! Breakfast was great! All staff was wonderful and very friendly. Will definitely be back when in NYC!

title: A very specil out standing wonderful staff
text: I would like to share my GOOD feelings about this Hotel . I mus say hat from traveling a lot around the world it is very very hard to find such a beautiful , kind , warm , nice staff like this Hotel has , and special these 3 staff members by the names ''''' ANIL ''''' VIBHUTI''''SUNITA'''' they are a real blessing for the Hotel , and i am very sure that anyone who will stay there even 1 time will agree with me fully on that and they will come back and back to this Hotel ....... Israel Apter . Denver Colorado..

title: Great Location, Great Price - I would stay again
text:
Great Location. Great Price.  5 minute walk to many of the Broadway shows.  3 minute walk to Shake Shack (you must try Shake Shack - even if you have to wait in line - and you probably will have to wait in line). 
Free breakfast was good - typical mid-tier hotel breakfast food (next time I will try the Waffles).  Room was clean but small.  Front desk staff was helpful.

Bottom Line:  Location and Price is great. I would stay again.

title: Small but close to everything
text: This hotel room was tight for two people but was near everything! It was 1.5 blocks from Times Square, was on the same block as our Broadway show, was 1 block from the Subway, a short walk from 5th Ave, Central Park, great restaurants, and plenty of other tourist attractions. The price was great for the location. I would stay here again in a heart beat.

title: So perfect
text: My husband and I stayed here on a recent mini-vaca away from our small kids. We could not have been more pleased. For the price, the value cannot be beat. We were steps to the blue line and more bars and restaurants than we could visit in a year. The complimentary breakfast was amazing! All of the staff were lovely. Our room was clean. I will say, after reading some reviews I was leery of being down in the basement, but for us it was fine. We were in room 105, which is the room right next to the elevator. There was some noise from the elevator, but it didn't disturb us at all. We loved having access to the courtyard. We will definitely be back.

title: Had all we needed
text: Went for work purposes for two days and it was okay.  Nothing stood out but the hotel had all that me and another co-worker needed.  It was near by places to eat only a short walk to some really good restaurants.   Staff was also nice.   The room was okay the bed was a little hard but I was so tiered I just slept.  For a one or two day stay it is okay. Price is good.

title: Clean and convenient
text: This hotel is the perfect place to stay when visiting NYC and seeing Broadway shows. It was a couple of blocks from everything we wanted to do in Times Square. It is also a couple of blocks from the subway station we used to go downtown to see the 911 Memorial and museum. It is a couple of blocks from the Port Authority Bus Station where the NYC Airporter takes you to and from the airport. This hotel is very clean and the staff is friendly. The continental breakfast is convenient and good for a hotel breakfast. The breakfast area was very clean as well. The price is reasonable and a bit less than other big name hotels in the area. This will be my regular hotel from now on.

title: UK School Trip
text: Went on a A Level Politics trip to New York and stayed in the Comfort Inn. Out for 8am every morning, back for 5pm, then out for dinner at 7pm and not back til 11ish, so not much time spent in hotel. But staff were friendly enough, great rooms, and a lovely variety of breakfast foods on offer of a morning.

title: Custo benefício bom!
text: O Hotel é simples. Como os "Inn" americanos, tem quarto pequeno, café da manhã bem limitado e poucos serviços disponíveis. Porém a localização é perfeita, ao lado da Times Square na altura da MAC , Disney Store, Forever 21. Os quartos apesar de pequenos oferecem o conforto necessário para dormir, que é só o que faz em hotel quem vai pra NY.  Banheiro ok, cama ok, televisão, internet. Eu ficaria novamente.

title: Great Times Square Hotel
text: Comfort Inn Times Square West is a block or so from the hustle and bustle of Times Square, minus the hustle and bustle. Conveniently located so that all of our sights were max 20 blocks from the hotel (we always chose to walk). Rooms are on the small side, but wasn't an issue for 2 people who were only using the room for the night. This hotel has clearly been updated recently. Selected this hotel because of the great rate and because breakfast was included. Typical continental breakfast, however eating area was cramped. All in all I would definitely stay at this hotel again and would most likely search this hotel first for my next visit to NYC.

title: Confortável hotel em uma ótima localização
text: O hotel tem uma localizaçao perfeita, perto da times square e ao lado de uma estaçao de metro. Internet (boa velocidade) e café da manhã (ok) inclusos. Os quartos sao pequenos (normal em Ny) porém confortáveis! Recomendo tanto que irei ficar no mesmo hotel em uma proxima viagem a Ny!

title: Good place to stay in NYC
text: I had a pleasant stay at the Comfort Inn: The room was clean, in a good condition and (compared to other hotels in Manhattan) relatively spacious. Staff at the front desk was very friendly and reacted quickly. The location is really good: There are many restaurants just around the corner and with two blocks away from times square it takes less than 10 minutes to get there. Finally the breakfast is better than what I've had in other hotels in NY since it includes waffles, fresh fruits, yoghurt and cereals. I can definitely recommend this hotel and will book there the next time I come to New York.

title: Próximo ao Time Square
text: O quarto é um pouco apertado, mas oferece café da manhã que quebra um galhão. Banheiro espaçoso e o hotel é próximo a tudo (Times Square, subway, Bus Station) e mesmo que você retorne tarde, o local não oferece perigo. E estávamos com duas crianças.

title: Great place to stay...
text: My daughter and I had four nights at the Comfort Inn and I cannot express enough how wonderful our stay was, it started from the check in and continued to the morning we left, with the private cab that they booked for us.  This location is close to everything we wanted to do...and the staff went out of their way to make our stay comfortable....the free breakfast was a great way to start the day, lots of choices including waffles, bacon, eggs, bagels, toast etc.  There was no problem finding something to eat.   Our room was also very clean and well stocked everyday with toilet paper, towels, etc.  Will definitely book there next year.

title: Bom custo-benefício
text: Considerando que NY é uma cidade carérrima....este hotel está bem localizado e possui o necessário. Os quartos possuem um tamanho padrão, cama aconchegante, mas não possuem ventilação. São equipados com ar- condicionado, possuem o inconveniente do carpete, e uma boa ducha. O café-da-manhã é o básico estilo americano, não esperem muita coisa, contudo é só sair do hotel que vc estará no maravilhoso mundo novaiorquino!!! Concordando com opiniões já deixadas aqui no site, como se trata de um prédio antigo, um único elevador complica um pouco...no mais, é um hotel limpo, com um staff gentil e muito bem localizado...faz-se tudo à pé, táxi ou metrô (na porta!) .

title: Great.
text: Went with a friend in early February of 2011. Services was nice, room was small but enough for us since we were only there to sleep. The fridge was helpful as we always brought leftovers from dinners. GREAT location, 2 blocks from time square. My friend was a first timer in the city and it was easy for her to find the hotel. Great overall experience, will be visiting again.

title: Definitely recommend this one!
text: Great stay for a great price. Arrived 3 hours before check-in. We expected to store our luggage so we could go explore the city, but to our surprise our room was ready! Rooms are tight but comfortable. Good enough to rest after a long day of shopping and walking. Breakfast was wonderful. They offer something for everyone! All the staff we encountered was extremely friendly and helpful, too. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Convenient, clean, quiet and a good location
text: We went to New York for several days for vacation. We wanted to see as much as we could in a short amount of time.  We inquired about the best alternatives for travel and the ladies at the desk were very knowledgeable.  They shared in detail where we needed to go and how to get there.  Our room was a suite and not surprisingly in NY style, small but functional. It was the perfect size for the two of us, though.  We were gone all day and just needed a nice, clean place to sleep. This place did just that.  There is a complimentary breakfast in the basement that provided a nice breakfast...eggs, sausage, toast, cereal, donuts, muffins, coffee, and juices.  Plus, we had two complimentary bottles of water in our room each day.  Those definitely were needed.  One works up quite the thirst walking around town. It is located in the Garment District, just a couple blocks from the subway and Times Square.

title: loved the roof top
text:
I was staying in this hotel with 3 other friends. The room was pretty small, but it was very clean.
We loved the breakfast, and the staff was very polite although they can barely speak English. It's right next to Times Square and you have a lot of restaurants and shops around it. The best thing was that it is very close to the bus/train station, and I loooooved the roof top. You have to go on the roof top and enjoy NYC :)

title: Великолепный отель.
text: Отель расположен в минуте хотьбы от метро. Из окон видны театры Бродвея. При закрытых окнах в номере тихо. Кондиционер работает тихо, как на холод, так и на тепло. В номере и ванной комнате очень чисто. Весь персонал вежлив и предупредителен, помогают при любой просьбе. Есть камера хранения. В номере удобные кровати, хорошее постельное бельё, шкаф, холодильник,утюг, кофеварка, наборы для чая и кофе, хотя на первом этаже круглые сутки можно выпить чай, кофе, горячий шоколад - это очень удобно. Завтраки очень приличные, в отличие от других отелей Нью-Йорка - йогурты,хлопья, омлет, сосиски, большой выбор выпечки, яблоки, бананы,апельсины. Отель оставил очень хорошее впечатление, в следующий раз я буду выбирать его, т.к. по сравнению с другими отелями Манхетена( проживала в трех отелях), он лучше по цене и комфорту, да и наличие завтрака играет в пользу этого отеля.

title: Perfect
text:
Had been following the reviews prior to arrival, but you're never really sure until you stay yourself. Happy to say the reviews are completely true! Great location and service, and very clean. For a small room the 4 of us had no issues of feeling crowded. Room had everything you would need, Coffee maker,flat panel TV, closet, mini fridge, hair dryer, ironing board and iron, personal safe and a small desk. 
Hot breakfast was great and 24 hr. coffee, tea and hot chocolate in the lobby was a plus. Our 3 mornings there we never had trouble getting a table. Even took some bananas and little cereal boxes for snacks during the day.
Staff very helpful. We checked out at 10:00 and left our bags there so we could still sight-see for a few more hours until our flight. For a flat rate of $60 they can arrange transportation to La Guardia airport in one of those black SUVs you see everywhere in Manhattan. We got back to the hotel at 3:00 and it was there waiting.
If the price was right I would definitely stay here again. Forgot to mention the free wi-fi. Always a plus!

title: Good price, nice people & clean
text:
I travel to NYC like 4 times a year and it was a great surprise, I have been to many other hotels in Manhattan for higher prices which were not so clean, not so nice people & not so well located.
So really my bet for my following trips to NYC, specially for 1-2 nights

title: Great Place to Stay
text:
Very Clean place to stay.  The service was also great!  We stayed in room 406 and it had a pretty good view.  The room had a mini-fridge in it.  

Breakfast was pretty good as well.  One day they had sausage links and another day they had bacon.  Different pastries to choose from.  You have a choice of waffles.  Plain or Blueberry on day and Chocolate another.  

They offer 24 hour coffee,tea, and hot chocolate in the lobby. 

The also have two computers in the lobby for you to use.

title: Great Management & Staff
text:
I've booked a layover in this hotel before moving elsewhere in NY via one of the online booking agencies. On arriving at the hotel, I was informed that I had no booking for that date - huge error from the online booking agency. The receptionist was very polite and tried to help - which you don't get very often in NYC! I was offered a room but was asked to pay for the rate again. I accepted at that moment given I had no other options. I realized that the booking agencies had me booked 10 days ago, which to the hotel meant that I had a no-show!

I explained the situation to the hotel staff and manager, they were really understanding but didn't promise me a refund for the missed night at that moment. However, later upon investigation, I was refunded that night and all went well. To me, this is a trustworthy hotel that I'd definitely stay at again.

The hotel location is great. The rooms are decent considering the rate compared to elsewhere in NYC. Breakfast was not bad at all.

My overall experience was excellent and I consider this hotel a great value for money!

Regards,
Ayoub

title: Great Service and Location
text: The location of this hotel is wonderful, and we were able to walk to most of our activities.  The front desk personnel were always helpful and smiling.  The rooms were very small (typical for NYC), but clean, comfortable and recently remodeled.  Breakfast was good and offered a nice variety of items.  There was even a different flavor of batter for waffles offered each morning.  We arrived early in the morning and were able to leave our bags while we started our day's activities until we were ready to check in later in the early evening.  They also let us leave our bags on the day of check out while we finished up our sight seeing.  We had only pleasant experiences with this hotel and would highly recommend it to anyone.

title: great value, great location
text: loved staying here, it was the perfect location for us as we  were in nyc for a few days mainly to see shows. the staff were so friendly and helpful. how great to have free breakfast in the morning and free cookies in the evening. can't wait to return!

title: Great Hotel, Great Room, Great location!
text: Loved the location, steps to Times Square...Room was small but extremely clean and four adults fit perfectly.  The staff was so helpful and extremely friendly.  Free continental breakfast was great...included waffles...cereal...fruit...juices and More!!  Please note that parking is across the street and costs 30 dollars every 24 hours...seems pricey...but for NYC it was a great deal.

title: Great Location! Friendly Staff!
text: The staff was so friendly when we checked in. The rates were the best around. Great location. Walking distance to everything! Great great great location. The room was clean and comfortable. Nothing fancy, but we weren't in our room much except to sleep. They also have a nice free breakfast. Don't waste your money on fancy, stay here!

title: Comfortable Stay at the Comfort Inn Times Square
text: The staff was kind, friendly and helpful. The Inn was clean, beds comfortable, shower hot, breakfast great.  The location is perfect, close to theaters & restaurants ! I would recommend to others, and will stay again!

title: Pleasant Stay in Midtown Manhattan
text:
The location of this hotel is perfect! Close to everything!
The staff were very friendly on my arrival. It was just me, so the room was a perfect size for one, although I don't think it's too small even if there were two people..it is NYC after all! 
The bathroom was clean with good water pressure, and plenty of plush towels.
The bed was comfortable, they give you 2 kinds of pillows, firm and soft..so you can choose which works best for you. 
The wifi connection was excellent and it was free.
The complimentary breakfast in the morning had lots of options: fruit, donuts, danishes, croissants, waffles, cereals, toast, biscuits, eggs, bacon, sausage, juices, coffee, hot choc, etc. I thought it was nice that the bready things were in mini form so you can try more than one thing without getting full :)
