The breakfast room does get crowded, but I think they did a good job with getting as much seating in the room as possible; you can always take a tray up to your room if you want.
Also...coffee, hot choc, and water are available 24hrs for all guests.

I opted to leave the Do Not Disturb sign on my door for my whole stay, and I appreciated that the housekeeping staff respected it and did not enter my room during the day.

I felt very safe staying at this hotel, as I was a solo female. The front desk staff greeted me in the morning, and always acknowledged me when I came back in for the night.

I'm sorry about some of the negative reviews that I've read here...I guess unfortunately, they did not have the same experience I had...but I would definitely stay in this hotel again.

title: Great stay at the comfort inn Times Square west
text: The staff was friendly and helpful.  The breakfast was good and free.  Location is perfect...close the subway, restaurants, bars, and Times Square.  Rooms, although small fit our needs.  Would recommend to others.

title: Perfect location
text: Se cercate un albergo centrale, a due passi da Times Square, pulito, economico per gli standard di NYC, questo è il posto che fa per voi. Non è certo un 5 stelle, ma offre colazione e wifi (sempre funzionante) inclusi nel prezzo e soprattutto la subway a 500 metri. Pulizia e cortesia. What else?

title: La mejor opción para conocer Nueva York
text:
La situación es excelente, te permite ir andando a todos los sitios turísticos, las habitaciones son cómodas y limpias, el wifi funciona en todo el hotel, incluso se me conectaba en la calle cuando estaba llegando al hotel. 
El personal se preocupa porque tengamos buena opinión del hotel lucen con orgullo la distinción Tripadvisor. 
Dispones de plancha, tabla de planchar, nevera y cafetera, la verdad que al hotel le pondría alguna estrella más.  Sin duda lo recomiendo a todas aquellas personas que queráis conocer Nueva York y buscáis algo para descansar y bien situado. Siempre y cuando el precio sea el adecuado será siempre mi primera opción cuando vuelva a  NYC
Las únicas pegas que tiene el hotel es que al ser un hotel pequeño, sólo existe un ascensor y se utiliza también para los empleados. Y que el comedor es pequeño y o te levantas pronto y desayunas sin problemas o a las 9 tienes que compartir mesa.

title: Worst night in a hotel ever
text:
Let's start with the good: the location is convenient for a short trip, the price is super good for NYC, the hotel is clean, the room was clean and seemed like newly decorated, the bed and pillows were very comfortable.
Now for the bad: the receptionist had no clue what she was doing and was super slow. Had to redo nearly every action twice as seemed to either not completely understand English or not listen. I was given a tiny room on the first (ground/lobby) floor next to the elevator. I did not sleep one minute all night due to the noise of people chatting and laughing coming and going from the lobby and in and out of the elevator. Even at 3.30am and 4am there was noise and I could even hear the conversations going on at the reception area. Just an awful night. So even though the price was good - it was an extremely expensive early morning shower that I paid for basically...! Couldn't wait to get back home and have some sleep.
If you do choose to stay at this hotel, make sure to ask for a high floor back facing room or bring a good pair of ear blocks! Or just sleeping pills!!!!
I only gave them the two stars for the room cleanliness and new decor, otherwise it would be a complete 0.

title: I should of read the reviews
text: I was given a room in the basement of the hotel. No guests should have to step over piles of laundry and boxes to get to their room. The room itself wasn't so bad. Small and clean. Although outside of the sliding door was full of debris from construction. ( old sinks, toilets, dry wall, ,etc,)

title: Great Location
text:
We stayed for 2 nights in August 2014.  The room had 2 double beds to accommodate 2 adults and 2 children.  Although the room was quite small, we expected that in New York.  The hotel frontage was in the process of being replaced but this did not interfere with our stay. 

The room and bathroom were small but clean as were the common areas.  The staff were very nice and helpful and the breakfast was nice, with quite alot to choose from on the buffet.  We ate early (about 6.30am) and it was just a couple of other families so no rush or crowd.

The location was great, only a couple of blocks to walk to Times Square and the tube. 

If you want a boutique hotel or spacious accommodation this is not the hotel for you, if you want a good value clean hotel to use as a base then I think it is.

title: Aconchegante
text: Gostei do atendimento, desde a recepção, todos bem solícitos,embora a recepção seja um pouco pequena para o porte do hotel. O quarto embora não seja grande é bem aconchegante, tem tudo que se precisa, inclusive secador, ferro e tábua de passar, que foram muito úteis. Limpeza adequada. E tem café da manhã, algo meio difícil em NY. Além disso, destaco a localização, no centro das melhores atrações de Nova Iorque , como os teatros e a Times Square, a poucos metros. Considerando os altos preços de hotéis da região, esse hotel traz um excelente custo benefício. Eu e minha família apreciamos muito. Voltarei a me hospedar no mesmo, e recomendo a todos.

title: Hotel muy comodo!
text:
El Confort Inn es un hotel muy bien ubicado. A dos cuadras de port autority y a seis del Times Square. Cerca del Central Park y de Broadway.

El hotel en si no cuenta con demasiados lujos. Las habitaciones son pequeñas, pero comodas. En mi caso viaje con mi hermano y los dos teniamos espacio para dos valijas grandes. El baño tiene lo esencial. 

El desayuno venia incluido. La comida era repetitiva y el desayunador es bastante chico, por ende en muchos casos nos lo llevamos a la habitacion. 

El trato del personal fue excelente. No tuvimos ningun problema con la reserva. Es mas, llegamos antes y nos brindaron un lugar seguro para cuidar el equipaje.

title: Ubicación y servicio
text:
Excelente opción en NY, muy buena ubicación cerca de Times Square, como así también, bien localizado en cuanto al transporte, en la esquina del hotel (44th st y 8th av) hay una boca de acceso para el metro y a la vuelta por la 9na avenida hay varias líneas de bus.
Las habitaciones son correctas, un poco ajustadas en cuanto a su tamaño, aunque en NY en la gran mayoría de los hoteles sucede lo mismo. Tiene desayuno de cortesia, que sin ser super completo tiene una variedad interesante de opciones.
El servicio del personal es muy correcto, inclusive en el front desk nos recibieron varios envíos de correo sin ningún cargo ni aún tampoco quisieron aceptar propina.
Interesante opción de alojamiento cerca de Times Square.

title: Pleasantly Surprised
text: The location of this hotel is ideal.  It is easy to park across the street and they give a discount for hotel guests of $30 for 24 hours which is a deal in NYC.  Yes the rooms are small, but they are clean, neat, and everything was in working order.  Staff was friendly and helpful and courteous.  I would definitely recommend if you are looking for a centrally located hotel that you are not looking for all the bells and whistles of luxury but a place to stay, shower and sleep that safe and clean and convenient while enjoying all NYC has to offer this is the place for you.

title: また利用したいと思います
text:
JFK空港からポート・オーソリティ・バスターミナルまで移動後、スーツケースを持っての移動が少ないホテルを探したところ、こちらのホテルになりました。同じ通りの並びにはバードランド（ジャズクラブ）と牛角があり、近くにはShakeShackもありました。夜遅くまで人通りがあったので、ミュージカル後にホテルまで徒歩で戻っても、治安の不安はありませんでした。　ホテルの部屋は清潔、室内金庫あり、空の大きめ冷蔵庫ありで、私の好み通りでした。　ロビー横のレストランスペースで朝食が振る舞われ、同じ場所で終日コーヒーや紅茶などが飲めたのも良かったです。夕方はフロントで焼き立てチョコチップクッキーも振る舞われました。（数量限定なのでタイミングが重要ですが...）
NYCでやっとお気に入りホテルを見つけました。次回も利用したいと思います。

title: ótima localização
text: O ponto forte desse hotel é a localização, a poucos passos da Times Square e Perto de vários e bons restaurantes. Gostamos também do atendimento, Staff sempre gentil. O quarto um pouco pequeno pra ficar mais de 2 pessoas, mas tem um bom banheiro e tudo bem limpo. Um ponto que deixa a desejar é o fato de ter apenas um elevador, pois em certos momentos demora demais. o café da manhã é bom, considerando o que se encontra nos hotéis dos EUA. Mas tirando os problemas a localização compensa tudo. recomendo.

title: Perfect location!
text:
My friend and i stayed overnight here, the location is perfect so close to Times Square and all the theaters. The room was fine although I could see some saying it was small, but its NYC it was clean, comfortable, it includes breakfast which had a good selection, the breakfast space is a bit tight and we had to wait a few minutes till people left so we could sit down...The lobby is a bit on the small size, there are rooms in the basement and before we checked in we had to go to the restroom which was in the basement, glad i did because i requested a room on a higher floor
I would stay here again for sure...

title: Fun location with great staff
text: 3rd stay at this inn. Location is perfect. Rooms recently renovated. Rooms are small. Very clean. Lots of tourists stay here. Close to Times Square and theaters. Staff is very helpful with all questions.

title: Ótimo!
text: Estivemos hospedados com eles no ínicio deste mês e não temos do que reclamar. Atendimento atencioso e prestativo, quarto e banheiro limpos, bem arrumados e confortáveis e café-da-manhã honesto. O espaço do café é muito pequeno, como já tinham mencionado por aqui, mas só o fato de ter café incluso na diária já faz a diferença. Nós levávamos pro quarto o que queríamos e problema de espaço resolvido! Vale mencionar que a localização é 10 e nos permitiu fazermos vários passeios à pé! Recomendamos!

title: Clean, Friendly Hotel Just off Times Square
text: We just returned from a four night stay at this hotel.  We were close to everything and found the rooms very clean.  Looked at all rates in the area and these were the most reasonable.  We had difficulty finding it the first night when we arrived as to the small front door access.  However, we had a very pleasant stay and would most definitely stay here again if looking for a room in this area.  Free wi-fi and free breakfast were a real bonus.

title: Excellent stay and even better location
text:
I stayed for 3 nights just for a quick getaway. The location was absolutely perfect. It was walking distance from everything. The breakfast was decent and having free wi-fi was really convenient. The hotel has a great deal with the parking lot across the road. We paid 30$ per day for parking which is fair considering the location. 
The staff was friendly and answered any questions we had. 
I would definitely stay here again.

title: Great Price and Location
text: The staff was very friendly and attentive. The building and rooms were clean, even when undergoing construction. The location is ideal and the rooms were more reasonably priced than anywhere else in the area. I plan to stay here for any and all future visits to the city. Thank you for the great experience.

title: Great location for a short NYC trip
text:
I stayed there for 9 night in July 2014. Small rooms, but clean. The good thing is the included breakfast, which in unusual in the major hotels in NYC. 
Had some trouble with the roomservice the last two days, but then we found out that they would not make the beds if there were personal belongings on it, what turned out to be a good thing because of all the open luggage and purses. 
Subway station steps away.
 I recommend it, but max 3 people in the room. 4 + luggage is too much.

title: Good Location
text:
The location was great.  Near Times Square and Broadway.  Close to the subway.  The rooms are small, but it is NYC.  They were clean and the beds were comfortable.  The breakfast in the morning was convenient and good.  There was a nice variety of pastries, fruits, waffles, eggs and other breakfast items.
We were on the top floor, but I did see the 1st floor and basement floor rooms that other people have commented on. I would not like to have a room there and would recommend when booking to make sure to ask for 2nd floor and above.
If you have a vehicle with you there is a parking garage across the street.  We went 2 hours over the 24 hrs. we were going to be there and were charged for another 24 hrs. which was another $50.00.  I would be careful if parking your car in that area and make sure if you go over the 24 hrs. you can pay hourly after that.
Overall it is a good hotel in a great location!  We would stay there again.

title: Great location & price
text: Very clean, friendly staff!  We really enjoyed the convenience of the location.  Complimentary breakfast made eating with kids very easy.  Kids loved the waffles :) Small rooms without a lot of space for luggage...but what would you expect in NYC?  Would definitely stay here again!

title: Several blocks from time square. Very small rooms.
text: We got a ground floor room right near noisy front desk. Hotel is under construction and is several blocks from time square. Also make sure you understand their late check-out policy or it will cost you.

title: Ótima acomodação
text:
Este hotel nos surpreendeu. Consegui um preço justo (em comparação aos outros hotéis), fica a poucas quadras da Times Square, bem próximo de muito local turístico (fomos a pé para o Empire State building) e é confortável. 
Apesar de ter reservado um quarto para não fumantes, chegando no quarto senti um forte odor de cigarro. Fomos logo reclamar e pedir um novo quarto e o funcionário prontamente nos atendeu e o problema foi resolvido. 
Voltaria com certeza. 
Café da manhã um pouco fraco.

title: Great location for Broadway shows and helpful staff
text: First time going to a Broadway show and wanted to be close. This hotel was only 5 min walking to the theaters. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was well supplied. Overall a nice experience.

title: Basement rooms scary
text: Rooms where booked on the internet when got to the hotel room where in the basement near the bins and smelling and when requested for a refund, was told it to late and had to pay for 1st night if want out of booking,after a long fight with owner over the phone and rude staff and shouting in reception we got letter than he would not charge for rooms and they refused to assist at 11pm even just to call a taxi BE VERY careful just reading review and place does not match what people say and worst been in a foreign country

title: Great Hotel !!
text: Was here this past weekend. Very clean rooms and spotless bathroom. You cannot ask for a better location if you love the theatres and Times Square so close and the subway is at the end of the block. Yes the rooms are small but nothing differant the most other hotels for New York City.My only issue was the carpet was all pulled up in the hallway on the third floor and whatever they had used to prep the floor to relay the carpet the smell was very strong and bothersome to my daughter. But since we we're there only one night we did not change rooms but would have had to had our stay been longer. Will stay again and hopefully the remoldel will be complete.

title: Great place to Stay!!
text: We were just here in July and the place is great. Very clean rooms, newly remodeled and free breakfast.  The breakfast was hot, which included waffles, eggs and bacon or sausage depending on day.  Lots of other things as well.  The hotel is very close to Times Square and Subway.  It was easy to find and quiet enough to sleep not so close that you could hear noise from Times Square.  Close to many restaurants.  Would recommend and would stay again!! Staff was very attentive as well.

title: Wonderful hotel!!
text: Great hotel with a great location and hearty breakfast! The rooms are pretty small but we were barely in them.  The subway is very convenient- less than a block away.  The staff accommodated a late checkout.  They were also available to answer any questions. We were on the 6th floor- it was very quiet.  The elevator is a little slow so we ended up using the stairs a lot.  Overall- very happy!

title: Nice but noisy!!
text:
I was given a room that was located on the first floor (room #109) and about 25 feet away from the front desk. It was noisy all night long until the early morning. I could hear people in the room next door coming and going and I could also hear the hotel staff laughing and talking all night.

The room was very nice and comfortable though and in the middle of all the action on Tines Square. I would have rated the hotel a 5, but the noise level was pretty intense and the fact that part of the noise came from the staff is reason for me to rate this hotel a 3. I had a 6:55 a.m. train to catch the next morning and could not rest well.

If they try to give you a room on the first floor, do not take it unless you plan on being out all night and all morning. Ask for another room on another level.

title: A+ for Cleanliness
text: Not sure why only 2 stars are given - this place is great for a reasonably priced hotel in a perfect location.  Staff very friendly and helpful, complimentary breakfast wonderful (with freshly-made waffles, etc.).  Serving ends at 9:30, so try to get there earlier than 9:00, as seating is limited.  My main concern in choosing a hotel is cleanliness....this got high marks from others, which was well-deserved.  Room & bathroom were spotless!

title: chambre exigu
text:
l hôtel est bien situe en revanche les chambres sont minuscules idéal pour eux a Eviter en famille la climatisation est bruillante  et le gros bémol la salle de pdj qui est minuscule l équivalent de deux chambre nous avons pris notre petit déjeuner pendant une semaine dans notre chambre ce qui n est pas top en revanche le buffet est bien garni et le personnel est agréable il y a d autres hôtels dans la même rue donc vérifier la taille de la chambre ainsi que la taille du restaurant 
attention il y a 50 $ de taxes par jour a prévoir dans le budget

title: Location
text:
This hote had was in a great loation. Central to Times Square and with the subway at the end of the street made my stay so much better.
The rooms were clean and well kept.Admittadly they are small rooms. but you are in NYC, you dont spend very much time in your room anyway. Staff are very polite and helpful.
 Breakfast was great, hot and cold on offer. 
If you are looking for somehwere in a central position this is where to stay.

title: Nice hotel , great location.
text:
The hotel is in a great location , only around 5 minutes from times square. The staff that greeted us were very friendly and informative from the minute we arrived and until we left.
The room we had was a family room, it had two double beds which were very small doubles!! The room itself was tiny extremely small but that was okay as all we wanted was somewhere to sleep.
The breakfast was good and even better it was free. The set up though leaves a lot to be desired! 
It was only on our second day in New York that we realised that right next door there is a male strip club! We hadn't noticed it upon arrival but it caused no issues for us or our children.
We would definitely stay in the hotel again.

title: Good deal
text: We stayed here for 1 night with our 3 kids to do things in the city before our early morning flight the next morning.  The front desk quickly checked us in and helped us set up a car for 4 AM the next morning.  Did I mention this was after 10:00 at night and they were still able to help us?!?  We got a good deal on 2 doubles and was sufficient for the night.  Rooms are a little small for 5, but the location is prime!  Just off Times Square and right by the theater district.  I would stay here again if we don't have the 3 kids with.

title: Good week-end pour un 4 juillet à New York
text: Super bien situé 5 minutes de Time Square ont arrive en plein dedans. Services courtois, nous ont toujours informés correctement et avec gentillesse.Chambre petite mais très propre, salle de bain semble neuve avec douche. Déjeûner impeccable, fruits frais, gauffres, yogourt, etc. Une personne s'en occuper et refraîchis les plats super bien. Le plus est encore sa situation près de la 8e avenue sur la 44e rue. Juste sur le coin il y a un restaurant à la mode le Shake Shack toujours plein et une ligne à l'extérieur. À 5 minutes de la gare d'autobus et Metro Port Authority.

title: Price is right and great location!
text: We had a standard room with two double beds, there was 3 of us and we only paid 180 per night. The rooms were a bit small but who cares! It was very clean, comfortable beds and they even serve breakfast in the morning! Eggs, meat, homemade waffles made right in front of you, fruits, cereal, bagels, deserts, etc. and fresh coffee that tastes great! haha The location is epic, just a short walk to times square! Really could not have asked for better and for the price. They even held our bags for us after check out for no extra charge because we had a bus tour and didn't want to have to lug the bags around all day, now that is 5 star service. Thank you for a wonderful and accommodating stay!

title: emplacement ideal
text: Petit hotel, situé dans une rue relativement calme, à proximité immédiate de times square et de la gare routière . Très gentil accueil (ne parle pas français, mais effort pour parler lentement) . Petit déjeuner copieux et varié . Literie confortable, salle de bains très propre. thé, café dans la chambre, petit réfrigérateur. Possibilité d'utiliser M.O dans la salle du petit déjeuner pour rechauffer.. Hôtel calme, pas d'arrivée de clients la nuit. Aux alentours , nombreux restaurants et une pharmacy-épicerie . Accès à internet gratuit.

title: Great Location, Tight Room Space
text: The staff was courteous. The check in and check out process was simple and quick. The facilities were well maintained and the room clean. There is only one small slow elevator used for both guests and housekeeping which made things a little complicated if you are on a high floor and are in a hurry. The breakfast was nothing incredible, but it was free (big money and time saver). Breakfast are is small. Depending on the time you go downstairs and the amount of guests in the hotel, you may have difficulties finding empty seats/tables.My room was super small. Two full beds, for four people. No drawers to store your clothing. You will probably find yourself living off of your suitcase on a daily basis. Could not book a room with two queen beds, so I don't know if these rooms are a little bigger to better accommodate four people. Hotel location is excellent. Near endless number of restaurants. In right the middle of Times Square and the theater district. Many nearby subway stations make it a big plus.

title: Bom, preços razoáveis e próximo ao Times Square
text: Hospedei-me  nesse hotel por 2 períodos. Primeiro, fiquei por 7 dias, depois fui a Washington e Boston, e no retorno a Nova York, retornei ao Confort In. Esse hotel está bem localizado, na mesma rua tem estação do metrô, bons restaurantes, o Times Square, lojas, teatros e fica perto de tudo, podendo caminhar para todos os lugares. O hotel é novo, quartos confortáveis, não são grandes, boas camas,  com aquecimento e ar condicionado, banheiro bom, com boas roupas de cama e toalhas. Serve um bom café da manhã, incluído na diária. Na recepção tem um computador com impressora grátis, wi-fi. Os atendentes são simpáticos e prestativos.Sempre que retornar a New York, voltarei a hospedar-me no Confort In.Os quartos de frente para a rua, são um pouco barulhentos, com carros de lixo e algumas buzinas, mas, nada que impedisse o sono, depois de um dia de andanças.

title: Comfort Inn Times Square, comfortable and convenient....
text: Our family of four had a wonderful stay.  We were within walking distance to the subway, theatre district, and a multitude of restaurants.  The staff was attentive, friendly, and helpful.  Breakfast was available until 9:30am during the week.  Don't go too close to closing time it gets very crowded.  They have a nice selection of beverages, cereals, bagels, Danish, waffles, eggs, and sausage.  The breakfast area was maintained nicely and there was an attendant present replenishing items.  The front of the hotel is being refurbished but did not interfere with our experience.  The rooms were typical for city hotels on the smaller size.  However, we had the convenience of a refrigerator, coffee maker, and wardrobe closet.  Our room was clean and appointed tastefully.  We booked through a discount site and paid an awesome rate.  Would definitely stay here again.  If you're driving, the hotel has a special rate with the garage across the street.  Just make sure to get your ticket validated with the hotel.

title: Good value for Times Square location
text: The hotel is a couple of block off Times Square and is a convenient base for exploring the City.  There is a complimentary breakfast which is made up of cereals, fruits, pastries and waffles.  Free wifi is provided.

title: Great Hotel!
text: Stayed here for our first trip to NYC! Great Location, just a few blocks away from times square, and within walking distance to a lot! Room was nice and clean. Nice staff and wasn't too overpriced. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and will stay here again.

title: Hotel muito bom
text:
Muito bem localizado, na mesma rua dos shows da broadway, uma quadra da times square e com metro na esquina da rua. 
O hotel é limpo e arrumado. Ainda tem café da manhã incluso e wifi grátis.
Algumas pessoas reclamam do tamanho do quarto, porém é mais do que suficiente, afinal você está em Nova York.

title: Great location; Friendly Employees!
text: Having stayed in NY hotels previously, we know they are typically small rooms and overpriced.  While these rooms were a bit smaller than a typical Comfort Inn, the location was fantastic.  A short walk to Times Square as well as many great restaurants.  We were particularly impressed by the employees at this hotel.  It appeared to be owned by a family all working together.  They were incredibly friendly and accommodating.  We arrived before the check-in time, and with no questions asked, we immediately received a room key as well as a yummy cookie.  The breakfast that was included (which, with the food prices in New York, this was a huge savings for my family of 4) was very good and well stocked.  We needed a 5 a.m. taxi for an early flight, and they arranged it for us the night before and our taxi arrived at 4:50 a.m.  They were helpful and very friendly; which in New York especially, this isn't always the case.  We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and highly recommend!

title: A great location, a good value and nice staff
text: I can't tell you how many hotels I researched before I chose this one for our budget, the location, etc.  We were definitely satisfied with our overnight stay here.  The staff that greeted us and the staff that was there when we left were very friendly.  The rooms are a bit tight but to be expected for NYC.  They were clean and comfortable.  They are currently doing construction to the front of the building and our room looked directly out at the construction crew that started about 8:30am.   Since I had three teenage girls with me who had planned to sleep in a bit, that was the only downside.  I should have specifically asked for a room toward the back.  It would have even been fine if the darker drapes could have closed completely.  Certainly not the fault of the staff but some advanced warning would have been nice and gone a long way in my appreciation of their service.  Breakfast and free wi-fi was a bonus too in the high priced city.  I would totally stay here again (asking first about construction).  Very convenient to Times Square, the bus terminal, the subway, etc.

title: Small, but clean
text: For a reasonable price we had a small, clean room. The AC unit wouldn't crank, but the temperature was still comfortable. I forgot my toothbrush, and the wonderful staff brought me one right away. The beds were small, and not the most comfortable ever, but yet I slept great.  The free breakfast wasn't really what we had in mind, but right on the corner is a Starbucks, so it was fine. Overall for midtown Manhattan it was clean, safe, and comfortable for under $300 per night. Within walking distance of Times Square.  Great hotel!

title: Camera piccola ma posizione eccellente
text: Abbiamo soggiornato in questa struttura per 3 notti durante il nostro viaggio di nozze. Ovviamente non è un albergo a 5 stelle, ma la posizione è assolutamente centralissima (5' da Times Square) e può essere un ottimo punto di partenza per visitare Manhattan. La camera era pulita ma piccolissima, considerando poi che avevamo 4 valigie, praticamente non riuscivamo a girarsi. Classica colazione americana a buffet. Il personale è stato molto gentile e paziente. Wifi, tv e frigo in camera, in più c'è la possibilità di utilizzare due pc alla reception che permettono anche la stampa. Abbiamo speso 250€ a notte, che è tantissimo in confronto agli hotel italiani, ma a Manhattan è uno dei più bassi :-)

title: GREAT HOTEL
text: This is a great hotel to stay at. Close to everything.the staff was very pleasant and helpful. WE had a front room on the third floor and was very quiet at night. They also served a great breakfast every morning. Hot breakfast not just danish and coffee. I would recommend this hotel.

title: Pleasant Stay
text: We had a pleasant stay here.  Don't judge a book by it's cover. The outside is very plain but right inside the front door is nice. The room was clean and nice.  The beds were very comfortable, the sheets were soft and blanket perfect and I loved the fact that there were pillows of different firmness so we were all happy.  The room and bathroom were small but since we were there mainly to sleep and get ready we didn't mind.  It still has a fridge, desk and everything else we needed.  The staff was pleasant and it was nice to have complimentary breakfast even though there isn't a lot of room to sit. We were walking distance to so many sites, restaurants, stores and the subway if we needed to go further.  The price was great!  I would highly recommend it!

title: Perfect choice for us!
text: I took my 2 children to NYC (ages 9 & 11).  We wanted something close to TS, but not in the middle of the very crowded area.  The location of this hotel is in between Hell's Kitchen and Times Square.  It was perfect.  Just 1-2 blocks away from the main action, and easy to walk to everything in the area.  One entrance to the very large TS subway station is at the end of the block.  There are several other subway entrances within 2-3 blocks also.  The staff was very courteous and helpful.  Always had a smile for you.  The rooms were clean and the beds were very comfortable.  Breakfast was good for what you would expect from this type of hotel for a free breakfast (continental breakfast items plus eggs, waffle, bacon).  The area is safe - I had no concerns at all with being in that area by myself with my children.  We will definitely stay at this hotel again during our next visit!

title: Excelente Localização
text: Perfeito para quem quer ficar próximo a Times Square! Estação do metro próximo!, Café da manhã com variedades de pães, quarto amplo e limpo o que é muito importante tratando-se de New York, recepcionista bastante atencioso, um dos melhores em custo benefício.

title: Excellent location
text:
I've stayed in various hotels over the years in Manhattan and this one beats the lot. The location is just perfect, with many good places to eat and drink in close proximety on 9th Ave. 

The staff at the hotel were very welcoming and helpful and the facilities on offer were good- with an excellent breakfast and free tea coffee service available throughout.

The rooms are typically Manhattan small, but well laid out, maintained and comfortable.

Overall, I'd give this an 8/10 and would definitely return.

title: A small treasure.
text:
We have stayed here several times now. Manhattan hotels are usually either super expensive or somewhat scary. This place is neither. The rooms are very small, but you don't come to NYC to tour hotel rooms. And everything is maintained very well. 

The hotel is walking distance to so many sights and public transport. We walked to just about everything. All the Broadway shows were just around the corner, and several tour-bus stops.

The staff is great. Very friendly and helpful.

title: Great experience
text:
This hotel is located close to Times Square and Restaurant Row.  Hells Kitchen is close too.

The staff:
The staff is always attentive to those coming in and out.  They do not relax when it comes to guest safety (although there was never an issue when we stayed there).  After one night, they knew exactly who I was and greeted me appropriately.  Something you rarely find in New York hotels.

The room:
If you are use to New York Hotel rooms and their size, you will fit right in.  If you are use to any normal hotel room not in New York, you will probably find this room small.  This is a no-frills kind of hotel, but (and this is very important) this is a immaculately clean room.  We booked 2 rooms for business and both of them were clean enough to walk around barefooted (we rarely do that).

Overall:
Good, I am looking forward to visiting again.  The price, the service, and the rooms all were impressive.

title: Excelente localização em NYC
text:
Excelente localização! 
O Comfort Inn Times Square West está localizado perto de tudo! Existe uma estação de metrô a menos de 100 metros! 
Como é padrão na Rede Comfort Inn a limpeza é impecável, o cafe da manhã é reforçado e satisfatório, e funcionários são prestativos. 
O grande destaque e vantagem deste hotel é sua localização. Está situado a 2 quadras da Times Square, com metrô na esquina. Consegue-se chegar a qualquer lugar em Manhattan em um curto espaço de tempo. Quarto um pouco pequeno, mas dentro dos padrōes de NY. E o melhor, tarifas bem acessíveis...

title: Small but nice
text: Everything was clean and staff was very friendly and helpful with everything that we asked of them.  Breakfast was simple but ok.  The elevator, only one, was a bit slow, so we used the steps 95% of the time.  The room was clean and efficient, but small.  A small stand alone wardrobe was all of the closet space.  The location was excellent for being very close to everything that we wanted to do and yet far enough away from the crowds so there was not a  problem with noise.

title: Great price, great place
text: This was our first time at this hotel and I am sure we will book there again.  The place was so clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful.  It is located practically around the corner from Times Square activity.  We brought friends and they were very impressed also.

title: terrible hotel
text: i do not know who writes the reviews on this hotel but we stayed for 4 nights at a cost of $1200.00, for that we got a tiny room not enough room for 2 people and 2 suitcases, breakfast was on paper plates and bowls that were so thin that you cut through them whilst trying to eat.  When i had to get my two suitcases and back pack for the lobby to the street they just sat there and watched me struggle, i would not recommend this hotel to anyone. please think twice before booking. about the only thing it had going for it was its closeness to times square

title: Will stay here again!
text:
I pre-booked our room at this hotel about a month prior to our trip. Even though our request of getting a high floor and away from the elevators was not met (we got the third floor and a room right beside the elevator), we were still happy with our stay. The room was surprisingly quiet from within the building as well as out on the street. The area was great, and the room was very affordable especially compared to the rest of the midtown Manhattan hotels. We expected less from booking at this place and instead we got more. The free breakfast was a bonus even though we barely had time to eat due to our tight schedule. Not many hotels offer that in the city. The WiFi was slow at times but still satisfactory. The staff were also extremely friendly. 

We only encountered one problem during our stay, which was the broken safe in the room. We were traveling with a few valuables and we wanted to leave it in the safe while we were away. We checked in around midnight and reported the broken safe. They did immediately send maintenance. However, he was there for almost 20 minutes not knowing what to do, and a little insensitive to the fact that we did have to rest up. He finally tells us that they will send a different safe in the morning but we would've been out of the hotel by the time they sent the new one, defeating the purpose of wanting to lock up our valuables in case someone were to go into our room. It wasn't that big of a deal. Since we were only staying for a few nights, we just decided to leave our Do Not Disturb sign on the door for the remainder of the stay and we were able to leave our things just laying about.

Overall, the hotel was lovely and everything that came with it. We would most probably stay here again next time around and I could definitely recommend staying at this hotel!

title: Clean rooms at a great location
text: Friendly staff - I needed a fridge for insulin and they brought it right up after I checked in.  We traveled with a group and the tour hostess said this was a easy hotel to work with.  We were able to walk to many of the sights - Grand Central Station, Rockefeller Center, M&M World, theaters and much more.  The rooms were clean - 2 queen beds.  And quiet too! Even though our room was right next to the elevator.

title: Pleasantly surprised
text: I booked this hotel and it was inexpensive for Manhattan so I was a little apprehensive about how it would be.  I booked it really based on everyone's reviews, which were great.  It was a really fantastic room. Two double beds, plenty of room (it wasn't the typical NYC small hotel room), quiet and comfortable.  The only thing I could say bad about it was it was a little difficult to get in the bathroom because of how the door opened.  But the bathroom was very nicely remodeled.  It was close to everything, so it is a very convenient location.  I would definitely stay there again.

title: Great staff, great stay!
text: Extremely clean and well located hotel for taking in Broadway shows. Staff is warm, friendly and attentive to your needs. Room was the expected size for NY and was clean and comfortable. I would highly recommend this hotel!

title: Great price, great location, comfortable rooms
text: We were traveling with out-of-town friends and looking for an inexpensive but well maintained and well situated hotel for one night.  This was literally the only hotel I could find in Manhattan with prices in the $200's (used my AAA and got a discount).  The front desk staff were friendly and the rooms were absolutely fine and clean with comfortable beds and pillows.  Breakfast, as others have written, was marginal - not enough room for people to sit (everyone up between 830 and 9 of course) and pretty limited with watery coffee, white bread, nasty pastry, etc.  I made due with bananas and peanut butter - no problem - but this was no different than what you might find on the road at this type of hotel for the "free breakfast" - would recommend walking and getting a bagel or pastry somewhere else.  There is only one elevator which can be a problem if you are in a hurry.  You can get your parking ticket stamped and pay $30 a day across the street.  My only complaint is the very very strong smell of the cleaners/disinfectant that was in the lobby as well as the rooms - we had to air out the room with the air conditioner and it still smelled strongly.  On the other hand, if this is what they need to do to keep the rooms clean and pest-free, so be it.  Would stay here again in the same circumstances but not bother with the breakfast!

title: Don't think twice...stay here
text: This hotel is perfect!  My husband and I stayed here with our teen and adult kids in a 2 double beds room.  For NYC this was roomy enough.  The location was great, beds where comfortable, hotel was very clean, and the added bonus of hot/cold brekfast was the cherry on top.  After this great stay, we won't be booking anywhere else.

title: Selecting a New York City hotel
text: Never having been to NY City, I didn't know where to stay so that we'd be near the things we wanted to see and do.  As other reviews stated, this hotel is situated near subway lines, theaters, restaurants, the hop-on bus and more.  The desk clerks were very pleasant and helpful, no matter what time of the day they were approached.  The morning breakfast was great. We stayed 3 nights and there was always something different offered.   We had a room with two double beds which were very comfortable with a selection of pillows on each bed!  Every part of the hotel was clean from the entrance right on up to the room.  Certainly the price played a big part in our selecting this hotel, and there were no disappointments in any part of our stay.

title: Very happy with our 12 night stay here
text:
We stayed 12 nights at this Comfort Inn hotel in late April.  We found it better than expected.  (You already know from other reviews, or a map, how well situated this hotel is for tourist sights and subway access.)  We had heard all the rooms in ‘budget’ priced hotels (assume $300 a night by the time all taxes are added) were the size of closets.  While hardly spacious, especially with two beds, it was fine.  I measured it at 9’3” x 19’, plus a 5’x 7’ bathroom.  It had a desk, one comfortable office-type chair, a small armoire for hanging clothes with two drawers, and a small refrigerator (great for leftovers!)  The beds were firm and quite comfortable.  Everything in the room and the entire hotel was clean and in good condition.  It is well-kept.
     We were lucky in the room we were given, #707.  We were on the top floor, facing north, away from the street we were on, and had a decent view.  And the window opened!  So nice to get fresh air at night.   Except for Saturday, or if a fire-truck went by on 45th (the next street over) it was pretty quiet at night.
     The breakfast was also better than expected.  The usual motel stuff, plus fresh fruit, eggs (scrambled one day, hard-boiled the next), sausage and bacon alternating, and it was constantly restocked by very attentive staff member.  
     The entire staff was friendly and helpful, from the desk clerks, to the breakfast room attendants, to the house-keeping staff.   Because of them, and the other things listed above, I would definitely stay there again anytime I went back to New York. 
     I do have 3 very minor knocks on it:  1) Maybe it was because we were 7 floors above the router, but the WiFi was very slow.  I would strongly recommend bringing an ethernet cable (yes, they have outlets for them.  Just make sure they are connected.)  2)  There is one elevator for 65 or so rooms on 7 floors.  Going down the stairs was often a better choice than waiting (can’t use them going up: only the first floor is unlocked from the stairwell side.)  3)  The toilet paper: it is about on par 1970’s Eastern Europe or Turkey.  I doubt they can do much about the WiFi or the elevator, but if they don’t upgrade the toilet paper I will go to a store and buy my own next time we are there.  And I will still stay there again.

title: Recent Stay
text: I recently stayed here for 3 nights. You can not beat the location. It's right down the street from Time Square, broadway shows and a subway station. Plenty of places to eat within walking distance. Beds are comfortable. Rooms are small, but that is not a big deal since you really are there to sleep and shower. Stay always had a smile of their faces when I came in and out. Will stay in this hotel the next time I'm in the city. Breakfast is free so you can't complain about it.

title: Une bonne adresse à Times square
text: J avais choisi cet hôtel en fonction des avis sur tripadvisor et nous n avons pas été déçus. Emplacement idéal pour ce quartier. Entrée de métro à quelques mètres. Port authority a 2 rues, ce qui est parfait pour arriver et partir en bus pour les aéroports. Hôtel très propre, décoration neutre. Notre chambre était grande pour NY et le rapport qualité prix et au rdv (l hôtellerie est très chère à Manhattan). Personnel très accueillant. Le petit déjeuner est copieux, salle effectivement un peu petite mais une place se trouve facilement. Je conseille cette adresse !

title: Bruyant mais très bien situé
text:
Hôtel très bien situé avec une bouche de métro au bout de la rue et tout près de Time Square. L'hôtel est confortable et le personnel très agréable. Petit déjeuner très bien mais salle très petite donc aux heures de pointe, il n'y a pas de place pour tout le monde.
Le seule hic de cet hôtel c'est le bruit. Chambre au 2ème étage à côté de l'ascenseur (assez lent soit dit en passant), la rue est très bruyante ainsi que l'ascenseur et les portes des chambres qui claquent.

title: Géniale
text:
Bonjour,

Nous avons voyagé fin novembre à New-york avec un petit budjet c'est pour cela qu'on a choisi cette hotel et on a vraiment pas été déçut. Pour un deux étoile à New-york WHAOUUUU l'hotel était parfait!!! il est extrêmement bien situé a 2 minute a pied de times square et en face d'une bouche de métro ce qui est vraiment très pratique pour ce déplacer à New-York. En plus le petit déjeuné est gratuit ce qui est plus que rare a new-york et il est vraiment top. Il y a de tout. Les équipes sont vraiment très gentille et serviable, il nous on rendus plusieurs fois servis.
De plus la literie ets magnifique je n'ai jamais aussi bien dormis dans un hotel et les oreiller que dire!!! Après une longue journée de marche vous vous poser dans le lit avec des oreilleé si moilleux ( pour vous dire nous somme tellement tomber amoureux des oreiller qu'on a acheter les même a MACY's). Le seul petit reproche qu'on peut leur faire c'est que les chambre sont petite mais soyons honnête si vous aller a new-york pour rester dans votre chambre d'hotel alors c'est du gachis. pour y dormis c'est vraiment l'idéal, le prix très correct, très bien situé et très propre. Je vous le recommande les yeux fermé.

title: A une avenue de Times Square
text:
Bon hotel très bien situé, arret de bus et metro à coté, personnel très serviable et à votre disposition, petit déjeuner correct mais la salle est un peu petite donc attente quelque fois !!!
Sinon une bonne adresse avec un très bon rapport qualité/prix.

title: disappointing
text: My wife and I stayed in this hotel on the recommendation of our travel agent - we thought that a 3 star hotel in New York would probably be about the equivalent of a 4 star hotel elsewhere - how wrong we were.This hotel would be ideal for a business person travelling to New York on their own but would not recommend it if travelling as a couple looking for a comfortable few nights holiday in New York.The location is the most attractive feature of the hotel as you are right on Times Square and also the staff were very friendly and helpful apart from the breakfast staff who virtually ignored you when it was obvious on your first morning that you were unsure of the way breakfast was operated here.For a hotel,the breakfast was a joke and it was more fitting of a youth hostel.I dont know how many rooms there are in this hotel but if they all came down at the same time there would be a large queue to get a seat.There was one large breakfast bar type area in the middle of the room which was barely larger than a standard size lounge and there was 6 stools situated around the bar.there was two other small tables which seated 4 persons, also sqeezed into the room.All your plates and cutlery were plastic and the only hot food available was a waffle maker which you had to make your own and obviously had to know how to work it as there was nobody willing to show you.This was a first for us and hopefully the last.Several times people came down for breakfast and had to go away as there was no room for them.The room we stayed in was very small and virtually nowhere to put our cases - the bed was comfortable and there was no problem with cleanliness.Finally if you are looking for a taxi you would be best to arrange it yourself as we had a bad experience with a taxi company the hotel obviously uses for their guests.We were travelling to Newport and had obtained a quote from the local taxi cabs - we told the receptionist at the hotel and he said he would get a quote from the company they use.It worked out 5 dollars more expensive but we were told they were reliable and would be on time with no hidden extras.When we arrived at the port the taxi driver asked us for 15 dollars more than we were quoted and after arguing with him for several minutes he put us on to his boss who was very rude to us and threatened to get the police if we did not pay what was asked.We eventually paid and complained to the hotel when we got home but they were not interested.One more complaint about New York is - do not use the green bus tours for the city as although they may be slightly cheaper,they have no recognised stops and when you are trying to get back to your hotel after visiting the sites you will hardly ever see a green bus and they will not stop for you if you put your hand out - we eventually had to take underground train to get us home.

title: Great location/clean
text: This is my second stay at this hotel in the past 6 months.  Both times the hotel was very clean and the customer service was great.  The location is fantastic and everything in Times Square is very close.  Three classic NY restaurants are within half a block of the hotel - Carmines, Shake Shack, and John's Pizza.  Breakfast every morning is super convenient.  They will also store your luggage when you check out.  Rooms are a comparable size to other NY hotels that I have stayed at.  Highly recommend.

title: Excelent location, nice room, pass on the breakfast
text:
We stayed at the Comfort inn for three nights, the room was clean, with comfortable bed, but not very spacious. The staff was friendly and helpful. The thing that struck us in a negative way was the breakfast. In other reviews you will read otherwise, but for us coming from Europe it was a bit of a shock to say the least. The entire cutlery and plates were plastic(!) and the only "fresh" fruit were bananas one day and apples the other day.

We would recommend it to travelers who value location over everything else.

title: Location, location
text: It was the perfect location for the theatres.  We could walk to any of them in 5 minutes.  It was also only a block from a subway stop and walkable to the Empire State Building and Central Park.  The rooms were small, but it had all the amenities and very nice bedding.  They served one of the best breakfasts.  All in all, we enjoyed our stay.

title: Ok for one night but you can do better
text: There were a few issues with my stay:1. The hotel didn't keep important work materials that we're sent for me to the hotel 1day in advance, 2. Maybe bc I asked for a quiet room but got a semi-creepy basement room, 3. I couldn't stop the AC and was only able to change temp within limits, 4. the bed was nice but there were small holes in the wall where once pictures hang, and while the free breakfast is nice, there was no space for me to sit when I arrived shortly after 9am. The service was otherwise friendly. But for $250 a night you can find a nicer place!

title: highly recommend.
text:
We stayed here last week, 5 nights. Room was quite big enough for us (2 adults + 1 eleven year old), clean, floor safe, Gideon's Bible, clean bathroom. Air conditioning unit a bit noisy. They have just started a re-furb, so I hope they will update these.
Plenty of choice for breakfast. Only one lift, we were on 6th floor, so had to wait for it. 
Receptionist very helpful, friendly, Helped us out a lot with taxis, changing dates, really put themselves out, I thought.
Location, well, 200 yards or so from Times Square, what more could you want?? We landed at Newark airport, got the "Newark airport express" bus, (16$ each) to "Port Authority Terminus", Times square, 40 minute trip,  about 10 minute walk from the hotel. No taxi needed. 
BTW, as other people have mentioned, there is a very good Italian restaurant just across the road, "Don Giovani's", really handy if its late & tired, as we were first night.About 65$ for three of us. We will stay there again, if we go back to New York.

title: boa localização
text: O hotel é bem localizado, mas o valor é bem alto pela qualidade oferecida. Como tudo em NY, caro e prático. Mas como utilizamos o hotel apenas para dormir, atendeu aos requisitos. Não conte com o café da manhã, não tem quase nada e o espaço é mínimo, dependendo do horário tem que tomar café em pé.

title: Great location! CLEAN hotel!
text: We had a great experience staying at the Comfort Inn. This hotel is located a couple blocks from Times Square. The hotel room is small (to be expected), but our room was clean and very comfortable. Did a mention free continental breakfast? There is no parking, but we found a place on 43rd for $25 a day. Nothing fancy but it's a great place to stay for the budget traveler.

title: <オススメ！>ﾌﾚﾝﾄﾞﾘｰできれいなホテル
text:
3月に5日ほど滞在しました。
とても心地よくよいホテルでした。
<スタッフ>
ホテルのスタッフの方はとってもﾌﾚﾝﾄﾞﾘｰでこちらからの要望も嫌な顔せず迅速に対応してくれました！
ﾁｪｯｸｱｳﾄ後も荷物を預かってくれます。
<お部屋>
広くはないですが、清潔感があり快適です。
<朝食>
美味しいです
<価格>
マンハッタンでは格安です。

また、NYCに行くことがあれば利用します！オススメです！

title: Can't beat price/quality
text: First time in this hotel. The staff was great, breakfast pretty good, rooms are large (for a NY standard) and cozy. But the price/location is wonderful. A block from Times Square, near good restaurants, transportation... Definitely, I'll be back soon.

title: Exceeded my expectations.
text:
I stayed here with my partner between 11 - 14 March. A warm welcome on arrival & immaculately clean room on the 7th floor, left an immediate impression on us. Yes, the King room is small; however I've stayed in smaller rooms in Paris. The bed was SO comfortable, with a choice of firm or soft pillows -  we were sorry to have to get up ! The bathroom, small again, but very clean and well equipped, with plenty of towels, had excellent lighting too. Wardrobe and drawer space for two people was a bit inadequate though. The room was warm, well ventilated and blackout curtains ensured good sound insulation at night.
The buffet breakfast each morning was a real treat for us with hot and cold selections on offer, sausages, bacon, egg, waffles, toast and pastries; with coffee, tea and fruit juice available. It did get rather crowded at peak times, 8.30 to 9.30 am, but everybody did find somewhere to sit down. The staff ensured that all items were replenished when necessary. Hot drinks and cookies were available 24/7 - which suited us fine after a day sightseeing out in the cold !
Some reviewers mentioned the slow lift/elevator, but we really didn't notice it too much despite being on the 7th floor ! The lobby area, small and rather cramped, with some seating, had tourist and flight information for guests.
Overall this "Times Square"  hotel is a great location, being only 100 metres from the nearest subway station. Many tourist sights and restaurants are within reasonable walking distance as well. We would recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again

title: resuelve
text: es un hotel que esta cerca de todo. a unos pasos de times square. hotel pequeno pero con todo lo que se necesita. lo unico malo de este hotel es el tamano de  los cuartos. tiene desayuno incluido que te economiza algo de dinero.

title: Perto de tudo!!!
text: Excelente localizacao! Hotel perto de tudo! Com metro a menos de 100 metros! Limpeza impecavel, reforcado cafe da manha, e funcionarios prestativos. O hotel oferece o servico de guardar sua bagagem  depois do check out sem qualquer custo extra! Recomendo!!!

title: Perfect location
text:
1.5 blocks from Times Square, close to the Theatre District, metro/subway stops, shopping and eateries all over. 

Staff were all friendly.., Anish, Ajay, Nimra, Ranesh. Our room was on the ground floor, no view to speak of but that was not a problem. It was right past the elevator, quiet and there were no noise issues either at peak breakfast or the other times we were in the room. Had a problem  with the non-cooling fridge (used their's as a backup) and hope it was resolved after we checked out. Breakfast was OK, tea/coffee/cocoa/juice, pastries, bread, cereal, fruits, waffles, eggs, sausages/bacon, yoghurt.

Loved the choc-chip cookies at the reception counter. Our stay was around the time of the snow storms, it was super cold and was glad to know that you could have a hot drink (coffee/cocoa/tea) in the evening to heat up if you need one. Nice plus!!

Definitely stay here again!!

title: Cosy & comfortable
text: This hotel is in a perfect location & is clean, cosy & comfortable & had everything we needed. If your looking for a central base from which to enjoy everything New York has to offer this is perfect. I can also recommend the New York beer company which is on the same street & Westway Diner round the corner on 9th Avenue

title: Theater Weekend
text: You can't get anymore conviente to the Theater district for under $350.00 a night than this Comfort Inn. Just one block away Time Square. The have parking right across the street so it's easy and conviente too drive as well as mass transit. Full well stocked continental breakfast with coffee 24/7. Everything is within walking distance. I would stay here again and again. The GM even gave me his email and phone # and said just let me know when you will be returning and he would take care of me. They will do all they can to make your stay comfortable and appreciated. They know there are plenty of other hotels you can stay. They want to make sure you come back to them.That makes all the difference in the world.

title: Good stay!
text:
I was able to check in early, and then able to move to the first floor as I requested.   Customer service much improved from my last review.   Breakfast is very good, great variety of food items changing from bacon one day to sausage the next, waffles always available.
Rooms are spacious and nice, refrigerator in each room is a definite plus!

title: Enjoyed my stay.
text:
Our greeting was great, took us not too long until we went into our rooms. The hotel gave free cookies. XD sweet of them. I found break very nice and was full everyday! It's a continental breakfast and there was a wide range of choice from waffle to bread to yogurt to hot food.

We had 4 people all together in one room, the walking space is limited but what can I say. I was with my friend and that was all that mattered. It was very fun and comfortable beds! Recommend :)

title: Horrible customer service.
text:
Let me start by saying I am a member of Choice Hotels and it was a bad choice that I stayed here. The hotel STINKS LIKE B.O. but that was just the least of my worries as when I went to check out (very early mind you as I am an emergency personnel responder and had to get back to work) I got later got numerous harassing phone calls from the hotel and the GM accusing me of not paying for my room. The GM Sam had the nerve to call me from his personal cell while he was home (which is very unprofessional). He was rude and yelling as I tried to explain to him that the charge was already on my account! I WILL NEVER STAY NOR RECOMMEND THIS PLACE TO ANYONE. My complaints went to Choice Hotels customer service which I think is the reason why I did not get my usual survey through email asking how my stay was. 

By the way, I stayed at the Comfort Inn in Virginia Beach just the week before and everything was perfect :)

title: Excellent Hotel Stay
text: This hotel has everything you could want. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room that we had ( 309 ) was extremely quiet. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom was very clean,& they provide you with more than enough towels. The breakfast was great. Coffee, tea, cocoa, juice, waffles, bacon, eggs, cereal, muffins, croissants, pastries, oatmeal. As you can see, it is a very filling breakfast. They add some nice touches such as giving you a choice of blueberry or regular waffles, for your coffee you have a choice of cream, hazelnut cream, 2% milk and skim milk. At the check in desk they have chocolate chip cookies. They have a few different racks with brochures & discounts to attractions. They have great security that you can see on the tv monitor at check-in. The hotel is located within walking distance to the bus terminal, the train station & Jacob Javits Center (which was where we went for a travel show.) It is about a block from  one of the main drags in NY. We stayed out late & felt very safe walking back to this hotel. In the future this is the hotel we will stay in when we come to NY. All in all, we think the owners did a great job by making our stay enjoyable.

title: Great Location/Great Price
text: Spent the weekend at this hotel. Arrived 2 hours before check in and our room was ready. The location is perfect and the price was even better! Our room was clean, the bed was comfy and the staff was very polite. It was very convenient with the free continental breakfast to grab a quick bite before heading out. Only issue was a very slow elevator.  Street noise was a bit loud (we were on the 4th floor) when the bars let out but what do you expect from the city that never sleeps! All in all, we would stay here again!

title: Clean and great location ...
text: The rooms here vary quite a bit , so if you need more room be sure you know what you are getting before booking. The location can't be beat and the rooms are ok - the staff is VERY nice and will do anything to accommodate the guests. There are really attractive rates at times, other times pretty expensive so we check frequently. We have stayed here 5 or 6 times in the last couple of years - consistently very good.

title: Very pleasant experience
text: This is the second time I have stayed here.  All of the employees are very friendly and courteous.  Rooms very clean.  Great breakfast.  Moderately priced.  Highly recommend this hotel.  I would definitely stay there again.

title: MUCH MORE THAN I EXPECTED
text: WOW It was perfect.  Very good breakfast, close to the theater and Times Square  and very clean.  We stayed one night (February 7th), went to a show (2 blocks away) and left the following day on a cruise. It was exactly what we were looking for.  Great value and a very nice room too. We will go back for sure.

title: Amazing Value; Great Hotel
text:
This hotel is a real gem.  The location is superb, just one and a half blocks from Times Square and surrounded by bars, restaurants and food outlets, not to mention the majority of Broadway shows and top shops within a 5 minute walk.
While it doesn’t have great curb appeal, the facilities and rooms are amazing for this price.  The rooms are well equipped – super king size or two doubles, TV, coffee machine, hairdryer, free safe – and the bathrooms look brand new.  Good central heating too which we needed as it was -9 outside.
The best bonus is the breakfast.  A massive range of  pastries, toast, yogurt, freshly made waffles and a rotating selection of hot items with sausage, egg and bacon (although US bacon is a bit rubbish!)
There is a great little Irish bar opposite called O’Quinn’s which does a fine array of beers and food.
I will definitely stay here again.

title: Close, clean and Cheap...no complaints here
text: What a great location. I just stayed here this week during some really cold weather. The location was perfect...Restaurant row was just two short blocks, the theater I was visiting was two short blocks, and Times Square was just three blocks away. The room was really clean (though small, especially the door into the bathroom) and the bathroom appeared newly renovated and immaculate. Though our TV had a loose connection, we called the front desk and someone was at the door within two minutes to address the issue.  Nice breakfast layout and attentive worker that was stationed to fill anything that needed to be filled. I would definately stay here again.

title: Ótima opçāo perto da Times Square
text: Estive recentemente hospedada neste hotel e adorei. Excelente localizaçāo a 2 quadras da Times Square, com metro na esquina. Super rápido de chegar a qualquer lugar em Manhattan. Excelente café da manhā, com disponibilidade de café e chá 24 h. Quarto um pouco pequeno, mas dentro dos padrōes de NY. E o melhor, mais barato que a maioria dos hotéis. Recomendo fortemente!

title: Location, location
text:
We spent 4 nights in this brilliant hotel. The value for money matched with the location is an unbeatable combination. Two blocks from Times Square, one block from the subway and really close to many budget restaurants and interesting bars. What more could you want from a New York hotel. 
The hotel itself is small and tight but the service, breakfast, free wifi and especially the price makes this a great option for New York accommodation. The room itself was pretty small but we weren't there to hang around the room. The tv options were extensive, the room was quiet and the bathroom was clean. All in all a great budget hotel.

title: Good location & price..set your expectations appropriately
text:
Good location and sometimes available at a very competitive rate. 

Having read the TA reviews, and after quite a bit of research into alternative hotels I opted for this hotel for a 5 night stay. I set my expectations too high based on the TA reviews and the following were my issues
1. Paper thin walls. I was beside a family with young children. There's nothing the hotel can do about noise from other guests but I could hear everything that happened in the room next door and what TV program they were choosing to watch. The issue is the walls are too thin.
2. Towels. These need to be refreshed. I stayed 5 nights and of the 5 sets of towels I used, 3 of them had significant wear/stains.
3. I have stayed in New York about 10 times, and I know how small hotel rooms in the city can be.... but this was the second smallest room I have ever stayed in. I was travelling alone (which was lucky) and stayed in a Queen Room. These really should be marketed (like other New York hotels) as Petite Doubles as there is almost no clear floor space whatsoever
4. Noisy air con. The air con units are very noisy. It was February in New York and it was snowing & cold. The Air Con was needed but it can not be left on at night as it is so noisy.
5. WiFi - very slow WiFi that drops out and prompts you to re-login at random times when you can be in the middle of using it!
6. Noisy, very slow elevator - and there's only one. I was on floor 6 - hotel has 7 floors. Lift was horrendously slow especially in the mornings and at other peak times. It is also extremely noisy so if you get a room in the half of the hotel closest to the lift you will enjoy the noise of the motor running all day and all night
7. Others have commented on the friendliness of the staff. I can't say the staff were unfriendly but I certainly didn't find them especially helpful, courteous, or friendly  - rather they were efficient.
8. Housekeeping is extremely noisy, often congregating in groups in the middle of the corridor having loud conversations...or, worse, using a walkie-talkie intercom system to hold long conversations
9. Breakfast was ok.  The dining facility was too small though, frequently running out of seating, and shutting service at 9.30 neither helps with the crowd nor provide guests with a restful lie-in in the morning when they are on vacation!
8. Hotel name slightly misleading as it's not on Times Square itself but once you look up your maps in advance you will realise this. I didm;t measure it but it's at least 2-3 avenues of Times Square.

Can;'t think of much to recommend this hotel, given the huge number of hotels in New York but it does have a decent location and the price is sometimes attractive

title: Unbeatable deal
text:
Two blocks from Times Square.  This hotel does as much as it can with this property, and it does quite well.  What it lacks, mostly, is extra space for things like a fitness room, restaurant and so forth.  There are many properties in NYC that cost more and don't really offer more, or even as much as this one.  

The rooms:  while small, they are bigger than many in NYC.  At least they have en suite bathrooms and there is some counter space in the bathroom.  The double bed rooms are actually a fairly decent size.  The king bed rooms would be big enough for a queen bed, but the king bed does leave a quite squeeze with the desk.  Overall, the rooms are fully-equipped and better than I expected.  While not luxurious, they are pretty much 3-star standard.  There was some noise in our room from the elevator next door, but overall it was quite quiet for being in downtown New York.  There are not many rooms on each floor, reducing the chance of noise from other guests.      

Breakfast:  The breakfast room is pretty tiny and crowded, but there were tables more often than not.  Staff did a good job keeping things stocked.  It was pretty much the typical complementary breakfast for these sorts of hotels, with some hot selections and waffles and above average pastries.  

Just one elevator does mean their are some waits.  The exterior of the hotel is quite plan, though the lights make it a bit more attractive at night.  

Service:  Fine.  Not especially friendly, and a bit busy most of the time, but pretty efficient.  

Location:  The location is awesome and is the reason to stay here  Just two blocks from Times Square.  

There are public parking lots around--the cost is high, so this is best for people not driving to NYC.  If you do drive, the lots are cheaper than garages.

title: Hotel  muito limpo,otima localização,perto de tudo
text: Hotel  muito limpo,otima localização,perto de tudo.Excelente café da manha.O quarto bastante aconchegante,com colchões e roupas de cama de boa qualidade.Vale a pena salientar os funcionários,muito bem treinados e extremamente atenciosos.

title: Great Value in Great Location
text: Clean, inviting, surprise conveniently located near Times Square.  Able to get 2 double beds for very good price.  Beds comfortable, rooms small (it's NYC!!) but clean and well appointed.  Excellent free hot breakfast in morning with the BEST fresh baked pastries I have ever had in a hotel of this type.  Definitely will return.

title: Great Location
text: Spent 4 nights here with 2 friends, good hotel in an excellent location with lovely reception staff.  Rooms have everything you need and hotel offers a free breakfast and hot drinks and cookies all day.  Some really good restaurants nearby.

title: Great hotel, great location!
text: I selected this place based on TA recommendations and on the fact that I got a really good rate on the room.  It ended up being the perfect place for my 3 daughters and I to use as a home base for a long weekend in NYC.  It's one block from the Theater District, 2 blocks from Times Square, a block from access to 2 subway stations, and close to lots of great restaurants.  Breakfast was included and was a typical hotel breakfast.  The only day the eating area got crowded was Monday morning.  The room was VERY small, but I was expecting that.  We were on the street side of the building on the 5th floor.  I was a little nervous about how noisy it would be, but we never had any issues with noise.  The only thing I would recommend is that you bring your own hairdryer.  Picky - I know.  But their hairdryers require you to hold down a button the whole time to keep the hair dryer on.  My hand was killing me by the time I was done.  Otherwise - GREAT place to stay.  Thanks, TA, for the recommendation!

title: Godt hotel og ikke mere
text:
Hotellet svarede næsten til vores forventninger: 
God beliggenhed nær Times Square (nemt at komme alle steder hen på Manhattan).
Pænt og rent.
Venligt og hjælpsomt personale. 

Men: 
Der er for lidt plads og ikke borde nok til alle gæster i caféen, hvor der spises morgenmad. 
En af dagene blev buffeten passet af en ansat, som ikke kunne holde trit med situationen, og resultatet var meget ulækkert: Snavsede borde der ikke blev tørret af, når gæster forlod dem. 
Nogle gæster var så uheldige at tabe mad og hælde kaffe på gulvet, og al snavset blev liggende, mens den ansatte var optaget af at hjælpe gæster med at riste vafler og ikke var nærværende i resten af lokalet.
De andre dage var der en ansat til stede, som på en ganske anden måde sørgede for, at der var rent og pænt. 

Og: Mens vi boede på hotellet (seks nætter) var der to gange problemer med det trådløse internet, og elevatoren strejkede et par timer på et tidspunkt. 

Men ellers: God beliggenhed og pænt og rent.

title: Hidden Jewel in New York City
text: This hotel was a truly amazing surprise. For a hotel in midtown Manhattan, we found it to be an exceptional value for the money. The room was not huge but more than adequate and immaculate, as was the bathroom and the whole hotel. The breakfast each morning was wonderful, with so many choices. The staff was very friendly, polite, and helpful. I would certainly recommend this hotel very highly. We will definitely be back!!

title: Lovely hotel in great location
text:
We stayed at this hotel in mid December 2013.  The location was very good, only 5 minutes from the subway, very close to Times Square and yet in a quiet street.  The staff were very friendly and welcoming.  The room was small but perfectly adequate and very clean.  Free breakfast was great. It was also nice to be able to make a coffee or hot chocolate during the day or evening in the small breakfast area.

We booked using Choice Hotels membership and got a good price.

The hotel is small enough to feel homely.  This is a bonus in a big city like New York.

title: Otima localização
text: Para Quem gosta da agitação da time square, o comfort inn Times Square west é um ótimo hotel para se hospedar. Você bem próximo dos teatros da broadway e com duas boas estações de metrô. O hotel tem café da manhã bem saboroso. Vale a Pena!

title: Excellent choice for NYC getaway
text: We chose this hotel to take advantage of an off-season special price, and because of its central location for theatre, restaurants, etc.   We were very pleased with everything, starting with the friendly and helpful staff at the desk, in the breakfast area and in housekeeping.  The rooms aren't real large (this IS New York city!) and the lobby almost non-existant.   But everything was immaculately clean and  updated, and everything (TV, shower, etc.) worked well.   Not much street noise either.   The breakfast was one of the best I've seen in a Choice hotel.   Eggs (cooked and hard-boiled), bacon, sausage, waffles, pastries, cereals. fruit, yogurt, and more.  The breakfast area could be a bit crowded at times, but we always found seats and enjoyed a very full breakfast indeed.    All of this, and especially the great staff, made this a perfect place for our winter getaway in the city.

title: Excellent location and excellent value
text:
We stayed here just before Christmas. We wanted something liveable but didn't want to spend a huge amount on accommodation as lets face it, its just a place to rest your head. We wanted to spend the money on doing the tourist stuff.

Well, all in all, this hotel was excellent for what we wanted. The hotel had mixed reviews but I am guessing that these are people expecting five star. Without a shadow of a doubt I would stay here again, without even looking at other hotels.

The location was perfect, just perfect. Just off the main road, so not too noisy. We even had a room at the back of the hotel. Yes, the view was poor but I would rather have that than road traffic. Although, the road wasn't busy at all.

Breakfast was nice, and getting downstairs at 8am we had no issues at all getting a table. 9am got a bit busier.

Yes, the rooms could do with a makeover but I tell you what they are exceptionally clean. The beds were very nice to sleep on.

Very polite reception and most helpful when I jammed my suitcase wheels in between the gap of the lift doors!

if you have booked this hotel you will be fine.

I really don't understand any negative reviews with this hotel. If you want top quality go and pay the money!!!

As I said, without question, if I was going to New York again I would just book this hotel without looking for others.

title: Wonderful experience, reasonable rate!
text: This tops my list of hotels I've stayed at in NYC. I stay in NYC 3-4 times a year and this was the first time I stayed at this location. First of all, it is centrally located and only a quick block to the subway, which was highly convenient. The staff was very friendly and accommodating.  The rooms are comparable, if not slightly larger in size, than other NYC hotels I've stayed at. The bed was extremely comfortable and a firm AND soft pillow were provided for guest preference. The hotel looked brand new (they opened in 2009, we asked) and the cleanliness was impeccable. I commented several times to my travel mate how clean everything looked, how fresh the linens smelled, and how shiny the floors were. The shower head was powerful and the water pressure was great (this may sound silly, but it's important for a woman!) The full breakfast in the morning was a bonus. They served hot options (bacon, sausage, waffles, oatmeal, biscuits and gravy, etc.) along with cereals, pastries, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, etc. There was a variety of selections for everyone. Not only was the food really good, but having a provided breakfast each morning really cut down on the food spending in the city (and that can get costly!) They also had hot coffee, tea, and hot chocolate packets available in the lobby at all times, which really helped with the caffeine fix I needed throughout the day. I usually don't write reviews, but I was highly impressed with my stay and I will make it a point to return to this hotel each time I stay in the city!

title: Ideal à New York
text:
Je me suis rendue à New York avec un de mes petits fils de 19 ans, du 26 au 30 décembre 2013. Cet hotel est confortable, le personnel et l'accueil souriants et serviables. La propreté est irréprochable et le petit déjeuner très complet. De plus l'espace petit déjeuner est ouvert en permance et on peut y boire un café ou un thé. Nous avions une chambre au 6ème étage coté rue, avec vue sur les immeubles illuminés. La situation centrale à quelques minutes de Times Square, des théatres, nous a permis également d'aller à pied que ce soit à Central Parc ou vers Ground Zero. Je ne peux que recommander cet hôtel où je sejournerai lors d'un prochain passage à New York.
Sylv76

title: Perfekte Lage Top gepflegt
text: Ich war für eine Nacht in diesem Hotel. Das Personal war sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit. Der eincheck ging super schnell und überall gibt es einen kostenlosen w-LAN Zugang. Die Lage des Hotels ist einfach perfekt. Ich musste nur ein paar Schritte gehen du war mitten im geschehen.
