Ich habe mich dadurch sehr wohl und sicher gefühlt was so als Mädel alleine oft nicht so der Fall ist. Die Zimmer sind rechteckig und top sauber in einem wirklich guten Zustand. Das Fernsehprogramm ist gut grade wegen dem jetlag. Ich würde mir ohrstöpsel mitbringen New York ist einfach laut. Genügend Restaurants sind ebenfalls um die Ecke und auch die Riesen busstation ist nur einen Blick entfernt. Ich werde zu 100% wieder dieses Hotel buchen auch für einen längeren Trip nach NYC :-)

title: Bem bom.
text: Perfeita localização. Silencioso. Quarto pequeno, mas limpo e cama bem boa pra descansar bastante. Banheiro satisfatório e o mais importante pra mim, café da manhã. Depois de um bom e farto café pode-se desfrutar com muita energia a maravilhosa cidade de Nova York. Sair a noite é fácil, mil opções de entretenimento e alimentação. Tudo que li em outras avaliações sobre este hotel se confirmaram, então escolhi, agora espero ajudar novos viajantes.

title: Great location! Clean and friendly!
text: This is our second time staying here, and we will be back. The entire hotel is always spotless...rooms and public areas. The staff is wonderful and helpful, always at the front desk greeting guests with a smile. Also, the location is fantastic for attending Broadway shows and trying all of the wonderful restaurants in Hell's Kitchen. It's in a safe area with great access to the subway just a block away. Since it isn't right on a main street, it is very quiet. The only downside is the room size, but for two people it isn't a problem. We have even stayed here with  four people, and while crowded, it was ok for the price.

title: Great Location for Tourists
text: Great location within walking distance of everything Times Square has to offer. The breakfast was a great little extra and made us get up to the make the most of our days sightseeing. We visited the bar across the street called Black Mouse Salloon (i think) and it was good for a few drinks and a game of pool before heading out for the night. We visited in February & our room was warm & clean. Would visit this hotel again if price remained cheap!

title: Great location, great value!
text: Stayed here for a week.  Breakfast was good and free.. Rooms were basic but comfortable. Friendly staff.  Would recommend to friends. A steal considering its 5 mins away from Times Square and all the broadway shows . Plus Shake Shack is just in the corner!

title: Service Oriented Comfort Inn 44th St
text:
What a nice surprise.  I must say that my room was very very nice,the bed was super comfy & their are blackout curtains so one can sleep in.  The cleaning staff are amazing & the hotel is extremely clean.
The breakfast was wonderful-they have everything including "fresh" fruit and of course coffee & tea all day.
The staff are very helpful & strive to make your stay a pleasant one-thank you Vibnuti & Sunira and to Anish & Sam.  They go above & beyond-I'll be back!

title: Great value for money
text: This was our first time in New York, and this was one of the only hotels with breakfast included for a good price.  It was an Ideal location, staff very friendly and the breakfast brilliant. The hotel was very clean and welcoming!  The free hot drinks available in the lounge were most appreciated. We would definitely return!

title: Nice Basic Hotel Near Times Square
text: I stayed here for one night during the busy Christmas season. The rooms are on the small side but this can be expected for NYC. The accommodations were also basic but had all the necessities. After all, in NYC how much time are you going to stay in the room? I was also pleasantly surprised that a room near the elevate such as mine didn't have much exterior noise.

title: Bom hotel e bem localizado
text: O Comfort Inn Times Square West é um bom hotel. Muito bem localizado, com estação do metrô próxima (uma das maiores) e muito perto dos teatros da Broadway. Os quartos não são muito grandes, mas são confortáveis. O café da manhã é ótimo, o que não é muito comum em Nova Iorque. O atendimento é muito bom! Vale o preço se paga.

title: Fabulous break
text:
Fabulous pre christmas shopping break in New York. Great hotel in a brilliant position in the theatre district 5 minutes from Times square. We even had the snow to make the break perfect.
The hotel staff cannot do enough to make your stay perfect. The rooms are basic but spotlessly clean and the free breakfast that is provided is a bonus.

title: Basic but clean and comfortable
text: Well placed hotel, clean and comfortable with breakfast included which was a good start to the day.  Room was a little chilly at times but the bed was comfortable.  The staff were very friendly.  It was a good stay.  Shame there is no lounge or bar but the New York beer company nearby was very good for a drink and for food.

title: Weekend in the Big Apple
text: Very nice hotel in Times Square.  Staff was very helpful.  The vending machines and ice are on separate floors.  The breakfast was very nice with scrambled eggs and bacon, plus a waffle maker.  The elevator was small as were the rooms, but remember you are in NYC.  Plenty of restaurants in the area and only 2 blocks from the center of Times Square and the theaters are all right there.

title: Great location for the price
text:
The desk clerk at night was very friendly, but the others were a bit more officious.  The room (606) was at the back of the hotel so it was pretty quiet for NYC. The room was clean except for the shower tile grout was showing a bit of mildew.  Towels are thin and skimpy but they allowed us four each day so that balanced out.  Breakfast was typical with microwaved scrambled eggs, bacon and waffles for hot food and a good selection of yogurts, fruit and breads as well.  The breakfast area was well replenished and that isn't easy at 9:00 AM when the capacity 35 room reaches overflow.  
The TV in our room would not show cable TV properly because of a loose coaxial that we had to have fixed twice, with poor results.  Also, the hallway had piles of laundry (clean or not?) in clear bags at all hours, something I have not seen happen before.
We were lucky to get a king room, that was a decent size for NYC, for $170 plus taxes for our three nights.  The location is 1 1/2 blocks off of Times Square with several restaurants and bars (with $8 beers) around it and the wonderful Shake Shack on the corner.  
All in all a good experience.

title: Localização e conforto.
text:
Esse hotel fica há 2 quarteirões da Times Square e praticamente ao lado dos grandes teatros da Broadway (King Lion, Mamma Ma, Matilda, etc.), com uma estação do metrô no mesmo quarteirão - o que é bastante útil se você quer evitar o trânsito terrível de NY e como eu, prefere andar à pé ou de metrô. Além disso, a Linha "E", que vai pro aeroporto JFK, passa exatamente nesta estação de metrô. 

Prós:
- Preço (Hotéis em NY são caros, mas conseguimos o Comfort Inn por um preço justo)
- Tamanho do quarto (para o padrão de NY, o quarto que ficamos era bem grande com duas camas de solteiro de tamanho equivalente a uma cama de casal pequena)
- Banheiro: pequeno, mas novo e limpo. A ducha é sensacional: pressão regulável e água quente a qualquer hora. 
- Café da Manhã (incluso na diária): muito bom. Ovos + banco padrão americano. Croissant, pães, café, suco de laranja, máquina de waffle. 
- Localização, já mencionado acima. O hotel fica perto de várias opções de alimentação: restaurantes, fast foods, etc. 
- Camas: muito confortáveis. Lençóis muito limpos. 

Contras: 
- Banheiro: não tem ducha higiênica
- Café da Manhã: fica no hall do hotel, em um espaço muito pequeno/apertado. Dependendo da hora que você chegar, não conseguirá um lugar pra sentar e terá que esperar um pouco. 
- Elevador: o prédio só tem 1 elevador que é leeeeento.

Enfim, recomendamos muito esse hotel e definitivamente ficaríamos lá outra vez. Os "contras" mencionados não comprometem a qualidade e não reduziram nossa satisfação.

title: Gran hotel!
text: Es un muy buen hotel, tiene todas las comodidades, el desayuno es excelente. El trato y la cordialidad tmb fue muy buena. La ubicacion cerca del Times Square lo hace tener una gran ubicacion y tener todo cerca. Por todo lo que teniamos el precio no fue caro. Ninguna queja para hacer. Las habitaciones no soy muy grandes pero estan bien. Limpias y ordenadas. El wifi era rapidisimo en todas las partes del hotel.

title: Don't let the name fool you :-))
text:
Even though you may not think of Comfort Inn as a 5 star hotel, I am here to tell you, this one will make you reconsider. The staff's professionalism, service, ettiquete, and friendliness toped most 5 star hotels- I know beccause I get paid to go  to 5 star hotels and rate their service.

These guys were awesome. The room was great. The bed super comfortable, and on top of it we got breakfast- a real breakfast! 

Over all 5 stars, the staff above and beyond. Thanks for making a cold trip on the holidays a warm place to come home to at the end of every day!

title: Snug, clean, great location
text: We stayed one night while in town to see a Broadway show. The location can't be beat -- we were just around the block from the theater. Everything about the hotel is compact: the lobby, elevator, breakfast area, hallways and rooms. There is no extra space anywhere -- the vending and ice machines are even on different floors! But everything was clean and functional, and the staff was friendly and helpful. Nit picks: the window curtains aren't room-darkening, and I couldn't figure out the shower until I found an information card.

title: Great hotel
text: We stayed in the comfort inn for a sightseeing break, me and my sister went with my 70  year old mum for her birthday so we needed a central hotel,this is in the heart of Manhatton a 5 min walk from Times Square and close to all the famous landmarks, the hotel staff were friendly and the continental breakfast was a fantastic bonus to the holiday saving us money every day. There was free tea and coffee 24 hours a day which was great to have, rooms were a bit small but you are in New York so your not in the room long enough to notice.

title: Excellent location
text: The rooms were very clean and also nicely decorated. The breakfast had a good selection both hot and cold and you could help yourself to as much as you liked. The staff were so lovely and very helpful. The location was amazing literally 5 minutes walk to time square and the metro. When I go back to New York if stay here again.

title: Perfect Location, Good Value
text: Arrived and greeted by friendly staff. Room was small, but no problems. It was quiet room for NYC. Great beds and bedding. Daily breakfast was excellent!!  The best one I've had compared to other Comfort inns. Well stocked with everything. It does get crowded in the breakfast area.

title: Clean and Comfortable, Great Location
text:
This was a great little place to stay at an affordable price.
The room was clean, but small, a queen sized bed, TV, fridge and a microwave. 
Free tea/coffee, a newspaper, choc-chip cookie on the way past the reception area. Continental breakfast was supplied and you couldn't fault what was offered. 
Location- Just a quick walk to Time Square, Rockerfeller Center, The Empire State Building, pier 83 for the Circleline cruises and Broadway Shows. Even Central Park is not all that far away. It's a great place to base yourself
All in all this was a great little hotel and we really enjoyed our stay. 
PS it's not high class but it's definite value for money.

title: Conveniente
text: O Hotel está bem localizado, os quartos são pequenos mas ninguém vai à NY ficar no quarto do hotel. Limpo, atendimento correto. receberam minhas encomendas (que foram muitas) e não me cobraram, diferentemente com o que ocorre com os hotéis da rede na Flórida. Possui um café da manhã modesto, mas que resolve, sobretudo considerando que alguns hotéis em NY não tem essa prática.

title: Great Location
text: Spent two nights in this hotel. The location couldn't be better. The staff was friendly and helpful, the room was clean and comfortable and the breakfast was great. Quiet hotel, no loud and rowdy wedding parties. Will stay here again.

title: Excelent location and nothing more
text:
The best way to describe this hotel: you get what you paid for. It's a cheap hotel in Times Square area, so keep it in mind when doing your travel plan. If you're on a budget it may be the ideal.
Location is excelent. 5 minute walk to Times Square, 1 minute walk to subway.
Room was not that small but had too much stuff in it, so it got small. For us it was no problem.
Other reviews mentioned it's clean but we got dirty towels and a strange spot in bathroom wall.
They put us in the street level, I don't recommend that. Doors don't totally close by itself so we had a shuttle guy opening our door one day. So make sure you close it properly.
Breakfast was great but we learned in the first day we should go sooner to have a place to seat.

title: Great Service, Perfect Location, Clean Rooms
text: I went to New York with my family for a couple of days. It was the best experience for them since it was their first time. We were greeted with a smile by the Duty Manager Sunita along with the other staff. They were kind enough to let us check in early and did everything quick so that we didn't have to wait to explore the city. The staff was always willing to help at any hour of the day. The room was cozy and clean. The location was just perfect since we didn't have to go on the subway at all. Everything was within walking distance or we just took a cab (which didn't cost a lot since the hotel was in the central location). Lots of good restaurants around the hotel. The breakfast was very good with a lot of variety - hot and cold. Lots of bakery items to choose from. Hot beverages were offered at any time of the day. The staff at the front desk also gave us ideas about different tour buses and set us up with the OnBoard tour which definitely was a very good idea. Overall, everything was excellent and the price was the best too.

title: bad stay
text: me and my wife stay here for a night out on the town so we took a cab from penn station to your hotel me  and the taxi driver almost miss your hotel if i did not say to the taxi driver its here we would have past it need a better sign. So we check in the room they gave us said first floor you would think that it would be on the same floor as the front desk nope it was in the basement of the place the ac did not work and the tv did not work so we went back up and ask for another room they did not want to give me a new room even if i am a employee of choice  they said to me rudely well he should know that i dont appreciate that i may work for the company but i still a guest finally they gave me a new room which was alot better and the ac work really well did not have breakfast because it was too busy .

title: Comfort Inn is a Great Deal.
text: Great Deal. Breakfast is AMAZING. staff is extremely helpful, room is very clean, comfortable bed & nice. Very good location near bus terminal & Times Square. Price was so much more reasonable & better quality than most in the area. I will definitely stay at this hotel again. Don Giovanni Italian restaurant across the street had good food, & a diner around the corner on 9th was good, also.

title: Perfect hotel for a City Break to NYC!
text:
My boyfriend and I travelled to NYC to celebrate his 23rd birthday, and booked our trip via Expedia. We chose Comfort Inn Times Square West due to the great price and location, and we wasn't disappointed! 

We checked in at 1pm, and was shown straight to our room (although I thought check in was 3pm so was extremely happy!). We stayed in room 509 and it was perfect for what we needed. A large bed (and one of the most comfy I have ever stayed in!), a fridge, table and chair and a shower. The room was spotless and came its a flat screen tv with a free movie directory! Amazing! The rooms are small, but in NYC, it's very unlikely you would get a large room! It was a comfy size for the 2 of us plus luggage and many many shopping bags! 

The location was amazing! 2 blocks West of Times Square, and in the heart of it within 5 minutes. There is a subway at the end of the block that runs A,C and E lines (many of which take you down to the 9/11 site without having to change!). The area was safe and busy but was not disturbed by any noise at night time. There are numerous bars and restaurants in the block, and slightly cheaper than eating in the heart of Times Square. 

The breakfast was an added bonus! Paid a lot more to stay elsewhere on my previous trip without breakfast! So this was amazing! Never had. Problem getting a table, and we was down in the breakfast between 8am and 9am each day. Breakfast had a lot of variety - American waffles, bacon, sausages, cereal etc etc. Breakfast staff were extreme polite and would bring over your waffles when they were ready. 

Overall, an extreme happy stay at the Comfort Inn and would recommend to all if your looking for a cheap and cheerful hotel in a perfect location! 

New York will always be my favourite city in the world, so I will be returning!

title: Excellent hotel and service
text:
I recently spend 3 days with my sister in NYC and our stay at this hotel was wonderful. We found the staff very friendly, clean accommodations, lovely breakfast. Location was ideal and we would certainly stay at this hotel again. we recommend this hotel to everybody excellent service.

Best regards

Pedro R Bernal B
CEO/ CFO
Bernal Corporation Inc. (USA)

title: Great Value, Great Location
text:
My wife and I booked 4 nights at this hotel, and it was ideal for our short break to New York. OK, it’s not the Waldorf Astoria, but for the money we paid it was great PLUS you also got breakfast.
From the outside the hotel does not look much, but it’s a 5 minute walk to Times Square and there are theatres and bars / cafes all on the doorstep. It is located on West 44th Street, Just off 9th Avenue (towards 8th Avenue).
Checking in was quick and easy. The staff on reception, to the cleaners, all were very polite and helpful.
The hotel has 7 floors and we were on the 5th. There is one small lift and it’s a bit slow but you can always take the stairs. The room had 2 double beds, flat screen TV, filter coffee machine, air conditioning/heating unit, fridge, iron, ironing board, en-suite bathroom, with small bath and shower. 
The room was a little small, and my only gripe really was that there was not enough drawer space. Perhaps the hotel should consider taking out a couple of the chairs and adding in a chest of drawers, or maybe instead of having 2 double beds, have one queen/king sized bed as this would just give a bit more space. The room was fine for a couple, but for more than 2 people I think that it would be a bit of a squeeze.
We had room 507, which was at the back of the hotel and quite quiet. The only noise was occasionally from the fridge. There was also a bit of a draught coming from behind the AC unit. The beds were very comfy and we got a good night’s sleep (or maybe that was due to all the walking that we did!).
Breakfast was coffee, tea, bread, bagels, muffins, pastries, cereal, waffles, fruit – plenty to set you up for the morning.
When we arrived at JFK airport, the cost of the yellow cab, was $58 to the hotel (set fare to central Manhattan hotels). We arrived on Sunday lunchtime, and the transfer to the hotel took about 45minutes. On our return, we asked the hotel to book a cab for us, and they use a private taxi firm, with a flat fare of $65. Note: if you want to use the tunnel you will have to add on the tolls of $7.50 to this. The private taxi was nice, a big 4x4 with blacked out windows – cool! This arrived on time and took about 60 minutes to get through the Thursday evening rush hour traffic to the airport.
All on all, we had a nice break and the Comfort Inn Times Square West was more than adequate for our city break and I’d recommend this for couples or 2 people who are looking for a central, good value for money hotel. 

P.S. The Beer Authority bar a couple of doors up from the hotel was great. It’s like a sports bar, but they have happy hours and do some nice cocktails and also a good selection of beers and ales.

title: Cómodo y céntrico
text:
Fue exactamente lo que esperaba. Es un hotel céntrico y con las comodidades necesarias. Las habitaciones y los baños están remodelados y esta todo limpio y no hay mucho ruido. El trato del personal muy correcto. El desayuno es correcto.
Lo mejor es la ubicación en la calle 44  muy cerca de Times Square y con una boca de metro en la misma calle.
Calidad precio es un hotel muy adecuado para pasar unos días en New York. Si lo que quieres es un hotel céntrico, para dormir, ducharte y descansar es una muy buena opción.

title: Nice, affordable stay
text:
Stayed for four nights, had a great time. We had a room with two double beds. While it was smaller than a hotel in other cities might be, it was normal for NYC, and a great deal for this location. The room was clean, especially the bathroom. 

Breakfast in the morning was awesome - a good way to save money in this city! 

The front staff was very helpful, especially when we needed our bags held after check out. 

It is only two blocks from the Subway and Times Square - great location! 

My only complaints would be that our room faced the street; it was a little loud at times. Nothing to keep us from sleeping the whole night, but it woke us up a couple of times throughout the four nights. 

Would definitely stay here again.

title: Single woman in New York - felt really safe
text:
I was travelling to New York alone in April 2013 and needed to stay somewhere for 1 night. The challenge was to see New York- Manhattan in 2 days and I needed a hotel that was safe and was in the heart of NY. I learnt of this hotel chain through some local friends and settled for it.
A 2-minute walk from the theater district of NY, the location is ideal and accessible.
Like all NY hotels, it really pinches your pocket ?(more in conversion from INR), but it is the best you can get in that area. 
When I reached the hotel, I was pleasantly surprised to see an Indian manager and his wife managing the place. I was taken to my room which was comfortable, just enough for me. There was a huge double sized bed in the room with all modern amenities. I was forewarned about the small sized rooms in the area, so I was ready for this one. The bathroom was really big and clean, which was good. The bed was comfortable and I slept well despite being alone.
The breakfast is included in the room charges and it was a basic one but very filling, with eggs, toast, fruits, yogurt, and waffles to end with. There are several restaurants around, so you should try grab dinner before you get back.
I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a cosy hotel in the heart of the city and are not willing to shell 5-star rates. The room size is ideal for a couple but not sure if you can fit in the children there.

title: Great hotel - very comfortable stay
text: Stayed here in October - family with teenagers. Good hotel, nice breakfast, clean (small) room, friendly and helpful staff. Location excellent - we walked everywhere from here as we had really good, dry sunny weather. The only time we took the subway was to 9/11 memorial. Breakfast does get very busy esp as some people want to sit and chat even after they've had their breakfast (!) but they do allow you to take food up to the room. Loved New York and would definitely stay here again.

title: Muito bem localizado!
text: Fiquei por 10 dias. Achei o quarto um pouco pequeno, mas nada que atrapalhe, pois quase não passamos tempo dentro do hotel. A localização é excelente, pertinho do metrô e a poucos metros da Times Square. Café da manhã gostoso e incluso, o que é raro em NY. Voltaria com certeza!

title: pleased
text: had week staying here with family, was so pleased with staff, location, breakfast, friendliness. I will certainly stay again when I return to NYC. Location to theatre, subway, times square, restaurants, all within walking distance.

title: Caro, pero muy cómodo
text: Las habitaciones son grandes, baño limpio y cómodo, espacio para guardar ropa, es realmente muy bueno, excelente ubicación! el desayuno es muy básico y muy pequeño el lugar en el subsuelo para tanta gente, pero bueno..... el precio no es barato, pero para un par de noches está bien.... recomendable habitación con 2 camas, muy cómodas y excelente temperatura!

title: Friendly Staff
text:
Just returned from NYC; a ladies only trip with family! Stayed five nights, NO complaints! Very clean hotel, fast, friendly check-in. Free cookies at front desk, coffee/tea/hot chocolate available in breakfast area 24 hours.
Decent hotel breakfast, very clean and efficient.
Awesome location! Just around the corner from Times Square....!
Would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone when visiting NYC!

title: Great hotel
text: I recently spend 5 days with my family in NYC and our stay at this hotel was wonderful. We found the staff very friendly, clean accommodations, lovely breakfast. Location was ideal and we would certainly stay at this hotel again

title: Fantastic deal in Theatre District, comfortable beds!
text:
We stayed 6 days and appreciated the great location.  It is within a few blocks of time square, many theaters, hundreds of restaurants.  There is a subway stop on the corner.  

The beds are very comfortable with lots of pillows.  

Staff were helpful and nice.  Helped with directions and advise on where to eat.

Complimentary breakfast, coffee/tea and little bits if you forget anything.

The computer and printer was handy for printing boarding passes.

I only would not give it 5 stars because it is not fancy and a bit dated.  It is a bit tight and not spacious but remember this is Manhattan.  This is a bargain and I would highly recommend it.

title: Gostei da localização
text: Fiquei no hotel por três dias. A localização é perfeita, o café é bom e o atendimento também. O prédio é velho e precisa de algumas reformas. O quarto é pequeno para  4 pessoas mas dá para se virar. Pelo que pesquisei todos os hotéis com este preço têm os quartos pequenos. O banho é ótimo.

title: Good value for New York
text: I've stayed at this Comfort Inn several times, and it's consistently clean and comfortable.  The location is perfect for theatre-goers; it's a safe area and you can walk to any Broadway theatre.  For visiting other areas of the city, you're only steps away from buses or subways.  Breakfast is fine, with a variety of pastries, cereals, a hot dish each day, waffles made to order, and good coffee.  Beds are comfortable; bathrooms are small but adequate; the staff is friendly and helpful.  It's not a luxury hotel, but if you're looking for a clean, comfortable hotel at a reasonable price, you can't do better.

title: Ótima localização!
text: O Hotel é muito bem localizado, fica a poucos passos da Broadway e Times Square, sem contar que fica próximo à estações de metrô e outras atrações. O atendimento dos funcionários foi sensacional, sempre muito simpáticos e solícitos durante toda a estadia. O café da manhã é gostoso, com diversas opções. Uma garrafa de café, de água quente e fria, e outros itens ficam à disposição dos hóspedes o dia todo no refeitório. Possui máquinas de salgadinhos e doces, e também, de refrigerantes e água. Há um caixa ATM no térreo. O dormitório é confortável e possui máquina de café. Ressalto apenas alguns pontos negativos, porém que não influenciariam na escolha da hospedagem. O quarto é um pouco escuro; o refeitório é pequeno, fazendo com que muitas vezes não tomássemos café, pois por estar muito cheio não havia condições de adentrar para pegar os alimentos ou mesmo sentar; o café da manhã vai apenas até as 09:30h, poderia ter mais uma hora, afinal a maioria está ali para descansar. Com certeza me hospedaria nesse Hotel novamente e o recomendaria para outras pessoas. Ótima estadia!!

title: Excellent hotel
text:
I stayed here as a single female traveller earlier in the year. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone travelling alone, but also for others. It is a brilliant location for exploring the sights, within walking distance of times square and with a subway station entrance just moments down the road. 
The price could not be beaten. I was worried about what to expect having paid so little but the room was comfortable and the hotel had everything you needed. Breakfast was included which was another nice touch.

title: Fantastic 5 days in New York City
text: Just spent 4 nights 5 days at the Comfort Inn midtown 343 West 44th Street. This hotel is quite small compared to some NYC hotels and nothing fancy but it is clean, comfortable the staff are excellent friendly and helpful, beds clean and comfortable. If you are just looking for a base to explore NYC I would recommend this hotel. It is located in midtown close to Times Square, 42nd Street and the Port Authority bus station. It was great value and included a lovely breakfast each morning  buffet style with a good choice to set you up for the day. We had two rooms on the third floor with 3 in each room. There is free wifi in your room and tea and coffee. I will stay here on my next trip to NYC.

title: Wonderful trip for my daughter's 16th birthday!
text:
All I can say is wow -- from the very first phone call letting them know why we were coming to New York and whether we could order a cake to be delivered to the hotel to the last day and keeping our luggage till we finished some last minute shopping -- this hotel is wonderful!!

Upon arrival they were courteous, friendly and extremely knowledgeable -- for a first time traveller to New York I felt at ease as soon as I walked into the hotel.  I have read some of the reviews and I can't understand the complaints about the elevator -- there is also a stairwell that can be used.  This hotel is extremely clean -- the area where breakfast is served is immaculate -- the food is very good and lots of it, fruit, yogurt, all kinds of baked goods, bread, bagels, cereal, eggs (2 kinds) and bacon and sausages.  The coffee is great too and very thoughtful to have it throughout the day for guests.  (One small suggestion is to leave a little milk in the fridge for tea drinkers).

The bedrooms are compact, but have everything you need.  The beds are comfy and the bathroom is very clean (and I am very particular).  Anything you needed was just a phone call away.

We were also very touched to find roses and chocolates for my daughter's birthday -- what a lovely touch.

Very close to EVERYTHING -- and yet pretty quiet.  We were on the second floor looking onto the street and we were not interrupted by noises while sleeping.

There is only one thing I want to mention -- and it was not the hotel's fault -- we were looking for transportation to Woodburry Commons for shopping and while the hotel staff were extremely helpful in arranging transportation, the Busline -- American Tours -- was terrible!!  Very unprofessional and I would not recommend them.  There are other busses that you can take to Woodburry Commons -- please use them.  I believe we paid an extra $11 each to use this service.  Again, not the hotel's fault.

Thanks so much for making our first trip to New York a memorable one and we will definitely stay here again if we can make it back for a second one!!

title: Excelent hotel.
text: Uitstekend hotel met vriendelijke staf. Ontbijt was meer dan voldoende keuze. Kamers schoon,goede bedden met keuze voor hard of zacht kussen, badkamer prima, koelkastje en kluis op de kamer. Koffie en thee zowel op de kamer als in het ontbijt gedeelte 24/7. Gebruik van computer met printer zonder extra kosten hebben dit in duurdere hotels wel eens anders meegemaakt.Ondanks dat mijn ANWB kaart niet de korting gaf waren we door het zoeken van de manager goedkoper uit. Prima ligging van zowel Times Square als de metro. Bij een volgend bezoek zeker weer een hotel om naar te kijken.

title: Not bad..not bad at all
text:
Myself and 3 other friends from New Zealand stayed at the Comfort Inn from Oct 2nd to Oct 9th 2013. The hotel is in a great location within the Theatre district, 5 min walk from Times Sq, loads of eating places around the hotel, subway entrances all around, a laundry right next door. A 10 minute walk to the Hudson River.  A majority of the staff were friendly and helpful with any of our queries. Our travel agent had booked all 4 of us in a twin room informing us that there would be plenty of room for all of us - the twin room is most assuredly NOT big enough for 4 adults (bear that in mind). We ended up having to get another room on our arrival. However, we found the rooms to be clean, beds were very comfortable and bathroom/toilet facilities did their job. Breakfast came with our room but you need to get to the dining room early if you want to sit at a table to eat (I think it only seats about 40 people) or you can take it back to your room.
If I was ever lucky enough to come back to New York, I would definitely come back to the Comfort Inn.

title: Go hotel at Time Square West
comfortable hotel, great location, helpful staff
text: We recently stayed 4 nights and found the location sensational. So close to key sights and subway. The staff were always helpful and the many problems we had read in reviews about the slow elevator really didn't cause us any grief.  Our room on the 4th floor at the back of the hotel had a pleasant view across a carpark to a neighbouring back street and was reasonably quiet.  Breakfast was good with plenty of options and we found it pleasant to eat early before the 8-9am rush. We would recommend and stay again.

title: Perfect location
text:
From the moment we arrived we were delighted with our choice of hotel for our 4 night stay in NYC. OK, the decor could have been a little brighter and refreshed and the one lift could have been a little quicker but after several long days sightseeing to the have the BEST nights sleep ever in a hotel makes this a definite return venue for our next visit to this great city. The free wi-fi meant that we could in close contact with our family at home. 

Did I mention the brilliant location - Times Square a 5 minute walk away, knocking on the door of Theatre district, Central Park an easy walk away and every type of food possible on your doorstep! The Subway is at the end of the street and the Hop on/off busses a couple of blocks away which provided us first timers with an excellent insight into this magnificent city. Also close and an easy walk were the Empire State Building, Macey's and an extensive array of shops.

Where the hotel punches above its weight are the softer touches - A Continental type breakfast which really set us up for the day (hot - eggs, bacon or sausages, toast, freshly cooked to order Waffles, Fruit, very fresh pastries, Yogurt etc & don't be put off by the plastic plates/knives/forks as they are just functional) and all day complimentary filtered coffee for guests in the Breakfast area on the ground floor by Reception. They will store baggage after check out and arrange private transportation back to the Airport (Slightly more than a yellow cab at $73 including tolls) but our vehicle was bordering on a Limo so a nice way to end our vacation.

title: Wonderful Location and Customer Service
text: My husband and I visited New York City and stayed at this hotel.  The entire staff could not of been nicer.  The front desk always helped us with anything we needed.  The breakfast area was very clean and the breakfast was delicious.  The person who worked in the breakfast area really went out of her way to help people with anything they needed.  Our room was clean and the beds were very comfortable.  The location was perfect.  We were close to very thing.  I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.  Thank you to the staff at the Comfort Inn Times Square West.

title: Great place
text: This is a great place to stay, the staff are very helpful, and friendly, the breakfast is good, and you are in walking distance to all time square,lots of shows , there are lots of shopping in the area also, and if you need to take the bus, to go to outlets,the bus terminal is only couple of blocks away

title: Great location at an okay price
text:
The Comfort Inn located on West 44th street between eighth and ninth avenue is reasonably priced for it location.  Literally just two blocks from the heart of the theater district, the inn offers clean, nicely appointed rooms  with all the basic amenities.  Although the room was a bit small it was more than sufficient for one person and the room and the bathroom were spotless.

There is little in the way of a lobby but there is an adjoining area where a full breakfast buffet  is set out each morning.  Plenty of food with a good variety.

I especially liked the location for its easy walking distance to public transportation, bus and subway, on 42nd Street.  I would stay here again.

title: Great Location in the Theater District
text:
This was our second stay here. The following review is my original review with updates.

If you’re the type of traveler for whom a hotel is merely an adjunct to a trip -- a clean place to stay with a convenient location -- a place where the hot water is hot, the toilet flushes, the shower works, the bed is comfortable, and the price is reasonable [by NYC standards], then this hotel is for you.

My wife and I stayed here for six nights. It was our tenth trip to NYC for a week of theater, delicatessens, and bargain shopping [while I stayed outside and people-watched, or in two instances walked across the Brooklyn Bridge].

LOCATION: Located on 44th Street between 8th and 9th Avenues the hotel is in the west end of the theater district, convenient to Times Square and the subway. It’s a safe, busy area, at least between 7AM and 11PM. I was in my room at other times. 

THE ROOM: 
The room with two double beds is somewhat small, even by NYC standards, but a couple coordinating their movements can avoid bumping into each other. 

The room contained an iron/ironing board, hair dryer, clock, fridge, coffee, coffeemaker, and safe. 

Drawers and closet space were minimal. Fortunately my wife prefers to live out of her suitcase, so I had the two small drawers and the small closet to myself. I found that I was storing items in places that I’ve never used -- the drawer of the night table and the empty space below the drawer of the night table. The room contains two chairs but it’s likely that you’ll use them for storage.

There was a full length mirror. 

Wall Street Journal and USA Today are included in the room price and are available in the lobby. 

We did not bring our laptops so I can’t comment on the wi-fi. 

The TV was a flat screen. 

The room-lighting is on the darker side of adequate. There is a nightlight in the bathroom as part of the hairdryer.

The shower spray is steady and the hot water remains constant. The shower is a shower/bath combination. 

The bathroom has minimal counter space for two guests but was shiny, spotless, and well-lighted. The towels are plentiful and although not plush, certainly do the job. A minor annoyance: there is no soapdish in the shower.

Housekeeping was dependable.

The bed, pillow, and linens were comfortable [This is subjective, of course. One guest’s “comfortable” can be another guest’s sleepless night.]. 

We were on the 6th floor so I can’t comment on the lobby noise that other guests have discussed. We didn’t hear the guests in the room next door; however, if the sound of the automatic lock engaging when a room door closes bothers you, then I suggest ear plugs. 

The air conditioner was effective and quiet. 

TWO UNIQUE FEATURES OF THE ROOM:
As a matter of course we all know that to take a shower we have to redirect the water flow from the tub to the shower. We find the lever, push it, pull it, or flip it and voila! -- a shower. Not here. HIDDEN at the end of the faucet is a ring. You have to run the water and pull the ring down. Kudos to my wife for figuring it out. Apparently I’m not the only one who’s had problems. I subsequently noticed that they have to explain it in the hotel information book in the room.

Most hotel rooms have two sets of curtains -- the thin white see-thru curtains and the lined room-darkening curtains. Here, however, the room-darkening curtains are stationary; they don’t extend across the window. So you figure that you have to live without room-darkeners. But there is a THIRD SET of curtains hidden behind the white see-thru curtains. These are the room-darkeners. I found these on our third day.

ELEVATORS: There is only one elevator. In addition, it seems to function as the service elevator. The staff does its best not to interfere with the guests. We had no unusually long waits. But the problem is obvious. Elevators can break and certainly require routine maintenance. What do guests do when the elevator is invariably out of service? For some guests the stairs are not an option.

STAFF: The staff is a major selling point for the hotel. In a word: excellent. They are pleasant, helpful, and accommodating.

When we checked in, we realized the prior occupants had locked the safe. We called the front desk. Within five minutes a staff member came to our room and solved the problem. He made sure that we tried it and it worked before he left. 

A lamp malfunctioned in our room. As we left for the day, we reported the problem. When we returned that afternoon, we had a replacement lamp. 

My wife asked the desk clerk about the location of a street fair. After getting an answer we went up to our room. Upon entering we received a call. It was the desk clerk apologizing for misinforming us and gave us the correct information.

INTERNET ACCESS: If you don’t have your computer with you, the hotel provides a computer in the lobby. The cost is included in the price of the room. The staff asked non-guests who were using the computer to leave.

SECURITY: There are surveillance cameras on every floor.

FOOD: Guests have access to a buffet breakfast, which is built into the price of the room. Cereal, sausage/bacon, eggs, waffles, yogurt, breads, bagels, pastries, fruit, juice, coffee, and tea are standard. Like the rest of the hotel staff, the woman working the breakfast was excellent. She kept all items restocked, made sure the food areas and tables were clean, and even made your waffles. She ensured that you got a good start to your day. A Comfort Inn buffet breakfast is not intended to be a sit-down breakfast at a coffee shop with your eggs made to order and is therefore easy to criticize for not being what it never intended to be. It’s an efficient way to refuel and get on your way.

The breakfast area provides tea, coffee, hot water, and a microwave 24 hours a day.
The front desk has chocolate chip cookies in the afternoon.

SUMMARY: A reasonably priced hotel must get its reasonableness from somewhere. In this case it’s the size of the rooms, a small not fancy lobby, rooms which could be somewhat brighter, and the one elevator, but if these money-savers don’t bother you, then the great location, the included breakfast, and the superb staff make this hotel a good choice.

title: localização,café da manhã
text: Localização é fantástica. "Na boca do gol" ( broadway com 7ª avenida).Você anda um quarteirão e está no meio de todo agito dos teatros e do povo. O café da manhã é simples, mas com fartura. O valor da diária é um dos melhores de Nova Iorque, fazendo a relação custo/benefício ser vantajosa. Vale cada dólar gasto.

title: A great place to stay
text: The staff was friendly and helpful, the room was clean, and the room was larger than the typical NYC hotel.  The beds were very comfortable.  With the great location and free full breakfast, we got off to a great and early start each morning.  I would stay here again.

title: Excelente Localização e Conforto
text: É difícil achar um hotel como este: preço, café da manhã e localização. Tudo perfeito. Foi um dos hoteis mais em conta no coração do Nova Iorque. Facilidade em pedir o early check in sem qualquer custo.

title: Whirlwind Trip to Manhattan
text: This Comfort Inn is perfectly located near the Theater District and Times Square.  Everything is within walking distance.  Even Rockefeller Plaza and the Empire State Building are easy walks - dangerous at times, but easy.  LOL  The hotel was quaint and clean and their staff was professional & always helpful.  The complimentary breakfast was great and FREE as were the morning newspapers and wifi.  I'd highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be in midtown Manhattan for a reasonable (based on Manhattan pricing) rate.  Loved it.

title: Perfect for theatres
text:
My daughter and I spent a week in this gem of a hotel prior to her going to university. It is perfectly located for the theatre district and is a short walk from Times Square and the subway station. There are also loads of restaurants just a stone's throw from the hotel. We always felt perfectly safe in that area which for two women on our own was important. The hotel was run by a team of Indians whose familiar accents made us Brits feel quite at home in the bustle of NYC. They were always courteous and efficient. The breakfast was copious and varied and the room while a far cry from designer boutique decor (rather 50 shades of brown) was clean and quiet with a decent bathroom. 
It wasn't cheap but that's central New York for you. But if you want something secure in the theatre district and close to New York's other amenities you could do a lot worse than this hotel. Not a honeymoon hideaway perhaps but definitely to be recommended for other travellers!

title: Great quality for the price
text: Stayed on vacation with my family... rooms are too small (most of NYC rooms are) and there is almost no room for even the luggage if you travel with small kids... the rest of the hotel is fine. Good breakfast with all you need to start the day, quiet clean rooms and toilettes. The crew offers good answers to the guest;s needs. And the location is simply perfect: one block from the Phantom of the Opera theatre.

title: Klein aber mein, as the East Germans used to say!
text:
My family and I (wife and 6 and 3 year old) had a great stay here a few weeks ago.  Right in the thick of things - super clean.  Breakfast is great wih a bit of variety and fruit, which was a lovely surprise.  Staff all excellent.  Rooms are small but very comfy.

Only complaint - real milk for my afternoon tea, please.  Not creamer!!!  But I might be being a bit picky and perhaps should be grateful they even have this facility.

Excellent restaurants nearby (loved the Thai and burger place a few doors down).

Best wishes to all and do go.

William

title: Great location!
text:
My husband and I stayed here overnight this past weekend, after seeing a Broadway musical. The location is great, right near Times Square. The hotel staff were friendly, and accommodating. (They will stow your luggage so you can explore before check-in time.) The room was fair sized, which is to be expected in NYC hotels. The price was reasonable, especially if you pay in advance for the discounted price. (Lower than a lot of the comparable local hotels.) The free breakfast had a nice mix of both hot (eggs, bacon, waffles - even chocolate mix!) and normal "continental" fare, as well.

My only complaint was that the hallway leading to my room was VERY narrow. This ended up being a problem as I was forced to be in a wheelchair during the trip. To be fair, I did not book a room that was accommodating for handicapped, but the hallway was even a bit narrow in general to walk through.

title: Hotel idéalement situé pour un prix raisonnable à NY
text: Séjour à New York dans cet hotel. Très bon rapport qualité prix avec le petit déjeuner inclu. Idéalement situé. Chambre très confortable. Accueil irréprochable ainsi que le personnel au petit déjeuner. Je vous le recommande.

title: Muy bien ubicado...
text: Un hotel muy bien ubicado a un precio super economico. Las habitaciones estan recien remodeladas y las camas son comodas. El personal es cordial, cuentan con Wi-Fi en las habitaciones y el desayuno -standard- es correcto. Si quieres disfrutar de la gran manzana al maximo y solo llegar al hotel para dejar las compras o dormir, esta es la mejor opcion. Ojo, el ascensor es lento.

title: Close to the action in the Big Apple
text:
A group of three (2 adults and 1 teenager) stayed at this hotel June 2013 for 2 nights. This was our first visit to NYC, so we wanted a reasonably priced room close to Times Square. This hotel fit the bill.
Rooms and bathrooms are very small (we were prepared for that by reviews). Basically enough floor space to walk around the beds and not much more. On the upside, the rooms are very clean and well-kept. Plus, we were in NYC to sight-see, not hang out in our room.
Included is complimentary breakfast which was great. Made-to-order waffles, cereals, eggs, yogurt, fruit, coffee, bacon, oatmeal. Perfect to start the day. Although the "dining" area is tiny, the area is kept immaculate and attended to during the breakfast hours. 
We were a few blocks walking distance from Times Square, which was perfect. During our visit, we did a hop on-hop off bus tour to see the city (the pick up site is in Times Square). It would also be very close for any shows. (Being small-town people, the best thing was leaving our car parked and walking...don't think that you'll get anywhere driving yourself around NYC!)

title: Excelente escolha
text:
Excelente escolha deste hotel, super bem localizado, quartos confortáveis, atendimento de qualidade, internet grátis em todo o hotel, café da manhã continental grátis e aceita entrega de encomendas de compras feitas pela internet.
Muito próximo da Times Square, Broadway e Metro

title: Very nice location -exceptionally clean
text: The room seemed small, but I was told by a friend in NYC, that it was large for the area.  The bathroom was spotless - not a streak on the mirrors, fixtures and tile.  The location was very convenient and the staff was very helpful with any request.

title: Brilliant customer service.
text: We stayed in new york for 7 nights and the customer service was amazing. The Airport had lost our luggage before hand and the staff and comfort inn really helped us do what we could to manage. Also i had broken my foot 2 weeks before hand and could not get up to the top floor where our original booking was but the staff managed to get me in a ground floor room to help me. The Cost, Service and location of this was amazing. First class experience.

title: Perfect Location in NYC
text:
My daughter and I recently took a 4 day trip to NYC. I did a lot of research to figure out where the best location to stay was based on what we were planning on doing. Then I looked at the cost of the hotels and decided on the Comfort Inn. Upon check in, we were greeted by a friendly desk clerk. Our room was on the 4th floor which was easily reached by the elevator. Once getting off the elevator, the rooms (about 10 per floor) are situated around the outside edges kind of like a square. We had a room with a king size bed. The room was a good size for the 2 of us. It did have a refrigerator which blocked the path to the other side of the bed. Without it, I would say it was a perfect size for 2 people. The bathroom was very cleaned. Shiny faucets and floors. The bed also had both soft and hard pillows to choose from and I would say our bed was very comfortable. Our room was street side, so we did hear the sounds of traffic, but to me that is expected given being in a city. 

Later in the day, they served chocolate chip cookies, had coffee and water available all day. There was also a continental breakfast which included chocolate or white waffles which were made by a hotel employee, eggs (hard boiled or scrambled), sausage, gravy, toast, pastries, cereal, yogurt, fresh fruit, juices, etc. The breakfast area is a nice size, but too small for so many people. 

As far as getting to the heart of NYC, this location is a straight shot (2 blocks) to the Broadway shows, a couple blocks to the Port Authority Bus/Subway station, 3 blocks from Times Square, Hard Rock, etc. If we ever travel back we certainly will stay here. It was in a quiet area, but close to all the "fun", or at least easy enough to get transportation - subway, bus, taxi to anywhere. The staff were friendly and very helpful in giving directions and making us feel welcome.

title: Short but sweet stay
text: Only stayed for 1 night here. It was a beautiful room and the view was great. The location was perfect, we were able to walk to everything we wanted to see. Breakfast had a good selection scrambled eggs and bacon! The only issue I encountered was at breakfast as there wasn't enough space to accommodate all the guests. Would definitely stay here again when in NYC.

title: New Yor State of Mind
text:
We planned our first ever stay in NYC while we were touring the East Coast by motorcycle and a few things were of concern.  First would be the cost of NYC hotels, we covered this by using our Choice Privileges points.  The next big concern was the security of my motorcycle during our three night stay.  I called the hotel on two separate occasions and they assured me they had a deal with the parkade across the street and that my bike would be as safe there as anywhere as they had staff on site 24/7.

We arrived at the hotel and check in was handled quickly by very friendly staff, a good start to our stay.  Unpacked the bike and headed across the street to park it and the stress level rose immediately when the staff tried to wave me out of the parkade and said they don't allow motorcycles in the parkade.  I tried to explain I was from the hotel and they said they had a deal but that got me nowhere and I'm fairly certain the only reason I got to talk to someone in charge was the fact I was blocking their entry and was not leaving.  Eventually the Asst Mgr. found a spot to park my bike and after making it very clear they would not be responsible for any damage to the bike agreed to let me park it.  Not exactly the warm fuzzy feeling I was hoping for leaving my bike for 3 nights.

When I returned to the hotel I was pretty stressed about this and mentioned to the staff at the desk in the future they should know the parkade won't take motorcycles as we would not have booked had we known this fact.  The manager came out and apologized and stated that because the parkades are always full they change their rules whenever they see fit and if the hotel tries to complain they essentially tell them to pound sand and void the contract.  I understand this is not directly a hotel issue but it was a major factor in my choice of hotels so I've included it in the review.

Our room was nicely appointed and spotless and it was also quite small but I had expected that based on other NYC hotel reviews.  Wifi worked great, maid service was excellent and about the only room related issue was the last day I felt our towels were beyond their service life but it was such a small issue it wouldn't affect me coming back based on how happy we were with the room itself.  If you are a light sleeper I'd recommend ear plugs as there is a lot of street noise early in the day.

The included breakfast was awesome, well stocked and kept full at all times by staff.  The only other issue we had was the Comfort Inn website states this hotel has guest laundry and traveling by motorcycle we planned to use it.  When we arrived we found out there is no guest laundry and the nearest laundromat was many blocks away.  Not a huge deal but had the website been accurate we would have done laundry the day before arrival at our previous hotel as they had a guest laundry.

title: Ótima localização
text:
A maior vantagem do hotel é a localização, perto da Times Square  e dos principais teatros,  além de restaurantes, lanchonetes,  etc. Fica a 2 quadras do terminal de ônibus Port Authority, onde há ônibus para os aeroportos e há uma estação de metrô bem perto (cerca de 100 metros).   Embora tenham nos dado um quarto muito pequeno e sem espaço para as malas,  tinha uma boa cama e um bom chuveiro, além de frigobar, o que é sempre útil.  Também havia  secador de cabelos,  tábua e ferro de passar roupas no quarto. A limpeza foi feita diariamente  e de forma satisfatória. O quarto era de fundos, sem vista nenhuma, mas  bem silencioso e bom para dormir.  O check in é às 14:00h e o check out às 11:00h, e estes horários não são flexíveis.  O café da manhã é bom, principalmente se comparado aos que costumamos encontrar fora do Brasil. Mas o salão de refeições é muito pequeno e dependendo do horário não se encontra lugar para sentar.  Para quem quiser tomar o café de forma mais confortável e tranquila,  a dica é descer até as 8:00 horas da manhã. 
Obs: Pessoas alérgicas devem ir preparadas, pois os quartos têm carpetes,  cortinas, edredons, o que sempre junta poeira e ácaros. 

O QUE PRECISA MELHORAR:  a internet wi fire é instável e à noite não funciona bem. Só há um elevador e aparentemente não tem boa manutenção.  Parou justamente no dia em que estávamos saindo e as malas tiveram que ser carregadas pelas escadas.

title: Good place to stay in NYC
text: Service was great as they brought us all the things we needed when we needed them.  Make note that this is one of the few hotels in New York City with complimentary breakfast, which was also really good.  Our room was clean but kind of small, but most rooms in NYC are also small.  Location was amazing, just a couple blocks off times square.  We were on the basement floor, which was under the lobby floor and when we went to our room we had to walk through the janitor/maid's area, which was kind of disgusting with dirty cleaning supplies and empty boxes everywhere.  But once you get out of there, it is like a normal hotel floor.  We actually had a window overlooking some courtyard behind the hotel, which wasn't really too cool but it was nice to have so you can let light in.  Overall a great hotel and I would recommend it to everyone looking for a good value hotel near times square.

title: Great location
text: Don't be put off by exterior view if this hotel. Its in a great location and the staff are very helpful. In an expensive city it is also value for  money. Rooms are small but very well presented and very clean. Breakfast included, fruit, bagels, toast, yoghurt, pastries, waffles, eggs etc. Good restaurants in area. Close to and within walking distance of many attractions.

title: Buona posizione, camera un po' piccola
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato una notte in questo hotel in una camera king al secondo piano che dava sulla corte interna. La camera e' un po' piccola ma comunque pulita e silenziosa (a parte un motore di un condizionatore che si trovava proprio sotto la finestra). Se potete chiedete una camera ai piani alti. Ottima la posizione a due minuti a piedi da port authority bus station (2 isolati), e a meno di 10 da Times square. 
Colazione nella norma per essere un hotel di poche pretese a Manhattan. Il wi fi lento e poco funzionante. Personale gentile e disponibile.

title: Very good hotel with excellent location
text: The hotel is nicely located close to Times Square.. It has hardly 10 mins walk from the hotel.. The rooms were nice and newly done.. The breakfast was good  as per US standards.. The staff is nice and cooperative..

title: Great stay!
text:
I brought my Mom to the city for two days of sightseeing and shows on 7/31 and 8/1.  We each had a King room on the 6th floor.  My Mom kept commenting on how nice the rooms were and they were; Clean and quiet, with great pillows, water pressure and comfy beds. 

As others have said, the location cannot be beat; half a block from many subway lines, another half a block to 9th Avenue which has every restaurant you can imagine within walking distance.  Plus only a block and a half from Times Square. 

Breakfast is included and was a step up from your typical continental.  There were eggs, bacon, waffles, toast and bagels.  Plus fruit, yogurt, cereal, juice and pastries.  Definitely enough to start your day. 

The staff was friendly and there are always cookies at the front desk when you walk in. 

I would absolutely stay here again

title: Great Location/Great Customer Services
text: We stayed at this location from 7/26-8/1/13.  The rooms were on the snug side but we really weren't in the room other than for sleeping.  Please note if you get a double room, the beds are full size, not queen.  This is somewhat uncomfortable for men who are over 6' tall!  The beds and pillows were the most comfortable I've ever slept on.  I slept better here than at home!  The staff is very friendly and eager to assist in anywaypossible.  All you have to do is ask.  The continental breakfast was a good way to start the day.  You couldn't beat the hotel location.  Just about everything was within walking distance. The complimentary cookies at the front desk were awesome and we certainly had our share!! ABAWA was very friendly with a good sense of humor!!  Would stay here again!

title: Can't fault it
text:
When our cab pulled up the hotel didn't inspire me from the outside.

However first appearances were very deceiving.  The staff were very helpful, the rooms immaculately clean, the location brilliant and the breakfast a pleasant surprise.

Yes, the rooms are on the snug side but who cares. We were never in the room and awake long enough to be bothered.

Would I recommend it? YES and if I'm back in NY I'll be staying there again.

title: Ótima escolha
text: Café da manhã maravilhoso, staff adorável e impecável, localização maravilhosa (a pouquíssimas quadras da Times Square/Broadway), porém achei os quartos um pouco pequenos. Me hospedei no reveillon e o hotel não fica no meio do tumulto, ainda dava pra andar pela rua. O único ponto negativo é a diária que está cada vez mais cara. :(

title: Trés bon hôtel pour un séjour en famille
text: Nous avons passé un excellent séjour dans cet hôtel. Idéalement situé, il permet d'accéder à de nombreuses animations et sites à pied et est situé à 100 mètres d'une bouche de métro. L'équipe est très sympa et vraiment à l'écoute.

title: Best location at a good value
text: We stayed 5 nights at the end of June. You can't ask for a better location: in the middle of the theater district, one block from Hell's Kitchen, 10 minutes walk to Times Square, 5 minutes walk to a grocery store (Duane Reade), 3 minutes walk to the subway station direct to the 9/11 Memorial and Lower Manhattan . The rooms are small  but very clean. We had a room located in the back of the hotel and we were never disturbed by street noise. There was a fridge in the room which was extremely convenient.The service was excellent  and the staff members were very helpful. The included free breakfast was very good. We also felt very secured in the area around the hotel. We would definitely go back.

title: Bem localizado, limpo, mas antigo e com diárias ELEVADAS
text: Eu e minha família estivemos nesse hotel em junho/2013. Havia feito a reserva com base nas avaliações do Trip Advisor. Realmente o hotel é muito bem localizado, limpo, com empregados simpáticos, dispostos a ajudar em tudo e tem café da manhã e internet gratuitos, raro em NY. Como pontos fracos,  as instalações são antigas e precisam de reforma (desde a fachada), o ALTO PREÇO das diárias (pagamos cerca de 1/3 do valor por um cinco estrelas em Las Vegas) e um ÚNICO ELEVADOR para todos os hóspedes e bagagens. Durante nossa estadia ele QUEBROU e tivemos que subir, exaustos, quatro andares de escadas ao final de um dia de passeios e na manhã seguinte descer as escadas para o café. O hotel vale, no máximo, duas estrelas.

title: Bom custo benefício
text: Hotel bom, por um preço acessível. Ótima localização, dá pra fazer quase tudo a pé. Porém, ficamos em um quarto muito pequeno, é a única coisa que deixou um pouco a desejar. Mas sabemos que existem outros quartos maiores.

title: Very pleased
text: Being a Choice Privileges member, I always stay at Choice Hotels.  After booking this hotel, I read some of the reviews, and was a bit leery.  I was delighted with the hotel.  Near the theater district, staff was very friendly.  Place was clean.  Our room on 4th floor was delightful.  Breakfast was great.  Subway was a block away.  What more could you ask for?  I would stay there again and would recommend it to anyone.  We felt safe walking back to the hotel at night after the theater.  Great location.  Helpful, alert, courteous staff.  Great place!

title: Best value for your money!!
text: The hotel is a great hotel , it's near everything. Only 2 block from Times Square. The service is excellent from the front desk to the maid service. They all are friendly and very helpful. The rooms are small but clean. In New York  this is nothing new.. I would definitely recommend.

title: WOW!  Great hotel, great price, great location!
text: It was our first time in NYC, but this hotel was really close to everything!  Great location, one block from the subway, 2 blocks to Times Square(across from Toys R' Us) which was great location for us.  We loved that the area was full of restaurants, stores, etc, it was a great location overall.  We were in the Theatre district which was really nice as well.  I loved it here, the hotel is small and quaint, but surprisingly clean & pleasant.  The breakfast was really wonderful with fresh pastries and crescents that my family LOVED!  I would stay here again very soon, it was a great first experience.

title: Excellent
text:
Couldn't ask for a better experience. The staff were super friendly, and were always willing to help. The hotel itself is a 2 minute walk from Times Square and couldn't at the more prime location. The rooms were exceptionally tidy, clean, and comfortable. 
The only minor complaint is that the rooms can at times seem small. For a my family members (6'0, 6'1 and 6'2), a slightly bigger room would be better. BUT, this is NYC. You aren't here to spend time in your room and complain about the size.

Book this hotel for a worry-free stay in the greatest city on the planet.

title: Great!
text: My mother and my sister and I stay for 2 nights at this hotel, good continental breakfast, safe place GREAT LOCATION for the subway system, Broadway, time square ALMOST EVERYWHERE!!! great stuff, great bed & great pillows (my sister complimented) :)

title: Excellent location - good family hotel
text:
Visited with 16 year old daughter in June, first time in NYC. Hotel location is outstanding - close enough to all the main sites (walk to many or subway at end of block) and literally dozens of restaurants in all the adjoining streets. Felt perfectly safe at all times (even after 11pm). 

Twin room on 3rd floor was fine. Back of the hotel kept us away from the elevator which could be disturbing if you were too close. 

Decor is tired, a bit drab, room was tight for space but adequate. Shower and bath good, air-con a godsend when returning hot and tired. Wi-fi free and perfectly adequate. 

Staff at front desk helpful with small tips. Breakfast really pretty good - always plenty and reasonable variety.

All in all, ideal for what we needed - a good base with decent facilities.

title: Excellent hotel 1/2 the price
text: Being a law enforcement officer, besides location my number 1 concern is safety.  I traveled to NYC with my 2 daughters and wife for eight days.  We stayed at Comfort Suites located at 343 W. 44 and I never felt or saw anything at or near the hotel that would make me feel unsafe for my family.  The location is excellent, staff was very friendly and the room was very clean and comfortable (the picture on web makes it look smaller than it really was but it is not huge but big enough for family of 4).   I have stayed at an other hotel just a block and a half away and paid twice as much for the room (I will never do that again and will stay at this hotel).  The subway one block away tkaes you to central park.  If it is raining can uses this same entrance to walk under ground to times square.  1/2 block away is pharmacy and some great food (Hells Kitchen area) especially desserts, head the other way and you are a block and a half away from Times Square.    Room even though by elevator was very quiet.  Only issue was the breakfast was area was very busy every day but it was good.

title: Pretty good stay
text:
Front desk was helpful and even changed my room from a Queen bed to King since the Queen room that was available was below ground floor.  Breakfast was good and wifi was decent.  The room was pretty small and the placement of the frig and room safe was inconvenient.
This hotel does not have a gym which is a bit of a letdown for me.  
If I had to come back, I would due to the friendly front desk guy and close proximity to Time Square. 

For fulll review, read my blog http://http://travelwithyj.com/

title: Excellent location, service and complimentary breakfast!
text: This hotel is a great place for anybody to stay while visiting NY! The staff is very friendly and helpful, the breakfast is superb - even serving pastries form a local bakery! The rooms are a bit small but very adequate and comfortable and clean. It is only two blocks away from Time Square center and less than a block from the subway station. It was very close to many popular sites! Great place to stay and reasonably priced for the area.

title: Great hotel, location and staff.
text:
Just got back from our family visit to NewYork (June 21st 2013). We found the hotel location to be perfectly central to all things-time square, Empire State, liberty cruise, grand central station. The room was small but fine-clean and tidy but not a lot of hanging room in the wardrobes! The complimentary breakfast was great! Waffles, eggs, bacon, sausages...yoghurts, pastries etc....
The best bit about this hotel are the staff.... Very friendly, warm, helpful people who could not do enough for us. Very impressed too with the manager- the lift was broke on one day but very soon fixed again, we didn't complain as it wasn't an issue, however on check out the manager presented us with a 50 dollar visa gift card as a way of saying sorry for any inconvenience ... Bought our tea at the airport so thank you... When we visit New York again we would defo stay here x thank you from mr and mrs langan and our daughter lily xxx

title: It was just as I expected it would be.
text: You read occasional reviews from disgruntled people and hope that they are not right especially when you spend this much money.  Hotels in New York City are expensive.   The bad reviews were not reflective of this hotel.  I have stayed in New York City 6 times in the last 12 years.  Rooms are small, this one was the largest I have stayed in though not much bigger.  Clean and comfortable.  We were very fortunate that our room was right across from the breakfast area so we did not need to use the elevator as it is the only one and the staff use it to get from floor to floor.  Our son and daughter in law were in the basement.  No problems with that room either, it was the same size and clean.   The staff was great.   Unlike other hotels where Parking is hard to get to after you unload your bags here the entrance is AFTER the hotel so I was able to just pull across the street after unloading everyone, no driving around the block to get into the lot.  Try driving in Times Square at 4pm on a week day it is not easy.  Breakfast was just like all the other Choice Hotels.  No issues here either.  It was an easy walk to Times Square and to the Intreped museum.  Eat at Bubba Gump in times square but that is another review.   Great hotel.  Of all my experiences in New York Hotels this was the best.

title: Very good hotel.
text: My friend and I stayed here and it was close to everything we wanted.  They will hold your luggage, too.  The location of this hotel is great.  The cookies are awesome, I just wish they would have given me more than 1.  The breakfast is great, too.  Gotta love hotels that offer free breakfast.

title: Nel cuore della Grande Mela!
text: Se cercate un posto comodo dove dormire, che vi offra tutto ciò di cui avete bisogno senza inutili sprechi, questo è l'hotel che fa per voi! Situato sulla 44th nel Theatre District - per intenderci Broadway e dintorni - è a due passi dalla 5th Avenue, da Times Square, dalla Public Library e da tutto ciò che vorreste visitare a New York: insomma, è un posto strategico per muoversi a piedi da veri turisti! Ma se non foste i tipi da lunghe passeggiate, niente paura! Nelle immediate vicinanze c'è una fermata della metro, la stazione degli autobus di Port Authority (collegata con gli aeroporti) e la stazione centrale, quella famosa dove la vecchietta picchia Alex il leone in Madagascar, sì! Pulizia e cortesia non mancano, oltre a un'abbondante e ottima colazione! Wi-fi e postazione pc nella hall gratuiti, ferro da stiro e asse in camera, bollitore per il caffè e minibar e una quantità di negozi e ristoranti tutt'intorno, vi faranno sentire coma a casa! P.S. Unico neo? Le dimensioni ridotte della camera, ma se come noi passerete le giornate fuori, non ci farete nemmeno caso!

title: Location, comfort and helpful staff
text:
My wife and I stayed at the Comfort Inn (Time Square West) for a week. From the first day to the last the staff were exceptionally accommodating with all our requests for information, directions and a late check out being catered for with great professionalism. We both recommend this Comfort Inn for the following reasons.

1) Very economical for its location 
-it is within walking distance of the majority of broadway shows, 
-the Hudson River with its great parks and walk ways. 
-It is 100 metres from an entrance to the subway for 42nd street
- There is a wash and fold laundry right next door at 90c per lb or on 9th Ave between 44th and 47 th (100-150metres) away there is a coin op laundry
-There are a great many eating places of all description and costs. There is a nice little Thai restaurant two doors up that has a $16.45 three course meal which is great and then there is the Gallo Nero for Italian (On 44th & 9th Ave)
- In other words it is very convenient

2) The rooms and bathrooms are small but only using the room to shower and sleep, the room was adequate. We had a king bed which had a choice of hard or soft pillows and was very comfortable. The rooms and the general environment of the Inn was clean and pleasant.

3) The breakfast room is small so get there between 06.30 and 08.30 because after that it gets very crowded though there was a constant turn over of seats. The Breakfast food itself is ok with a selection of cereals,yogurts, coffee, tea, breads, muffins, bagels (These at times were somewhat stale).The only poor part of breakfast was the cooked breakfast which was not the most nutritional being sausages, bacon and eggs cooked in a bag.

If you don't want to spend too much money, have a convenient place to stay which is comfortable, clean and a reasonably good breakfast you can't go past  this Comfort Inn.

title: Très bon hôtel
text: C était notre 2ème voyage à nyc et nous n avons vraiment pas été déçus. Situation exceptionnelle avec une station de métro à 100m2 et Times square qu on aperçoit des la porte de l hôtel. Le petit déjeuner était Copieux et le personnel toujours charmants. Les chambres étaient très propres et faites tous les jours. L hôtel était très calme alors qu il était complet. L avantage également l hôtel se situe dans un quartier avec plein de restaurants dans un budget raisonnable ( ce qui est le point noir de nyc). Le thé et le café sont à dispositions toutes la journée et possibilité de manger dans la salle de restaurant qui nous est mise à disposition.  Dernier point nous avons pu laisser nos valises 1 journée à l hôtel avant de reprendre l avion et ce gratuitement. Nous recommandons fortement cet hôtel pour son excellent rapport qualité prix.

title: Satisfeita
text: Fiquei muito satisfeita com o hotel. A localização e perfeita, café da manha bom, internet no quarto o que e um diferencial em NY, chegamos bem antes do horário do check in e nos deixaram ir para o quarto. Pra quem vai para NY para passear bastante e só vai usar o quarto para descanso e perfeito. Com certeza me hospedaria novamente.

title: Fijn hotel met super ligging
text:
Nette schone kamers met dito badkamer. We hadden een kingsize bed op de 6e verdieping aan de straatzijde. Het raam kon open, wat erg leuk was, want daardoor had je mooi uitzicht op 44th street.

's Nachts heb ik 1x een vuilniswagen gehoord, maar verder geen geluidsoverlast gehad van de weg ( is een 1 richtingsstraat )

Het ontbijt was prima, met vers fruit, yoghurt, verse wafels, bagels en muffins (en nog meer, maar dit is wat wij gegeten hebben ;) )

De ligging van het hotel is fantastisch, je bent zo op Times Square en ook zo bij de metro. 

Prijs kwaliteit is voor dit hotel meer dan perfect, een enorme aanrader. Volgende keer NYC zouden wij zeker weer hier kunnen overnachten!

title: Sehr nahe am Times Square gelegen
text:
Wir haben uns für dieses Hotel aufgrund seiner zentralen Lage und der guten Bewertungen im Internet entschieden und wurden nicht enttäuscht.

Zum Times Square läuft man in etwa 10 Minuten. Die U-Bahnstation ist gleich an der nächsten Strassenecke - keine 2 Minuten entfernt. Die Abfahrt für die Stadtrundfahrtenbusse der Grayline befand sich zwischen der 47th und 48th Strasse - auch in etwa 10 Minuten zu Fuss zu erreichen. Also insgesamt eine super Lage um die Stadt zu erkunden. 

Das Hotel selbst liegt mitten in der City in der 44th Strasse - einer Einbahnstrasse. Es ist ein 6-Stöckiges Haus. Die Zimmer empfand ich als zu zugestopft und sehr klein. Im Zimmer befanden sich die beiden Doppelbetten, ein Schreibtisch mit Bürostuhl, Nachttisch, Kühlschrank und noch ein grosser Sessel. Soweit OK - aber wohin mit dem Gepäck? Wir hatten hier einige Probleme mit unseren zwei grossen Koffern. Es war alles sehr sauber und positiv empfand ich auch, dass man hier mal ein Fenster öffnen konnte. 
Das Frühstücksangebot war ausreichend und das Personal sehr nett und hilfsbereit. Das Abstellen unserer Koffer am Abreisetag an der Rezeption - bis zu unserer Abholung -  war kein Problem.

title: Location, location, location
text: A Comfort Inn just off of Times Square?  Yes, indeed and a surprising bargain for the area.  Affordable digs in one of NYC's prime destinations.  Rooms are roomy by Manhattan standards, clean and well appointed.  Prices are competitive and include a breakfast buffet served in the lobby.  Staff are friendly and efficient despite the constant press of visitors coming and going to nearby attractions.  Recommended.  We'd return here again.

title: Much more then expected for that price
text:
This is the most price worthy hotel I have ever stayed at. We payed just 2/3 of the price for all similar stared hotels in NY and got an excellent stay. 

FIrst of all the location is great. Two blocks from Broadway and Times Square and on the corner of the block you have the subway. All blue, red, yellow, purple and S-line goes thru 42nd/Times Square.
