Breakfast was included, not great but not bad either (don't look for fibers cause it's carbs and fat you get). Small eating area. Some reviews says that you have to stand to eat but we sat down all of the six mornings we were there. 

Our room was cleaned every day and it was mostly well done. The room was not huge but not mini either. We could easily fit three persons with luggage and shopping bags in there. You have two different kind of pillows to choose from and the bed were really comfortable. The air conditioner was terrible loud and that impacted our sleep a bit.

Staff is really helpful and friendly! 

Overall we had a great stay! 

There is rooms in the basement by the way, I would try to avoid these.

title: Muy buen hotel en relación al precio/calidad
text: El servicio del hotel es muy bueno, las habitaciones a pesar de ser pequeñas, son muy funcionales. La atención es excelente, tanto del personal de recepción, como el de limpieza. El desayuno es muy completo y con productos de buena calidad. La ubicación es inmejorable, a 200 metros de la 7° y 44 (El corazón de Times Square), cercanía con todos los medios de transporte. Tiene un convenio con el Parking que se encuentra enfrente del hotel (Costo de la estadía de 24 hs, de una Van: u$s 30). Hotel muy recomendable. Volvería

title: fab hotel 5 minutes from times square
text: stayed here with daughter for shopping trip- the room was clean and  big compared to other hotels in NY- room safe and fridge very useful- reception staff very helpful and friendly- breakfast was included and provided lots of variety for a good start to the day- would defintaley stay here again

title: Excellent Beds
text: This is a popular place to stay because of its location. Most of the staff were friendly and helpful except for one young man who appeared very grumpy and not interested in his work. The cost is reasonable for the area but pricey for a comfort inn hotel. The rooms are quite ok, but because there are so many people in the hotel, the cleaners sometimes take short cuts in their duties. The worst thing about this place is the breakfast -- man you have to stand up to eat your breakfast because there is no place to sit. The hotel is also very punctual about the 9:30 am end to breakfast -- they should definitely relook at this. The best thing about this place is that their beds are really good. Lastly, this looks like "Little India" with all the staff from India but i have no problems with this as they do provide good service.

title: Great location
text: We are four friends,two x fifty something,1 x fortyish 1 x twenty three.the location of this hotel was fantastic,stones throw to Times Square .breakfast was great,free wifi,rooms small but to be expected .we were out nearly all day anyway.you were always able to sit in breakfast room which is at front of hotel and have a cuppa,or use microwave etc.staff were very polite and helpful.man at front desk organised airport transfers no problem.great value.would recommend .

title: Quiet and Clean in NYC
text: We stayed at the Comfort Inn Times Square West on 42nd St. in NYC for a four-day visit to New York. It was quiet. It was clean. The continental breakfast offered plenty of choices. The room was small, but we were gone all day every day, so it didn't matter to us. We were located on the 3rd floor in the back of the building and it was very quiet. I haven't smelled that much cleaning products or bleach -- in a good way. Everything from the towels to the room to the stairwell smelled clean. It was a short walk from Times Square and some fantastic restaurants. If I go back to NYC I will definitely stay there again. The staff was very helpful and friendly.

title: Habitaciones muy pequeñas precio alto bien situado
text:
Solo para dormir,  no agradable para descansar.  Bien atendido pero el desayuno da pena,. Un solo ascensor hace que pueda pasar 5 o 6 minutos hasta que puedas usarlo. 
Las habitaciones muy pequeñas y estrechas

title: Ótimo
text: Hotel com localização ótima, funcionários gentis, café da manhã muito bom, limpeza excelente, o quarto que é pequeno mas não tive nenhum problema por isso. Hotel todo novo e perto de tudo. Dá próxima vez que voltar a NY, com certeza ficarei nele!

title: Unbeatable location, comfy quarters
text:
I brought my mom to NYC for her birthday, and we stayed overnight at this hotel. What a fantastic location! You can walk quickly to Times Square and the 42nd Street subway station, which was very convenient. The check-in process was very quick, and our room was ready early, an added bonus. Although small, the room was very clean and comfortable. Other than the family of circus elephants in the room next door, who continued to run and slam their room door multiple times, we were pleased (we paid them back in kind by talking loudly and slamming our door at 3am).

Be mindful that there is only one elevator in the building, which is also used by housekeeping. It takes FOREVER, so plan either a long wait or a walk down the stairs. As others have said, the shower is just plain confusing - they actually have a laminated card with instructions behind the front desk! I don't know why they don't just print that up and stick it in all of the bathrooms. Also, the free breakfast was tasty but the dining area is overcrowded. You can hardly maneuver between the tables with a plate full of food, and I was constantly tripping on chairs and purses. 

Overall, it was a relatively pleasant stay in a wonderful location. The few inconveniences I've mentioned above did not outweigh the benefits of the location and nice accommodations in the room, so I would likely stay again.

title: Highly recommended, great location, delicious cookies
text:
We stayed here just last week and thoroughly enjoyed our 3 days.

THE GOOD:

- The location is UNBEATABLE. You are, no exaggeration, two blocks from Times Square. It's no more than a 300 meter walk and you're smack bang in Times Square! 
- Lovely little room, it's small but its all you need. You're in New York! 
- Beds are luxurious and linen is great
- Rooms are very modern and extremely clean and well looked after
- Has everything you need, fridge, TV with cable, reliable WIFI, coffee machine, desk and comfy chairs
- They provide free and delicious chocolate chip cookies at the lobby all day and night
- The complimentary breakfast is superb. Waffles, eggs, bacon, toast, cereals, wide rage of juices, pastries, coffee and tea
- Staff are lovely and helpful and are happy to hold your bags and luggage if you have some time to kill before or after you check out

THE BAD

- It's freezing in the lobby. 
- The shower is initially confusing for silly foreigners like us who aren't aware of North America's curious shower tap design. 

Honestly, it's very good. Worth the money! You won't regret it.

title: Not that impressed
text: I booked this hotel through an online service. I'm used to small accommodations in Manhattan, and thus was not fazed by the cramped lobby area. However, I was not pleased to be given a room on the ground floor, one that opened right out into the lobby and was next to the elevator to boot. This meant noise both late at night, as guests on the upper floors returned late from the theater or wherever they'd been, and early in the morning, as they arrived for the complimentary breakfast (which was good). Do not accept one of these rooms if you are assigned it, especially if it has as small and cramped a bathroom as mine did--the shower door and the bathroom door could not stay open at the same time, and the former leaked so that the small floor space ended up mostly covered by water after one use. The price is good, however, and the location is great, right in the Theater District.

title: Bon rapport qualité prix et très bien situé.
text:
Je reviens de New York, un voyage entre amis où nous avons posé nos valises au Comfort Inn Time square west. Cet hôtel est très bien situé, à 1 rue de Times square, proche d'une entrée de métro, proche de la gare de bus port authority et du fabuleux shake shack. Il est très bien équipé : coffre, sèche cheveux, cafetière, frigo, Literie au top, wifi gratuite et à l'accueil il y a un ordi avec imprimante ce qui m'a permis d'imprimer mes billets de retour ainsi que faire une réservation au restaurant le charthouse. Demander une chambre à étage. Nous étions chambre 702, 7ème étage. Aucun bruit de la rue ni des voisins. Petit déjeuner inclus. 
Petite astuce pour la douche tirer le bas du mitigeur.
Le dernier jour nous avons laissé nos valises à la réception pour profiter de notre dernières journée dans la big Apple. 
Je recommande vivement cet hôtel qui est un très bon rapport qualité prix, je compte y retourner avec mes enfants.

Bon voyage,

title: Wish I could give it a 3.5 rating
text:
We just returned from 2 nights here, and were in the city for a graduation.  There are several small things that add up that could be improved with this hotel:  
1) only one elevator is a problem.  The service staff use it heavily so often you travel with them and bags of dirty linens, etc.  What would happen if it broke down?
2) The room doors do not automatically close behind you.  I have never seen this in a hotel.
3) The lobby was kept uncomfortable cold
4) The lobby does not have a comfortable area to just hang out.  There is one sofa that faces the checkin desk and the area frequently smells like cleaning supplies.
5) It is not obvious how to turn on the shower and when you try long enough and eventually get the front desk, it is obvious that they've had the question asked of them numerous times.
6) 9:30 is too early to shut down breakfast abruptly.  People travel from all different time zones and for all different reasons and I have been in other similar-style hotels that keep it going a little longer particularly when their occupancy is high, as it was.  
7) The sink needs to be turned off exactly the right way so that it does not drip.  For those of us who really care about those types of things, I highly recommend installing water-saving sink faucets.  There are good products that could probably save the hotel a lot of money and maybe allow them to spend it upgrading a few other things.

The important stuff--a comfortable and clean room are fine here and I prefer to grade up rather than down but in the future I would for the same price, stay somewhere else.

title: Hôtel idéal pour un super séjour (court) à New York
text:
L'hôtel est très bien situé. Vous avez une bouche de métro et le nouveau Shake Shack (++) au bout de la rue et il est à 2 blocks de Times Square et de Port Authority Bus si vous arrivez par bus de Montreal. L'Intercontinental au bout de la rue permet d'avoir un flux constant de monde dans ce coin ce qui est rassurant. Nous avons laissé nos bagages à la réception en arrivant et en partant pour pouvoir profiter de New York. Le staff à la réception n'a pas bronché, ils étaient très serviables. N'oubliez pas le tips! La décoration à l'entrée est très cosy et moderne. On aperçoit des chambres au rdc (à éviter vu le bruit du petit déjeuner).

Nous avions une chambre double pour 4 personnes au dernier étage (7ème) avec vue sur la rue (un parking et quelques hautes tours). Un peu étroite mais calme, propre et bien décorée. Nous avons mis du temps à trouver comment utiliser le pommeau de douche (tirer le bas du mitigeur). La literie est géniale! Reposante après des longues journées de marche. 
Le petit déjeuner est complet mais le chaud est préparé au micro ondes. Ce n'est pas choquant pour ma part car les gauffres sont faites avec un appareil, il y a des viennoiseries, des boissons chaudes, jus, céreales, flocons d'avoine et fruits. 
L'ascenseur est un peu long. Le Wifi est gratuit et un ordinateur + une imprimante nous ont permis d'imprimer nos billets pour le match de basket.

Je conseille vivement cet hôtel et n'hésiterait pas du tout à y retourner pour mon prochain séjour.

title: Excellent rapport qualité prix !
text: Très bon hotel si comme nous vous ne l utilisez que pour dormir. Très bonne situation, a deux pas de Times square, bouche de métro et gare de bus Port Authority a 2 pas (pour se rendre au Charthouse restaurant pour la vue de la skyline) Chambre 702, 7eme étage. Aucun bruit venant de la rue ni de nos voisins. Literie au top. Petits déjeuners compris ce qui est loin d être négligeable dans le budget et en plus ils vous servent des gaufres tous les matins. Accueil irréprochable, personnel très sympathique et serviable. N hésitez pas a les solliciter pour vos réservations type taxi, tour hélicoptère ils se chargent de tout.

title: Great stay!
text: Great location. Safe and convenient. Rooms were small and bathroom was very tight(as expected). Breakfast and wi-fi were added bonus. Check in and out was smooth. Only negative was one elevator and had to wait quite a bit.

title: Terrific location, friendly staff
text:
we stayed at the comfort Inn for 8 nights with our 6 months old baby. We were concerned with the price (slightly 300 US$) per night Vs/ quality. This proved to be an excellent choice. Price-wise, NY is expensive at this time of year. no matter how hard we tried we couldn't find anything decent at a sane price, and the Comfort did deliver good quality for this price. Location is great for first time visitors- 5 minutes walk (with stroller) from Times Sq. 2 minutes walk to the nearest Metro station and about 15-20 minutes walk to central park/ 5'th avenue. also close to the 34'th shopping street. Many dining options around, ranging from fast food (including the much hyped "Shake Shack") and some fancier places (we usually to just had the food to-go and ate at our room, baby limitations). The hotel is small but friendly, with free wifi. the room we got (a queen size bed ) was great for a couple but absolutely cramped with a baby's crib. after one night we had to move to the (little more spacious) double room. Lucky for us there was one available  and the Duty manager, Sunita, offered it to us at no extra cost for the entire stay. this is what I call service!
The room was kept clean and was in good condition. Cable TV, coffee maker and fridge were all nice to have.    
Breakfast was nice, with bagels, waffles and, fresh fruits and cereals. the only downside is that the dining area was tiny and usually packed by the time we got there. still, this represents excellent value as a similar meal eaten outside would cost around 10-15$ per person.
Overall I would recommend this hotel more to couples or business travelers, but we still had  a great time there.

title: Good location and clean hotel
text:
We stayed here for 5 nights. The rooms were clean and twin beds were comfortable for three adults. However rooms are on a smaller size compared to other places we have visited in USA. Great location for travelling in Manhattan. Metro was down the road. Time Square 2 minutes walk and good variety of restaurants at the other end of the road. 
Breakfast was good and plenty. All staff were very helpful though some did not speak much English, however this did not stop them from doing the jobs there were assigned to do. Restaurant area was too small. They could arrange it differently to make use of the area and also have chairs that would fit under the table to make space. I did not feel comfortable carrying my hot tea to my table !!! 
The receptionist/ duty manager Ajay was friendly and very helpful. 
If I go back to NY again I would definitely stay here.

title: Brilliant hotel close to Times Square
text:
We stayed in room 706 for seven nights in April 2013.  I was worried about arriving here after reading a few mixed reviews but I can honestly say this hotel was lovely.  

It's in an excellent location close to a tube station which is always a plus in New York. 

Breakfast was fine, good choice although the dining room does get full so most days we took our food up to our room. 

This was our third stay in NYC and some people have said that the rooms are small.  All NYC hotel rooms are small, this was the largest room we have stayed at in the city. 

I'd have no hesitation to stay here again.

title: A place to sleep near Times Square
text:
I recommend this hotel if you need to find a room with two beds and don't care about any amenities. 

Positives: It was clean; there was free breakfast; it's located near Times Square and within walking distance of a lot of restaurants and theaters. 

Negatives: No frills; the lobby smells heavily of bleach; the elevator is slow to the point of making it worth walking 5 flights of stairs to your room; apparently they don't have enough storage space because trash bags of linens are left throughout the hallways on a regular basis (we referred to them as "the bodies"); the cleaning crew is either very understaffed or very slow - after being out all day, we returned to an uncleaned room - then housekeeping showed up at 5:30 p.m. as if it that was an acceptable time to come clean (we were getting ready for dinner and said no). I requested that they come clean the next morning and we didn't have any trouble after that.

title: ROOMS TOO SMALL
text: Well, it was a great stay, but unfortunately, the room was so very, very small.  We booked for 3 adults, there were two beds, 7 LARGE suitcases (no storage, no room) .. one of us had to sleep with suitcases as our bed partner!  But the Hotel was in a GREAT LOCATION, the Customer Service was superior, they even make homemade chocolate cookies EVERYDAY!!!  My suitcase did not arrive at the airport and was not seen at the hotel until very late the second day, but the staff gave me the essentials, which was something that I did not have to worry about purchasing.  It was an overall good experience .. you really had to laugh about the small room, which we did!  In fact, my friend had brought numerous pairs of shoes for her numerous outfits and those were lined up on the windowsill due to no storage or space for 3 people, if you know what I mean .. but other than that .. it was PERFECT!

title: impressed with staff, room, location, price, food
text:
We had a  nice 2 bed room in theatre district for an affordable $200.  Shower is tricky, a gadget in the tub faucet.  Impressed from the start.  We arrived for early check in to hear/watch exchange of a guest berating the check out staff because thought the price signed for night before was too high for 11 hours.  Doesn't matter 11 or 24 hours, same amount of clean up and care for staff, that guest paid $10 less than our room.  Guest was nasty, repeatedly spitting of the word despicable!  Staff was polite, balanced and fair in responses, showed no agitation in reaction to this attack on them.  The staff had agreed to hold our bags prior to room readiness, but room was ready upon our arrival! Center of everything we wanted, we walked to Empire State Bldg, walked to Broadway show, walked to Jekyll & Hyde theme restaurant, cab to National Museum of History and Central Park. The continental breakfast next day surpassed by far the common definition of it.  Available was fresh made pancakes, sausage, muffins, yogurt, fresh fruit, juices, bagels, and much more. Buffet is a better description.  Staff agreed to hold our bags after check out.  Mind you we were carrying 2 bags the size of some large purses, we did not burden them with large or numerous bags.  

If the staff stays the same I would come back to this place again and again.  Only hope I find one as good when I decide to go back to Manhattan South.

title: Great location and value
text: We stayed for three nights at the hotel with our young grandson.  Staff were very helpful and friendly.  It was clean and bathroom was very good.  Breakfast and free Internet were a bonus.  Location was great.  We felt as if we were in the middle of everything.  Would def stay there again.

title: great location
text: we stayed here 2 nights and were very happy with the hotel. the location is great, right near times square . the rooms were small but were clean , tidy and comfortable .we arrived early in the morning and they allowed us to check in earlier. we were at the front of the hotel and it was a bit noisy but thats new york !! . overall a great stay and we would stay here again

title: Sehr gutes Hotel für Städtetrip in Top-Lage
text: Tolle Lage, ein paar Minuten zum Times Square und zur U-Bahn. Alles war sehr sauber, Zimmer sind klein (aber wo nicht zu diesem Preis), Bad völlig o,k., inkl. Frühstück (für amerikanische Verhältnisse passend), Gepäckaufbewahrung problemlos nach check-out, An- u. Abreise vom JFK mit Airtrain u U-Bahn "E" super (ca 2 Min Fußweg zum Hotel), JEDERZEIT WIEDER!

title: Ótimo custo beneficio
text: Hotel, muito bem localizado,com bom cafe da manha,pessoal da recepção muiot educado e receptivo,quartos bem conservados,ambiente limpo, banheiro limpo,toalhas limpas, e cheirosas,enfim vale a pena ficar neste hotel

title: Good hotel close to Times Square and shows
text: My daughter and I stayed 4 nights at this hotel during a Spring Break trip. The hotel is in a great location - very close to Times Square, Theater District, Rockefeller Center, etc. We went to two shows and felt very safe walking back to our hotel late at night. The rooms are small - to be expected - but clean with comfortable beds and a good shower. Breakfast was ok. The service by the staff at the hotel was excellent - all the staff we encountered were polite and very nice! We had a room at the front of the hotel for our first 2 nights which was quite noisy - just street noise - and asked to move to a quieter room. The front desk staff was very helpful and found us a quieter room at the back of the hotel. It is not the fanciest place to stay but offers pretty good value for its location.

title: Great value location near Times Square
text:
I was very happy with our stay at this Comfort Inn. The photos and comments here give a honest representation of what to expect.
Rooms were small (as all NYC hotel rooms are) and were pretty basic - but were clean and tidy - and we managed to get onto the free wifi without issue.

We found the hotel was clean and tidy and had a fantastic location - it was far enough away from Times Square to be nice and quiet, but still only a few minutes walk to times square, theatres and all the other attractions of the area. A subway stop is at the end of the street - so quick and easy to get up or downtown from here.

We always felt safe walking to and from the hotel - even late at night.

Staff were friendly enough - in particular the lady who manages the breakfast area was really helpful and friendly.
The complimentary breakfast was much appreciated - nothing amazing - but certainly acceptable considering it is complimentary. A waffle, fruit juice and coffee from here was a great start to the morning.
The only downside to this hotel is the appallingly slow lift - but considering the location and the price paid, this is an excellent hotel and would definitely consider this when next in NYC.

title: Clean, Great Location, Safe
text: I didn't really know what to expect since there were a few curious postings, but I went through all the on-line photos and made a reservations...glad I did, we enjoyed our stay.  The hotel is on 44th street, which is straight down the road from the Majestic Theater where the Phantom of the Opera plays.  Unbelievably convenient.  There's also a subway stop just down the block about 30 yards.  There's also a multi-level parking garage directly across the street.  Yes, a few bums on the street (you can escape 1 or 2), but they never entered the hotel and the hotel attendant watches the door all night long.  Rooms are small, but larger than a European hotel.  The room was clean, the bathroom was clean, the towels clean, and the linen clean.  No bad smells, no bad stains.  The one bad thing was that the safe in the room didn't work.  No biggie.  The breakfast is also very good for a continental breakfast. They always have waffles, but they alternate scrambled eggs and bacon one day and hard boiled eggs and sausage the next (I've never had a "nuked" hard boiled egg, and not sure I will again, I really wish they'd boil them).  Anyway, a woman makes the waffles and ensure the entire area is tidy (I've seen places destroyed when hotel staff aren't around).  The woman is generally quiet and my kids were nervous, but they said good morning and she had a smile that was worth a million bucks.  She's just shy.  Anyway, there's toast, cereal, bagels, yogurt, you get the photo.  AND!  At night, on 8th and 43nd (I think) there's a Crumb's Bakery where you can get killer cupcakes (BabaBooey Flavor, no joke) and you can eat them back at the hotel where they have coffee and tea all night long.  We're not night birds, so it was nice to cap off the evening with green tea and cupcakes.  Anyway, the only snafu was a young, short, heavy-set girl behind the counter in the mornings who is rather curt.  It seems like the place is a family owned hotel, so I have no doubt that her parents will help her with courtesies in the near future.  Anyway, we felt safe, secure, clean, fed, and rested.  You can't ask for anything more from a Comfort Inn that's this perfectly located in the Big Apple.

title: Convenient and Affordable
text: This hotel is convenient and affordable.  The rooms were clean, the staff was welcoming and the breakfast was quite good.  A few block from everything from theatre to restaurants.  Would stay again as it was perfect for my son and I during spring break trip.

title: I like this place.
text:
Close to Times Square. Very clean.  Free breakfast (including chocolate waffles!). Great, helpful staff.  

Slow elevator but you can just take the stairs.  Not that many floors in hotel.

I would definitely stay here again.  

J.D.
Grand Island NY

title: great price and location
text: stayed here for Spring Break. rooms were clean, staff was nice, location was perfect!! the breakfast was really good. we couldn't have asked for more for the price. walking distance from Times Square, Guy Fieri's restaurant (where he was actually sitting and talking to people as they came in!!), and all of the Broadway shows. We saw Annie, Cinderella, and Spiderman and were able to walk to each.  Also, we saw Tom Hanks on the street getting into his vehicle from Lucky Guy along with the other cast members!

title: Nice place great location.
text: Stayed here Easter weekend. Very clean room, staff very nice and helpful. Nice breakfast with several things to choose from.  Just a few short blocks from Times Square. We actually were walking to Times Square when we saw people standing by a theater door, we waited and was able to see Tom Hanks and the others from the cast of Lucky Guy come out. I highly recommend this hotel.

title: A great find!
text: I stayed here in Jan 2013 with some girlfriends for a shopping holiday, it was the ideal spot for us! Only a short distance from Grand Central and Times Sq it couldn't be more ideally situated. The breakfast was simple a combination of hot food & cereals, fresh juice & hot beverages available all day we couldn't have asked for more! The rooms are small but when you're in NY you don't want to spend your time in a hotel room! The staff were very friendly and provided all the information we asked for. If I ever get the chance to come to NYC again this will be top of my list!

title: Great hotel for a family
text:
Just returned from a trip to NYC.  Since it was Spring break it was difficult to find a reasonably priced hotel in the CIty.  Fortunately, we stumbled upon the Confort Inn Times Square.  It is in an amazing location, close to the subway, to Times Square and to lots of restaurants without being in a noisy location.  They serve a very nice breakfast, have coffee and hot chocolate out all day and the personnel work very hard to keep things running smoothly.  Our room was cleaned while we were eating breakfast!  The rooms are small, and the bathrooms tiny, but not any smaller than higher priced NYC hotels.
The only negative is that they held our bags the day we checked out, and when we returned my husband's ipad had been dropped and had a ding in it.
